Thank you, family, friends, others alike, and readers! Your support, gratitude, and love has this publication possible. God bless you, thank you, and enjoy the excitement you have all waited for and have long-deserved to experience. You are all heroes in my eyes, heart, and soul. Thanks to you, this writing experience will always be infinite.


-Jacob Arasim

INFINITE

VALOR


Written and Illustrated

By

Jacob Arasim









Part 1:

Press “Play”

Chapter 1: Welcome to Kingzing City

Welcome to Kingzing City, population of almost a million! Sitting on the beautiful waterfront, in the state of Oregon, Kingzing City never fails to be a part of an awe-inspiring community! Other than the city’s free-spirited people, gorgeous climate, and amazing architecture, there’s one person who tends to make a complete ass of himself! His name is Axyl Matthew Smithy, he’s eighteen, and over 90% of the students in his high school hate him! Anyone would think being hated by so many people would lower Axyl’s self-esteem. However, Axyl only cares about himself and only cares about what he does!









Axyl Matthew Smithy, formally known as just “Axyl,” walked through the hallways of the school, with a smug grin spread across his face, as followed by others. The jocks walk by, and other students stand out of the way, clearing a path for the most popular kids in KHS. Adding to that, the jocks were also joined by their girlfriends (Axyl is the only one who’s single, which was a substantial surprise for many.). Three minutes before the horrible passing period bell rang, Axyl and his group of jocks started walking towards a thin kid, known as Kyle Manning. Kyle is Axyl’s most vulnerable target; by target as in a mere victim of Axyl’s notorious bullying and ridicule. As Kyle was pulling out a couple books from his neatly organized locker, Axyl came out of nowhere, slamming the door shut. Kyle jolted and gasped for air, as everything had fallen onto the brown-painted, tile floor.

Welcome to Kingzing City












“Hey, Kyle,” Axyl said, followed by slight laughs from his friends.

Full of fear, Kyle utters, “H-hey Axyl.”

Axyl looked down at the books on the floor. “You dropped your stuff, buddy-boy.”

“Y-yeah, I-I did.”

Axyl smiles, followed by more annoying chuckles. “Well, aren't you gonna pick 'em up?” Hesitant and full of anxiety, Kyle quickly knelt down to pick up his things, unaware that one of Axyl’s friends was about to kick him in the rear from behind. Axyl signaled his friend (known as Cale Omnous) and the jock gave him a swift kick up Kyle's bum. Such a powerful blow like that made Kyle fall forward and hit his head against the lockers, thus falling onto the ground. The whole group roared with laughter, with Axyl smiling with his arms crossed. “You better tie your shoelaces too, buddy-boy.” The group finally left, after Cale projected a wad of phlegm, from his nose, and onto Kyle's trapper keeper. Kyle could hear how proud Cale was thanks to his pig-like laughter, after performing that unnecessary stunt.

Axyl Smithy, the perfect asshole. He's the guy where dating him would be like babysitting a six year-old. And once the bell rang, Kyle rose on his two skinny legs, rubbing his head gently. A girl walked toward Kyle and helped him pick up his things. The girl was extremely gorgeous and she wore

Chapter 1

luscious, blonde hair. She looked at Kyle's snot-covered trapper keeper in disgust. She then pulled out a tissue, from her bag, and wiped Cale's disgusting remnants clean. Kyle and the girl both stood up and looked at each other, after a brief moment of sorting Kyle’s school supplies.

“Th-thanks Holly,” Kyle stuttered, making eye-contact with her.

“You're welcome,” the girl replied with a cute smile. “If those stale pieces of crap come near you again, let me know okay?”

Kyle nodded, and they both started walking to class. This was Kyle's best friend, Holly Ransfield. Her eyes were like gazing at stars; her smile like gorgeous waning crescent. The jocks, the nerds, the “stoners,” the “emo’s” and the “rockers” all knew of her, and none wouldn't hesitate to “get with her.” Other girls, included, wouldn't mind in doing so, also. Holly was very independent, sophisticated, and after eight years of knowing karate and boxing, anyone wouldn’t dare mess with this girl.

Holly and Kyle have been friends, ever since they were freshmen in high school. They first met during Kyle’s first year of drama class, a class of which seems to amuse him the most. Kyle loved acting and performing on stage, while Holly appreciated playing her guitar. Although, they both had a lot in common; especially when it all came down to different varieties of music, movies, and video games. Ever since they met, they have been inseparable.

“So, you got trigonometry? This period, right?” Holly asked, as they walked through the empty hallways of the school. Kyle didn’t talk, just nodded. Holly frowned, plastering pity all over him, and she knew he couldn’t defend himself, let alone speak to his nemesis. Kyle wasn’t like that, or so he thought.

“How've you been?” Kyle asked.

“Oh, I've been okay. I was good until I saw you on the floor. God, Axyl and Cale are such tools.You could just call them 'Asshole' and 'Fail.'”

Kyle laughed out loud, and was feeling much better. After more talking, the duo finally approached Mr. Loughmiller’s classroom. Before Kyle walked in, Holly said, “Meet me during lunch. We can go to the Funky Munkey Café.” Kyle smiled, nodded, and walked into class. Holly walked in the opposite direction from Kyle’s, as she heard Axyl and Cale whistle at her from behind.

Welcome to Kingzing City












“HEY!” Axyl hollered. “Shouldn’t you be in class?!” Cale busted up and repeated what Axyl had said, like a copy-cat “poser.”

Holly rolled her eyes and kept walking, and the two idiots followed.

Holly finally stopped, turned around, and faced the two of them, saying, “Can't you two go kiss each other somewhere else?”

Axyl and Cale spat laughter.

“Ooooh, someone is on their time of the month!” Axyl hollered. “Damn, girl, we didn't do anything to you. What's your problem?”

“YOU are my problem! I know what you guys did to Kyle.”

“Who? That little snot?” Cale snorted. “We didn't do anything! He just fell. Fell! Just like the little baby wussy that he always―”

Cale was stopped immediately when Holly punched him in the stomach and grabbed him by the nose. She twisted it with two of her knuckles, back and forth. Cale screamed like a little sissy, as she increased the pain; Holly took the advantage of no witnesses in the hallway, giving Cale immense pain.

“You know I can break your nose, you sick, twisted toad!” Holly said angrily, her eyes in flames. Axyl just stood there and watched and his eyes widened. “It takes only seven pounds of pressure to break the human nose. You like that? You like that feeling??” Axyl took a step to help his friend, but Holly gave a quick horrifying glare that labelled “Don't even think about it!”

Cale was on his knees now, with faint trails of blood trickling from his nostrils.

“If you ever TOUCH or do ANYTHING to Kyle again, so help me

Chapter 1

God, I will break not just your nose! We got a deal?” Cale nodded weakly, in agony. Holly faced Axyl, once more. “Got it?!” Axyl quickly responded and Holly let go of Cale's nose. The jock covered his nose with cuffed hands and slowly got up, once Holly spat on him and walked off. Axyl stood there in shock, for he totally did not see that coming. A girl, half his size, almost broke his friend's nose like it was no issue. He was sure that anyone else could do the same, but the thought gave Axyl a big smile on his face.

Cale looked at him, covering his bloody nose. “Wut are you so excited abutt?”

“Nothing. Let's go to class.” Axyl now had a growing crush on Holly.

Out there. . . .In the stars.



You unlock this door with the key of imagination. Beyond it, is another. A dimension of sound, a dimension of sight, a dimension of mind. You're moving into a land of both shadow and substance of things and ideas. You just crossed over into...the Twilight Zone.

Having nothing to do with the classic television series, the following excerpt explains the truth of what is really happening, thousands of light-years away. On the planet Strom, there lies a base, a military base, a non-human military base. A military base for a race known as the Asids. As of right now, the Asids’ base was under attack by another non-human military force, known as the Adoa. Combat ships of advanced technology swarmed everywhere around the base, deploying Adoa troops (There were the Adoa Mazers and there are the Adoa Strikers. The Strikers are much larger and they carried heavier weaponry.) The enemies eventually broke into the Asid base, taking the Asids by surprise. Why were they attacking? What was their motivation? The Adoa was after something, something of good value, something in the hands of two alien beings, known as Preox and Rig. They were very special alien beings, indeed. Preox was a high rank, as a formal Asid Magnate. In other words, “Don't test his patience.”

Welcome to Kingzing City

The happy-go-lucky raconteur (He just goes by “Rig.”), whose race is Aziquet, had an antenna of which can eject a substantial amount of deathly lightning. Deathly enough to blow stuff up!

Anyway, as the Asids consistently fought off the Adoa in an epic, gruesome battle of terror, Preox and Rig wiped them out like a napkin on spilled milk.

“There's they is!” shouted an Adoa Striker. “Eliminate them! Get the Misara! Do not disappoint our master!”

Rig stood there, laughing like the happy-go-lucky idiot like he always was. The Adoa opened fire, as Preox reloaded his weapon canister. Once the two took cover behind thick debris, Preox shot at the walls, ricocheting the crystal bullets into the bodies of his enemies. Apparently, however, there was a suicide bomber within the small group of Mazers and it just so happened that one of Preox's bullets struck the Mazers' bomb. An implosion occurred, tearing portions of the military base, followed by dismembered limbs. Preox and Rig began to run through the halls of the base, taking out any other forces who had dared to stand in their way.














“Wooh! This is so much fun, I wish I had pants!” Rig hollered happily.

“Oh, I just love wearing pants!!! Where's we goin’ Preox?”

Preox sighed. He hated talking to that blubbering idiot companion of his, all the time. A Mazer came up to them, Rig extended his antennae like a whip and smacked the Adoa with his tremendous volts of lightning. The Mazer died. “We are, Rig, going to the hangar area. We're getting the hell out

Chapter 1
















of here!”

Rig screamed happily. “We goes to another planet??”

“Yes, we do 'goes to another planet.' Now, shut up and let me think! Okay, dammit, the Adoa is blowing up everything! I can barely recognize where we're going!” Preox’s voice was raspy and dry, as Rig’s voice was loud and obnoxiously high-pitched. Preox detached an ammo packet from his fully-protective armor, thus reloading his rifle. (A device was also displayed on his back and it was what the Asid military had to wear when in training, or ultimately fighting in combat. The Vambit had the features of mini-turrets and a fully operative jet-pack.) Preox pushed a button on his Vambit, and the two auto-turrets were deployed. Once an enemy was in sight, the turrets would fire an immense amount of rounds, tearing the enemy apart.

The bludgeoning and disturbingly bloody battle raged onward, as Preox and Rig proceeded through a door, which led to another Asid structure on the outside. This was where the hangar was located. Unfortunately, a giant enemy drop ship was swooping down, opening fire upon the base. Preox wanted to ignore, but Rig was persistent. “Hey, over here, stinky poo!!!!”

“Rig!” Preox hollered alarmingly. “Get your ass moving, now!”

Rig didn't listen, he kept waving and yelling at the drop ship. The ship took notice of the moron and slowly turned to face Rig. Its laser cannons prepared for total annihilation, upon the two. Preox didn't hesitate but to shoot at the pilot of the ship, and the bullets implanted inside the enemy's

Welcome to Kingzing City

cranium. Grey blood splattered on the windshield, along with the ship’s guns malfunctioning, which resulted in killing several other foes. The drop ship had begun to fall to the surface of the planet and Preox and Rig ran for it, toward a seemingly large and heavily damaged structure. “Go, go!!”

They both entered the building through a damaged metallic door, and they ran through a large corridor full of dead troops. All they could hear was a distant crash and explosion. The drop ship was diminished.

They continued running and Rig said, “Hey that was my ship to explode! Grrr, me angry now. Me wanted to blow it up!”

“Don't get your G-string in a wad!” Preox yelled right back. Preox started getting a huge headache, not just from the battle, but from hearing Rig's voice. Around the corner was the hangar area, which was their escape from this epic battle. Two Strikers stood in the way, however.

“Okay Rig, take ‘em out,” ordered Preox, trying to catch some breath.

“Oy!” hollered a Striker. “It’s da special aliens! Dey is the super bad ones!! Kill dem now!!”

Rig started screaming at the top of his lungs, like some sort of mental patient. His antenna, charging thousands of electricity, struck the two Strikers point-blank in the face (Damn, that’s got to hurt!) The back of the two Strikers' heads burst open, with grey blood splashing everywhere. They collapsed, and one of them faintly said “ow” before finally dying. Those were typical last words for an Adoa troop.

Preox pushed a few buttons on a pad next the door (which was once heavily guarded) and it surprisingly opened, without showing the slightest bit of damage. Only one ship sat inside the massive hangar, it was good as new, and it was ready to be taken into flight. (It also happened to be one of the first light-speed ships, ever invented. Not only that, it had never been tested!) Deactivating his Vambit and taking a seat in the cockpit, Preox got the ship started. Having never flown such a ship before in his life, Preox had no hesitation in getting the ship off the ground. The ship levitated through a massive gap of what used to be the ceiling, and began to fly away. Rig marveled the view of planet Strom, like an excited child. After being rid of the opposing forces swarming the area, Preox took a deep breath and

Chapter 1















activated the light-speed feature. Rig, totally ignoring the whole ordeal, just sat there shouting “WEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!!” The ship was going so fast, Preox almost coughed up his fourth lung. He had to get as far away from the Adoa as possible. The ship went faster and faster and Rig flew backward, slamming his head on wall.

“'I see skies of blue and clouds of white!” the Aziquet laughed deliriously, after receiving the new pain.

“Rig, you okay?” Preox asked, turning around to face Rig, actually feeling concerned for him. All he heard was a great belch coming from his companion. “Oh you're fine.” He turned back to face the front, as he deactivated the light-speed, and shrieked at the site of a cellphone satellite. They seemed to be approaching it at great speed.

Preox jerked the ship quickly to the side, and Rig whined in agony, “I think my butt has been punctured.”

“Oh, piss off, you bleedin’ harpie!” yelled Preox, turning the ship with all his might, though it was too late. The ship's left side burst through the satellite's solar panel. All the sudden, the ship's engines were failing, as it was just entering the planet’s atmosphere. Preox attempted the emergency evac option, but believed that it wouldn’t help, considering the situation he was in.

Welcome to Kingzing City


“Damn, damn, damn! Oh dammit!” Preox cried frantically, trying to save the ship's life. The ship gave a sudden jolt, making Preox fly from his seat and bash his head against the ceiling. The container, which contained the Misara Serum (A weapon of which the Adoa desperately needed to grasp their fingers on) flew off his Vambit. Rig quickly caught it, with a slight chuckle of insanity.

“Oooo, hoo hoo! That was close!” A small explosion had occurred, blasting a freshly-torn hole through the ship. The extreme suction of gravity snatched the Serum right from Rig's hands. “Oooohh! And it's gone.”

“What's gone??” demanded Preox, whom had gotten back to manage the controls.

“Uhhh… the thingy”.

“What thingy?”

“The special potion thingy.”

“The MISARA SERUM??!”

“I believe so, dude,” Rig said in a calmly matter. Before Preox could have an episode, the ship gave another sudden jolt, indicating the ship's engines diminishing. “Ahh, son of a triscuit! We just lost the ship!”

The ship was up in flames, was in Earth's orbit, and was falling rapidly towards a large body of water. Rig was pinned against the back of the ship, screaming at the top of his lungs, as Preox held on for his life. Bits and pieces were flying off the ship and there was no way in saving it. With his stomach swirling everywhere in his body, Preox opened a trap door above him. Rig was sucked through the trap door and Preox activated his jet-pack, from his Vambit, and flew out of the ship quickly. He saw a falling Rig, bawling his eyes out, and caught him with his masculine arms. Rig stopped bawling, once Preox had caught him. Rig looked up at him, with tearful eyes of happiness. The look he gave made Preox want the satisfaction of gouging his eyes out.

“Oh Preox, you're my hero.”

“Yeah, yeah, shut up.” The ship ignited into a fiery, neon-purple explosion, with debris flying everywhere.

“Why you gone go blows up our toy?” Rig asked.

“I didn’t, you dolt.” Preox rolled his eyes, for he surely had no time to put up with Rig’s ludicrous questions.

Chapter 1

“We certainly had no point in flying it, anyway,” Rig laughed.

“How dense are you? The Adoa almost tore us apart.”

“Oh, come on! We could take 'em! We didn't need to fly off, like a couple of neurotic wussies in a light-speed ship, which you epically failed at operating!”

“Shut up, Rig! I shouldn't have to be taking criticism from someone who doesn't even know the term ‘neurotic’!”

“Oh yeah?? Yeah?? Well what does 'nertonic' mean, then?? Hmm?!”

“It's 'neurotic', you dip! Plus, it means—” Preox and Rig were both silenced into unconsciousness, once a large portion of debris slammed against their skulls. Preox's Vambit became critically damaged and their unconscious-selves hurdled toward Earth’s surface, along with the rest of the ship’s remains.


Chapter 2: Misara Serum


















Shortly after the terrible blow, which Preox and Rig had received from falling debris, the Misara Serum was gone… out of the hands of the ones who had a major responsibility in keeping it captive and out of the Adoa’s sight. For a detailed insight, the Misara Serum was contained in a black container. And there’s a reason as to why it was considered deadly, being the fact that the Adoa were the creators. With a weapon of mass destruction, there was really no telling what the Adoa was capable of doing with it. The Asids stole the Serum because they knew well of the the Serum’s capabilities. The leader of the Adoa, Zjok, created this Serum shortly after betraying the Asids, long ago. Zjok invented the Serum to become supremely powerful and successful leader, as reigning his own militia of Adoa Mazers and Strikers. The Serum, being as dangerous as it was, was also told that it could grant super powers.

The Serum was made of a toxic blood found from the extinct species, known as the Drokensmur. After the last Drokensmur died off, Zjok was able to extract its blood. Once he got the blood, he mixed it with hot boiling lava and ice from a comet. After he obtained these materials and the Serum was

Chapter 2


ultimately created, Zjok recorded a test run on a web cam, and posted it on the social network of Bookface, so all his Mazers and Strikers could see. He tested the Serum on a rat and once the rat barely took no more than a couple of samples, the rat immediately grew twice its size and began flying around its cage. The rat opened its mouth and breathed fire like a dragon and began bending the bars of his cage, with his own paws. Zjok laughed his evil laugh and blasted the rat dead, with a big ray gun. His horrible, ugly face came to camera and simply said, “Adoa, we will now rise!”

Oh, and they did rise. Over the course of ten Earth years, Zjok’s Adoa had become a stronger Empire, destroying dozens of other species and colonizing other planets as their own. The Asid Military was prepared, however, once Zjok eventually threatened their planet, Suzia. Preox and Rig were sent on a suicide mission to collect the Misara Serum (Once Zjok had created it), on the Adoa's home planet, Fleek. The mission was a complete success. After Zjok’s Serum was stolen, while he was conveniently asleep, Rig actually managed to drop the Misara Serum during a celebration party. Obviously, Rig would do something as clumsy as it was and after the Misara had dropped, the lid snapped off, spilling a puddle of the fluids onto the ground. Preox had resealed the lid tight. As for the puddle of Serum, well, Rig offered to lick it off the floor. After this unthinkable act, Rig had obtained his powers, powers of the last Drokensmur.

“No!” yelled Preox. “Don't you dare! We don’t know what the capabilities―” And the puddle was gone.

Rig eventually felt excruciatingly sick, ever since he had slurped up the Serum. The Asids examined the poor, ill Aziquet and they realized that Rig was now a living weapon of mass destruction. They realized the amazing advantages they have achieved when possessing the Serum. The Serum was too deadly, however, according to the Asid Council and it had to be disposed of properly. Unfortunately, the Serum was impossible to evaporate and it could not be touched without turning into a living weapon. However, planet Strom was the perfect planet to do research and plan on how to destroy it, without being ultimately detected by Zjok’s forces. So, the Asids made a rendezvous point to their base on the planet. Everything was going great, up until the Adoa had relocated their theives.

Misara Serum


Zjok and his Adoa had formed a counter-attack on the Strom base, although they had failed. With the help of his combat skills and his lightning, Preox and Rig were unstoppable, until they unexpectedly, and unfortunately, got ultimately knocked unconscious by falling debris. The Misara Serum had been leading up to many harsh conflicts and it was about to bring much more.

The Misara Serum was hurdling towards Kingzing City, towards a truck, which was loading off boxes of Boiling Blood energy drinks at a local coffee shop. A coffee shop known to be the Funky Munkey Café.

“Hey!” yelled the truck driver to his partner. “Hurry up with those boxes! We still got another load to take to the next shop!”

“I'm hurryin', I'm hurryin'!” the truck driver's partner snapped. “Just hold on a sec', while I pick this damn thing up, Chuck! Haha, I said 'upchuck'.”

Chuck shook his head. “Want me to call your mom to help you, Cletus?”

“Shut up!”

The Serum, falling from over 100 miles per hour, landed straight onto Chuck's big head. A perfect hit. The big-bellied man grunted and fell forward on the ground. Good thing he was wearing his trucker hat, because it was known to be the perfect helmet! The Misara Serum, resembling a typical product of Boiling Blood, rolled beside the half-conscious Chuck, who made the angriest face ever. Ever. He slowly got up.

“Cletus! Why in the hell did you throw this at me?”

“Ugh, throw what?!?”

“This energy drink, you dipstick!”

“I din't throw crap!” hollered Cletus, walking out with a box of Boiling Blood.







Chapter 2

Chuck shrugged and threw the can at Cletus.

Cletus squealed as it hit him in the head, making him drop the box of products, as he was walking down the truck's ramp. Bottles and cans tumbled everywhere, causing the Serum completely unrecognizable.

“Shove that in your little, scrawny butt,” Chuck said, laughing. People inside the Funky Munkey Café stared at the two truckers, with concerned looks on their faces. Holly and Kyle, whom were also in there, had the same looks on their faces, as well. As the mess was cleaned up, the Serum was placed inside a box-full of energy drinks. Uh oh. The two truckers left, once the employees of the Funky Munkey began stocking the Boiling Blood into the coffee shop.











“So, I got in for the spring play,” said Kyle, joyfully. He was feeling a lot better than before. With the help of Holly being there for him, and his caramel mocha, nothing could go wrong!

“Really?” Holly replied, taking a sip of her hot black coffee. “That's awesome, man. What play is it?”

“The Princess Bride.”

“Oh, sweet!! I love the movie! Who are you playing as??”

“Inigo Montoya,” Kyle answered with a smile.

“Aaah! Do the impression!!”

Kyle got into acting mode. “'My name is Inigo Montoya...You killed my father...prepare to―’” Axyl and Cale were seen in his sights, once the two meatheads had entered the café.

Misara Serum


“Hey, what's up, ya jagga-loons?” said Axyl with a smile. Cale snorted out laughter, though immediately stopped because his nose was insanely sore. Holly scoffed at the two, assuming that they both followed her and Kyle to the Funky Munkey, in order to cause more trouble. They both took a seat at the table, the one where Kyle and Holly were sitting at. “So what's up? You two on a date?”

Cale snorted. “Haha, yeeeahh.” The blonde-haired jock took Kyle's caramel mocha and downed it. “MMM! That's good stuff.”

Kyle sat there and said nothing, staring down at the table.

“Aw, you gonna cry?” Axyl laughed hysterically. “Look he's gonna cry!”

Kyle looked awful and Holly looked pissed.

“That was his mocha you know that?” she said to Cale sternly.

“Pffft, so?” he replied.

“He paid $3.45 for that mocha, with his own money. You think it's funny to just take it and drink it all, butterhead?”

Cale laughed. “Quite a bit, yeah.” Holly was enraged with fury, as she slammed her palm against Cale's nose. “Ahhh!” He fell backward from his chair, Axyl laughed his ass off. Holly hated that laugh, she really did, so she wasn't hesitant when she took her hot black coffee and splashed it in Axyl’s face. “AAAAAHH!” Axyl fell backward, desperately wiping the hot coffee off his face.

“Hey! This ain't a prayground! You wanna pray?! You pray outside!” yelled the Funky Munkey manager, who had a thick accent.

“We were just leaving, anyway,” Holly said with a smile. “Let's go, Kyle.” The two left the cafe, leaving Axyl and Cale on the ground.

They both got up and Axyl calmly approached the front counter to buy a can of Boiling Blood. Without even noticing, he had selected the Serum and put it on the counter, thus taking out his wallet.

“That'll be $1.99. That all for you, wittle pansy?” the manager said.

Axyl nodded. “Yeah”. He gave the money and took the Serum, thinking that it was Boiling Blood, and gave the manager a threatening look. “Hey! I am in varsity baseball and I can lift sixty-fives! Don't mess with me, alright? Don't make me kick your ass. So you better watch it, buddy-boy!”

Chapter 2


The manager spat laughter in his face. “Ooooh me so scared! Good thing I have unrimited amount of black coffee for your face! Go home, wittle pansy! Hahahahahahaha!!”










The two jocks left the cafe and they watched Holly drive away, with Kyle, in her car. Cale groaned as he looked at his cell phone.

“What now?” Axyl asked as they both walked through the city of Kingzing. The gorgeous buildings staggered over them.

“My phone! It has no signal at all.”

“What phone company do you have?”

“Flint.”

“Ah, no wonder,” Axyl stated as he struggled to open his energy drink. “Flint is the worst cellphone company, ever. Sometimes I think their satellites are always busted. But look at this! Look! The Boiling Blood label isn’t on this can! Weird. What a weird thing!”

“That is weird, yet I do not care,” Cale simply said.

Axyl continued to examine his beverage. After one a few shrugs of uncertainty, Axyl then took a large gulp of the substance. Axyl took a deep breath from the quick refresher, and let out a huge belch. The belching felt warm and disgustingly distasteful. Axyl felt a weird feeling inside his stomach, as if he was going to throw up.

“Hey man, you okay?” Cale asked.

Axyl nodded. “Yeah, yeah, I'm good. C'mon, let's get back to school.”

Cale looked confused. “But I thought we were going to skip?”

Axyl answered in his head. But Holly is in my Biology 2 class!


Misara Serum


He actually ended up not saying anything. Instead, they got into Axyl’s black 2003 Sierra pick-up truck and drove off. The taste of the “energy drink” was foul and extremely warm. Strangely enough, it felt so cold when he took it out of the fridge in the cafe. Axyl felt weird, really weird. Not only he felt sick, he also didn't “feel the energy” coming from what he just drank. Something was wrong. Axyl decided to let this concerned thoughts slip his mind, as he took another sip of the Serum, hoping he’ll just get used to the taste. Today was going to be very different for Axyl Matthew Smithy. Very different, indeed.

On the coast of Golden Gardens beach. Seattle, Washington.









A hand was rising out of the cold, sandy, and salty waters. Was someone going swimming? Oh, it was just Preox rising out of the surface, with Rig holding onto his leg. It was a cold and foggy, yet very wet, day for Seattle. The Asid gasped for air as he stomped his armored feet on the cool wet sand; His four lungs were about to burst from the lack of oxygen. Angrily, he kicked Rig in the face so he would let go of his leg. They both inhaled and exhaled deeply, becoming aware of their surroundings. Preox’s eyes grew, as wide as dinner plates. He had never been to Earth before and, according to the Asids, the planet had always been known as a universal myth. Planet Earth was, in fact, real and Preox’s first thought was “terror.”


Chapter 2


“No,” he began, “this is impossible!”

“Anything is possible, if you just set your mind to it,” Rig said happily.

“Shut up, you ridiculous weasel!” Preox snapped. “This is planet Earth. We're on planet Earth? How? I thought this place was just a horror story.”

“Well, I guess it's not,” Rig replied in a smart-assed tone.

“This is Earth. The studies were true. But where are the humans?”

“Humans?” Rig asked confusingly

“Yes, humans. There seems to be none out here. But be careful and do not get spotted.”

“Why?” the Aziquet whined. “I wanna cuddle with the humans.”

“They are not to be cuddled with, Rig! Humans are so ridiculous when it comes to new discoveries. If they discover a species outside their planet, they'll put us on autopsy tables and gut us out.”

“But what if I want to be gutted out?”

Preox flinched. He was not in the mood for stupid questions. “You DON'T want to be gutted out. First thing we should do is find something to blend in with! Then, we shall search for the Misara Serum. My Vambit is totaled, so flight is certainly out of the question. I’ll have to fix it, later, in an isolated area.”

Rig blinked. “How do you know the Serum is still around here?”

“When the Misara Serum was invented,” Preox began, “Zjok planted a tracking device inside the lid of the container. Since we have the codes to do that, I can get us to the Misara Serum in no time! Although, again, my Vambit is busted, but I believe the coordinates are still intact. The sooner I get my Vambit fixed, the sooner we can retrieve the Misara and get off this God-forsaken planet.”

“Yeah, about that,” Rig said, “how are we getting off this planet? You broked the flying toy remember?”

“I’ll kill you if you mention that again! And I do not know, yet.”

The two aliens began running lightly through the sands of the beach and onto a trail that led inside an empty parking lot. They could see a small tunnel up ahead, under a small wooden bridge. There was no one in sight, which was very helpful. Preox motioned Rig to follow him towards the tunnel.

“Hey, Preox?” said Rig. “How did you know all that stuff about the

Misara Serum


humans?”

Preox sighed. “Looks like someone wasn’t paying attention in Myths & Legends class.”

“Yeah, and your point is?”

They gently, and quietly, ran toward the dark tunnel as light rain began to intensify. Before they got into the tunnel, Preox spotted a human hobo sitting up against the wall. The Asid gasped and pulled Rig back.

“I know it's you, alien,” said the hobo. “I know you are here to take me away into space, where I belong.” Preox walked into the tunnel, followed by Rig, staring at the hobo, cautiously. The hobo was a complete mess and his cackled laughter was hoarse and sickly.

“Wh-what happened to your teeth?” Preox finally asked, after a brief moment of silence.

The hobo laughed, completely ignoring Preox’s question of concern. “With this hand, I can control myself; pleasure myself; love myself.”

Preox wanted to vomit, though he remained focused on what needed to be done. He eyed a pile of clothes, sitting next to the hobo. A disguise, perhaps?












“Do you think my nails look fine?” the hobo asked showing his finger nails. Preox looked absolutely disgusted. They were wreteched and rotten.

“Uh, yeah,” Preox answered, taking the hobo's clothes. The hobo didn’t


Chapter 2

notice.

“Oh, thank God! Thanks, man,” the hobo replied happily.

“Yeah. Sure,” Preox replied.

“You look gorgeous!” Rig hollered and knelt down to give the hobo a hug. It was a rather touching moment.

The hobo fell asleep and Rig ended up smelling much worse than he did before. They were both probably going to end up smelling like sardines, once they were to use the hobo’s clothing for their disguises.

Rig sniffled and tried not to cry, as they both departed the tunnel. “What a sweet, cute human.” As they made it through the other end of the tunnel, they crossed a pair of rusted rail-road tracks and continued along a trail that led to the inside of a forest. Once out of plain sight, they stopped and began to dress up.

Rig put on a greasy T-shirt when he said, “Awww, look Preox! A moose!”

They both stared at the creature, which happened to be a few yards away from them. He perked his head up with a huge mouthful of grass. The moose's eyes grew large at the sight of Preox and Rig.

“Amazing,” Preox said sarcastically. He continued to dress up and noticed the creature had never stopped staring at them. He just stood there, staring. Preox shrugged and slipped a stocking cap on his bald head, as Rig ended up putting on a blonde wig, along with a pair of glasses. They began to move swiftly, unaware of the moose’s true identity. Once Preox and Rig were gone, the moose stood up on his hind legs and ripped a piece of bark off a tree, revealing a metal pad with buttons. The moose pushed a couple buttons and a voice came through a speaker.

“Yes? What is it, Agent Moosey17?”

“We got somethin',” replied Moosey. His voice was small and high- pitched. Similar to that of a young child.

“Whoa. Really?” replied the voice.

“I just saw two aliens putting on clothes exactly 37.3 yards away.”

“What're your coordinates?” the voice demanded. The voice was very formal, yet deep and big. He sounded like Robert from the sitcom Everybody Loves Raymond.

Misara Serum

















“My exact location is 47.692379 degrees North and 122.43359 degrees west.”

“We shall send back-up as soon as possible, buddy. For now, keep an eye on them, you never know what they could be up to.”

“Okay, thank you. Ooooh this is so exciting! Finally!” Moosey laughed hysterically.


Kingzing City, OR

It's the middle of Biology 2 and Axyl was hardly paying any attention, at all. He couldn't stop staring at Holly's fine hair, and watch her quietly jot down class notes, from the projector in front of the class. He loved how her beautifull blonde hair had swayed with every move she made. It didn't have to move at all to be amazing and Axyl probably wasn’t the only one crushing on her. For all he knew, Kyle could be crushing on Holly also. Axyl was not only a total jerk, but his paranoia was extremely aggravating. And whether Kyle liked Holly or not, attempting to actually “win her over” was the stupidest idea he could ever think of.

He had to get Holly's attention, but how? She'll most likely ignore him, especially after what had happened at the Funky Munkey Cafe. The room was silent, as students wrote in their composition notebooks. The teacher, Mrs.

Chapter 2

Flatulence, wandered around the classroom looking down on students' desks to make sure they were obtaining her useful information.

Every time Mrs. Flatulence would pass by, Axyl would open his notebook and pretend to write notes. After Mrs. Flatulence had passed him by, again, Axyl silently crumpled up a piece of paper. He tossed it at Holly, hitting her in the back of the head. She slowly turned around and looked at Axyl.

He mouthed, followed by hand gestures, and implied, “You. Want to. Go. On a. Date. With. Me. Sometime?” His final hand gesture was a thumbs up, followed a stupid grin on his face. Holly knew exactly what Axyl was mouthing about. She gave him a deadly look and cracked her knuckles.

Axyl loved that about Holly: She always meant business and she was always ready for an ass-whoppin'. Axyl thought it was one of the hottest things in the history of time and he was not exaggerating even the slightest bit. Holly had turned around, facing the screen of the projector and continued to write her notes quietly. Axyl was determined to find another way to grab her attention, when he suddenly felt a sharp pain in his chest. Heart burn? The pain reached his stomach. It felt like someone was lighting a light saber in his body.

“Ooooo,” he exclaimed faintly, making some of the students turn around, in order to see who the hell made that silent moan of agony. Axyl rose his hand and asked to use the restroom. Mrs. Flatulence excused him and he proceeded to make his way to the toilet. What was happening to him? He didn’t eat lunch (unless if someone were to count a can of Misara Serum as a form of eatery), so that couldn’t be the reason why he was enduring this new pain. Axyl felt like he was going to throw up. The sharp, stinging, fiery pain got worse! He rushed into the men's restroom and went into one of the stalls, got on his knees, and vomited inside the toilet. He had barfed three times, before he realized that he was belching no ordinary vomit. The toilet started to melt, turning into a pile of what looked like mushy clay. Then, the substance, which Axyl had released from his mouth, oozed slowly out of the melting toilet. “What?” Axyl started. He was too astounded from the sight of hot, boiling lava oozing. He scrambled up on his feet, just about to freak out and scream, like a little girl. He ran out of the restroom and began running


Misara Serum




















back to class. Thank goodness no one was in the hallway when Axyl unexpectedly released more large amounts of lava from his mouth. He wanted to scream in pain from the burning sensation. The pain was awful and his throat was was practically on fire.

“Oh, good golly God,” he whispered, almost crying. He weakly took a few more steps, opened his classroom door, and sat down. Axyl felt dizzy and felt like he was going to pass out at any given moment. However, he decided to pretend that nothing had happened. How the hell was he going to explain piles of vomited lava? Then again, how could anyone questions such a preposterous factor? Axyl hesitantly took out his pencil and began to write his biology notes, like a good student.








Chapter 3: Being Watched


















First, Axyl asked himself if it was possible to literally throw up lava. How could this be possible? Axyl felt stupid asking himself the very question. If anyone else was in his position, however, there was no doubt that they would feel the same way. Axyl was so confused he got a headache, for all he could think about was what had happened in the bathroom and how people would ultimately react towards seeing lava all over the school floor and restroom.

The bell rang and Axyl was the last one to walk out of class. The idea of asking Holly out was a ridiculous idea, especially now. The fire department, the police, ambulances, and the Environmental and Health Safety Patrol were at the school in almost in no time at all. School was dismissed early, due to the deep concern of the ludicrous event.

Axyl didn’t do anything, other than walked back to his black truck to leave campus. He turned the ignition and began driving through the city, where he and his dad both lived in an apartment complex. He tuned through the FM radio and continuously listened to the Kingzing City news, which specifically reported about what had happened at the high school. He was so anxious that he had to slap himself silly a few times.

Chapter 3


He stopped in front of the Funky Munkey Café and took a deep breath. He switched off the ignition, stepped out, and walked inside the café, just in time when the manager was leaving from his shift.

“Oh, rook, it’s da wittle pansy,” the manager laughed.

“Shut up, will ya?” Axyl said, who was full of stress.

“Oh? An' what if I no shut up?”

“Just shut up! Anyway, I have reason to believe that there's something going on in your café! Ever since the last time I had been there, I have been throwing up lavvvvva-lot! I’ve been throwing up, a lot!”

“Why you say dat, wittle pussy?”

Axyl shut his eyes and took a deep breath to relieve the anger. Damn that coffee manager! Axyl had to find out whether something was wrong with the café, or not. Ever since he and Cale had left the Funky Munkey, he felt extremely weird. He was completely unaware that the answer he was looking for was literally resting in the passenger seat of his truck! Axyl continued and asked, “Dude, is there, like, some sort of gas leak, of some sort, in the cafe?”

“Uh, harrro?” the manager chuckled. “Dis cafe have been healthy; approved by health inspector, for the past five years! There’s nothing wong with Funky Munkey! Now go away, pansy!”

The manager left, imitated Axyl’s final question, and laughed. Axyl was angry at that manager. Of course, he never really enjoyed receiving a taste of his own medicine. He walked all over the Funky Munkey Cafe area, finding nothing suspicious, which really seemed to frustrate him even more.

He walked back outside and noticed, across the street in an alley way, a person was getting mugged by a couple of notorious thugs. They were beating the poor man senseless and demanded to hand over his wallet. Axyl tried to ignore it, despite the man’s cries for help, though he couldn’t help but notice that no one else was attempting to put a stop to this dangerous conflict.

“Rgghhh!” Axyl grunted under his breath and ran across the street, and hollered at the bad guys. “Hey, buddy-boys, leave him alone!”

Axyl was ready! The last time he had punched someone was Kyle, and now his fists were ready to smash the skulls of two criminals! With Axyl’s fists clenched, the two thugs had turned around and they looked much larger up close.

Being Watched














“Or what?” one thug responded.

Axyl gulped and was intimidated for the first time in his life. “O-or, I'll break both your freakin' necks!” The two thugs stared at each other and they smiled. The thug who spoke, whose name was Butch (And the other’s name was Tom), had a bat at his side.

“Hey Tubbo, don't you be thinkin' about swingin' that at me,” Axyl said.

“Then get outta here, Skippy,” Tom said, who wielded a crow bar. “This is nun-ya.”

Axyl lifted one eyebrow. “What the hell is ‘nun-ya?’”

Butch laughed. “Nun-ya BUSINESS!” The thug swung the bat and hit Axyl in the side.

“OW!!!!” he screamed in pain, kneeling to the ground. Butch was about to swing again when Axyl quickly grabbed the bat and yanked it from his hands. “That hurt, you big brute!” Axyl jabbed the bat in Butch's stomach and swung it against his hip. Then, Tom came for Axyl with the crow bar. Axyl grabbed him by the shirt with both hands. He slammed Tom against the wall so hard, the thug collapsed on the ground moaning in pain. Axyl heard Butch holler at the top of his lungs, and he quickly turned around to lift Butch over his shoulders! The adrenaline was so rushed that Axyl didn’t realize that he was carrying over 275 pounds above his neck. In fact, Axyl’s recent acts of violence didn’t feel like adrenaline at all. Something else was aiding his strength.

Axyl took Butch outside the alley way and ran him through the city.

Chapter 3


“Put me down, you little crap!” Butch hollered, angrily.

“Where's your car?!” Axyl yelled back.

“It's a white 1999 Camaro, parked on Gut Street! Why??”

Axyl didn’t answer, and he ran faster once he had seen the 1999 white Camaro. “I shall teach you not to hit people with bats because it's...A STRIKEOUT!!”

Butch yelled and got free, making them both stumble on the ground. They were both facing each other and Butch threw the first punch; Axyl ducked and did a swift upper-cut up his jaw. Butch fell back on the ground and was completely unconcsious. Everyone was in awe and amazement of what was going on: An eighteen year-old had beaten the snot out two bigger, middle-aged men. People were going nuts, as they took photos and made urgent phone calls to their peers: “Get over here, right now! Some teenager just beat the tar out of this dude!”












Axyl felt proud and pumped! He picked up Butch, with both out-stretched arms, and he could not believe what was happening. He felt like he was dreaming, but surely wasn’t! For a final, finishing blow, Axyl slammed Butch on top of his Camaro. The wind shield and hood of the car was totaled, followed by the alarm system continuously blaring. People of Kingzing City clapped and cheered (A woman, with her camera, approached Axyl and said she was there recording him when he first walked up to Butch and Tom, after they were beating a hopeless victim to near-death.) Then, police sirens were heard, making everyone complain and moan because the “fun was over.”

Being Watched


Axyl’s thoughts were swimming in a contiuous loop; he didn’t know what to think! After a few brief moments of self-victory, he had suddenly remembered of the poor guy who was getting the life beaten out of him. He ran off quickly, before the police arrived at the scene. He got back to the small alley way and saw Tom on the ground, completely unconscious from Axyl’s damages. The victim, however, had fled and Axyl couldn’t blame him. He quickly got back into his pick-up and watched a police car pull up to the alley way, escorting Tom away. This little, yet big, moment reminded Axyl of him and Cale harassing Kyle. He felt bad, really bad, but he quickly got to thinking how unusually unusual his day had been. He threw up lava, he withstood a heavy blow from a baseball ball bat, and he lifted two ugly middle-aged men like little children. He was amazed about what happened and realized that this could be on the news! In his overwhelming thoughts, this could all make him more popular, and therefore (hopefully) persuade Holly into hating him much less?! Oh, this was perfect for Axyl!! But boy, did his elbows burn. Why did they? He flexed his bicep and tended gently to his elbow, as he examined. “Why is everything being so weird tod―?”

PEEEEW!!

Axyl almost soiled himself when a beam of laser past through the interipr of his elbow, shattering his windshield. Smoke escaped through the shattered glass, as Axyl’s jaw dropped. “W-why…?”

“Yo!” yelled a guy. “You oughta get yo' window checked!”

Axyl, completely awe-struck, replied, “Yeah, okay!”

The guy shook his head and said quietly, “Crazy white people not checking their windows!”

Appalled and astonished, duely noted to the fact that no one had noticed the sudden blast, Axyl shook his head and and began to drive his way home. His jaw was shaking and his palms were sweating, all because Axyl now focused the conclusion that he had POWERS OF MASS DESTRUCTION!

Impossible, right? Nope! As Axyl came to a halt in front of an upcoming traffic light, he noticed the police talking to witnesses. Surprisingly enough, the police did not suspect the damaged windshield. He looked at his passenger seat and eyed the Misara Serum lying beside him. The

Chapter 3


can was half-way empty and he felt very suspicious. He shrugged, completely ignoring his ethics, and downed the rest of what was left of the Serum. “Woo! I'm thirsty! I still can't believe they forgot to put the Boiling Blood logo on there. Ha! Those idiots!” The red light had turned green and Axyl casually drove off. Despite the anxiety, he felt extremely over-accomplished.

Pike Place Farmers' Market, Seattle, WA








Traveling several miles in two hours, Preox and Rig absolutely could not find a better place to fix the Vambit. What’s worse was that time was being wasted, all thanks to Rig’s redundant curiosity. On a much brighter note, it wasn't at all difficult blending in with the humans. They were completely thrown off by Preox’s and Rig’s appearances, but the idea of calling them “martians from outer space” never seemed to cross their primitive minds.

“This place rocks!” Rig yelled excitingly, as the duo roamed around the interior of Pike Place Market, within the city of Seattle. They continued to walk around, with Rig being the only one to admire his surroundings.

“Time is being wasted, you tart!” Preox snapped, as they entered a knick-knack shop. “We need to find a place, now, to repair my Vammmm....back-pack! Yes, we must fix the ‘back-pack!’” Rig ignored his partner, as he admired a dress. Preox detached his damaged Vambit and began examining it. The Vambit was excruciatingly damaged, and needed a fine tune-up before their voyage for the Misara Serum were to continue

Being Watched


The alien toyed with a few buttons and a faint projection appeared, revealing a faint, small, red beacon on the state of Oregon. It was the tracking signal of the Misara Serum!

“Jumping Jabberwocky!” Preox exclaimed and latched his Vambit upon his armor. He saw the map of North America behind the cashier, ran up, pounced on the counter, and ripped the map off the wall.

“Hey! My family spent generations with that map!” the cashier whined.

“Oh, calm your hair! You can get another one from the gift shop,” Preox snapped. “Rig! Get over here, you lifeless sponge!” Rig dropped the dress and approached him. “Look, Rig, my tracking device barely worked for just enough time for me to see where the Serum’s location currently is! It appears to be residing in that location, here!” He pointed at the south-western coast of Oregon. Rig didn't understand, for all he asked was, “So your Vambit is fixed?”

Preox didn't hesitate in folding the map and storing it in the greasy pocket of his jacket, which he had stolen from a homeless person. “You know what? Never mind, Rig, never mind! C'mon let's go, we gotta get that Serum.”

“But Preox!” Rig whined. “I'm sooo hungryyy!!!”

Preox sighed the biggest sigh, ever. “Okay, what do you wish to eat?”

“Cheeseburgers!”

“Let's go get cheeseburgers! After that, we are continuing this search!

“You got it, pal!”

“Don't you dare call me that again or I'll rip your stupid, smiling teeth in front of all these people.”

The two finally left the knick-knack store and just as they were heading out, Preox had seen the moose from before! The moose was also wearing a suit and tie. Preox was now facing a deep amout of concern and he was concerned about the moose’s potential appearance to be of a plausible threat.

“C'mon, let's go get them cheeseburgers,” Preox said, as they hurriedly made their way outside the Market, without making too much commotion.

Moosey took a peak from his hiding spot, which was from a pile of freshly caught fish. Exclaiming with distress, and angry fishermen yelled at him for getting fur in their products and was immediately booted out.

Chapter 3


(As Moosey began to trace his two targets, a random civilian walked up to him saying, “Cool costume, bra!” So, Moosey’s appearance wasn’t as alarming as Preox and Rig’s.)

One fisherman of the Pike Place Market was so angry at Moosey, that he started to interrogate him. However, the moose was swift and shot the man in the neck with a tranquilizer gun (This moose meant business.) Moosey began to walk slowly after his targets, until Preox and Rig were almost out of his sight. He took out a cell phone, from his jacket pocket, and spoke into it.

“They’re on the move,” Moosey said.

“Good. Are they going somewhere where it wouldn't cause too much of a scene?”

“Ugh, I hope so. I've been travelling almost eight miles, tracking these two. Are you going to send any backup?”

“Yes, we are. Agent Nathan12 will be there by the time the aliens get to their next ‘resting area.’ Any idea where that could be?”

Moosey continued to follow Preox and Rig, keeping his distance from any more suspicion. “Some sort of burger place, I believe. I heard one of them mentioning cheeseburgers; I'll keep you posted.”

“Alright,” the voice sighed, “Agent Nathan12 will be on his way at 18:00. Moosey, I'm surprised we could contact you, we've been having trouble contacting the others.”















“Why? Wait, what cell phones does everyone else have?”

Being Watched

“Flint.”

“Aaaah, no wonder. Flint satellites are never efficient,” Moosey laughed. They both hung up the phone, as Moosey proceeded his pursuit.

Axyl’s apartment building.

Axyl was somewhat relaxed. Although, he was still eccentric, ready for another fight, and he couldn’t stop smiling like a smug idiot.













He just couldn't believe it. The questioning struck him as if someone threw a brick at him: “Am I a superhero?” And at this point, if he were present, Kyle would respond, “No, you're a super jerk!” Axyl continued to ask himself this question repetitively, as he walked into his dad’s apartment.

“Dad!” he hollered. “I'm home!” The apartment was very formal revealed plenty of Axyl’s weathier life; his father worked as a manager for home realestate. Axyl’s father, Jared Smithy, was always a persistent and hard-working individual. And the magnificent and massive interior of his apartment was a prime result of that hardworking commitment. The apartment room, in all, had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, one kitchen (which occupied a quarter of the interior) there was an entertainment center, pinball machines, a nice living room with nice furniture, a fireplace, and a large balcony, viewing the very skyline of Kingzing City and the Pacific Coast. A second floor was a part of the establishment, also, which was specifically for the two bedrooms and the one other bathroom.

Chapter 3


Axyl tossed his backpack aside, avoiding the fact that he had a substantial amount of homework from his general classes. To keep himself occupied on a daily basis, other than school and homework, Axyl worked at a local supermarket, named Cheese and Crackers. The supermarket was commonly known as having the best cheese in the city. Also, a lot of white people worked there, so anyone could easily guess why it was called Cheese and Crackers. Before Axyl had to continue another shift at his job, he made his to the entertainment center and hopped onto the computer. Axyl logged onto the social media website of Bookface and saw that he had over 25 “friend” requests and 36 “new messages.” Now if Axyl were an attractive young woman, like Holly Ransfield, he would be receiving many notifications like this on a regular basis. According to him, this was great!

Axyl was so excited! His popularity was rising up to ULTRA POPULARITY! On a side-note, he was actually hoping that Holly was one of the people who had sent him a “friend request.” Maybe she had noticed Axyl’s amazing heroism on the news? He searched, with hopes held high, and there was nothing! He looked in his messages: Nothing there, either! Nothing about Holly, at all! As for the other messages and requests, they were from those who either saw Axyl in action, or on the news. Everyone was excited for him. However, Axyl had really wished he would hear from Holly; even though that seemed to be nothing more than a fantasy.

Axyl left the computer, sighing heavily, and turned on the flat screen TV in the livingroom. The local media was going hysterical over what Axyl had done. “So, you made the news, eh?” It was Axyl’s dad. His voice was deep, but demanding.

“Oh, yeah,” replied Axyl. “Dude look at this! Isn’t that insane?!

His dad, whose name was Jared Alvin Smithy, shrugged of Axyl’s excitement as if he couldn’t care less. “It's just a fight, bucko.”

Axyl looked at him. “Really? I just beat the snot out of two ugly and I saved someone's life. I rocked it!”

“Oh, jeez,” Jared chuckled, “I'm damn proud, son. However, I wish you could achieve in more important terms, other than a fight. Say, a promotion? Maybe some better grades?” Axyl rolled his eyes. “Hey, Axyl! Don’t give me that eye-rollin’! Got that, buddy-boy?”

Being Watched


“Ugh, sorry, DAD,” Axyl argued back, “I wish my life didn't have to be ruined by your annoying lectures.”

Jared laughed. “I've been paying for your school, your truck, and your stupid phone, and your baseball caps! With the money I make, you’re still the most expensive thing I’ve ever spent my life on! When I was your age, I was busy sorting some prestigious asshole’s groceries! I didn't always live a wealthy life, who owned two pretty fountains! I don't want you turning into a snotty punk, like the ones I had to put up with when I was in high school!”

Axyl snorted, walked upstairs, and obnoxiously responded, “Why do you have to ruin everything for me, Dad??”

“See?? That's the attitude I do not enjoy, right there! That pig snort won't get you anywhere but a circus, buddy-boy! Remember that!” Axyl’s door slammed and Jared laughed hysterically. “Oh, damn, do I just LOVE kids!”

Axyl was throwing a fit, with his face planted into his pillow upon his bed, which was embarrassing for a kid his age. Amongst his whining attitude, he wanted to actually try out his new abilities; he wanted to achieve greatness, become a superhero, and find what else he was capable of! As far as he knew, Axyl was stronger than ever before. He could lift much heavier objects, shoot a laser out his elbow, and throw up lava! However, puking lava was not Axyl’s favorite.

The decision was difficult: He had to decide whether he should eat dinner with Jared or leave the apartment to practice his superpowers. Would he rather miss out on his Dad’s famous ribs, or go out to experiment his abilities in an isolated area? After thirty minutes of thinking, followed by a slight distraction in playing with his pocket lint, Axyl rose from his bed, slipped on his lettermans jacket, and made his way out of the apartment. He avoided his dad, like a grumpy four year-old, as he left his home. Other than being angry at his dad for shoving moral fiber down his throat, Axyl knew he was going to regret missing out on those delicious ribs.





Chapter 4: Newborn Foes














The day was ready to turn off the sunlight and successfully end. Preox and Rig, so far, have had it rough. They were stranded on a fully-inhabited and “horrendous planet,” surrounded by humans who would all literally crap themselves, if they were to discover the aliens’ true identities. Preox’s paranoia continued to grow drastically, as Rig’s stupidity remained at a constant. Preox had become vigorously suspicious, knowing that Moosey was pursuing them, and he had to fix the Vambit fast.

They’re next conflict began in the residential area of Queen Anne, Seattle, just outside a restaurant known as Dick's Drive-In. Dick’s was the perfect place to not only make ridiculous jokes and nautical puns out of its own title, but to eat the most delicious cheeseburgers in the city!

It was 7pm, the sun was setting, and this time was the perfect time to grab a bite out of Dick's, and Rig couldn’t be any more excited. Preox’s ansy behavior was like a ticking bomb, for he couldn't spend any more time walking around in a homeless person's clothes; fixing his Vambit was now a number one priority, as well as retrieving the Serum and escaping Earth.


Chapter 4


As soon as Preox finished ordering Rig's cheeseburgers, Preox ran into the restroom and occupied one of the stalls. He detached his Vambit, pulled out an exotic tool (a tool for fixing Asid technology, specifically), and began working on the repairs. Neon sparks shot out, which faintly lit the entirety of the small, cramped space with a toilet. During the fixation of the Vambit, there followed loud crackling noises, causing the fixing process to be so obnoxious, that anyone within the Dick area could take notice and inspect.

A man, who appeared to be an employee, walked into the crudely disgusting restroom and Preox immediately stopped working. No! Not now! Go away, human! The employee was silent. His peculiar facial expression of raising eyebrows made him wonder about what was making the loud noises from the inside of the restroom. However, it was dead quiet, until the employee finally spoke in a prepubescent tone. “Umm... Are you OkAY in hERE, sir?”

Preox moaned in agony, pretending to release his digestive tract. How else could he explain the nautical noise from fixing his Vambit? “Err... Ugh... Oh... YES! Yes I'm fine! Just―you know―releasing! Oh, dang! Oooohh here it comes!” Preox found a pen laying nearby, picked it up, and dropped it in the toilet to enhance the pretentious act.

“Oh,” employee said, covering his nose. “Well, okAY! Feel better, sIR.”

“Thank you kindly, precious human. Ohhhhh, UGGGGH!!”

Once the employee was out of the restroom, with an awkward expression on his face, Preox immediately went back to work, with the return of that loud and obnoxious noise. Preox was very clever.








Meanwhile

Agent Moosey17 waited patiently, outside the Dick's restaurant. People laughed because they thought he was a man in a costume. This didn’t phase him, however, despite their false accusations. Moosey needed to focus on his

Newborn Foes


mission of interrogating the disguised aliens.

Standing in his place, as he was trying to resist the urge to tranquilize the next person who dared to tease him, a dark-blue vehicle drove up and parked beside the curb several feet away from the moose. An average-sized man exited the passenger’s seat and approached Moosey. They both stood upright, side-by-side each other, avoiding eye-contact. The unknown driver operated the dark-blue vehicle and drove out of sight, as quickly as a ghost. The man, who had joined his fellow Agent, was much shorter than Moosey. Moosey was about seven feet tall, however.

“Glad you could make it, Agent Nathan12,” Moosey said in his child-like voice. His voice was too admirable to be taken seriously.

“Always been a pleasure working with you, Agent Moosey17,” Nathan replied with a smile, though immediately straightened his expression back to neutral. “So, what intel do you have so far?”

“The aliens are in that restaurant, to the left. They've been inside for exactly―” looks at his phone “―sixteen minutes and forty-seven seconds.”

“Wow, you're really precise with your timing, huh?” Nathan said.

“I know!” Moosey digressed. “I love this phone! It has a timer and everything! It’s so revolutionary.”

Nathan chuckled. “Welcome to 2005, Moosey.”

“Oh yes, thank you.” The two agents laughed softly.

“So, has ‘the Commander’ given you any further updates?” Nathan asked, as he took off his sunglasses and wiped them clean with the sleeves of his blue tuxedo. His hair was purely blonde; his face shined like pure butter.

“Yes,” Moosey answered attentively, “he said when you get here, we have the permission to tranquilize the aliens at any given time (We have several other Agents surrounding the area.)”

“Don't worry,” Nathan said, as he wielded his tranquilizer gun and loaded it, “I'ma make momma proud!”

“You’re ready, Agent Nathan12? Try to not cause too much of a commotion. We need to perform this act swiftly and carefully.”

Agent Nathan looked around his surroundings, slightly admiring the architecture in the city of Seattle. Turning at his partner, he smiled brightly, putting his sunglasses back on. “Hold on, just a sec.”

Chapter 4


Reaching in his pocket, Nathan stuck a wad of gum in his mouth and chewed to his heart’s content. He figured, that if he chewed gum during combat, he would feel much more superior and motivated to pursue the objectives of his missions, past and present. “Oh yeah, baby. Let's do this.”


5 Minutes Later


Preox had finally done it! The Vambit was finally fixed! After a couple more visits from concerned employees, Preox managed to fix his most reliable instrument. He was actually, and truthfully, happy. He had enough happiness to relieve his anger towards Rig, as well as getting his heart pumping at its appropriate rate. Rig was sitting at a counter, alongside a massive window inside the diner, waving at people as he gorged himself on cheeseburgers and fries. “HI! I’M EATING! SEE?!”










“Rig!” Preox whispered loudly, once approaching him.

Rig turned his head, food sliding down his chin, “Whaff?” He spat food on Preox's big, pale-green, head and the Asid’s rage level began to rise, once again. He calmly wiped the food off his face before stating, “Rig, the Vambit, it's fixed.”

Rig spat more food out his mouth, against the big window. “Wow! About time!!”

Preox rolled his eyes. “Hurry up with those cheeseburgers, we got to get out of―” with his peripheral vision, he could see Agent Nathan12 aiming his tranquilizer gun at him “—HERE! GET DOWN!”

Newborn Foes


Preox tackled Rig off his stool and took refuge on the ground, right when Nathan shot and missed.

Moosey came around the corner. “Prepare to be captured!!!” Preox yanked Moosey’s tranquilizer gun and smacked it against his head. Moosey fell down and started crying. Preox gave him a second glance of pity and told Rig to get on his back, as people in the Dick area began to leave in a state of panic. Preox activated his Vambit and the two auto-turrets were immediately deployed, as well as his jet-pack. They zoomed through the window, with the help of immense firepower, thus flying away from the restaurant.

Nathan’s adrenaline was in a rush, and was slightly panicking as well. Everything went downhill so fast and he immediately approached an injured Moosey, who was suffering major headache. “Targets are on the move,” Nathan said into phone, “I repeat, the targets are on the move! Ascend backup, now; the aliens just broke a big window, so be careful! Moosey! Can you get up?”

The poor moose whimpered, “He hit me with my gun! He didn't have to do that! He’s so fast! OH! Mother of God, save us!”

Nathan’s panicked expression expanded after hearing his partner cry in uttermost despair and went back on this phone. Sweat dripped down his forehead as he spoke, “We have an agent wounded! The aliens are hostile! But the Commander still wants them alive; use your tranquilizers!

“Wow that was crazy sheeeezz!” Rig said with a chuckle, as he and Preox flew through the Queen Anne area. Just then, several dark-blue vehicles were in view, pursuing the two of them. Men stuck their guns out the passenger window and began shooting. One tranquilizer nearly ticked the Vambit, enraging Preox. “Oh! You dare shoot ME with DARTS?! Okay, if you wanna play rough, I'll play rough!”

Rig laughed. “That's what she said.” Ignoring his sensual remark, Preox turned around, swooped down towards the vehicles, and fired his weapons. Once he passed them by, the agency vehicles were either flipped over or critically damaged, as other passing cars had collided into one another. Preox watch Nathan get out of his damaged car; his outfit ruined and was covered in bloody scratches. Nathan looked up at the two aliens, hovering imitatingly the air, and shook his fist at them.

Chapter 4













“Is he congratulating us?” Rig whispered.

Preox replied sarcastically. “I suppose so! Anyway, my Vambit is low on lemonade fuel and we need to savor it. Let’s find a region to continue our journey for the Misara, somewhere more discreet, and look for more fuel.”

The aliens were flying away, leaving Nathan who was yelling, “I will get you for this!!!! HOW DARE YOU RUIN MY AWESOME SUIT?!” Preox and Rig got away from the mysterious agents. However, Preox knew that the agency would continue to chase them, no matter what. Venturing for the Misara Serum was going to be much difficult than he thought.

Meanwhile, National Kingzing City Junkyard


A beautiful, significant, and unforgettable sunset sat above Kingzing City, followed by a wave of perfectly warm climate. The gorgeous weather was the perfect emphasis to conclude such an eventful day! The ending of the fruitful day began with Axyl entering the middle of the National Kingzing City Junkyard, in his truck. His windshield remained obliterated, ever since he had literally blasted it into pieces, with his intriguing laser ability. He seized his vehicle, with a slight pushing of the brakes, and parked. Axyl was pretty confident this was the perfect and most discreet area to practice his super powers, without gaining too much attention. However, that was just another ill assumption made by an eighteen year-old with a low grade-point average.

Axyl continued to exit his vehicle, stuffing his car keys in his jacket pocket. The region was the perfect “realm” for an immense amount of junk.

Newborn Foes


The junkyard was full of unwanted things, enough of which to demonstrate incredibly awesome super-powers through a casual method of target practice. “Okay,” Axyl whispered to himself, “stay calm, stay calm! This has happened before and it’s going to happen again; even though the last time it happened, I could have incinerated more than just my windshield!” His new super-strength was the first ability he decided to perceive: He went behind the tail gate of his big pick-up and calmly lifted the vehicle’s rear above his head, like it was no big deal. He compared his strength to that of the Grinch who stole Christmas, only “better looking” from his own perspective. After setting his truck down, Axyl wore a great expression of excitement, as if someone mysteriously farted and he secretly took a liking of the stench. In other words: his eyes were wide, in reaction from his super strength!

Axyl made his way to a pile of junk and found a used pot. Unexpectly enough, Axyl hit himself in the head with the pot several times and it felt like he was wearing an “invisible helmet,” thus feeling only a slight headache. Axyl was overwhelmed! He could take a heap of damage and he did not have to suffer for it!
















Axyl was not only overwhelmed by this experience, but he was also ready for more action! Appropriately, it was now time for testing the crazy laser, which he had just recently discovered. His elbows felt warm and toasty, as he readied himself for some messy work.

Chapter 4


Axyl spotted an old, abandoned automobile, which appeared to be inoperable. In which case: It was covered in rust, the wheels were gone, and it was simply irrepairable. He pointed his elbow directly at it and took a liking as to how his elbow was positioned. Thinking of Holly and how beautiful she was, Axyl flexed his bicep for only a split second, and his elbow released the mighty laser. The old vehicle was completely destroyed; up in flames! An old muffler had flown out from the explosion, slamming againt Axyl’s head. He was too distracted, too excited, and so full of adrenaline that he didn't notice the muffler impacting his skull. He couldn't help but jump into the air and shout, “HOORAY!!!”

Now something was rather odd after he performed that small “victory leap.” As he jumped in the air, gravity did not take its course to bring him back down. He was hovering in the air! Axyl screamed like a banshee, after realizing he could fly! Axyl soared through the air in a calm and glorious manner, but he actually wasn’t so sure as to how he would actually land. He had no professional control of this new ability. So, with much hesitaton, Axyl flew down to land on the ground. The only problem was that he was going too fast, and he hit hard. Frustratingly shaking the dirt and shattered recycled glass off his face, he started flying again and decided to shoot his elbow laser at the same time! Blasting junk piles and flying at the same time was something Axyl could only dream of! All of the sudden, however, an old man appeared from the inside of his mobile home. He was tall, extremely thin, had no teeth, and seemed to be the only resident living inside the junkyard. And by the looks of it, he happened to be the owner of the junkyard and he didn’t look particularly happy towards Axyl’s disruptive actions. Once Axyl had first heard the old man yell at him, he was already back on his feet.

“Hey!” the old man yelled softly. “There's some people trying to eat soup!! I don’t know what you’re doin’, but you should stop!”

“Okay, sorry, sir,” Axyl apologized.

“Good! I do not like being wakened! I'm Bobby, by the way.”

“Sorry, Bobby. It won't happen again, Bobby. I was doing my acrobats for science class.” Axyl, being a jerk, couldn't laugh at the old man help but. The old man sounded almost inaudible as he spoke through his gums, where two rows of teeth once occupied.

Newborn Foes












“Good. Now I must go and finish my soup, by which you have made cold because you distracted me!” He slammed his door, never noticing the sparks of fire and smoke all around the junkyard, which Axyl had been the definite cause of. At that moment, Axyl decided it was time to go home. He’s had quite a day as is. He was hoping that Jared had the respectful decency to leave left-over barbecued ribs for his late dinner.

Axyl thought to himself, Shall I tell people of my amazing abilities, or shall I not? He wasn't so sure what to decide and he felt silly just thinking about it because he thought it would be great to show off his powers and eventually get Holly to swoon over his heroic stature. He did know plenty about superheroes and comic books. Some of them would hide their secret identity, some would not. If Axyl were to become an actual superhero, it would be a pain in the ass hiding his true identity from everyone. There would be a lot of interference with work, hanging out with friends, and especially attending school. This was actual reality, not a comic book, and hiding his true identity as a superhero would also be difficult. This was something Axyl had to really think about, and he really hated the idea of “thinking.”

He was now driving through the partially empty streets of the city, casually listening to music. He saw a billboard showing an ad featuring latest cologne product. Next to the picture of the product was picture of a cute couple in their underwear, in each other’s arms, lips barely touching. This immediately got Axyl into thinking about Holly Ransfield and his destiny to ask her out on a date. Axyl’s confidence was really going overboard and his hopes were being held high, like the hopes of those who had contructed the Titanic. In the perspective of Holly, she could let him sink without hesitation.

Chapter 4


On a related note, Axyl simply had no damn clue as to how he was going to win the likes of Holly. She tossed a substantial amount of hot black coffee in his face! So why should Axyl even bother to try? However, Axyl didn’t let Holly’s hatred bother him too much. His confidence clogged his mind from anything that appeared to intercept his admiration towards the independent female, because he believed he knew so much about girls in general. Axyl, in all respects from his peers, happened to be the one to give dating advice to those who needed it; even though his advice was completely biased and manipulative (What Axyl didn’t know was that Holly was much, much smarter than that.) He then remembered dating a younger girl in his sophomore year of high school, a girl named Velouria Lancelot. Axyl believed that his experience with Velouria could be used as an advantage to get to know Holly better. However, Velouria was compared to be the complete opposite of Holly’s intentions of being in a relationship. Velouria was very affectionate, Holly was not. What happened to Vel’s and Axyl’s relationship? Long story short, he was bored of her constant devotion and atrociously dumped her. Her heart was shattered.

It wasn’t like Axyl was a player, or anything, no no. He was, without a doubt, a heartless dolt. Whenever he would see Kyle, it would be an awful day for that poor kid. As any heartless dolt would do, Axyl could eventually ruin Kyle’s entire high school career. And Holly wanted him dead for it.













So, how was Axyl Smithy going to “win” Holly Ransfield? What first popped into Axyl’s head, as an idea, was to... Not be a jerk to Kyle or anyone else? The idea was brilliant, but difficult to perceive because Axyl was always

Newborn Foes


known as the biggest shithead in his school, if not the entire history of the school’s existence. This was going to be hard work for him, but Axyl simply adored Holly and nothing was going to stand in the way of that.

Axyl smiled, as he drove through the illuminated city in the night. He turned up the volume on his car radio and started singing along with the country music, completey unaware of what was bound to happen which was right about… Now.

Axyl squealed like a girl when he saw it; a big wad of cheese landed on the hood of his car! Axyl was lucky to park next to a curb of the nearby the Kingzing City Dansko Bridge, without completely crashing his vehicle. Axyl took a few deep breaths of relief. What’s with the cheese?! He was angry and was ready for giving a serious beating to anyone who was responsible for the mess. Axyl took the keys out of the ignition and stepped outside.

“Okay! Who in the name of Captain Crunch did that??” There was complete silence; just the sound of distant cars, the rustling sounds of bushes nearby, and trees swaying with the breeze. There was hardly anyone, or anything, in sight. “Come on out, wussies! Bring it on!!” Axyl hollered at the top of his lungs. “I am ready for a fight! Any fight! I am built to be so very―” Axyl was immediately silent, once he heard a loud, disturbing chuckle coming from anywhere. Chills ran up his spine. He kept his eyes open, daring to shut them for not even a second. The chuckle ended with a loud smacking of dry lips. Axyl turned white and clenched his fists. He then noticed every single surrounding sound ―the passing of cars, the rustling of leaves ―was diminished into nothing but silence. “Okay,” Axyl said with a shaky voice, “YOU may think this is a laughing matter, but it isn't! Prepare for a foot in your ass!”

The silence was persistent and Axyl’s arm hairs were completely standing straight. Despite the fact that he had super powers, Axyl was scared out of his socks. He kept his fists clenched, ready to throw an amazing punch. Nothing was happening, however, and this helped Axyl feel at ease. He had convinced himself that he was only out of his mind and said, “Yeah, you better run and hide, buddy-boy.
