You better watch it!” All hope was lost when he saw an orange street lamp shatter to pieces. The street lamp was only a block away.

Chapter 4


“Oh Jesus,” he whispered despairingly, with faint amounts of sweat running down his forehead. The disturbing, random chuckle occurred once more, and it seemed closer than it was before. Axyl turned around, for he thought it came from behind. “Okay, Cale! If that's you, consider your nose gone, buddy-boy!” Then, the street lamp, from the other side of the rode, went out. Axyl’s heart was pounding with fear and anxiety. He felt something hit the top of his head.

He took his index finger and hot nacho cheese covered the tip of it. This was scary, yet it was the most ridiculous thing ever. Without warning, two more street lamps went out, leaving just one more lit up. Axyl was standing right under it.

The loud and obnoxious, “BAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!” made Axyl jump ten feet, followed by the sound of distant SPLAT. The roof of Axyl’s truck was completely covered with freshly melted cheese.

He felt someone tap his shoulder and swung his fist, punching nothing but the cold air. There was no one behind him. After a few seconds of new silence, he heard a cold, croaked, and horrible voice whisper in his ear. “Boo.”

Axyl squealed once again, seeing absolutely no one near him. He had to get out of here! The booming laughter came from out of nowhere once again, as Axyl got into his truck and drove off. He began to cry, but only by the sight of the dripping nacho cheese that covered his once-beautiful truck.



















Part 2:

Six Days Later






Chapter 5: The Adoa
















It was mentioned earlier that Zjok betrayed the Asids long ago. But this was due to the lack of respect from others, battling constant ridicule, and following his selfish perspectives of rule. To make a long story short, Zjok’s strategic ideas for warfare and other related conflicts were exemplary. However, other Asids did not think so. Enraged, Zjok was ultimately moved from good to evil. Thanks to the Adoa, who accepted his devilish plans for conquest (such as colonizing other planets and creating unnecessary weapons of mass destruction), Zjok was able to rise through power, making him and his small fleet of Adoa the most dangerous force the Asids have ever faced.

Residing above the planetary orbit of Fleek, there sits a massively militarized space station, known as the Whale, particularly owned and operated by Zjok’s Adoa. As combat space ships loomed about the Whale, Zjok calmy pushed the buttons “A” and “6” to retrieve his favorite snack from the Adoa’s customary vending machine. Standing over ten feet and wearing pale-grey skin, plated with a suit of amor, Zjok was also equipped with a Vambit. He also wore an expression of pure distress and anger; it had been plenty hours since his Misara Serum was stolen and he had been desperately searching for it. The staggering alien took his favorite bag of chips out of the vending machine and began to snack on its wondrous taste.

Chapter 5


His lips tilted upward slightly, as he munched on his favorite snack. He stood in front of a great window, monitoring his entire militia in the massive realm of space, within the all-around metal interior of the Whale. All of the sudden, the door behind him burst open from a few singular blasts of firepower. The door was blown into pieces, followed by no sudden reaction from Zjok. The alien slowly turned around to face the damaged doorway, as an Adoa Mazer nonchalantly entered the room.

“Brilliant job on blasting that door down,” Zjok said happily to the Mazer, his anger slowly diminishing.

“Thank you, your Majesty,” the Mazer said, chortling. “As you can see, I have been practicing!” The Mazer wielded an enormous, technological weapon in his hands, he was much uglier, and his teeth were exposed 100% of the time, due to the lack of an actual pair of lips. The Mazer, who had been aptly named Galg, stood a much shorter height than Zjok and wore thick armor with a massive gun above his shoulders.

“I see you have been practicing, indeed,” replied Zjok, “and this will be a great technique for you in the future, once we retrieve the Misara Serum. It is my prized possession.”

“I can't wait to blow down some more doors in combat,” the Mazer said.

“Soon, Galg, very soon,” Zjok replied. “Do you have any updates?”

Galg chuckled deeply. “The Serum has been residing in the same region on the planet Earth for the past 144 hours. Maybe our enemies are taking a vacation?”

“No,” Zjok said calmly. “Our enemies do not have it. Alas, someone does have possession of the Serum, Galg. Can't you get that through your thick skull? Why would our enemies be in the same region for the past 144 hours? Someone else has it, someone who doesn't know of the Serum first-hand! This is good news, however. This location gives us a swift advantage.”

“Damn, talk about being in the wrong situation at the wrong time.” Galg laughed, drooling.

“Shut up! Don't make me laugh. I am supposed to be angry! Anyway, we must leave Fleek, before the Serum is used wrongfully, or even worse!”

“What would be even worse?” Galg asked.

The Adoa













“It would be even worse if someone were to obtain its essence, you mozzarella!”

“What?” Galg questioned, raising an eyebrow.

Zjok rolled his eyes and ingnored Galg’s question. “Look, just get the ships ready and tell them we'll be orbiting Earth, within a few weeks.”

“How many days is that, sir?”

“How the hell should I know?? A lot?!”

Galg smiled. “Oh! Well, that's easy!”

“Yes, now GO!” Galg hesitantly exited the room, leaving Zjok to finish his snack alone. Now he had some time to think, to think about how stupid he was for showing a video of the Misara Serum in the first place. The thought lingered in his Asid brain, making him angrier. He was so angry that he wished to shoot someone with a laser cannon. He knew getting to the Serum’s location would take a while, and the Adoa had no advantage like Preox and Rig did with the light-speed prototype. If he hadn’t have been sleeping, during the time of the Serum’s disappearance, this problem would never have happened. In fact, if Zjok were to have obtained the Serum’s aweseome powers accordingly, he wouldn’t be popping blood vessels right about now.

Zjok gazed at the breath-taking view from the massive window, until he started to hear a faint sound coming from a distance inside the space station. Curious enough, Zjok went out of the small breakroom room and followed the sound. As he ventured through the long, metallic, and almost run-down corridors of the Whale, he’d realized he was following the sounds of music!

“Oh jeez, not The Carpenters again!” Zjok yelled angrily. For the past

Chapter 5


years, since Zjok formed his army, the Adoa had no interest for any music group other than The Carpenters. However, The Carpenters were a music group of which Zjok could not tolerate, along with many other things unmentionable. He took a rifle from a gun rack nearby, and burst through the room where the music was coming from. Inside the smaller room an Adoa Mazer, working out with dumbbells. The minion squealed, farted, and dropped his dumbbells on the floor. Zjok spotted a record player in the furthest corner of the room, playing a Carpenters record, then blasted it into smithereens with the rifle.

The Mazer began to cry. “NOOOOOO!!! Why??!”

“Learn the rules!” Zjok snapped.

“But, this music was played during my grandma's funeral! I do this for her!”

“Look at the triangular-shaped pupils of mine,” Zjok said quietly, “and does it look like I give a damn?!”

The Mazer's face was distraught and he was just heartbroken. “N-no, your majesty.” The Mazer began to tear up, once Zjok had left. Then, the evil Asid continuously wandered around the area, checking if everything was in order before the Adoa were to set out for their voyage. After a twenty minute walk of more careful monitoring, Zjok proceeded into the hangar area where ships of massive sizes were ready for take-off. A vast number of ships include:


The Adoa Bat Fighter T-93


-Travels up to 3,000 mph


-This little beast can fly faster

than a real bat; fires many

rounds of pure bullets made from

lava and solid platinum.


-They’re about the size of the average

fighter helicopter.



The Adoa


The Adoa Mohawk Deployment Ship U5-106


-This is not a ship you want to

be close to, when in combat.


-Preferably known as a drop ship for

infantry reinforcement. Capacity of

twelve Mazers, two Strikers.


-Three laser cannons: two on both

sides, one on top.


-They’re about the size of a blue whale.


The Adoa Elephant ZK-5


-Run for your lives! These ships

are nothing but total devastation!


-Equipped with two large lightning

cannons and several

turrets that shoot

sharp blades of metal.


-Also known as the Adoa

“Mother Ship,” and there are

three in the entirety of Zjok’s fleet.


-Extremely durable, very efficient.


-They’re two times bigger than

the average skyscraper.

Chapter 5


Once the ships began to take flight, Zjok approached an Adoa Striker. This Striker in particular was much bigger and much taller than most. He also had special armor plating, which recognized him as a higher rank in the fleet. He name was known for Magnate Yayvox, the first of many Magnates of the fleet itself.

“Ah! Good to see you, your majesty! We're almost ready for official take-off. T-minus two minutes, I believe! You better get into your Elephant.”

“Yayvox,” Zjok began, “that was the most messed up sexual remark I've ever heard you say. I would laugh right now but I'm supposed to be angry.”

Yayvox didn’t find anything in his recent remark to be sexually crude, in any sort of way. He ignored Zjok’s mild assumption and stated, “You’re always angry, sir.”

“See. This is why I like you!” Zjok said happily, deliberately changing the entire subject. “You actually get me, unlike those other idiots who keep playing Carpenters!”













Yayvox sighed “Ah, sorry about that, your majesty. I personally love Karen Carpenter’s voice, but I love you more.”

“Your gratitude will always be noted. Anyway, it turns out the Serum has been the exact, same region for the past six days.”

“Then we have a very advantageable advantage,” Yayvox replied with wide eyes. “By the way, may I take pictures during our conquest?”

Zjok stared at him blankly. “Fine, fine, take some pictures. You better send me some copies, though.”

The Adoa


Yayvox saluted to Zjok and they both proceeded to their designations, as hundreds of ships took flight. Within minutes, the three Elephants were all that remained. Zjok activated his Vambit’s jet-pack system and neon-green flames gave him the ability to fly. He flew up to one of the Elephants and purposely burst through a window. The window shattered, along with Adoa Mazers clapping and cheering for his abruptive entrance, seeing it as something rather impressive. A newer pane slid up the frame, as if someone was rolling up a window in a vehicle.

“Thank you,” Zjok said pleasantly. “Okay, idiots, let’s retrieve my prize.” Once the Elephants had taken off for their journey, Earth’s safety had become an all-time low.

Kingzing City, OR, USA, Earth

For the past six days, Axyl had been making trips to the junkyard, twice as often, to practice his super abilities (And it wasn't too difficult to avoid Bobby's threats to call the police. How does Axyl do this? Well, the simplicity of staying further away from Bobby, and pretending he was a stray cat, seemed to do the trick.) In other news, Axyl had been bothering Kyle more than usual, with his constant questioning about Holly and what her interests were. Axyl couldn’t simply walk up to Holly and ask her these things, because he knew she would kick his ass to the curb. He seemed to be more comfortable asking these redundant questions about his crush towards Kyle because, after so many years of bullying him, Axyl knew he would never fight back. Kyle found it surprising that Axyl wasn’t actually threatening him to give him the information he needed, but was being rather annoying and completely unavoidable. Finding it frustrating to deal with the consistency, Kyle knew that Axyl had a desperate crush on Holly and he knew that Axyl was willing to apologize for all the suffered torment.

Axyl was finally done with baseball practice, and with only one more practice until the district game of the season, he was ready to kick it up a notch with his “hidden talents.” Axyl was changing in the locker room, when Cale Omnous exclaimed with excitement. “Dude! Keep it up with that radical swinging, broski!”

“Where am I? The '80s?” Axyl said with a quirky smile. The other jocks in the locker room laughed along his ridiculous remark.

Chapter 5


“I'm serious, man!” Cale exhilarated. “With a swing like that, you could get so much pussyyy! Yeeee, boy!”

“Indeed, he would get lots of cats,” replied a jock, named Hayson Prent.

Axyl laughed. “Good one, Hays'!”

Cale snorted. “That was a good one, man.” The jock picked up his stuff, after finally changing, and stuffed everything in a dufflebag. Cale and Hayson soon left the locker room, along with other members of the baseball team, leaving only Axyl by himself.

















Axyl had been taking his time changing into his everyday clothes. He had been getting lost in thought over the excitement of his superpowers, a lot lately. He was just tying his shoes when he saw something small and orange splatter on the ground. His heart sank immediately, and knew it was nacho cheese. He quickly tied his shoe laces, grabbed his stuff, and ran out. He did not look back. Something really weird was going on, with all of the mysterious cheese appearing out of nowhere. Ever since that horrible and anonymous encounter, six days ago, Axyl had been severely paranoid that someone, or something, had been following him. He bumped into Hayson when he hastily exited the locker room. Hayson, conveniently, had a plate of nachos in his hand.

“Whoa, man! You almost made me drop mah nachos!” Hayson yelled.

Axyl screamed inside his head. “W-where'd ya get those?”

The Adoa


“Oh, the nachos? The annoying cheer leaders are selling them. Pathetic right? As if cheerleading were even a sport. HA! Anyway, would you like a nacho?”

Axyl stared at the nachos with slight hesitation “Nah, I’m good. Thanks, bro, I can eat better food at home.”

“Right?! HA! But hey, don't you work tonight?” Hayson asked.

Axyl closed his eyes and made an irritable grunt. “Dammit! I do!”

Hayson laughed and shoved a big, cheesy nacho in his mouth. “Alright, see you around, man.” Hayson pat Axyl on the shoulder and left in the opposite direction, while Axyl proceeded through the other. Thoughts swarmed through Axyl’s brain, like a crazy Japanese cartoon. Thoughts like: How am I going to get Holly to date me? How are the remaining days of high school going to turn out? How am I going to treat Kyle fairly? Who the hell scared the crap out of me, the other night? And most of all, How am I going deal with these super abilities? How did this happen?? Of course, the eighteen year-old did not know the answers to these important questions. For now, at least.

Axyl was walking in the school parking lot when he saw Kyle opening his car door. The car was small and it fit Kyle’s scrawny form, perfectly.

“Hey! Kyle! Buddy-boy! What's up?!” Axyl hollered, jogging toward him. Kyle rolled his eyes with complete frustration.

“Ugh, not this again. What now?”

“Just want to say 'what's up, doggy?'”

Kyle stared at him. “What's with you, these past few days? Am I due for another beating? I-I am in great haste, as it may appear unto you!”










Chapter 5


Axyl looked puzzled. “No! Kyle, I'm not here to mug you! I'm here to ask you something.”

Kyle put his backpack in his car and looked at him. “Well, w-what is it, this time? I probably already know what it is, anyway. Probably starts with the letter ‘H’?!” He looked slightly intimidated, as usual. If Axyl asked him a question that he didn't know the answer of, the result would usually be disastrous.

“D' you,” Axyl started, “know what else Holly likes?”

Kyle didn't feel so nervous anymore, and he sighed with discontent. “Again?! Are you serious?” Axyl nodded. Kyle stared at Axyl and suddenly let out a huge burst of laughter. Axyl was embarrassed, embarrassed to be laughed at by someone he had been picking on for the past five years of his life. As Kyle continued to crack up, Axyl slammed his palm on the roof of his car, giving Kyle a sudden jolt of fear. “Oh, Jesus! Haha! Please don't beat me up! But seriously, are you serious?? You really like Holly, the woman who despises you?? Pfft!”

Axyl got angry, though resisted to punch Kyle’s face in. Beating him wouldn’t actually help him at all. In fact, if he hurt Kyle now then all hope would be lost in getting Holly to like him. “I’m sorry, Kyle, but I do. I like her a lot! I feel all stupid when I’m around her. She's just so...different.”

“Well duh, spiffy!” Kyle said, laughing some more. “She's not like any high school air head of which you jocks tend to go after! Holly has a back-bone for everything, she has a 4.5 GPA, she has higher standards, and she can practically kick your ass!”

“Hey! She just gets me by surprise, that's all!” Axyl snapped. Axyl had never seen Kyle Manning talk this way before, which made him realize that he was becoming much more vulnerable, rather than intimidating.

Kyle spat. “As if! For eight years (Count 'em, eight), she's known karate and other defensive-combat affairs! She wears her black belt on a daily basis! On top of that, you’re a dick! So what makes you think Holly would go for you? Ha, I said ‘gopher.’”

Axyl felt bad. “Maybe if you just helped me out a little?”

“And I probably would, if you didn’t make my life miserable!”

“Kyle, I'm sorry.”

The Adoa


Kyle spat again, “Too late... Buddy-boy.” Kyle opened the car door on the drivers' side, though paused like a startled deer when he was just about to enter and drive off. He was looking into the distance, staring at someone.

With an eye brow raised, Axyl analyzed where Kyle was looking and there was Velouria Knight Lancelot, Axyl’s ex-girlfriend from sophomore year, walking towards her car. Kyle exhaled passionately, as he gazed of what he thought to a beautiful goddess. He liked Velouria a lot and this gave Axyl a brilliant idea.

Axyl grinned. “Yo, Kyle. If you help me with Holly, I can guarantee I can score you a nice Velouria, over there.”

Kyle snorted. “W-what?”

“I dated her dude, I know everything about her! I think! And look at yourself! You look like the desperate girl from Sixteen Candles!”

“Which one, if I may ask?”

“The Molly Ringwald brat.”

“Ah! But I never see you two talk! Why would she date you, anyway?”

Axyl grunted. “This was back in 10th grade, alright? It's been a while since I've talked to her, but I know I can get her to like you. I know, for a fact, that her favorite flowers are Forget Me Not’s. Wow, I can't believe I didn't forget that!”














Kyle watched Velouria, helplessly, as she “blissfully” drove out of the parking lot. He looked back at Axyl and said sweetly, “She's so beautiful.”

“Well, have you talked to her at all?” Axyl asked.

Chapter 5


“Yeah, once or twice. She has the sweetest voice, the sweetest personality! I still can't believe she dated a goon like yourself.”

“Okay, will you please shut up? I get it! Call me a name one more time and I'm stealing your jacket!”

“You're wearing my jacket right now, after you stole it from me!” Kyle hollered. Axyl rolled his eyes, took off the jacket, and gave it to Kyle.

“No wonder it barely fit me. But here! Do we have a deal, now?”

Kyle thought for a while. “Well, first off, gimme fifty bucks IN CASH! Second off, if you gimme the slightest sort of beating or harassment, consider yourself GAME OVER! I love Holly, she's my best friend, and if you can prove that you can be a swell guy, there just might be a SLIM chance for you. Thirdly, don’t forget to talk to Velouria for me, alright? I’m too shy to even wave at her.” Axyl moaned out loud. They were both acting like elementary school kids. Amongst this planning, agreeing to not punch Kyle ever again wasn’t the most difficult decision Axyl had ever made in his life. He pulled out his wallet, gave the fifty bucks to Kyle, and they both shook hands.

“Thanks, man,” Axyl said.

“Whatever,” Kyle said, getting into his car. “However I know, for a fact, that Holly's favorite flowers are tiger lilies.”

Axyl smiled. “I'll see you around.”

“See ya.” Kyle didn't smile back, for he still hated Axyl’s guts. He pulled out of the parking lot and drove off. Now, it was time to go to work at the Cheese and Crackers Supermarket, where something interesting was bound to happen.

Somewhere in Southern Washington, around 6:30pm.

Preox and Rig were walking alongside an empty interstate, in the hopes to find means of faster transport. The Vambit was extremely short on lemonade fuel and Preox had no idea where he could find some.

Preox moaned. “This voyage is much more tedious than I thought.”

“I feel just fine,” Rig replied, chuckling. “I actually have to go to the bathroom.” Preox grew angry and was about to deck Rig in the face when they saw a human vehicle headed in their direction.

“Human!” Preox yelled, hopefully. “Please we give a lift in your... thing!!!”

The Adoa


The Asid began to look like an idiot, flailing his arms and jumping in the air, while Rig just stood in one spot. The car wasn't slowing down, as being operated by two obnoxious teenagers. They sped right past the two disguised aliens and called them vulgar names. Preox was outraged, and he had enough of this God-forsaken planet, already. Preox signaled Rig to electrocute the car before it got away from their view. Rig obeyed and released a huge lightning bolt toward the operated vehicle. The car came to a complete stop and Preox began to sprint to the car, wearing an expression of pure rage. The teenagers were scared and began to freak out, as he got closer to them and their temporarily disabled car. Preox showed up, said “Hi,” and wielded his rifle from his Vambit. He pointed the gun at them and yelled, “GET OUT OF THE VEHICLE, NOW!”

Rig snapped his fingers. “Ooooh! You just got tolded!”

“Shut up Rig! And you humans are lucky I don't blow your brains out, right now!!”

“Yo, it was just a joke!” one of the punk teenagers explained.











Preox opened the driver’s door and simply said, “I'm not your 'yo'. Got that? The least you can do is shut up and go away, thank you! C'mon, Rig.” The two entered the vehicle (Rig reactivating the car with his lightning) and drove off, leaving the two kids completely stranded. Preox had no problem in operating the foreign vehicle, not one bit. He had mastered the manual shift, within seconds and as angry as he seemed, Preox’s mind was spectacular.

After driving for twenty minutes, Rig opened the glove compartment

Chapter 5

and found a bag of unrecognizable proportions. The bag contained a decent amount of crystal methamphetamine, previously owned by the two obnoxious teenagers.

“Preox! What's this stuff?”

Preox caught a glimpse of it and just shrugged. “Whatever it is, it disgusts me. Toss it out the window!”

“Okee dokee!!” Rig tossed the bag of unknown elements out the car window, completely unaware that the bag had hit someone in the face.


“This is Agent Moosey17,” Moosey said speaking on his mobile phone. He had just appeared from a nearby bush, where Preox and Rig just passed. The illegal drugs, which Rig threw out, partially covered his face. “I just saw the aliens speed by and one of them just threw crystal meth in my face! You may commence the combat helicopter."

“Great job, Moosey! We are ready to capture those aliens for good! Agent Nathan12, over and out.”

“Here I am, rock you like a hurricane!” Rig was singing along to the radio and pumping his fist in the air. Rig, not only enjoying the music, was also slamming his palms on the dashboard, pretending to play the drums.














The Adoa


Preox remained calm, as he successfully ignored Rig’s actions.

In the corner of his eye, Preox saw a helicopter hurdling from behind. It seemed to be following them, gradually getting closer and closer.

“Son of a bitch,” he said under his breath and slammed on the acceleration pedal.

“Wooo!!! Preox knows how to have fun!!” Rig yelled happily. “Let's go! Faster faster faster!” He stuck his head out the window and barked like a dog. Tranquilizer darts flew from out of nowhere and one of them whapped Rig in the back of the head. “OW! PREOX, THEY GONE SHOT ME IN DAH HEAD!!” The back of his head was slightly bleeding when he aggressively pulled the dart from his skull, before it would put him to sleep.

“Rig, get down! We seem to have some company!” Preox commanded.

The helicopter was gaining on them, and a handful of Agents were driving their customary vehicles to catch them. “Rig! Take my rifle in the back seat. Blast those humans!” Rig grabbed the rifle and shot at the helicopter the the back window frame of the car. Preox’s bullets smacked against the helicopter’s strong armor, as Rig laughed hysterically.

“Ooooo hoo hoo hoo hoo,” Rig laughed, “Preox step on it, this flying aircraft is a tough one!!” Preox slammed on the accelerator. “We're gonna die!” Rig was so excited that he covered Preox’s eyes in a playful manner, causing him to drive more recklessly

“Rig! Stop! I can’t see the road!!” Rig let go, spazzing out completely to no end. Their vehicle was now sliding off the pavement and eventually slamming into a tree, before Preox could make another move. The two aliens became seriously injured and were completely unconscious, once again.






Chapter 6: An Abomination










Axyl was currently working the night shift at the Cheese and Crackers Supermarket, feeling boorish at his best. He worked in the Say Queso film shop, and switched to being a bagboy every-so-often. During his shifts at Say Queso he sold cameras, batteries, rolls of film, frames, and printed photographs. Axyl had two employee friends, working in different sections, nearby. There was Von Alan, who had managed the firearms department. As being a middle-aged man, being very efficient with any sort of weapon, and being exceptionally mechanically-inclined, he was the man of the hour when it came down to hunting game. There was also a younger-aged woman by the name of Sayra Haro, who was working in the electronics. Sayra was just in her early twenties, as an expert in musical instruments, and even owning her own group of mariachi catering. Compare the two with Axyl Smithy, he was quite talentless. Obviously, however, all of that drastically changed within an instant.

It was 10:30 at night when Axyl was developing pictures from a roll of film, which was anonymously left by a customer. During this time, he was still trying to decide on how he should correctly approach his ex-girlfriend, in the hopes of making Kyle happy. Shall he text her, or talk to her face-to-face? The decision was more difficult than he thought. They haven't talked in a little over three years and it will be excruciatingly awkward for Axyl to be discussing the subject of “hooking up” Velouria with someone she barely knew. He was willing to put in the effort, however. He took out the photos from the printer and inserted them in an envelope, and that’s when Von approached him. He was much taller than Axyl and had a smile on his face.

Chapter 6

“How’s it goin’?”

Axyl yawned, for he was very tired. “I'm good, bro, and you?”

“Amazed!”

“Why's that?”












“Some new guns came into stock today, I don’t know if you noticed.”

“Really? That's cool! Which ones?”

“I got some rare M3A1 sub-machine guns, and some semiautomatic pistols. Most beautiful things I've ever seen. Not only that, I got this sweet

Remington 870 modular combat shotgun with an eighteen-inch barrel. You also gotta check out the new blades I got, specifically for camping!”

Axyl yawned again. “That's awesome, broski!”

Von looked confused. “What's that?”

Axyl looked puzzled, too. “'Broski?' You don't know what that is?”

Von shook his head and Axyl realized he had no idea what the term “broski” meant. He was too tired to explain the definition, so an awkward silence roamed until Sayra approached.

“Hey guys.”

“Hey Sayra!” Von said excitingly. “Did you see my―?”

“You've told, and showed me, a thousand-trillion times.”

Axyl forced a laugh. “That's quite a lot of times of… telling things!”

“Hey, you're all just jealous that I work at the firearms department, junior,” Von snapped. “I'm going back. Come check out the supplies when you can, Axyl. We oughta go fishing, sometime.”

An Abomination


“Sounds good! See ya!” Once Von left, Axyl had continued developing more pictures, left from another anonymous customer. Amongst the loud and abruptive sound of printing-processing (from an older model that seemed to be from the 1990’s), Axyl could hear Sayra exhale disparingly as if something was really bothering her. Axyl sighed right back, imitating her sigh of slight distress. “You okay, wuss?”

“Shut up! God, why you gotta be such a jerk?”

“Dang,” Axyl laughed, “what the noodle is wrong with you? Time of the month?”

Sayra paused. “Shut up, Axyl!”

“Sooo...?”

“Yes, it is that 'time of the month!'”

“Ooooh...”

“Yeah. Not only that, I'm starting to feel uncomfortable around this place, bro.”

Axyl raised one eyebrow. “Why's that?”

Sayra shook her head. “I dunno, man. I keep smelling cheese, like, melted cheese. And it’s weird.”

Axyl got a sudden shiver down his spine, though behaved naturally. “Well, we DO work in a place, called Cheese and Crackers, dopey.”

Sayra had the urge to back-hand Axyl across the face; she also hated Axyl’s unnecessary attitude. “It's not that, Axyl. It's something else. I keep














hearing scratching sounds, coming from the vents.”

Axyl’s fear gradually began to rise. He immediately thought of the

Chapter 6


mysterious nacho cheese, which once covered the roof of his 2003 GMC. Could Sayra be referring anything related to this subject? That would be too peculiar to be true.

“Oh yeah, and get this: Some asshole left a whole puddle of nacho cheese on my cash register. Sucks, right? Just my luck.”

Axyl squealed, like a ferret, making Sayra jolt.

“What's your deal, bro?”

Axyl caught his breath. “Oh, I'm fine. I just remembered that I need to― umm, I need to― clip my toe nailsss, later.”

Sayra gave him the look of concern. “Um… you okay, bro?”

“Yeah, I'm fine. I just really need to clip my toe nails, y’know?!”

Sayra said nothing and she shrugged her shoulders, proceeding her exit from the scenario. “Hope you have fun with that!”

Axyl was scared out of his wits. The thought that he had super powers left his mind, especially when Sayra brought up the “nacho-cheese-all-over-her-register incident.” He was very cautious now that he had of this disturbing update. Whoever was pursuing Axyl in the creepiest way possible, the effect was accelerating; especially whenever Axyl caught a glimpse of the color orange, he would almost have a heart attack.

A few minutes later, literally no one was around Axyl’s photography store. That being mentioned, Cheese and Crackers was drawing closer to closing time. During this mode of silence, his paranoia was rising higher. Then, out of the ordinary, Axyl noticed something disturbing about the pictures he had recently printed. One picture was of a dimly-lit street lamp in the night. Another was of Axyl’s truck covered in the immense amount of nacho cheese. Axyl felt sick to his stomach; he was sweating out of the ‘pits! Axyl dropped the stack of photos and his hands began to shake violently, as if he was clutching a wild jack hammer.

“You pathetic, ugly morsel,” a deep, crackling voice was heard, “I pay good money for those pictures.”

Axyl recognized that voice, he had heard it before! It was the voice that whispered in his ear on that one, horrifying night! Axyl turned around and saw what was standing in front of his counter. The monster was at least seven feet tall and was well-structured in body tone, despite his slight deformities.

An Abomination

Although it didn't look human at all, the being had lightly-tinted orange skin, with thick orange spiked hair and he wore a horrible grin, which spread widely across his face. He wore a gray shirt and very baggy pants, with ordinary sneakers, which seemed to be off-putting. One other deformity included, which was the most disturbing feature of all, was that the monster had razor-sharp, yellow nacho chips attached to his entire body as if he was born into these conditions.

Axyl coiled, the intense fear growing inside him.

The monster grinned and politely said, “Hello. May I introduce myself? I am the Evil Nacho.”

Axyl stared blankly at him, not taking the given name seriously. “Then how come I haven't heard of you?” Evil Nacho was gonna speak again, but was rudely interrupted by a concerned security officer whom of which patrolled the Cheese and Crackers every so often.












“Hey man, are you responsible for spilling amounts of cheese, here? I know we have a lot of cheese in this supermarket, but that doesn't necessarily mean that you can just leave it on the floor and/or cash registers! You're gonna halfta come into my office, you naughty boy you!” Evil Nacho turned slowly, his mouth gaping, revealing his horrifyingly substantial and sharp teeth. The security guard’s eyes widened. “Okay, I had no idea you were a monster! My apologies!”

Evil Nacho screamed ferociously and punched the security guard, causing him to fly into a shelf full delicious candy. The candy shelf fell back,

Chapter 6


causing other shelves to collapse in a domino effect, as shoppers immediately fled in confused terror. Two more security guards approached, in an attempt to tackle the beast, but Evil Nacho was too fast and so strong. He plucked several nacho chips from his body and threw them like ninja stars. The stale and piercing tortilla chips injured both guards and they were on the ground bleeding within seconds. Axyl was about to soil himself. “Jeez! W-what’s happening?!” Then, he realized that he had an opportunity― a great opportunity! This was it! This was going to be Axyl’s first real fight with his super powers! There was no time for anymore hesitated decisions; no time for delay! It was time to become what he had always dreamed of as a child: A Kick-Ass Superhero!

He hopped over the counter of which stood between him and Evil Nacho, without the monster taking notice, and made his way towards the costume section of the store. The monster turned around to face Axyl and saw he was gone. “Dammit! The one time I let my guard down! RRRGGHH!! Where are you, idiot?? I'm here to kill you!!”

Axyl squealed once he scrambled through a pile of costumes, which were all completely thrashed from Evil Nacho’s onslaught. The teenager was experiencing complete thrills of utmost excitement and absolute fear.

“Come on out, little boy! Won’t you like to treat yourself to a nacho?! Perhaps spice it up a bit with a jalepeno up your ass?!”

“Yeah?!” Axyl shouted from his hidden location. “I don’t think so, bub! This is ‘not-cho’ turf!” Axyl rolled his eyes, after he had announced a most redundant pun, as he wrapped a red ninja mask around his head and tied a red cape around his neck. He had hoped that no one would recognize him, but rather as someone who was ready to kick some ass. He stood up and noticed that every innocent bystander in the supermarket had fled. Quietly, he lurked toward the sound of Evil Nacho grunting angrily and without warning, Evil Nacho came from around the corner and he did not recognize Axyl in his moderate disguise. “Excuse me, silly man, but do you know where I can find a putrid turd, like yourself?” Axyl pointed his elbow at the monster and blasted him with his laser. Evil Nacho quickly got up, after the force of the laser sent him slamming against grocery shelves. The villain immediately rose upon his feet, as if the laser had no effect on him.

An Abomination


“You sly, little gerbil!” Evil Nacho laughed out of pure insanity. “Ha! I didn’t recognize you in that ridiculous outfit; I was wondering when you were going to use that laser upon me! What're you? Some sort of lame super hero? Do you call yourself Super Meathead?' HA!” Blue Lazer, the superhero of Kingzing City, glared at him viciously (He felt like he was living a different life, behind the eye-holes of the cheap ninja mask.)

“Let's go, skippy,” Blue Lazer said confidently, “you mess with me, you mess with the supermarket. Wait, that's not what I meant―”

Evil Nacho threw a nacho chip at him, which impaled him in the fore-head. Blue Lazer yelled angrily, tore the chip out from his skull, and began shooting at Evil Nacho with his laser ability in a repetitive motion (The impaling wound healed in almost no time at all.) As the monster dodged Blue Lazer's laser, he laughed hysterically. “Amazing! You can shoot lasers out your elbow and take a terrible hit from my nacho chips! Phenominal, I might add!”

“What was that?” the hero shouted. “I can’t hear you! Are you speaking English?!” Blue Lazer flew at Evil Nacho, tackled him and punched him in the nose. They tumbled through the automatic doors of the supermarket, scraping their bodies against the gravel of the parking lot. Blue Lazer grabbed Evil Nacho by the leg and threw him at a street lamp. Evil Nacho quickly grabbed the street lamp, swung around, and gave Blue Lazer a powerful kick in the face. The teenager flew backward against the back of a parked vehicle and the car alarm blared obnoxiously, as Evil Nacho threw more chips at Blue Lazer. Without thinking, Blue Lazer tore a car door from its hinges and shielded himself from the odd projectiles. Local bystanders were watching in complete awe. “Thank God for car doors! They’re really open for opportunities!” Blue Lazer then concluded that he was going to stop making ridiculous phrases, holding unnecessary puns.








Chapter 6


Swiftly, Blue Lazer threw the car door at Evil Nacho. Evil Nacho jumped at a great height, avoiding the thrown object, and then tackled Blue Lazer. He had him pinned against the ground and Blue Lazer had noticed nacho chips were growing back from where he plucked them. Who is this freak?! This guy is like a living pile of nachos!

“Let's make this easier than it has to be,” Evil Nacho cackled and started hawking up phlegm, from the grotesque interiority of his mouth. A thick strand of boiling cheese slithered from his lips and was hot enough to melt Blue Lazer’s face. Despite the monsters strong physicality, Blue Lazer was able to shift his elbow under Evil Nacho's stomach and fire another vicious round of red light. Evil Nacho grunted angrily as he was thrown off, landing roughly on the pavement. Blue Lazer got up and began walking to Evil Nacho casuall. The monster breathed hoarsely out of sheer agony.

“Please,” Blue Lazer said, “I don't wanna die, especially after I just got these sick powers! Makes me so mad!” Blue Lazer stomped his foot against the ground (expecting to add depth into his anger) and a sonic boom occurred, causing Blue Lazer and Evil Nacho to fly backward.

“OWW!!??” Blue Lazer yelled angrily. “I had no idea I could do that!”

Evil Nacho laughed his ass off. “How pathetic! Next thing ya know, you'll end up puking lava! Your mutated abilities are putrid!

Blue Lazer stared at him with a stern look on his face. It got awkward when Evil Nacho realized that the “puking lava” remark was not a false assumption. Evil Nacho began throwing chips once again, Blue Lazer went into the air and flew away to avoid getting hit. Evil Nacho jumped high, grabbed Blue Lazer by the neck, and they were both flying through the sky, punching each other. Before they knew it, they were flying through the busier streets of Kingzing City.

Evil Nacho attempted to spit on Blue Lazer, but the younger of youth bashed the monster’s face with his own. Evil Nacho grew angrier and threw Blue Lazer down on the ground, like a lifeless rag doll. Blue Lazer impacted the street and cars haulted before him, causing a few collisions. Evil Nacho picked up Blue Lazer by the shirt and threw him at a car windshield, which shattered on impact. After a few seconds of moaning in displeasure, Blue Lazer looked up to see the citizens of staring at him, completely puzzled.

An Abomination














The owner of the vehicle, of which the hero landed upon, peered his head out the driver’s window. “Oh, dios mio! Rough night, my friend?”

Blue Lazer got off the car and nodded, as he wiped blood off his arms. “Very rough.”

“Oh it must be,” the driver said.

“Sorry about the windshield, buddy-boy.”

“Oh, it's fine, it’s my sister’s!”

Blue Lazer knew he had to act quick, seeing Evil Nacho running toward him. Blue Lazer then saw a fire hydrant nearby and started running towards that. Evil Nacho roared, jumping, and when he was just over the fire hydrant, Blue Lazer tore the hydrant from the concrete, and a great blast of water blasted Evil Nacho higher into the air. Blue Lazer watched Evil Nacho begin to obey the law of gravity, hearing applause from the residents of Kingzing City. Evil Nacho landed harshly, completely soaked in water and enraged. Unfortunately, a mother and her son were hesitantly walking by, before Evil Nacho held them both as innocent hostages.

“Mommy, mommy!” the little boy cried as Evil Nacho held him by palming his head. The mother was crying and begging for mercy as he held onto her hair.

“Which one, Blue Lazer?!” Evil Nacho demanded. “The adorable child, or the beautiful single mother!?”

The mother sniffled, but took notice of Evil Nacho’s misguided accusation towards her. “I'm not a single mother! My husband is at home!”


Chapter 6

Evil Nacho rolled his eyes, then repeated the demanding question. Once again, the mother interfered.

“No seriously, asshole, what made you think I was a single mother?!”

“Yeah, ash-hole,” the little boy said angrily.

“Johansen!”

“Sorry, mommy!”

“ENOUGH!” Evil Nacho yelled angrily. “How 'bout this, Blue Lazer: Surrender yourself, or I'll pound these innocent idiots down to the ground so hard, they'll be wearing concrete as Halloween masks!” This was getting really intense. Will Blue Lazer trade his life to save two more? However, something rather embarrassing happened to Evil Nacho, right at the moment of demanding questions. The “single mother” happened to have mace in her jacket. She brought it up to Evil Nacho's face and sprayed diligently. The spray had no effect on the monster, but in fact started to embrace the spray in his mouth. “Mm, breath spray! Thank you, madam,” Evil Nacho said. “Did you actually think that stuff is harmful to the MIGHTY EVIL NACH―?”


PEEEEW!!


Thanks to the mother, Evil Nacho was distracted well-enough to get a laser to the face. Evil Nacho was on his back once again, and was finally defeated. It was quiet, and witnesses murmured and chattered, as they admired Blue Lazer's heroism. Evil Nacho's face was burnt and distorted. Blue Lazer had won his first fight, as a superhero, and people all around him applauded happily, as the mother and son gave him hugs and kisses. Also, news reporters approached the hero and interviewed him. The city will now know him as the invincible... “Blue Lazer.” As long as Blue Lazer wore the cape and ninja mask, nobody knew who he really was.

As Blue Lazer was telling the news reporter about the fight with Evil Nacho, he turned around so the camera could get a shot of the defeated

An Abomination

villain, only to see that he had disappeared! Out of sight! Everyone gasped to see that Evil Nacho was gone. Followed by gasps of surprise and the sight of the remnants nacho, a booming voice was soon overheard.

“YOU HAVE DEFEATED ME, BLUE LAZER, FOR NOW! I APPLAUD YOUR OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE! WE WILL MEET, ONCE MORE! AND ONCE WE DO, IT BE THE END OF YOOOUUU!”

The voice could have been coming from anywhere, but Blue Lazer just rolled his eyes and looked at the camera. “Well, if anyone needs my help, just gimme a 'holluh!' Peace!”

Blue Lazer took off flying. The news reporter faced the camera and said, “Well there you have it, America: Another flippin’ super hero!”

Axyl was not only excited about the whole ordeal, but he was also excited that he was in the possession yet another super power, which was the access to stomp his foot on the ground to create a “sonic boom effect.” One thing he had to learn was how to use it in a controlling manner, without hurting himself. The want of training at the junkyard was now more of a priority, in order for Axyl to keep his brand-new image. He could imagine it now: Blue Lazer merchandise upon mugs, cereal boxes, the white t-shirts of big-breasted college girls― the excitement was becoming so overwhelming.

Axyl returned home close to midnight, exhausted out of his wits. He kept his ninja mask and cape somewhere safe (under his bed), flopped clumsily on his mattress, and immediated droned into a deep sleep.













Chapter 7: Ridiculous Strategy















Monday!!!

Axyl’s whole body was in severe soreness, all from the epic fight with Evil Nacho, and the pain expanded to the very tips of his fingers and toes. Thankfully, and miraculously, Axyl’s physicality was back to normal within no time at all, whereas his injuries would have been fatal if it weren’t for the Misara Serum’s efficient healing powers. It was an early, beautiful Monday morning, a lovely day in March, and it all started with Axyl lazily descending down the stairs. His dad, Jared, was sitting at the kitchen table, wearing a coffee-stained t-shirt and boxer briefs, and flipping through the newspaper. Axyl made his way into the kitchen and poured himself a bowl of cereal. He was always tired for, let alone of, waking up for school. Jared noticed Axyl. “Tired, son?” Axyl nodded and moaned as he poured some milk from a one-gallon container. Jared took a sip of his coffee, which sat next to his eggs and bacon. He sighed happily to the satisfying taste of damn good black coffee.

“Merr,” Axyl exclaimed. He felt like someone had repeatedly slammed a brick in the back of his head during brain surgery, all from being out so late at night and being awake so early in the morning The disgusting taste of morning breath didn't help, either.

Chapter 7

“You know what I think?” Jared said, looking at his son and setting down the newspaper. As a skeptical, strict father, Jared couldn’t help but get in Axyl’s business once again. “I think a girl is keeping you up late. You been sneaking out and such? You been doin’ the ‘inny-and-the-outty’ kind of deal?” Axyl shook his head slowly. He was in no mood for his dad’s notorious, smart-ass assumptions. Axyl brought his cereal to the dinner table and ate, as Jared continued reading the paper. Ever since Blue Lazer's amazing accomplishment, against Evil Nacho, he had been all over the media.

“So,” Jared began, “this 'Blue Lazer' has really made an imprint on Kingzing City, especially his stupid name. Seriously, 'Blue Lazer?'” Axyl was surprised as to how no one had noticed that he was actually Blue Lazer. The name was such a dead give-away, or so he thought, but even his father did not see the obvious resemblance between Axyl’s and his alter-ego’s physical structure. Axyl enjoyed keeping this a secret and he surely did not mind doing it just for show. Axyl had finished his cereal, got ready for school, and was walking out the door when Jared hollered, “Good luck with the rest of your baseball season, son!” Axyl paused. The baseball state districts! He had forgotten all about it! The thought of Blue Lazer and Evil Nacho glossed over the whole importance of this game. However, he certainly had nothing to worry about; especially with the help of his super abilities. This is going to be an interesting day!

As he was walking to his car (Which was through the apartment garage of which he believed was extremely creepy, along with its dull and cold tone.), he looked in his school bag to remember if he had packed his red ninja mask and cape. Alike many superheroes, he could never be too sure as to what disastrous event could occur. He had to be prepared for any of that drastic sort. After realizing he had remembered his Blue Lazer equipment, he reached in his pocket, pulled out his keys, and unlocked the car door. Before he knew it, some random masked man (Who looked like he was living in the dull and dreary garage.) was pointing a gun to the side of Axyl’s head.

“Hey, man,” the man said. “I don't wanna hurt anybody, just give me all your money.”

Axyl felt no fear. “I don't have any money.”

Ridiculous Strategy


“Don't lie to me, brother.”

Axyl turned around with his hands up, making the masked man grip his gun tighter with two hands and stepped back. Axyl grinned and decided to taunt the criminal. “Why did you step back? Come at me, you wuss.” Axyl stared down his opponent, although his heart was racing faster than a horse on hardcore drugs.

The man looked confused. “Stop! I'll shoot you, dude, I swear to God!”

Axyl grabbed the gun from the man’s hands in a flash, and tossed it over his shoulder. The man went in to punch Axyl, but the teenager was too fast and

he grabbed the man's long hair, pulling it hard enough to lift him above the ground. The man screamed in agony as Axyl took off his mask. He could tell that it was just some worthless drug thug, after getting a good look at his grotesque teeth and scratched face.

“If I were you, you piece of toad,” Axyl whispered in his ear, “I'd get a job to get money. You know what else I would do? I would use that money to get a haircut, rather than spend it on drugs!” The words spat on the man’s face. Axyl punched him in the gut and left him on the ground moaning. Axyl went and picked up the gun and shouted at the thug one last time, “You little scoundrel,” he said, “I'm gonna be late for school! “After delivering the thug to the nearest garbage dump, Axyl then tore the thug’s gun to shreds like paper with his amazing, super strength.

Axyl was not in the mood for a bad day. He tried his best not to think about Evil Nacho and what that “cheesy” beast was capable of performing. What worried Axyl the most was that Evil Nacho knew Blue Lazer's true identity. He liked keeping Blue Lazer a secret, which also aided him in getting out of trouble. Although, Axyl wanted to know, exactly, who the hell this Evil Nacho character really was. He also wanted to know why that ridiculous beast wanted to kill him so badly. For all Axyl knew, that monster could attack at any moment. This was not going to bother the almost-incompetent teenager for long, for he had other tasks to accomplish. One accomplishment such as to dominate the Marsing High school's baseball team in the district game on Friday! Another task to accomplish would be to aid Kyle to get the girl he deserves, so Axyl can try to get the girl that he doesn’t exactly have the real permission to even talk to.

Chapter 7


As Axyl parked his truck, once he arrived to Kingzing City High school, he had noticed Velouria walk from her vehicle to the school campus. He quickly gathered his things and hastily got out of the truck. Walking at a fast pace toward Velouria, Axyl hollered at her, “Velouria! Hey!”

Velouria turned around, expressing a face of puzzlement, once she realized that it was Axyl who was hollering at her. She couldn’t believe Axyl remembered her name, at all, come to think of it. It had been so long since the two of them had talked. She sighed deeply and bit her lip “Oh, hey Axyl.”

Axyl knew, immediately, that Velouria was uncomfortable being around him, after all these years of silence between the two. “Sorry, I just wanted to tell you something.” They started walking together through campus.

“Yeah? What is it?”

“Well, hmmm, how should I put this? Do you know Kyle Manning?” Velouria didn't say anything, though thought about it. “You know, the scrawny kid?”

Velouria gasped. “Ooooh! You mean the socially awkward one?”

Axyl sighed and nodded. “Yeah, him. Anyway, he has mentioned that he would like to take you out sometime! Doesn't that sound great??”

Velouria didn't look so excited anymore. She looked up at Axyl, as though he had made an inexcusable passing of gas. “Um, I'm sorry, Axyl. I'm kinda dating this guy. H-he's a friend of yours.”

Axyl raised one eye-brow. Who would possibly date one of Axyl’s friends? They're just about as dumb, neglectful, and immature as he is. Well, as\dumb, neglectful, and immature as Axyl “USED” to be, anyway (according to his standards, of course).

“Who are you dating?” Axyl asked.

“Your friend, Cale. Cale Omnous. “Axyl became distraught, and his eyelids twitched. Hooking up Velouria with Kyle was the main goal to get to Holly! That is the key to prove that Axyl isn’t such a jerk-wad, like he used to be and it took Cale to ruin all of that!






Ridiculous Strategy

“S-sorry,” Velouria said quietly. “I feel bad now! I'm not one to reject!”

Axyl was about ready to beat Cale’s head in with a scorched, metallic cooking pot. Although Cale was Axyl’s best friend, he was strongly interfering with Axyl’s progression towards Kyle and Holly. “Its fine, Velouria, don't be upset.”

Velouria sighed. “Well, I gotta go, okay? I have to get ready for art class.”

Axyl laughed. “You're still into that, huh?”

Velouria nodded happily. “I really want to be an artist. It's my dream! Well, it was nice talking to you again, Axyl. We should catch up.”

Axyl smiled and stopped walking. “Sure thing. Well, it's your loss, Velouria, Kyle's a good kid.”

“Oh yeah?”

“Yep,” Axyl said with a smile. “He also really likes boobies.”

Velouria raised one eyebrow. “Um... Okay? See ya, Axyl.”

That last remark made Axyl legitimately believe Velouria was completely interested in Kyle, which was sought to be inappropriate and completely not helpful whatsoever. Axyl’s head wasn’t always the thinnest. Axyl watched Velouria walk away in disappointment and utter displeasure. “Unf, sunufa bitch. Cale, you can annoy just about anyone without even trying.”

Kyle tapped Axyl on the shoulder from behind. “Hey, you talked to Velouria? What’d she say?”

“Sure did,” said Axyl, “but there's a big boulder in your 'Path of Love.'”

“Nice analogy,” Kyle said happily. “What is it?” His smile was stretched like an open wound, with damaged nerves. Once Kyle was going to learn the truth about Velouria, those nerves were going to return to normal it was going to hurt like hell.

Axyl took a deep breath. Kyle immediately took the hint that whatever Axyl was going to say, it wasn’t going to be good. Cale, out of all the damn girls attending Kingzing High, was dating the girl of Kyle’s dreams! For once in his life, Axyl was actually pitying Kyle. He really wanted to fix this.

Axyl took another deep breath and calmly said, “She's dating Cale.” Kyle blinked, keeping an emotionless face. “Come again? Hehehe, I

Chapter 7


could have sworn I heard you say that Velouria was dating Cale Omnous, your knave of a friend.”

“Um― She is, bro. I'm sorry, but what's a kna―” Kyle didn't hesitate when he slapped Axyl across the face. .

Axyl stayed calm. As much as he wanted to drop-kick Kyle into the ground, he refrained. “Look, Kyle, I'm so sorry. I'm pretty upset, also.”

Kyle sighed out loud. “How could this happen?? I never saw this on the Internet. Is this even Internet official?!”

“I know you’re upset, but Cale hasn’t always been the brightest―”

“MHMMM! YA THINK?!”

“—light bulb, ever since I've known him! I know he’s my best friend, but you’re so much better than him! You just have to prove that to her, to Velouria. And I help you, alright? I’m a kiss-ass, but it’s true.”

Kyle stared at him, with a tear glistening in his eye. Axyl tried not to laugh his ass off. “Really, Axyl? You really think I’m better? Are you high?”










“Yes. Wait, what?! No! Kyle, you're my bro! And it’s not just ‘cause I’m using you as an advantage to get to Holly. I’m also willing to make up all those years of hell I’ve put you through. I’m serious, broseph.”

Kyle smiled faintly. Axyl could see hope in his eyes.

Axyl nodded. “I promise, this is all for you and Velouria. Plus, being an ex-boyfriend of her’s, I think she deserves to be with you more than some mental patient, such as Cale, or me for that matter.”

Kyle laughed obnoxiously and so did Axyl.

Ridiculous Strategy

“So, what do I do?” Kyle asked. “You couldn't really get Velouria to admire me, which WAS a part of our little 'plan.' And, I couldn't get Holly to 'admire' you either―”

“You’ve talked to her already?!”

“No, not exactly. I'm sorry! Every time I mentioned your name, her eye would twitch and her fists would clench. She really hates you, I’m sorry to say.”

“You remember about me telling you about what Holly's favorite flowers were?”

“Yeah, tiger lilies.”

Kyle was astounded. “Wow, you really have changed, Axyl. You remembered something!”

No, really, you don’t say? Axyl said in his thoughts, but was thinking about Blue Lazer.

“Anyway,” Kyle said, “if you get Holly a couple tiger lilies, she'll melt. Maybe not on the outside, but most definitely on the inside. I've seen her happy, before. I know she was, before you and Cale showed up at the Funky Munkey, a while back.”

“Yeah, I figured, dipstick,” Axyl said stubbornly.

“Okay, shut up. But get those tiger lilies, Axyl, it's your destiny.”
“Your MOM is your destiny,” Axyl laughed and Kyle glared at him, as was purely disgusted by the immature remark.

“Sweet! Okay, got any tips for me?”

Chapter 7

Axyl and Kyle both noticed Cale and Velouria walking outside together, side-by-side.

Axyl pointed in their direction. “Okay, notice how the idiot won't even hold her hand? And how he's looking at her chest, instead of her face? I dunno if you can notice that, but he does that all the time. Girlfriend or no girlfriend.”

Kyle nodded. “I do notice.”

“I've seen this guy have a girlfriend before Velouria, Kyle. He's ignorant and manipulative. Dating him would be like babysitting a kid. At one point, he will ignore her and she will be upset, though won't show it. I know Velouria, too; I dated her. She’s one of the most devoted, most selfless people I’ve ever met. She’s delicate.”

Kyle sighed. “She’s just like me. Well, today was the first time you talked to her since you two broke up, right?”

“Pretty much. It was totally weird.”

“I’ll bet. What we’re planning here is pretty risky, Axyl. Cale will pummel me into a pulp if I talk to Velouria, let alone show my face to the general public! However, Velouria is worth it; me getting my ass kicked and all.”

“Aww,” Axyl exclaimed happily, “don't worry, bro. If anything happens, I'll back you up, okay?”

Kyle smiled and they high-fived.

“So hey!” Axyl said, “I’ve got a ball game, this week. State districts! Since Cale is playing, there's no doubt in my mind that Velouria will be there.

Game starts at six. (I propose, and this is just coming from the top of my head, for you to show up at the ball game, ‘unexpectedly.’) Oh, and invite Holly if you’d like, since she’s super protective over you.”

Kyle laughed. “Oh, she’s like my mother. As awkward as that sounds, but when it comes to Holly, that’s always the case.”

“Just make sure she comes.”

“I hope she can, she might have work that day,” Kyle informed.

Axyl rolled his eyes. “Ugh. Fine! Just make sure you bring yourself and see if Holly can go! Gosh! We have the whole week to situate this plan of ours and it shouldn’t be too difficult.”

Ridiculous Strategy


“Alright,” Kyle grinned. “Sounds good! I'll see you Friday, sir.”

“See ya there, buddy-boy.”

They both bumped each other’s fists and left for their classes, as the school bell blared. Axyl’s first class was with Holly, so it was time for him to pull a few smooth moves. This week was going to consist of nothing be ferocious planning and extreme caution. On another note, Kyle grew worried that, by talking to Velouria, Cale would ultimately end his life. Kyle knew he had to get Velouria out of that heap-of-trash relationship. As much as he didn’t talk to Velouria very often, he especially knew that Velouria was far from being a self-centered bitch who took everything for granted. Much like Cale’s ex-girlfriends. Kyle’s thoughts swam like a confused fish, after being delivered to a new aquarium. He took a deep sigh of stress, as he proceeded to walk through campus.

Axyl was extremely tempted to simply ask Holly to go the ball game, but he knew she would simply scoff and say “no,” followed by a raging rant full of insults. Axyl stood against the wall like an idiot, waiting for Holly Ransfield to walk into the small classroom and take a seat. She sat down next to another girl, completely unaware of Axyl’s presence. Giana was another great friend of Holly’s; she was about as aggressive and independent as Holly was, which meant Axyl was dealing with a double-threat. It was time for him to be smooth. Being hesitant and cautious as to what Holly and/or Giana might do to him, Axyl sat down next to Holly, who was having a normal conversation with her friend. The substitute teacher was a gorgeous, middle-aged woman. Though she was pretty and eye-catching, she looked as though she was not in the mood for being a substitute teacher.

“Alright, hello, little class,” the sub said, “I am your substitute teacher, Mrs. Sitts. If there's any questions about today's psychology assignment, don't ask me, ask your partner. Any disturbances made in class, he/she will receive a 'knuckle-bone.'” Axyl immediately rose his hand in the air, ready to ask a redundant question, with the intent of showing off in front of Holly.

Mrs. Sitts sighed. “What?”

“Hehe, what the heck is a 'knuckle-bone'?” Axyl smiled brightly, like a curious chimpanzee, as Mrs. Sitts gave Axyl a death glare and walked up to him. She clenched her first, exposing only one knuckle.

Chapter 7


She aggressively nudged Axyl’s arm and he reacted to the pain almost immediately. “Ow, jeez!”

“That's a 'knuckle-bone,'” Mrs. Sitts snapped and walked back to sit at the teacher's desk.

Axyl mouthed curse words, tending to his bicep. Holly and Giana were silently laughing, once Axyl had realized that his remark had backfired.

About 45 minutes later, classmates were working in groups on their psychology assignment. They didn't exactly work, rather just copied each other’s answers. Holly and Giana were the first ones to finish and they started talking quietly to each other, once again. With another ten minutes to spare, Axyl had to make his move before the bell rang. This was it.












“Hey, Holly?”

The two girls turned their heads slowly, questioning themselves if that really was Axyl who possessed such an annoying voice. And it was!

Holly replied, calmly. “Yes?”

“I'm, kinda, stuck on question number 19, here. It says, 'do psychological conditions have any physiological manifestations?' I wanna say 'yes', but I'm not so sure how to come up with a reasonable explanation.”

Holly looked at Giana, Giana looked at Holly. Giana shrugged with a confused look on her face. First, Axyl decided to sit next to Holly and now he is asking her for help? Hearing Axyl’s voice was compared to that of poison, slowly filling her eardrum, similar to the assassination of the king in Shakespeare’s Hamlet. It was dreadful, and Holly was well-familiar with it.

Ridiculous Strategy


“Well,” Holly started, moving her chair over, “your answer is right. Psychological conditions do, indeed, have physiological manifestations. Not only that, these physical side effects are not― as always― concrete right away. Most of the time, I mean. You get what I'm saying?”

Axyl nodded. He had no damn clue what she was talking about.

Holly nodded back. “Okay, good. Uh, what I would also put is that ‘manifestations are noticed after the appearance of behavioral abnormality.’ It’s in your textbook, page 197. Does that help you? God, I hope it does.”

Axyl was writing down exactly what Holly had just told him (Most likely spelling some words incorrectly.) He smiled at her, “Yeah. Thanks a bunch. You're really smart, Holly.”

Holly looked at him, as Axyl continued his psychology assignment. She was confused. She and Axyl have never had a normal conversation together, up until now.

“What the hell just happened?” Giana whispered.

“I dunno!” Holly whispered right back frantically. “I think he just complimented me! Must have smoked a bong.”

Axyl smiled, taking notice of Holly's surprised face. He finished his assignment, got up from his seat, turned it in, and sat back down.

“Hey,” he said sweetly, “I really like your shoes.”

Holly was puzzled and looked down at her orange tennis shoes. “My favorite color,” Axyl continued. “ Orange reminds me of tiger lilies.”

Holly totally began to blush. When Axyl wasn’t looking, she gave out a faint smile. Holly asked herself, Is this all a mere coincidence? The only people who know of this information is Giana and Kyle. Giana never talks to Axyl! Wait, Kyle was mentioning Axyl’s name over and over again, just the other day! *GASP!* Kyle!! RRRGGGGH!
