The way you insult me and despise me, it's all well-deserved. I hope someday you can forgive me.” Axyl was apologizing and that really seemed to throw Holly off her guard, although she firmly stayed put

Chapter 7


She gazed into his eyes, eyes of what belonged to the mightiest prick in Kingzing High School. Holly was ready to reply to Axyl, until Giana whispered to her, “He's full of crap. You really expect him to change, Holly?”

That's when Holly clicked, which gave Axyl the notion of which he had failed to swoon her. He sighed, and felt nervous about how she felt. At this point, it was best to leave her alone. Suddenly, the bell rang, and everyone left class. Axyl shook his head in disappointment, until Holly walked in front of him, grabbed him by the collar, and slammed him against a locker, which rested along the walls of the school corridor.

“What're up to, Smithy?” she said angrily.

Axyl acted dumb. “W-what?”

“Don't play dumb with me! What was that back there?? You flirting with me or something? I'll kick your ass if you ever do it again! The last thing I need is a jerk, like you, giving me 'googly' eyes the entire day. Was that whole 'I'm stuck on this problem' thing, all just for show?” Axyl stood there, not moving, forgetting how to talk.

“No it wasn't, Holly, I-I―.”

“Shut up! I know who you are Axyl! You're a heartless, pathetic turd that even I would love to throw in the trash bin. I know you and I know your stupid friends. You just wanna mess with a girl's emotions, manipulate her, abuse her, get bored with her, and tear her apart.” Axyl was frightened, and was about to soil himself. “What about this: Why was Kyle talking to me about you so much the other day? Huh?? What did you do?! I swear I'll―”

“It's 'cause I like you!” Axyl hollered. Students walking in the hallway immediately stopped. “I like you Holly, I like you a lot! All I wanted was your attention to prove that I'm not so much of an ass hat as I used to be. It’s like I’m back from rehab, but for ass hats.” Holly stared at him, speechless. Without warning, she threw her fist at Axyl. He was too fast, catching it before it was socked in his face. Holly hesitated and left, with Giana following her. Axyl went the opposite direction, knowing his attempt was a complete failure. All of the students in the hallway looked at Axyl, not like they ever have before. Axyl glared at them. “Well?! Isn’t it class time, children?!”

Chapter 8: Moosey's Frustration







Area 72, a very secretive place that held so many secrets; it could be compared to the Chamber of Secrets for today’s modern society! However, their intentions were never fully appreciated by the government, because not many people believed in what members of the A72A (Area 72 Agency) relied on― such as tracking down bigfoot, searching for the Lochness Monster, etc. The agency, being effiecient at its best, was actually suffering from an all-time low with their finances, due to the fact that the United States government didn’t feel the need to fund an agency that only focused on supernatural/paranormal activities.

On another note, after being hunted by the A72A, Preox and Rig’s unconscious selves were brought to Area 72, where they were currently being held as curious experiments if not prisoners.

Agent Moosey17 and Agent Nathan12 walked casually through the hallways of Area 72, both wearing angry expressions on their faces.

“I'm so angry,” Moosey said.

“Me too,” Nathan agreed.

“I wanted to kill some aliens today, but no, we had to bring them back for some damn reason.”

“Commander Derno wants to question the aliens.” Moosey shook his head in disappointment, and so did Nathan. Moosey ultimately snapped.

“Could he be anymore cliché than that of a science-fiction movie??”

Chapter 8

“Yeah! They're hostile!”

The two agents approached a huge, metallic door. Nathan picked his nose and smeared a large wad of snot upon an identification pad next to the door. The pad disintegrated the snot and the door slowly opened.

“I've been keeping my boogers extra crispy lately,” Nathan said happily

Moosey rolled his eyes. “Good for you, I’m so glad your DNA is fresh.”

Once the door was open, the moose and the human walked into what looked like a huge exhibit especially constructed for alien-related possessions. Scientists were seen observing a massive, alien space craft, which looked like something anyone would see from an old 1950s science-fiction movie. More scientists and the agents, of Area 72, were gathered around a certain area. They were mumbling and discussing in excitement, as if Santa put a butt-load of presents under their Christmas tree. It was Preox and Rig inside a huge, six-foot thick glass containment with air holes at the top. They were admired as if they were freshly caught butterflies.

Moosey and Nathan stopped in front of the glass structure, watching the two mysterious beings. Joining them inside the structure was a TV and a couch. Rig was watching the television wearing a ridiculous grin, and seemed to no longer posess his electric antennae. The aliens’ disguises were also taken, showing their true and nude form. Also, the humans had ceased Preox's damaged Vambit – which was currently being repaired and kept by curious scientists. His armor was also taken and being angry as usual, Preox was throwing a tantrum. He wasn’t angry by a means of which anyone else would expect, anyway.

“This is a poopy outrage!!!” Preox shouted, belching loudly. “What have you canines... *burp*...done to my brain?? This is wayyy worse than someone... Cankeromeberytrrrrrr...”

Moosey approached a tall, masculine man and asked, “Um, Commander Derno, sir?”

“Yes, what is it, Agent Moosey17?”

“Just by curiosity, but what did you do to the green one?” With Moosey pointing at Preox, Commander Derno spoke into a small microphone on a desk that was cooordinated to the glass containment. Derno was tall, both physically and mentally; badges covered the right side of his blue suit,

Moosey's Frustration


indicating his nobility and bravery from past experiences in the A72A.

“The reason why you're feeling quite odd is because we put large amounts of alcohol into your blood stream. This is just a minor test. The scientists wanna see what alcohol can do to your kind. Obviously, it's affected you rather heavily; we dare not try it on your special, blue friend. This also gives us a much better advantage at figuring where you're from and why you're here.” Derno was dead wrong about the last part of his speech, because Preox’s drunkard status would not be an advantage, not one bit. Preox was freaking out, and he had no clue what Derno was talking about, all thanks to the massive amounts of alcohol flowing through his body.

















“Is my mommy here?” Preox asked.

The scientists and agents laughed.

“YOU will pan for this! I mean 'pay!' Yes! You humans shall play for what you have done to me!”

Commander Derno shook his head again and spoke into the mic. “Listen here, you balloon-headed freak, tell us why you are here! Who sent you? Why are you hostile with us? What is your true intention or intentions?”

“Oh, they're hostile, alright,” Nathan spoke, and Derno shushed him, immediately.

“Weeeee,” Preox began, “come from a cute planet called, Suziaaaahh!” Preox started laughing softly. The scientists began to write down what Preox was saying, while also observing Rig laughing hysterically at the television.

Chapter 8


“Okay,” Commander Derno replied and continued his persistent questioning. “What was your motivation to come to our planet? Do you plan to destroy us, or be friends with us? Do you have a favorite color?? Okay, whose idea was it to give him alcohol in the first place? Please, someone tell me, anyone who thought it was―”

“THEY WANNA DESTROY EARTH!” Moosey shouted.

“Shut up, Moosey, please!” Commander Derno hollered right back.

“Yeah!” Preox shouted right back. “You are a stupid reindeer!”

Everyone laughed, including an agent saying, “HA! He kinda looks like a reindeer, actually!”

“I do not look like a reindeer!” Moosey snapped. “Moose are more aggressive and heroic. Reindeer suck!”

Everyone gasped, especially Derno. “Moosey― Reindeer can fly. How dare you diss upon the majestic creature that help bring toys to all of us, once a year?! Did I forget to mention that they fly???”

Moosey grunted angrily. “There's no such thing as flying rein―”

“GET OUT!” Commander Derno ordered.

Moosey, ran away from the scene on all-fours, with Nathan running after him. Everyone turned and watched the two agents leave the area in utter silence. They all turned back to see Preox sprawled on the ground passed out, with a bit of vomit leaking out his mouth.

“No, that's not how we have a Cattermole in crimson lutniftong,” the alien muttered in complete jibberish in his sleep. Rig stood over Preox, looked at the agents and scientists, and started licking the glass structure.

They continued to watch Preox talk nonsense and Rig lick other things in the structure, as Commander Derno was beginning stress from the two ridiculous aliens. All he wanted to get a little bit of information! He wasn't exactly planning to kill the aliens, but his mind was slowly starting to change.

Derno tapped on the glass slightly, with Preox jolting out of sleep in surprise. “Peaches 'n' crème! Es gibt zu viele Katzen in den Räumlichkeiten! Sie steigen ME!!”

“Will you please calm down and stop yelling in German?!” Derno hollered. It looked like the huge amounts of alcohol was really beginning to back fire.

Moosey's Frustration


beginning to back fire. “Très bien,” Preox replied, now speaking French, “je suppose que vous déteste la façon dont j'aime m'exprimer.”

“Please! English!” Commander Derno shouted.
















“Okay, okay fine,” Preox said calming down. “You DID say please, after all.”

Commander Derno sighed. “Okay, will you please tell us why you are here? What made you want to come to Earth?”

Preox stood there, thinking, followed by disturbing belches. “When I was a young boy, my father took me to the city to see a marching band.”

Scientists were writing down what Preox was saying. Preox continued his speech. “He said, 'Son, when you grow up, will you be the savior of the broken? The beaten and the damned―?”

“Song lyrics by My Chemical Romance are not going to get you our of this precinct!” Commander Derno shouted furiously and exhaled heavily. Derno was bright red; his face could roast an egg in no time, at all. Preox’s mind was so fogged from inebriation, he could mistake an alarm clock for a toilet. He also never had any recollection of speaking German, or French, only when Derno had merely mentioned it. The slightest sight of Preox’s drunkard status, Rig’s consistently annoying stature, Derno felt like he was was going to have a headache for the rest of his life. He would most certainly rather take a gun from a nearby agent and put a bullet in his temple because this plan of captivity went entirely haywire.

Chapter 8


“Aww! Is Preox making you die, Mister Old Man?” Rig asked calmly. Commander Derno ignored the idiot's side comment and hollered, “You, Blue man, will you please tell me why you two are here??”

Rig thought for a while. “Oh, yeah! We're here because we've lost a drinking thingy that can make you go BOOM!”

“Gas?” asked a scientist.

“No,” an agent snapped, “that's stupid! Is it Pepto Bismol?”

Rig shook his head, like a hyperactive rabbit. “No. It gives you super powers and such! That's why I can make sparklies with my antennae! You remember that?! Now I can’t do that anymore because you took it away from me! Thanks, meanies!”

The scientists were craving for more information from the Aziquet. However, thanks to the redundant gibberish from Preox (whom of which they sought to be the smarter one), there was no way in hell that they were going to believe Rig’s childish explanation. “Oh yeah? Why do you need this 'drinking thingy' so badly?” Derno replied, sarcastically. He had finally given up on the two and was on the verge of executing the two aliens for wasting so much time.

“So we can destroy these other idiots!” Rig shouted happily

“Other idiots?”

Rig wasn't very good at keeping a straight, normal face. His ridiculous grin made him look like he was lying to the humans. Rig couldn’t help it, for he's always never known better and always had an act of not being taken seriously without even trying. The agents and scientists observed, as Rig and Commander Derno discussed about everything that had happened, ever since they ended up on Earth's surface. From the crazy hobo in the tunnel, to being chased on the interstate, the humans still didn’t believe him.

“So, this ‘Zjok,’” Commander Derno said, “wants the 'drinking thingy' because he invented it? But you guys stole it, after just recently learning of its capabilities?” Rig nodded happily. The more Derno grew impatient, the more Rig seemed to be happier. Rig never intentionally annoyed someone, but if he did, there would be no stopping him, anyway. “You don't say?” Derno said. “And this 'Adoa Army' could be on their way to not only retrieve their ‘drinking thingy,’ but to eradicate us all?”

Moosey's Frustration


“Yeppy-yeppo!” Rig shouted happily. Preox was standing aside, watching the whole conversation, remaining heavily intoxicated.












Commander Derno nodded, then shook his head before announcing his latest plan. “Get these two aliens ready for execution, within the next day. Then, you scientists can have your autopsy fun.”

“WOO!” Rig yelled happily, completely unaware as to what the word “execution” actually meant. The scientists were excited, as well.

“Rig,” Preox said laughing, “I can't believe you just killed us both.”

“Thank you, Preox. I like you when you're drunk.”

“I'm just a little tipsy, that's all, silly goose,” Preox snapped. Then, he felt sick and vomited all over the floor, before falling asleep on the floor once again.

“I'm gonna go to sleep too!” Rig announced and laid himself down on the couch. The scientists and agents left the area and went back to their normal duties. Meanwhile, Agents Moosey17 and Nathan12 both sat alone in the official Area 72 cafeteria. Moosey ate ferociously at his little bowl of rice, as Nathan calmly ate his Express Panda. Nathan wasn't as angry as Moosey was, but he could certainly understand Moosey’s frustration about the whole “alien ordeal.” Moosey was a faithful agent of the American government and he had never been yelled at, infront of his fellow agents, in his entire life. Whether he was right or wrong, the fact that no one would take heed towards Moosy’s warnings, this caused him to take his frustration to a personal level.

Moosey growled and started babbling, with a mouthful of buttery, white rice.

Chapter 8

“Nathan! I've been working for the stupid human government for the past decade, have I not???”

“I guess,” Nathan replied, taking a sip of his soda. Moosey swapped the drink out his hand. Nathan squealed as the soda sprayed all over his suit.

“You guess?? Nathan! I've been through so much! Well, not really (just dealing with farting donuts and paranormal platypuses), but this alien thing is the biggest moment to ever happen in my career!”

“Moosey, j-just calm down, okay? I just got a text message from Commander Derno! He usually hates texting, so I think this is very important!”

Moosey went berserk and threw his rice everywhere. Once he calmed down, he sniffled and asked politely, “What'd he say?”















Nathan looked at his phone in shock. “He's given permission to execute the two aliens, later this week.”

Moosey immediately started wagging his tail. “Reallys?? At what time?”

“It says 'during this afternoon or something.'”

Happiness erupted from Moosey's face, and cheered, as if the Death

Moosey's Frustration


Star just blew up. The aliens were going to die, at last! All thanks to Moosey, himself, he will be the most famous moose of all time! He had saved the world! Of course, this was all coming from the egotistical mindset of Moosey himself. “D-did he mention me or anything?” he asked hopefully.

Nathan felt horrible for Moosey, after looking through Commander Derno’s message a second time, shaking his head “no.” Moosey stopped wagging his tail. “But, I'm the one who discovered them! I started stalking them in the first place, back at that stupid beach! RRGGH!”

“Look, Moosey, it's fine. I'm sure he knows that you deserve to be credited for finding these aliens,” Nathan said, trying to cheer up his poor buddy. The mammal sniffled and started crying. Moosey was a tough, sophisticated agent, but always had a soft side. Moosey continued to cry, then suddenly stopped. His face switched from sad and depressed, to angry and pissed! He got up and left the cafeteria. Nathan followed him, asking where the deranged moose was going. He was making his way back to the precinct, where Preox and Rig were being held in captivity.

“Moosey! What the heck-hole are you doing??” Nathan hollered.

“Something I shoulda done almost a long time ago!” Moosey answered. He pulled out his pistol, aimed at Preox in the glass structure, and fired several rounds. The bullets deflected off the glass, barely receiving any damage. Nathan was ducking for cover until a bullet ricocheted off the glass and hit Moosey's horn, critically damaging it.

Moosey started crying again and threw the gun at the structure. The gun bounced off the glass and hit Moosey on the shin. He cried even harder. Preox and Rig, being brain dead, stared at the poor moose, having trouble depicting exactly what was happening. Nathan came out of hiding and comforted the moose. Scientists and other agents stared with concern.

“You gotta take care of your poor son there, bub,” Preox inquired. Nathan shot a look at Preox and the two left the room. Preox and Rig could hear the faint echo of Moosey's sobbing. He had never felt so disrespected, so humiliated in his life. Preox and Rig stood there for a bit, until Preox collapsed on the ground once again. Rig looked over the Asid, smiling happier than usual, which appeared to be creepy and uncomfortable to see. Moosey and Nathan slowly made their way out of the area.

Chapter 8


“You okay, buddy?” Rig asked sweetly.

“Gnome!” Preox snapped, meaning to say “no”. “This sucks graham crackers! This 'alcohol' is ruining the way I think! I keep thinking how

sexy giraffes are! I don't even know what a giraffe is!”

Rig sighed. “That's what alcohol can do to you, man.”

“We must!” Preox shouted.

“We must what, sir?”

Preox shrugged and deliberately began laughing uncontrollably, and as did Rig.

Preox and Rig were surely doomed.

Planet Strom













The planet Strom was not far from Zjok's reach. That's what a few Asids had little knowledge of, after surviving the epic Adoa invasion from not so long ago. The invasion of which Preox and Rig barely escaped. Eight Asids had also survived, but were ultimately stranded on the planet Strom, with no means of communication or transport. Everything was destroyed of what used to be the Asids’ military base. Piles of burning dead soldiers were piled in several piles, scrambled all over the area, the weather was cold and damp, as it was eerily quiet. Planet Strom was an empty, mildly-weathered planet, and with the only form of shelter destroyed, the Asids were left to die.

Moosey's Frustration


Ranking in a much higher military status than that of the rest of the surviving Asids, Admiral Bxir stood proudly amongst his troops. Despite his armor being scratched and damaged, Bxir wore a cocked smile of pure confidence. What also made him stand out from the quiet and utterly depressed survivors, he held a booming southern accent of which emphasized his exuberant attitude. Following Admiral Bxir, there was Zitkir (a frustrated soldier and the least confident of the troops), there was Drox (the youger Asid who was new in the realm of warfare), followed by Asids named Querznem, Oil, Kriket, Rav, and Bunny.

The group of Asids sat around a purple camp fire, during a dragging night on the planet Strom. Their location had a perfect view of two beautiful crescent moons, surrounded by brillant stars and cosmos in the cold night sky. Admiral Bxir was the only one standing out of the camping area, gazing at the beautiful night sky. Kriket rose up from sitting on the cold ground, and calmly walked up to Bxir.

“Beeeww-tee-fulll, ain't she?” Bxir said.

“She?” Kriket asked.

“Tha universe! She sure is purty, huh?”

“Yes,” Kriket answered, gazing at the sky. “Um, Admiral?”

“Yessum, Common Kriket?”

“You think they're okay? Preox and Rig?”

Bxir chuckled. “Of course I deeww! Dey flew away in tha only ship dat had light speed. I'm sure they've found a place where tha Misara Serum is darn safe and/or disposed of!”

“They left without us, Admiral.”

“Yeh? Yer point, Kriket?”

Kriket sighed. The fact that Preox and Rig got away in the only functioning ship that the battle had left, without Bxir and the others, really disappointed Kriket. In fact, she hated them both for doing so even though they both had a job to do.

“My point is, Admiral, is that those two idiots left us here to die!”

“Kriket,” Bxir interrupted, “I would rather die fer my planet, than let tha Adoa destroy another. Dis damn 'jah-hooky' is really gettin' old, as old as Satan’s britches! If it's worth tha safety of planets all over tha galaxy, I wood

Chapter 8


do anythang tah put an end to Zjok’s corrupt vigilance; even if it result’d in death, Common.” Kriket was still upset. She looked back at the other Asids sitting by the purple camp fire, then back to Bxir.

“Well, those Asids wouldn't, Admiral. Look at us! We’re just waiting for death, now! And how do we know that Preox and Rig aren’t dead, as of now?! Is this how you want everything to end?! Preox had enough time to wait for all eight of us.”

“Why we fightin'?”















Kriket looked puzzled. “I beg your pardon?”

“We all know that yew has a crush on meh,” Bxir said laughing.

“Wait, what?”

“Yew all being like... 'I gone looks at tha stars wit' Admiral and flirts with him.'”

“I'M NOT FLIRTING WITH YOU?!”

“Yes, yew totally is!” Bxir laughed hysterically.

Kriket stormed off towards to the camp fire. Bxir followed her and continuously cackled amounts of saliva out his big mouth.

“What's so funny?” Rav asked. He had plastic bandages all over his head and his armor was blood-stained, similar to some of the other Asids.

“Kriket must be flirting with Bxir,” Oil answered. He was a depressed, young soldier. “I wish someone would flirt with me.”

“Oh, you big baby,” Kriket snapped.

Moosey's Frustration


“So what's up, Admiral?” Zitkir asked. “The smell of dead bodies is starting to get to me. How're we getting off Strom, now that all of our transportation and communication is gone? We can't just use our Vambits. We don't have enough lemonade fuel for that kind of distance to just fly away.”

“Dur!” Bxir exclaimed. “It's space!”

“Oh, be polite,” Bunny said. “It’s not often we get to. Be nice!”

“Asids,” Bxir said with a sigh. “Mah Vambit is steel sending off dat signal, in case any Asids happen tah pass by Strom in search of servivers. Fer now, we can jus' stay here, eat fish sticks, and jus' cheeelll.”













There was a long session of silence throughout the camp fire, except the sound of the crackling, purple ashes.

“I'm bored,” Drox said, flexing his muscles in front of Kriket.

“Me too,” Querznem replied. “Let's do something. Wanna play ‘I Spy,’ anyone?”

Then, the sound of falling iron occurred, causing the Asids jolt from their positions. “What da hail wuz dat?” Bxir said, wielding his rifle. The rest of the squadron did the same.

“Preox??” Bunny hollered, aiming his rifle to wherever the sound could have come from.

“Shut up! They're not here!” Rav whispered angrily.

“Shut tha hail up!” Bxir yelled angrily. “It gots to be some fallin’ debris, but keep your focus on Focusin’ Mode!”

Chapter 8


“Admiral,” Kriket whispered accordingly, “we haven't heard any falling debris for over a week. Don't you think we should take this more seriously? Like, I don’t, scout this out?”

“Kriket, just becerz yew is a girly, doesn't mean yer the smartest outta all of us. Por que?”

“It's 'comprende', sir.”

There was another loud bang, as if someone or something was thrashing through the debris of what used to be a military structure.

“Okay, there's something out there,” Oil said, gribbing his rifle tightly.

“It gone come from over dere, I think,” Bxir said pointing to the exact same spot where the first disturbance had occurred.

“Should we really go check it out?” Drox asked.

“Just make sure you go to the bathroom first,” Zitkir said sarcastically.

“Jeez, Zitkir, I didn’t ask for your attitude!” Drox yelled.

“It IS the perfect time tah express attitude, cuz yew won't shut up!” Bxir yelled right back. “Alright, Kriket, Zitkir, Rav, Oil, Querznem, follow meh. Drox and Bunny, as sharp shooters, cover us! Keep an eye out for whatever's comin.’”

Bunny and Drox saluted and the five Asids quietly made their way to the destroyed base.

“Lights,” Bxir whispered and everyone's revealed small flashlights, from each side of their Vambits. They all held their rifles tight, ready to open fire upon anything that could be a potential threat.

“Querznem, gimme an update on our position.”

A small, holo-graphic radar-screen unfolded from Querznem's rifle. It was working perfectly, even after fighting against the Adoa from earlier. “I'm just reading the five life forms, which a―”

“Holy!” Bxir whispered loudly. “Asids, get ready!”

“Admiral, the five life forms are us,” Kriket said calmly. Zitkir snickered uncrontrollably, which only resulted in Bxir smacking him upside the jaw.

They entered inside a structure through a blasted doorway. The ceilings and walls had gigantic holes in them from the amounts of obnoxious warfare. It was much darker inside and the lights hardly seemed to do any justice.

Moosey's Frustration


“Okay, now I'm reading something else on my radar, except it's not a life form,” Querznem whispered.

“Holy tits,” Rav said in a voice that showed his fear. “We're dealing with ghosts!”

“It must be a Probe,” Zitkir corrected.

“Dat's what I was gonna say,” Bxir said. Kriket rolled her eyes, she knew Bxir was full of crap. As always.

“Whoa, I'm reading three more,” Querznem whispered. “They're headed our way.”

“Alright, Asids, get yer butts ready fer sum whoop ass,” Bxir ordered.

Querznem laughed. “I feel like we're on―”

















Someone, or something, shot Querznem dead. They weren't Mazers, nor were they Strikers. They were tall, robotic beings, which all wielded a massive weapon of their own, replacing of what could have been their right arm.

“Damn! Adoa Probes!” Oil yelled in fear, firing his rifle, along with the others. Knowing that Querznem was gone, Bxir took the dead Asids' rifle, folded it, and stuffed it in his Vambit, as they all shot at the Probes. The Probes were strong with thick armor and they shot purple, deadly lasers.

Chapter 8


“Go go!!” Bxir ordered and the Asids began to flee from the Probes.

As they ran, Kriket threw a grenade at the enemies, getting it lodged inside a Probe’s armor. The grenade exploded, taking out the Probe and the ones surrounding it.

“Oh, God, that's so hot,” Oil said, as they made it out of the base. Just then, they realized Drox was fighting off a couple more Probes; Bunny was presumed dead, once he had been seen lying next to the camp fire, covered in his own neon-pink blood. Bxir hated losing his Asids more than anything. He yelled angrily, activated his jet-pack, on his Vambit, and flew back toward one of the Probes chasing them. Bxir grabbed the Probe by the face, shooting the rest of its robotic body to bits with his rifle.

Rav and Zitkir went over to help Drox, as Oil and Kriket fought off the other Probe that was chasing them. The fighting continued, until the Probes were all destroyed. Kriket was kicking their deceased heads as Bxir announced, “Everyone fine and dandy?”

All of the remaining Asids responded that they were fine.

“Querznem is dead,” Kriket said.

“I was gonna say dat,” Bxir said angrily. He took out Querznem's rifle and displayed it next to Bunny's. “Two fallen soldiers from a buncha annoyin' robits. Yew will be greatly missed, Querznem and Bunneh.”

This was an upsetting moment, especially when Rav, Oil, and Zitkir placed the two dead Asids in their own campfire, as a ceremonious form of memorial.

“Admiral,” Kriket said, after they all mourned their losses, “this situation is far from over.”

“Kriket is right,” Zitkir said. “Adoa Probes are not only troops, but the Adoas know what or who destroys them (They must have been put under ground, for scavenging any survivors from the battle, before.). The Adoa should be here sometime soon.” Before they knew it, the Asids saw several Adoa Bat fighters arrive from a distance.

“Yeah, I think that's what Probes are for,” Drox said to Zitkir sarcastically.

The fighters were not firing their weapons, but were proceeding for the capture of the Asids. Bxir sighed and said, “Well, we’re screwed.”


Chapter 9: Survivors













“SO!” Zjok yelled at the top of his lungs. “You actually think you could survive on MY watch?! Thanks to my Probes, which are programmed to record anything, you mindless bozos were doomed, the minute after the Bats arrived on the planet Strom and captured Bxir and his team. They were stripped of their Vambits and their weapons, before being sent for interrogation from Zjok himself. Before Zjok started exploding out of anger, the Asids were thrown into a dense, filthy prison cell. The cell was cold and was purely made of metal, and Zjok’s yelling surely didn’t make things any better. The Asids stood against the cold hard wall of the interior, not bound or chained ―just minding their own business― as they listened to Zjok's lecturing.

“I think we would've gotten away with it perfectly,” Drox replied, “if BXIR didn't have to let out his 'pet barking spider!'”

“Hey!” Bxir snapped, admitting to the fact that his disruptive flatulence was what gave them away the moment they were captured.

“Shut up!” Zjok yelled. “Enough of this fart-talk! It’s not funny!!”

“It's pretty disgusting,” Kriket said laughing. Despite all of the pandemonium and warfare she’d witnessed, farts were funny no matter what.

Chapter 9


















“Hey! Girls give out a little gas, teew!” Admiral Bxir added, arguing with Kriket.

Zjok's eyes widened. He completely took his mind off of the main subject. “NO WAY! My life has been a lie.”

“Yeah, dude!”

“How can they make them so quiet??” Zjok turned towards Kriket.

Admiral Bxir shrugged. “Sometimes they do, sometimes they don’t!” Zjok was appalled and Kriket was annoyed and was no longer laughing.

“Okay, back to the main subject,” Zjok continued. “HOW DARE YOU SURVIVE?! Well, I hope you idiots know that we know exactly where the Misara Serum really is. Fortunately enough, it Preox and Rig no longer possess the weapon; it’s been sitting in the same region of its destination for quite some time, now. You’d think it would be moving all over the place, with Preox and Rig trying their best to dispose of it. By the looks of things, it seems your allies have failed and have completely wasted their lives.”

The Asids gasped. Kriket was more distraught than everyone else, once tears streamed down her face. Zjok laughed hysterically, “Look at you! You big cry-baby!” The evil Asid noticed Kriket sniffing, on the verge of bawling. Zjok looked down her, his height towering over hers and laughed maniacally. “Aw, what's wrong? You gonna cry, ya little baby? Lemme see those tears, you putrid scum! Cry, you lifeless brat!”

Survivors


Kriket was bawling and Rav absolutely had enough. He stood up and pushed Zjok. The Adoa guards were about to blast his head off but Zjok signaled them not to. “Oooh, getting a little pushy, aren’t we?” Zjok said laughing. “What're you gonna do, tubby? Suffocate me with your fattening fat?” Rav was quite obese, and that little remark offended him greatly. He swung his fist at Zjok, Zjok caught his fist and with great force he bent his fist backward. Rav yelled in agony as the rest quivered at the sound of bone shattering. Even the Adoa guards reacted negatively.

Zjok bent Rav's fist further and further as he whispered, “Wanna see my new gun?” Keeping Rav his place, Zjok pulled a shiny-looking hand gun, loaded with over-sized medical syringes. He pressed the gun against Rav's stomach and pulled the trigger. What was left, after the sound of the gun going off, was an over-sized needle lodged in Rav’s stomach. He fell on the ground, moaning in pain as the needle seemed to be sucking every last drop of his blood, and vaporizing it from the other side of the syringe. The remaining Asids watched in horror as Rav's evaporated blood lingered in the air like smoke. Rav's skin wrinkled, and he died before all his blood was completely diminished. Zjok aggressively ripped the needle out of Rav's dead, wrinkled body and reloaded it back inside the medium of the handgun.



















Chapter 9


“That was a nice test run, wouldn't you say?” Zjok said with a menacing smile.

“You asshole!” Kriket yelled angrily, with tears rolling down her cheeks. Bxir stared at Rav, with anger over-flowing his brain. He wanted to do something, something to stop Zjok but the horrific sight of his deceased comrade paralyzed him.

“Oh, boo-hoo! Let ME have some fun, for once! YOU, puny little turds, stole what was precious to me! Isn't it fair that I do the same??”

“Not really,” Oil said nonchalantly.

“Excuse me??”

“The Misara Serum, it's hella dangerous, fool! What’s up in your head, huh?” Oil seemed to be the second Asid of the group to have the balls to stand up against Zjok’s cruelty. However, this would ultimately get him killed.

“Oil, just shut the hell up, please,” Zitkir whispered.

“Of course,” Zjok replied, “I WANT the Serum to be dangerous! It's for my vendetta! It’s for total damnation of this filthy galaxy! It’s everything the way it should be! I deserve domination! You deserve damnation!”

“Oh simmer down, now!” Bxir hollered, feeling more confident. “Just because yew were so socially awkward, back before yew betrayed us―”

“ADMIRAL, would you like to see dead pig innards the first thing you wake up?!” Zjok said angrily, referring to an incident which had occurred when he was part of the Asid Military. Back in the day, Bxir DID put a large pile of dead pig guts all over Zjok, as a prank, before he had woken up from a deep slumber. But that was a different story.

“Yeah, but it doesn't mean you should be a brat and invent a super weapon that can destroy not only us, but you as well,” Oil replied.

Zjok was too pissed. He took his fancy handgun and shot Oil in the head. Kriket was quiet and couldn't bear to watch Oil die.

“Ugh, four enemy deaths in just one hour,” Zjok said happily. “How unfortunate for you idiots! As a reasonable punishment for you remaining four, you will now work for me. I need a few Asids to keep me company. Being with many Mazers and Strikers can get really old, ya know??”

Survivors


Zjok tore the needle from Oil's cracked skull, once his body was rotted and reduced to nothing but a bag of innards, and reloaded the gun. “Guards, dispose of these bodies. I don't want their rotting stench stinking up the whole ship.” The two Mazers dragged the two dead Asids out of the vicinity. Admiral Bxir and the rest were not only enraged by Zjok’s harsness, but they just as upset as Kriket. They lost four of the Admiral's greatest soldiers: Querznem, Bunny, Rav and Oil. How much could they possibly take before eventually suffering the same fate as the others? Just before Zjok left the room, staring into the watery eyes of Kriket, he took a few deep breaths and continued to lecture the four of them.

“Now,” Zjok said in a calm voice, “I want you to stay here, like the insignificant primitives you all are. I'm gonna go set the timer on the kitchen stove and once it goes off, I’ll relieve you from time out and I will assign you some special chores! 20 hours of labor a day sound fair? YAY! Perfect!” The space dictator finally left the precinct, leaving out-of-shape survivors in a quiet state.

Bxir couldn't help but think about the death of Bunny, Oil, Rav, and Querznem, especially now that they were held captive in an enemy ship. It was quiet, lonely, and Kriket was traumatized beyond measure. She leaned against the wall, breathing silently. Her silent breathing was the only thing she wanted to concentrate on. Although, she failed miserably as she only thought about the dreaded aspects of the present time. She broke the lingering silence by breaking down into crying uncrontrollably. The loud sound of an Adoa rifle hit against a cellar door, followed by the voice of an Adoa guard. “Can you please be quiet? I'm trying to watch Family Matters.”









Chapter 9


“Oh, shove it up your ass!” Kriket yelled back.

“What'd you say?! That's it! Guards, cover me!” The noise of heavy footsteps came toward the Asids' cellar door. The door unlocked and a Mazer marched aggressively towards Drox. The Mazer wailed on him, using his massive fists and the butt of his rifle. Drox screamed in agony, followed by confused looks on Bxir and Zitkir; especially Kriket. They couldn’t fight the guards and they couldn’t do anything to help Drox without being killed within a second.

“Ow! Dammit that hurts! That wasn't me that said that!!” Drox hollered.

The Mazer stopped beating him and left the cellar with the few others. “Then shut up!” the Mazer hollered right back, making no sense whatsoever, as if he just wanted to beat Drox out of spite. The heavy footsteps continued when the Mazers left the cell.

Drox's face was critically bruised, and was on the verge of complete unconsciousness. He coughed hoarsely and neon-pink blood oozed from his swollen lips. “Kriket― what the hell―?”

He began to whimper and cry a little. Kriket felt awful. “Drox, I'm so sorry.” She crawled on the metallic floor towards him, hoping that none of the Mazers hadn’t taken all of her medical supplies from the storage compartments of her combat armor. Thankfully and unfortunately, Kriket only found one small syringe attached to a compartment along her thigh. The syringe could only do so much as numb the pain for Drox. She gently slid the needle in Drox’s bloodied wrist and rested his head upon her lap.

Drox thanked her and was almost tempted to kiss her on the mouth. “Thank God that needle doesn’t suck all of my fluids, am I right? Well, the next time you wanna bitch at a Mazer, let me know alright?”



Zjok entered his lovely cockpit, whistling a catchy tune, with his deadly weapon in his hand (A box of crackers in the other.) Galg was monitoring radars other spontaneous activity, as the Elephant patrolled through space at a great speed with the rest of the staggering fleet.

Zjok walked up to Galg, who was particularly in an outstanding mood. “Galg, I can't help but notice, do we seem to be going faster?”

Survivors

“Hell yeah,” Galg said happily. “Apparently, when arriving Strom, we have recovered gallons of this special fuel the Asids had been hiding. It gives our ships a much faster advantage of trasnport. Our researchers say that this is the fuel used for 'light-speed' ships, Master Zjok. Although the fuel is far too advanced for our models and we won’t proceed as fast as Preox and Rig did, but we will be arriving sooner than later. All thanks to orange juice fuel.”

Zjok's eyes widened. “Light speed (orange juice) fuel? Galg, our researchers are geniuses; which is a huge surprise! I thought all of you were stupid.”

“ME TOO!” Galg shouted excitedly, scaring one of the Mazer pilots. Zjok looked at the image of planet Earth from one of the ship's magnificent telescopes. The live image was displayed, from a projector, on a big billboard, next to the pilots' station. He admired the beauteous planet, he found it quite different, and he grinned devilishly.

“I see that our destination is loaded with water, landscapes, and so much life. If we wipe out all of the dominant life on this planet, the whole planet can be our home. My home. All mine.”

Galg was confused. “Zjok, sir, what about Fleek? Fleek is our home.”

Zjok chuckled. “Yes I know, you silly bastard. But, look how much bigger 'Eeerth' is compared to Fleek. The air is so much cleaner, according to the image displayed here. Just imagine all the facilities, military bases, and ships we can build on this planet. Think of all the food! There are billions of life forms living on that big rock and it's not even close to being over-populated! We have the technology to give this planet the rightful owners it deserves! US!!!”










Chapter 9


“What about the Misara, sir?”

“Oh, we're still retrieving it, of course,” Zjok's voice getting lower and deeper. “That's why I made this.” He showed Galg his weapon, with the massive syringes attached.

“The Steamy Vampire B-105?”

“Yessssssss,” Zjok replying with a snake-like voice. “This is not just a weapon to kill, my friend, but the key to bringing me my wonderful Misara Serum. I have no doubt that something, or someone, has obtained the Misara's incredible powers. Like Rig, for instance. There’s still hope that the Misara has not been drank, or absorbed, into one's skin. If that has happened, then we got plan B, right here: Just one shot from the Steamy Vampire B-105 and this needle will drain the blood of the victim, evaporating his blood into thin fog. If I am to shoot the one obtaining the Serum, the needle will recognize the Drokensmur’s essence, which is mixed in the Misara Serum All while the victim’s blood is being evaporated, the syringe will also obtain the liquidity of the Serum itself and stash it inside the syringe’s containment compartment.”

Galg was almost speechless. “That's incredible, sir. So, once we get the Serum, with thousands of our troops alongside us, we will pretty much be unstoppable?”

“Indeed, my lovely partner. Whether the Misara Serum has been obtained, or not, we ARE unstoppable.” Zjok shoved a mouthful of crackers in his mouth and began to laugh his evil laugh. Galg began to laugh, too. The Mazers and Strikers laughed also, not knowing what the hell they were laughing about.

“Your majesty!” Yayvox announced. He had just entered the area. “We have located Preox and Rig. Well, we are not so sure, for we have only tracked Preox's Vambit signal.”

“But, a Vambit can only be traced if the long-range cloaking device is offline,” replied Galg. “Unless―”

“OH THIS IS GREAT!” hollered Zjok. “Our alien friends are under a conflict! An Asid like Preox would never switch off his cloaking device! Someone else has gotten ahold of it! Or even better, Preox and Rig could be DEAD! Pathetic! Well, this will be fun! Galg, I'd like you deploy Probes to \

Survivors


planet 'Eeerth' because I'd like to see how strong the planet's defenses are. Once they reach the Serums' current position, of course. We need to see what we’re going to be standing up against before we actually invade the place! Oh, and send Probes to where Preox's Vambit is located. I would love to make sure that he and Rig are truly diminished!”

“How many do you want me to send, sir?” Galg asked happily.

“Hm, as many as you want!”

“OH, YAY!”

Zjok laughed uncontrollably. He was laughing so much, he started to drool and he didn’t feel so angry like he was before. He was happy with what he was plotting alongside Galg. Zjok was so sincerely evil, that he took it as a personal gain and yet most of the Adoa would question as to why he was in the first place. Now the Adoa have had a long history with the Asids (both good and bad), especially long before Zjok rose to power and turned his back on the Asids. The Adoa had no idea what their new leader was capable of and they were unsure as to whether enjoy it, or be truely afraid of it at the same time. Zjok was horrendously unpredictable and if the Adoa were to make such a statement, the Asids wouldn’t hesistate in vouching for that factor.

Galg left the area, heading toward the launch station, once it was announced that Zjok’s plans for “pre-warefare” were in order. They were going to have an outstanding headstart with the help of the nasty advancements of the Adoa Probes. The Probes could travel much faster and more efficiently than the Elephant and the remaining Adoa ships. From where the Adoa was designated, the Probes could reach Earth within a matter of days. They were next to that of the speed of a light-speed ship and they were especially handy in fighting in a war without worrying about killing real lives. It’s easier to think of it as sending an aggressive text message to a hated person in the meanest way possible!

The echoes of Probes being launched into space was heard nearby the precinct. Zitkir, Kriket, and Drox were curious as to what the echoes may be. As for Bxir, showing no expression, he knew what was happening and knew EXACTLY what was going to happen. The Adoa have made their first official, malicious move on their target.

“Admiral, what is that noise?” Zitkir asked, listening carefully.

Chapter 9


Without looking at Zitkir, Bxir replied, “Dey is releasin' the Probes to wherever tha hell we're goin'. Whatever lives on thuh planet we're going to, they is doomed ter die.”

“Bxir, we need to get out of here, now,” Kriket whispered. She was still tending to Drox’s wounds to the best of her ability. “Let's attract those guards over here again, and let's pummel them.”

Bxir chuckled hoarsely, “Yew kiddin', son?! We're in the depths of an Adoa Armada… of thousands! Thuh only Asid allies I see are three, defenseless prisoners, including me! That's five defenseless Asid prisoners, Common Kriket. We is goin' no-wheres, unless we agree tah go on Zjok's side.” Kriket was searching for another possible solution, but failed. All four were completely hopeless.

“Hey,” Bxir finally said.

Zitkir looked at him. “Yes, Admiral?”

“Why did thuh cheeken cross dah road?”

Zitkir gave a soft laugh. “Why?”

“Tah get tew a gay man's house.”

Zitkir looked puzzled. Kriket and Drox immediately awoke with the same expressions on their faces.

Bxir laughed. “Hey, knock-knock!”

“Who's there?” Zitkir replied.

Bxir laughed even harder, “Thuh cheeken!!!”

The Asids blew laughter from their mouths, echoing the whole prison facility.

“HEY!” shouted the same Mazer guard from before. “Will you please be quiet?! I'm trying to watch Family Matters!”

The Asids looked at each other, laughing even harder. Though things ultimately sucked right now, even the smallest things could cheer them up.

And amongst the upcoming and most certainly threatening events, who could possibly uphold the terrifying Adoa? Could Blue Lazer? Preox and Rig? Anyone could be a hero.





Chapter 10: Velouria








It was five o' clock on a gorgeous Friday afternoon! The baseball field of Marsing High School was particularly empty, although it was soon to be filled by plenty baseball fanatics. The Kingzing High School Rattlesnakes were to face their rival, the Marsing High School Jellyfish in a great game of America’s #1 sport. Of course, this week’s game was to take place at Marsing High’s baseball field, but this game will ultimately determine which team will be the fittest for the state championships! As the Rattlesnakes prepared to take a bus to “Jellyfish Territory” and sports fans were to provide transport of their own, this was going to be one hell of a night indeed.

School had ended for the day and all of the students had successfully made it through yet another terrifying day of learning. Holly had been on Axyl’s mind all day and the plan of which he and Kyle have cautiously devised together was surely going to be more risqué than simple, in terms of both winning the women of their dreams. Axyl was ready, as he was already decked out in his sports gear. He walked out of the school building, toward the bus, when Kyle hollered for his name. He was in the nearby parking lot standing next to his car, waving his twig of an arm.


Chapter 10


Axyl had the feeling that he and Kyle were becoming wondrous colleagues and he had never thought, in his life, this would be in anyway possible! In fact, Kyle himself was starting to feel the same way. Axyl walked over to Kyle, with is cleats smacking against the rough concrete.

“You pumped?” Axyl said with a smile and hoisted his heavy dufflebag over his shoulder after straightening his baseball cap. Kyle didn't smile back and Axyl noticed dribbles of sweat sliding down his ridiculously large forehead. “Are you okay, man?” Axyl really wished Kyle wasn’t a nervous wreck during times of risky business. He didn’t blame him. If there was one thing that really bothered him about Kyle, it would be his lack of confidence.

“Yeah,” Kyle responded. “Just a little nervous.”

“Hey, don't worry about it! Just be yourself and don’t stare at her chest. Apparently it’s a rude gesture, of some sort.”

“It's not that I'm nervous about actually conversing with Velouria, for the first time in my life, I’m nervous about Cale.”

Axyl completely forgot that Velouria and his other best friend were together. Kyle was stepping into the deep side of the pool and if Cale found out about the “flirtatious” acts, which will be done by Kyle, towards Velouria, Kyle will surely suffer an excruciating fate.

Axyl took a deep breath. “Oh, yeah. Forgot about that. Dammit. Hmm, well if anything happens, let me know alright? Just yell, or something.”

Kyle looked at him strangely. Not only Axyl just admitted that he will protect Kyle, if Cale were to start a quarrel, but against Cale himself. Kyle couldn't believe how different Axyl was behaving. Axyl was somewhat becoming a good person; finally seeing how much an ass he and Cale have been to poor, poor Kyle. Kyle nodded with a faint smile. He, remarkably, knew he could trust Axyl, who was now his ex-rival. This also proves that Axyl does not take too kindly of Cale's behavior. On a more unfortunate note, Axyl knew what Cale could do to Kyle, IF he so much as see him in public, other than talking to Velouria. Axyl let his thought process roam his mind, as he thought about the risks that could come upon him and Kyle. He didn’t want to screw over Cale, but he knew Velouria and Cale was not the best fit for her. After seeing the two in school, kissing and holding hands every now and again, Cale is an awful boyfriend. Axyl was not just doing this for Kyle, but also for Velouria. When she and he dated, Axyl was about as crappy as Cale was, which also raises concern about Axyl’s pursuit for Holly’s heart. Axyl had to try for Holly, and he wouldn’t allow himself to give up.

Velouria

“Hey,” Kyle finally replied, “how’s talking with Holly?”

Axyl sighed with frustration. “It sucks.”

Kyle gulped. “Well, can’t say I told you so.”

“It's fine,” Axyl replied, rolling his eyes. “I still got this.”

“Oh really?”

“Yeah, you still gonna invite her to the game?”

“Yep. Or, at least, I’ll try.”

“Thanks, bro! I gotta go! I'll see you at the game!”

Axyl bolted toward the bus, just minutes before it left. Kyle, approaching his car, dialed a few buttons on his cell phone and began calling Holly. He was completely unware of Holly’s upcoming sass. However, Kyle should always see this sort of trait coming.

“Kyle, you little turd.”

Kyle's stomach sank. “W-what?”














“You've been talking to Axyl, like all the time now, huh?” Holly replied. Her voice sounded cold and stern.

“What the hell?! N-no of course not! W-why would I do that? He would slam me down to the ground if I was within his sight! He’s a… poop.”

Holly growled. “Did he force you tell him about me? ‘Cause he's been giving me googly eyes all week! It's driving me nuts. Oh, and he somehow knows all of my favorite things! Are you sure you’re not telling him all this? I know I shouldn’t be asking that because it’s obvious you would never talk to him, you know? I’m just really concerned. And I want Axyl to die.”

Chapter 10


Axyl was digging a grave for himself, and so was Kyle. Kyle, for the first time, was scared of Holly. Who knows what would happen between their friendship if she were to find out about Axyl and Kyle's recent alliance? The unfortunate end of their longing friendship?! Quite the possibility.

“He hasn't bothered me since that day at the Funky Munkey. I think he's just acting like all insensitive jerks do. He’s a poop.”

“He told me he liked me, Kyle,” Holly said, her voice getting colder. Kyle was talking to Death, herself.

Kyle, thankfully being a theater student, acted in a shocking manner. “That fugly man! Just ignore him, then. He's a l-loser head!”

There was a long pause. “A 'l-loser head?' You okay, Kyle?”

“Y-yeah! I'm fine! Why you ask stupid question?! Silly Holly, thou talk'st of nothing! Anyway, want to go to the district baseball game with me, tonight at six?”

There was another long pause. “Kyle, you never go to baseball games. Plus, Axyl and Cale will be there.”

“I-I just thought it would be fun. Being a senior and all, I thought it would be fun to spend this Friday evening with my best friend! And, if Axyl starts something, you'll take care of it right? My girly, lovely, protector?” Kyle felt absolutely pathetic after he had said that Holly was his “girly, lovely, protector.”

“I can’t go, Kyle,” Holly responded with a sigh. “I got work tonight. Anyway, you've been acting like a weirdo. Ha, you're always a weirdo and that's why I love you. Let’s do something soon, yeah? I am also sorry for calling you 'little turd.'”

Kyle spat. “It's fine, Holly! I love turds.”

Holly laughed. “Love you, Kyle, I'll talk to you later.”

“Bye-bye. Love you too!”

Kyle hung up and sighed heavily in utter frustration. He was shaking, for he felt like he was going on some sort of secret mission. He liked Velouria a lot, even though he didn’t talk to her as much he talked to Holly. It was time for him to grow some balls of steel. He has the advantage to talk to Velouria like any other normal being, all thanks to his drama class. Despite that advantage, he was scared out of his wits to, most likely, facing Cale.

Velouria


It was nearly five-thirty, once Kyle looked at the time on his car stereo. The school bus was long gone and he was just about to leave Kingzing High until he saw a face. A wonderful, beauteous face of pure angelic feats. It was Velouria, driving her 1968 Volkswagen Beetle. The beetle purred as she drove past him. Kyle stared at her in awe; she was absolutely stunning. The short, brown, and curly hair hung over the tips of her shoulders, along with the small groups of freckles on her rosy cheeks, made her flourish like a tulip. Kyle was practically drooling, and thank God Velouria did not see that. He watched her drive in the direction of where the bus had gone to Marsing High School, with a faint smile on his face. Once she was out of his sight, he then followed, desperately trying to build up as much confidence as he can before he was going to actually talk to her.





Ever since Preox and Rig were sentenced to an untimely execution, ordered by Commander Derno, the two aliens remained in the glass cell, almost approaching the brink of their demise. Seeing the two aliens were completely useless, according to Derno, today was the day that Preox and Rig were to meet their unfortunate fate. Moosey should be happy about this, though he really wasn’t because the credit he thought he deserved was not getting received. And he was depressed about it all week.

Moosey walked on all fours, his eyes barely open. He had barely gotten any sleep, ever since he discovered Preox and Rig's existence. It was time for him to hit the hay, for once. He walked through the cold, dark facility of Area 72. Soldiers, agents, and scientists were wandering about, working on what they were supposed to be working on, whether it was research, combat

Chapter 10

training, guarding doors, etc. Moosey was undeniably depressed and quiet, which was portrayed no differently than the atmosphere he was in. Everyone took their job seriously and there was rarely any moment to be goofing around. Employees laughed and chuckled silently as Moosey strode through the area. He was laughed at for his horn, which was damaged by a ricocheting bullet, from earlier. Moosey attempted to repair it back to its original state, with duct tape. He looked absolutely ridiculous and humiliated. Moosey had no idea where his partner, Nathan, had wandered off too. He didn’t care, he just wanted to get some rest.

Moosey, who was on the verge of tears, walked by a room, which was labelled as the “Camera Room.” The door opened and out came an average sized, six-foot tall agent.

“Oh!” the agent exclaimed. “Thank goodness you're here, Agent Moosey17.”

“Something the matter, Agent Eugene7?” Moosey asked, perking his head up, revealing his watery eyes.

“Yeah! I gotta go potty pretty badly. Can you keep an eye on the cameras for me?! I promise I'll be right back, buddy.”

Moosey sighed. “Alright. I got nothing else better to do, anyway.”

Moosey watched Eugene sprint to the bathroom, followed by the whimpering noise of anxiety, desperately holding his bladder. Moosey walked into the room, which was full of monitors, alongside the wall. Each room had approximately 120 camera monitors viewing from certain angles of the secret military base. Moosey couldn't help but notice that the monitors of this room viewed all images from the research facility. He could see Preox and Rig in their glass containment from cameras 21, 39, and 42, from three different angles. Moosey stared at the two, lonely aliens (The scientists must have finished their research for the day.), with Preox sitting alone, as Rig watched the television.

Curious enough, Moosey took control of camera 21 and zoomed in on Preox. Moosey, full of anger, still believed that he and Rig were the most dangerous discoveries Area 72 had ever collected. If Moosey was going to be happy about anything, it would be the death of Preox and Rig. Mostly Preox.

“How about you zoom in more to get a better look at my face?”

Velouria


Moosey jumped in fear. It was Preox's voice that he heard! The alien must have known Moosey was getting a closer look on him with the camera

Moosey spoke into the mic. “Um, what?”

“I'm talking to you, you mindless creep,” Preox replied. Moosey was utterly frightened. He was talking to a real alien being. He didn't know what to do. His hatred towards Preox was now with a minor sense of fear.

“What do you want from us?” Moosey asked.

The Asid stood up, his green naked body reflecting the lights shining down on him, staring at the camera. Rig was still sitting in his place, minding his own business, not taking notice of what was going on.

“If you incompetent crabs haven't have drugged me, then you would have found out long ago. If I wasn't drugged, let alone captured, you wouldn't have to worry about a damned thing.”

Moosey gulped. “I—What? What do you mean by worry?”

Preox sighed and began pacing back and forth. Moosey began to worry immediately, whereas the alien remained calm.

“Your researchers have something of mine. Something very important. My Vambit. I would like to collect it, please.”

“A V-Vambit?”

“Yes. The red thing you saw attached to my back when you first confronted Rig and I.”
















Chapter 10


Moosey took a deep breath. “Yes. What about it? It's dangerous?”

Preox nodded firmly. “Oh hell yeah it is. You witnessed it yourself. All of my kind has one. It runs on typical lemonade, consists of two auto turrets that shoot deadly fiery bullets, and a jet pack. Not only that, it can track down objects and call for transmissions. Your researchers have probably fixed the damages, after you guys took us. As we speak, they must have done something they will soon regret.”

Moosey gulped, loud enough for Preox to hear. Agent Eugene7 came back into the room.

“Woo! Cafeteria food, I swear. Hey, what're you up to, Moosey?”

“Hello, foolish muskrat,” Preox replied.

Eugene's heart sank, just as deep as Moosey's. “Um—Hi, alien?”

Moosey butted back into the main subject. “What do you mean?! What would our scientists do that they would regret?”

Preox chuckled for the first time ever. “So that's what your researchers are called. Once they turn off the long-range cloaking device on my Vambit, due to certain curiosity of research, the Adoa will be able to track us down and give us a little company.”

Eugene was flipping out. “What? The Adoa? Vambit!? Moosey what's going on?!”

“So you're not here to kill us all, then?” Moosey said frantically.

“You're not even worth my time!” Preox shouted in anger. “We were minding our damn business, until you idiots came and ruined everything with your fancy blue vehicles! Now that you curious jackasses have access to MY armor, my Vambit, and Rig's bleedin' electric stem, we’re definitely screwed! Regardless, I might add, we are screwed! You don't even know who and what you're dealing with. It’s too late.”

“Yeah!” Rig randomly hollered.

“I-I gotta go stop the scientists,” Moosey said.

“HA!” Preox shouted. “It's way too late for that, now. You guys have dug a grave in an enormous pile of goat feces!”

Eugene hesitated and spoke. “What's gonna happen?!”

“The Adoa wants us dead. We stole something from them that should never have been created. Now that they can track my Vambit (most likely),


Velouria

they would have sent in their Probes, by now. They can travel faster than any typical ship we have, other than light-speed of course. Once they reach our location, all hell breaks loose. And, if you don't believe me, then adios amigos because we're all dead. That’s if you don’t let us out of here, now. Unfortunately, your Commander Derno will not believe anything I say.”

“Well, we can just blow these 'Probes' out of the sky before they reach us right?” Clarke asked.

“As unlikely as this may sound to you,” Preox said, “you can't. The Adoa have the technological ability to have cloaking devices, also (similar to my Vambit), and they're untraceable. You need to let us out!”

Moosey was not so sure about anything being untraceable from radar. Nothing can be untraceable from Area 72, according to his knowledge. It was impossible. But, he was still curious about this whole Adoa ordeal. However, Moosey did not allow himself to risk letting Preox and Rig free, as he still firmly believed that they were dangerous and untrustworthy.

“If they do come, the Probes I mean,” Moosey replied, “we can take them out ourselves.” He switched off the mic.

“WHAT!?” Preox angrily yelled, as he was muted. “YOU STUPID MOOSEY PIECE OF CRAP! YOU’RE GOING TO KILL US ALL!”

Moosey turned to Eugene slowly. “Agent Eugene7, I want you to report this to the Captain. I’m not going to let the aliens out, but I believe the Commander needs to hear of this. Can you do that for me, Agent?

Eugene nodded in obedience. He was quite nervous, hearing about Preox's notification. Eugene was nervous. What if we’re not capable of defending ourselves against foreign (and maybe advanced) technology?












Chapter 10


Marsing High School: Home of the Armadillos


















Axyl felt a little sick to his stomach once he took that first step off the school bus, with the rest of the baseball team. He came to realize that he wasn't sick, but that he was full of affection; He was excited to see Holly, hopefully. As he walked, having a good conversation with Cale Omnous, Hayson Prent, and other baseball players, Axyl noticed the Marsing team sitting in their dugout. Their coach was yelling at them, pointing his clip board in the direction of Axyl. The coach must know about Axyl’s greatness, for Axyl’s coach always loved to brag about his players.

“Alright, ladies,” Axyl’s coach Neilberg Sleeve announced, “we are gonna kick some butt out there, right?!”The team cheered like a bunch of barbarians, especially Axyl. “Good! But, hey, even if we lose, at least we made it to districts right? Right? We played great this year, with Cale's fast pace, Hayson's awesome throwing, Gary's outstanding back flips, and Axyl’s amazing batting. This is probably the best team I've had since 'Nam. So, if we lose, that's alright.” It suddenly became very quiet in the dugout. Coach Sleeve grinned. “I'm full of crap, if you guys don't win then it's fifty laps around the track for you guys! Now, let's get out there and play some ball!!”

Velouria


The Kingzing Rattlesnakes cheered once again with a steady, yet nervous, attitude. It was five minutes before the first pitch was to be thrown. Things were about to get intense.

Axyl sat next to Cale, who was adjusting his baseball cap. “Hey, man.”

Cale was frustrated, as he tried desperately to adjust the head size on his cap. He seemed to have no clue how to do so. As he struggled even more, Axyl took the cap from him and adjusted it to fit his stupid head.

“Ugh, thanks bro,” Cale said with a sigh of relief, placing the cap on his head. “Those caps are very not cool.”

“I noticed,” Axyl said with a laugh. He noticed Cale was not keeping eye contact with him, for he was keeping his eye on someone else. It was Velouria, who had just shown up for the game. Cale stuck his arm in the air and flailed like an excited, young orphan. She waved back with a faint smile. Axyl couldn’t help but barely gag at this sight.

“How—how are you two? You and her?” Axyl asked curiously.

“Who, me and Vel'?”

“No, you and your grandma.”

Cale laughed. “We're good! We already made out three times, so I think we're off to a pretty good start!! She has an amazing body, dude.”

Axyl forced a laugh out of his sarcastic mouth. “Wow! That's awesome, buddy-boy.”

“Hell yeah,” Cale replied, raising his eyebrows up and down. “She's a nice piece of meat, ya know what I mean? Huh?” Cale laughed, elbowing Axyl in the side gently.

In his mind, Axyl couldn’t help but give Cale the best criticism. You're an idiot. Then, the sports announcer's voice came into the ears of his and many others.

“Alright, ladies and gents, welcome to the High school district baseball game of 2005! Here we have two arch rivals: The Marsing Jellyfish VERSUS The Kingzing Rattlesnakes. We are in for a great game tonight, folks. We are gonna have Jellyfish up to bat first, as the Rattlesnakes will get into the field.”

As everyone got into position, for the game was about to start, Kyle had

Chapter 10


finally shown up. He was anxious, once he began looking for Velouria. He went up to the snack station and got a bag of popcorn to help ease his mood. He loved popcorn more than anything. He continued searching for Velouria, when he finally saw her sitting by herself. He was ready to talk to her, for once in his pathetic life. He made his way up the seats, getting closer to Velouria. She turned around, noticing Kyle, who had a goofy smile on his face.

“Hey, Velouria! How goes it—OOF!”

He had tripped on someone's leg and totally biffed it, spilling his popcorn everywhere.

“Oh damn! My food! Stupid kid!” yelled an angry audience member, as Kyle struggled to get up.

“Are you okay?” Velouria said with a smile. It wasn’t faint.

“Yeah!” Kyle hollered right away, ignoring the pain in his abdomen. “Yeah, yeah, I'm good! I'm wonderful, actually. I was saying ‘hi’ t-to that cr-crow over therrre-- he looked happy. Do you like crows?” Kyle was on the verge of vomiting from all the “butterflies” in his tummy.

Velouria made an awkward look and laughed a bit. “I-I never really thought of that. But, yeah I guess so!”

“Yeah!” Kyle smiled, agreeing. “They're pretty cool. I just never really see any—OKAY, anyway, how're you doing, Velouria?”

















Velouria


Velouria let out another laugh. “I'm good. How about you? It's been awhile since we've actually talked.”

Kyle put on a goofy look. “Right?! It's been so long! And, I'm pretty good, I guess. After all, I just spilled all my popcorn.”

“Damn right you did,” replied the angry audience member, Kyle ignored him.

“So, you're here by yourself?” Kyle asked. Velouria nodded. “Mind if I gave you some company as we watch the game?”

Velouria was about to answer when the sports announcer began announcing some more. “Alright, ladies and gents, we're in the first inning and first up to bat is number 76, Kramer Gerald. Let the game begin!”

Hayson Prent stood in the middle of the field, ready to throw the first pitch of the game. His eyes didn't blink for a second as he concentrated on the first batter. He shook his head a few times, as the catcher gave him finger signals, and threw the batter a screw ball. The sound of the ball smacking against the bat went off. Axyl, who was in the outfield, saw that ball zip past Hays. He ran toward the ball, remarkably faster than anyone else, and caught the ball in his mitt before it would have touched the ground. The audience roared with cheers as the batter, realizing he was out, stood there scratching his head. There was no way any other player could have caught that ball. Cale hollered from second base, giving Axyl a thumbs up. As for coach Sleeve, he looked like he just crapped himself from happiness.

“Damn, did you see that?” Velouria said happily. “Axyl has gotten frickin' amazing this year.”

“Yeah,” Kyle said with a nervous chuckle. He looked down, not at Velouria's chest, and desperately searched his head for something to talk about. Velouria was so gorgeous, Kyle thought of her as a princess. On a similar note, referring to princesses and beauty, Kyle had finally came up with a subject to discuss about. “Hey, I’m in the school play!”

Velouria smiled. “I love Princess Bride. That’s so cool! Wow!”

Kyle cleared his throat a bit, sticking his chest up. “Well, I happen to be Inigo Montoya in the play, not meaning to brag.”

“Really? Ah, that’s wonderful! You’ll do great as him, Kyle. Wanna give me a sneak preview of your character?”

Chapter 10


Kyle looked up at the sky, thanked the Lord Almighty, and went back to talking with Velouria, as the game progressed.

Meanwhile. . . Again.











Rig sat in the middle of the floor, whistling along the elevator music that echoed through whole facility. The only lights that illuminated were the ones above the two aliens' heads and above the old alien craft, about a hundred yards away. Preox leaned forward against the glass containment, sleeping and full of anger. All he could think about were the Probes, for they could be on this planet any minute, now. Preox and Rig were in the same position as Bxir, Kriket, Zitkir, and Drox were in: Preox couldn't call for help and he had no Vambit, weapons, or armor. And if he were to call in for help, anyway, the Adoa would probably have taken over Earth before any reinforcements would show up. Not only that, the only light-speed ship ever made was completely obliterated. There's no way in Hell Preox or Rig could get out of this, unless the humans would get the hint that they were in insane danger.

Over the intercom, a voice came through in their glass containment. “Okay, uglies, shower time!” Little sprinklers erupted from the white, clean


Velouria


floor and sprayed directly upon Preox and Rig. Rig faced the water and tried to eat it like a dog, whereas Preox just stood there, not moving.

“Preox come play,” Rig said happily. “We're never getting out of here anyway so come play with me!!”

Preox looked at the annoying thing and shook his head. He was too angry to maul the Aziquet. Then, he heard people talking in the distance as the sprinkler continued to spray him. The voices belonged to Commander Derno and a few other agents, along with Moosey and Eugene. Oddly enough, Nathan was still nowhere to be seen. The sprinklers stopped, just in time when the group of humans approached the glass containment. Commander Derno looked at Preox, examining him and finally said, “Moosey, here, tells us you have a complaint? Let's hear it, little space man.” All, except Eugene, laughed like critical English men, waiting to hear more “complete nonsense” from Preox.

“Yes, I do have a complaint,” Preox replied. “You jack-knobs are in serious jeopardy.”

“Hehehehe, that's exactly what he was talking about last time! Through the camera!” Moosey laughed, followed by other outrageously obnoxious laughs. Commander Derno was the only one who kept his laughs in neutral.

“Was I talking to you?” Preox snapped, shooting a stern look at the moose. The agents laughed even harder, except Eugene.

“So, what's gonna happen in a matter of time?” Derno asked curiously.

“You mean 'any minute now?' The Adoa on their way here. I'm sure your little pip-squeak moose has told you enough, as far I know.”

Derno laughed. “Oh yes, he has. At first, we thought he was full of crap, as usual, but I guess not. You, however, are still out of your freakin' mind! You take forever to hang over from alcohol!” The agents laughed even harder. Preox could have sworn he felt a blood vessel pop because he was so angry; Rig rolled around in a big puddle of water. The Asid slammed his pale, green fists against the glass wall, making most of the agents jump from a sudden reaction. Preox was no longer hung over from the alcohol, either. through the echoes of the facility. The agents stopped laughing immediately, once some electrics were powering down.

“Get us the hell out of here now! I promise I won't tear you all a new one, once you do. Just give us our stuff: My Vambit, Rig's stem, and our armor,” Preox demanded.

Derno, still looking at Preox, commanded, “Agent Eugene7, get these two aliens out of here.”

“But sir, they're dangerous!” Moosey hollered, with a high-pitched squeal, as he loaded his pistol.

“Eugene, that's an order,” Derno said, ignoring the moose. Eugene nodded, pulled out his gun and pushed buttons on a key pad. Another explosion occurred, followed by gun shots, as the glass containment opened. Preox and Rig came out hurriedly.

“Where's your armory?” Preox said, with a stern look on his face.

“Straight down the hall to the right,” Derno replied. “We'll follow.”

There was no time to yell at Moosey for screwing up, once again, as the group booked it through the halls of the building. Blue lights blinked and a loud siren began blaring, indicating an intrusion. They made it into the armory and there was Preox's Vambit, Rig's lightning stem, and their armor displayed neatly on metallic pedestals. The humans watched the aliens put on their armor without hesitation. The armor looked completely brand new and clean, thanks to the human scientists’ tender care for their research. Rig laughed maniacally, as electricity sparked above his head.

“Oh it feels good to put this stuff back on!” Preox shouted. He unfolded his rifle and loaded it with ammo from his armor, as Rig began to charge

Velouria

















electricity with his awesome lightning stem.

“They must have a tracking on my Vambit. I need to switch on the invisibility device,” he switched it on and charged at the door, burst it open and looked both directions for hostiles. “They're here, alright. If you see a Probe, shoot them in the damn face.”

“That's how they die?” Eugene said quietly. He was far too frightened of combat.

Chapter 10


so was Eugene. Moosey had never been in combat like this before and Eugene had never been in combat at all! Commander Derno quickly took that commandment into account, once he eyed a nearby vending machine in the hallway. He and the other agents started pushing it over. The vending machine collapsed and they all took cover behind it. Moosey was laying down, facing up, as he saw flashes of purple fire-power zoom over their heads; he was about to crap all over the place because he was so scared. “Okay, on the count of three,” Preox whispered quietly. Moosey gulped, his grip tight on his pistol. “One... Two...”

Preox stood up quickly, covering his face with his forearm to prevent from getting shot in the head, and the turrets fired a massive amount of exotic bullet shells. Moosey stood up, along with the others and fired their weapons. The Probes immediately fired back, taking out one of the agents. The rest took cover, leaving Preox and Rig standing. hardly believe what was happening. He and Moosey were trembling as they looked at the dead agent. Derno set the dead human against the wall to give him more comfort… even though he was dead. That's what the Adoa does. They destroy everything before we even get the chance of thought to call in for reinforcements. That's what happened back on the planet Strom, RIG, we had to get the Misara Serum out of there.”

“What the hell is this 'Serum' thing anyway?” Moosey asked as they kept moving. “Your blue friend, here, kept babbling about it, if I'm correct for once.”

“It's a weapon of mass destruction,” Preox replied as they cut around a corner. A Probe was right behind them, firing its weapon, thus killing the other agent, right next to Eugene. Eugene flipped out and fired his pistol, taking out the Probe in an instant. He looked at gun with full adrenaline and reloaded it. “The Misara Serum is something the Adoa created to wipe us all out of their path. It's a weapon that can give you unique powers. Long story short, my race stole the Serum to dispose of it properly. Next thing you know, Rig and I end up here, while the Serum remains thousands of miles away.”

“Why couldn't you just destroy it when you had the chance?” Derno asked, blasting a Probe in the face with his shot gun.

a door they were approaching. The group came to a sudden halt. There were dead bodies everywhere: Agents, scientists, soldiers, all have fallen to the wrath of the Adoa Probes. The bomb imploded on the door, bursting it through its arch way and slamming againt duo of Probes. The Probes have disconnected the whole area. We gotta find some way to restore the power. We have to restore power as soon as possible. Preox's Vambit displayed another image, revealing the whole planet Earth. A little red dot sat on the west side of the United States, indicating the location of the Serum. There was also a little blue dot, indicating the location of Preox's location, which was far off toward the east side of the United States. They sure weren't in Washington anymore, like he and Rig were before. They were ultimately in the country of Canada and the Serum was in the united state of Oregon.

“I don't know?! Invite us for a cup of coffee, or something?!” Preox said sarcastically. Small explosions occurred from the damage left by the Probes, as fire cracked and increased in size. The place was beyond repair.
