“Keep that thing away from him, keep it away from alluh us,” Bxir ordered to Preox. Preox nodded and attached the container against his Vambit, as everyone else was concerned about Rig’s antennae which was currently erecting from his bald head. “We don’ know whut this Serum is actually stable of. We still need tah give time intah fully testin’ its capabilities. Keep it close tah yew now, Magnate, keep it clo--.” The entire party was startled when the ground began to shake, followed by an obnoxiously muffled sound of a distant explosion.


Kriket woke up almost immediately, all when she heard the sound of two Mazers conversing. “Did you see the latest footage, from the Probes that we recently sent to that planet?”

“Yeah. Dude, who the hell are those guys? A crazy ninja and a spikey, porcupine mutant?”

“Well, I can tell you one thing, Zjok is furious. Oh, and make sure you hide your milk, you know how much he hates that stuff.”

“Oh, I'll make sure my milk is safe,” the Mazer said, with confidence. Kriket was puzzled by the random statement about Zjok's hatred towards milk. How could anyone hate milk? Impossible. She heard the foot- steps of the two Mazers march off, and thus hearing Admiral Bxir whispering, “A ninja and a spikey, porcupine mutant? What dah hail?”

“Whatever they're on,” Drox said, assuming the Adoa was high on drugs, “I would be more than happy to have twice the amount. I’d rather do drugs to death, rather than be in this dump.”

Chapter 13


The four captive Asids hadn’t the slightest idea what the Adoa was up to. They also didn't know that they were getting closer to their unknown destination. Anyway, Zjok sat in his lucky lawn chair with a most unhappy expression slapped on his face. He sat in front of the great projector screen on the billboard, within the cockpit. He was watching Blue Lazer and Evil Nacho destroying his Probes, through the cameras of his robot minions and his rage couldn't help but over-flow. However, Zjok was not as angry once he saw the footage of the Probes’ Area 72 invasion. Although, once he saw Blue Lazer, all Adoa troops knew that a portion of hell broke loose.

An Adoa Mazer walked in, happening to be carrying milk, not knowing Zjok's hatred towards the white substance. “Hey, bros! I stopped by the market and picked up some milk. Two percent! So, now we shall eat our cereal in peace! Rejoice!” All the Mazers in the area stared at him, including the pilots that maintained the Elephant ship. The unlucky Mazer looked confused. “What's wrong, you guys?”

The Mazer felt the great force of Zjok snatching the gallon of milk from his hand, in rage, and slammed it against the floor. Milk splashed everywhere, causing one more Mazer to slip and fall on his ass. Zjok's blood was boiling, as he approached the Mazer who had brought the milk. The minion's hands were shaking, as he stood in his place, traumatized. “Clean up your mess, Jorfb.”

“Y-yes, s-sir! Right away, sir!” Jorfb replied with a salute.

Galg had walked in, once Jorfb began cleaning up the spilled milk.

“Are we there yet?!” Zjok yelled at the top of his lungs. “I wanna tear this 'Super Butt-Face' to shreds! How dare he drink my Misara Serum?!”

“No wonder the tracking signal of the container is still in the same destination,” Galg whispered to himself.

Zjok's eye twitched as he turned to face his companion. “What'd you say?! You think I suffer from too much masturbation?!!?”

Alarmed, “No!! No! Sir, I said--.”

“SSSHHHHH!!!!!”

Zjok stormed off to the middle of the cockpit with his arms crossed. “I want this Blue Lazer dead and brought to me. I want to use The Steamy Vampire B-105 gun against that little monk! Galg!”

Don't Bring Milk


The Chief Mazer replied, “Yes, Zjok?”

“Where is Vanish? He's the smarter one, amongst you others.”

Galg had no idea where this “Vanish” was. Vanish happened to be one of the smartest assets of the Adoa Military and happened to study the characteristics of foreign planets and their inhabitants, whether they were real or fiction.

“Bring me Vanish, that smart little clam,” Zjok ordered. “He and I need to have a little talk, before we arrive to planet Earth. When will that be, by the way?”

“Soon, sir, sooner than Christmas!”

Zjok grinned. “Good. Oh Galg, my lovely Galg, and the moment we reach Earth, it will be better than Christmas! In the meantime, I wish for our four prisoners to be scrubbing our toilets, once again. Yayvox, I'm pretty sure, has been having irritable bowel problems. He's been in there a lot, recently. I actually hope he's alright. In conclusion, the toilets need extra scrubbing.”

“Affirmatory,” Galg replied, giving a salute and marched off.

An Adoa guard walked up to the Asids' prison cell and opened it, using the identification of his teeth. “Alright, you ugly tarts, time to scrub the toilets once again.” Three Mazers had Bxir, Zitkir, Drox, and Kriket all at gun-point, with massive rifles in their hands.

“We just scrubbed the toilets 30 hours ago,” Drox whined.

The Mazer slapped him, as the Asids walked out of their cell. “Yeah, well we all poop.” The four prisoners were given buckets of dirty water and used sponges, once they were inside the washrooms. There were only about five other restrooms in the entire Elephant ship. Thousands of Mazers, Strikers, and a Zjok used all these restrooms. What a wonderful life. Bxir had gotten onto the floor and began scrubbing it with Kriket. Drox and Zitkir took care of the toilets. The three Adoa Mazers patrolled the restroom, which was pretty hilarious if others were to see it, let alone think about it. Bxir looked up, noticing Kriket was crying, before she was kicked in the side by one of the guards. “No crying in the lavatory! There's enough crying that goes on in here, am I right, Merk?”

A guard started laughing, “You got that right, Oink! Poor Yayvox.”

Chapter 13















The guards laughed even harder, as Kriket held onto her side, gasping for air. She was gradually getting weaker than the other Asids, especially from the lack of food. Bxir couldn't stand to see Kriket like this. Thankfully, He knew there was a way out of this hell-hole. They’ve been captive here long enough to know that the launch pods happened to be nearby, located on a further side of the Elephant, where escape was more probable. They just had to get their Vambits, weapons, and not to get their heads turned into a pile of slushy innards. Then, Bxir had come up with the most tolerable plan to get off the ship. First, all he had to do was finish scrubbing the floors, before it was his turn to scrub the massive toilets. Kriket looked up, looking at Bxir, the Adoa guards pacing back and forth. The Asids were bound to get shot at any moment, for the Adoas' fingers patiently rested on the triggers of their perpendicular rifles. Without warning, Bxir was kicked in the side, and so were Zitkir and Kriket.

in an awful mood today because of the whole commotion that's happening on that planet, 'Bertha,' or whatever.”

Ever since Grief had kicked him in the head, Drox could hardly see through his damaged eyes. He coughed weakly and neon-pink blood slowly oozed onto the disgusting floor. Kriket was lost in her head, not even noticing that she couldn't see Bxir any longer because of the stalls separating the two. If she was going to die now, she didn’t want to die staring a frequently used toilet. She needed to look at a fellow Asid, an Asid she was completely devoted to; she couldn't stop thinking about Preox. She thought about him, as she scrubbed the toilet with the dirty water, before she heard a large noise of flatulence. Then, she heard several grunts and a few counts of melee. She stuck her head out of the stall, seeing that Oink and Merk had their guns pointing in one direction. It was Admiral Bxir, holding an Adoa rifle to Grief's head.

Admiral Bxir’s breath stank like old fish crackers, the motivation was pure.

Chapter 13


Zitkir grinned with determination, as he picked up a massive Adoa rifle, and helped Drox on his. “Come on, Envoy, we're getting you out of here.”

“Be careful, Klondikes!” Bxir yelled. “This gone be a bumpy ride!”

The Asids were back in action, blasting away any Mazers that came in their path. They had made it back to the prison cells, where their Vambits were stored in a prisoner storage room, nearby. Zitkir fought off angry Adoa Mazers, as the others hastily strapped on and activated their Vambits.

“My Vambit is almost out of lemonade fuel,” Kriket said with frustration.

“Yew can have some o' mine when we leave,” Bxir replied, blasting a Mazer in the face, as they left the room.

Zitkir's Vambit, as bad ass as it was, unloaded an Efficient Asid Rifle (a.k.a. E.A.R.). “This is so much better than the Adoa's crap weapons,” as the Asid loaded his gun, shooting at his enemies.

Lava-made bullets hit Kriket in the chest. She screamed in pain, but her armor was able to stabilize the bullets from entering her skin. Although she screamed in agony, she also screamed in anger as she blasted rounds into her enemies' heads. They were almost to the launch pods, now and they were going make it.

It was, indeed, an Adoa Striker going berserk and he chased the four fugitives. Zitkir eventually ran out of ammo as he shot at the monster. Don't Bring Milk


almost out of lemonade fuel. Fortunately, Bxir had saved her by carrying her light-weight body. The pods were finally in plain sight, as the Adoa roared angrily, continuously firing their rounds. “Cover meh, Asids,” Bxir demanded. Drox, Zitkir, and Kriket fought off any approaching enemies with swift movements and combat skills. The launch pod opened and they immediately went in before any more of the Adoa could get to them.

They were out in the open void of space, getting shot at by a hoard of Adoa ships. The armada was massive and Bxir couldn't help but think about hopelessness when they were to reach their desired destination, sooner or later. Once they failed, they retreated.

“Why are they going back?” Kriket asked. The pod was increasing in speed. Wherever they were going, they were fortunately travelling much faster than that of the Adoa fleet.

Chapter 13


KRIKET, DROX, AND ZITFACE! This is no fun, I try so hard.”

He stood in front of the screen, replaying the footage of Blue Lazer over and over.

“An asshole,” Zjok replied, referring to Blue Lazer.

“No, no sir, that!” Galg leaned forward, pointing at the screen, pausing the raw footage. The paused feature showed Blue Lazer carrying someone with long streaks of blonde hair.

“What the hell?” Zjok said with fascination. He repeatedly tapped his finger on the screen, causing commanding the video to play in temporary slow motion. Zjok and Galg watched Blue Lazer put a blonde-haired female human into a trash can, after her face was fully exposed. Of course, the female human was Holly being rescued.

“Must be a damsel,” came a voice, making Zjok and Galg jolt with sudden attention. It was, who they call, Vanish. The smartest Mazer in the whole armada. “She’s pretty hot, I should say.”

“Oh yeah, I found Vanish,” Galg implied.

“Indeed, when I was in the middle of my oil treatment,” Vanish said with a smile. “What is it that you needed, master Zjok? Updated research? Cheats to the most recent video games?”

“Updated research,” Zjok surely said. “As you may have heard, this masked villain has destroyed the Probes sent to the destination, where the Misara Serum has been designated.”

“What about the other Probes sent to Preox and Rig's destination?”

“Nothing to worry about, Vanish,” Zjok replied, “according to the footage from their destination, it is a fact that their ways of transportation has been temporarily denied. We should have no worries about Preox and Rig, considering their distance from the Serum and lack of transport. The only thing we need to worry about the most is getting my formula back, and thus taking over the planet where it resides.”

Vanish nodded in agreement. “Good, Zjok. So, you have reason to believe that this 'Masked Villain' has obtained the Misara Serum?”

“Oui.”

“And you intend to use the Steamy Vampire B-105 upon the host?”

Don't Bring Milk


“Duh. Did you not see what the Steamy Vampire can do? It can cause all his blood to evaporate into the air and it is specially designed to suck in Drokensmur blood. My Serum will be saved.”

“Brilliant, sir!” Galg shouted.

“Indeed, sir. First off, this 'Earthly' culture is no more than primate satisfactory, according to our technological standards. For your 'Masked Villain,' I would say his age is at the preadolescence time period of his life. So, in order to figure out where we can fully attack him and retrieve the Serum, we must first invade his destination of education: A school, a university, etcetera.”

“Holy crap, write that down, Galg,” Zjok ordered. Chills ran down the Asid's spine. He was so excited to annihilate Blue Lazer.

“Secondarily, and most of all, scavenge the whole region where the Misara carrier is located. There’s no doubt in my mind that he will attempt to defend this region from our invasion. So, invade his learning facility and attack at a 15-mile radius within the Misara Serum’s designation.”

Chapter 13


Vanish. We shall use this information as a great source of advantage as we arrive to our destination. This goon has no clue who he is messing with. We will teach him the lesson he truly deserves! That is my Misara Serum and I shall have it!”

Area 72: The Next Week

Preox, calmly and casually, began to work on the old space-craft, which had currently been kept in Area 72. The ship was almost in perfect condition, considering its age. According to Preox, this space craft was known as a Retriever ship, formally used three-hundred years ago. Preox found it remarkable to find such a Retriever in such mint condition. He just had to make a few modifications, especially if he were to go up against modernized Adoa war-mongers. Preox distinctly heard an unpleasant scream of utter terror, causing him to look up with a most concerned expression. It was Moosey, frantically running like a complete maniac.

As Preox watched the disturbed moose approach him, Moosey hollered, “MR. PREOX! Big meteor thing in the sky! It coming down!” Preox didn't hesitate when he wielded his rifle, which was being kept safely on the back of his Vambit. More combat was surely yet to come, combat of which remembers, all before this current madness began…

“Kriket! Get the hell down now!” Preox demanded at the top of his lungs. His voice was raspy and barely heard, as he and the female Asid were under heavy fire. Asid soldiers were falling before them, dead, as they took cover behind massive debris, set by a recent explosion. Adoa fire-power soared over the two Asids' heads, as they kept their heads down. The area was cramped, almost impossible to escape without getting shredded to pieces. Preox and Kriket had no way of returning fire, in the hopes of wiping out the several Mazers that had the easier advantage of killing. Then, as all the Asid soldiers surrounding the two had been wiped out, the Mazers ceased fire. It

Don't Bring Milk


was quiet in the Asid facility; the Adoa had invaded the Asid base on Planet Strom and Preox was in possession of the Misara Serum (He also wore the Vambit he was more familiarized with, though it was brand new at the time.). The horrible stench of torn Asid flesh was beginning to fill the whole artillery room. The Mazers seemed to have taken notice of the two Asids who were both still alive, as the two of them blended in with the many dead bodies.








Preox and Kriket listened, not making any movements of any sort, to the Mazers laughing with pure evil slithering through their tongues. “Well damn, they is all dead now! Shall we rendezvous with Zjok's group now?” This was all occurring on the same day Preox became a Magnate, and when Rig was being tested for the symptoms of the Misara Serum.

“Well, duh. Come on, Mazers, let's go kick some more ass.” It was quiet, once again. Preox couldn't decipher if all the Mazers had left or not. The fact that Zjok's name was mentioned shocked him. He couldn’t believe that his best friend had betrayed his own species. As a Magnate, he was surely not expecting any of this to happen. Magnate Preox also knew many of the Asids who laid dead around him and Kriket. His head hurt, almost like a migraine, and he just couldn't bear to lay around here any longer. The cold, hard, ground was covered in neon-pink blood and the ultimately deceased.

Preox looked over at Kriket, her face was beaten, and she was much more out of shape than Preox was. She looked back at him, her eyes were innocent and full of fear. Preox counted his fingers, slowly, down from

Chapter 13


“three,” signaling Kriket when to jump out from their spot. He counted down to one and they both immediately rose to their feet, their guns pointed to where they could hear the Mazers speak. They were gone alright, except for one. He was immediately caught by surprise, cursing at the top of his lungs. Preox rushed over, with a most angry expression and grasped the Mazer by the throat, lifting him off his feet. Kriket stayed in her position, keeping her eye on the entrance, where the Mazers originally intruded.

Preox took the Mazer’s rifle away from him, keeping ahold of his neck. The Mazer gasped, as he desperately attempted to scream for help. He tried to hurt Preox with his free arms, but the Asid was quick enough to snap it into dislocation. The Mazer gave out a raspy scream of agony, Preox's anger heightened. Kriket couldn't help but watch Preox slowly torture his enemy, without making any sound... She kept her gun pointed to the doorway, but kept her eyes on the Preox. Preox grabbed hold of one of the Mazer's teeth with his free hand, tearing it straight from the root.

Grey blood oozed from the Mazer's mouth as he choked and gasped in pain. Preox dropped the large tooth, clattering on the ground, as he tore out another tooth. The Mazer's blood sprayed in Preox's face, but he didn't care, this Mazer was reaping what he sowed. Kriket felt indisposed as she heard, let alone watched, Preox tearing the Mazer's teeth right from their roots. All of the Mazer's teeth were gone, looking like a Muppet. Preox shut his mouth, causing the Mazer to slowly drown in his own blood.

Breathing heavily from anger and adrenaline, Preox kicked the Mazer's head in, once he was dead. Kriket saw flames in Preox's eyes, as she kept watch of the doorway. It was continuously silent, except for distant explosions and fire-power that was happening throughout the base’s interior and exterior. Preox wiped gray blood off his pale-green face and made his way across the room, where he found extra ammo cartridges. He motioned Kriket to follow him and ordered her to load her weapon. “It’s going to get even more hectic out there, Common Kriket, I suggest you prepare yourself. He faced Kriket, her face was still beautiful amongst the brutality, but well innocent, and defiantly said, “Let's see how these asshole like getting blasted by their own weaponry. Come on, Kriket, let's go find Rig, and have ourselves our very own slaughter festivity.”

Don't Bring Milk


Kriket was now worried. She felt as though Preox was turning into a war monster. She really couldn’t blame him, however, being the fact Preox knew Zjok well. Besides that point, the two Asids left the blood-infested room, holding hands, only to find Rig a few yards nearby, electrocuting every Mazer in his path with his electric stem.



























Preox shook his head to get back into focus of what was presently happening. He couldn’t just dwell in the past, not now, not at this moment. Anyway, he found it undeniably and incredibly annoying that the humans were seriously lacking in reinforcements and transport. At this point, if he were on planet Suzia, many Asid soldiers would have taken immediate action against the Adoa’s most recent attacks. The sun was setting, as many people

Chapter 13


gathered to see the astonishing site of an illuminating object, hurdling toward their destination. They all stood in awe and discussing in excitement. Preox, however, was ready for more fighting along with Rig, Commander Derno, and several United States marines. They watched the falling object hit dirt about an eighth of a mile out in the forest region surrounding Area 72, making Moosey squeal a bit.

“Okay, since I am an Asid and I know what has been going on these past few days,” Preox announced, “we will approach this object. By the looks of it, it looks like a mere launch pod from a space craft. Could be Adoa or Asid, I'm not exactly sure.”

“Hey!” Rig shouted. “I know stuff like this too!”

“Then what am I wearing, right now?” Preox immediately questioned, referring to his armor.

“A coat?”

Preox sighed. “Armor, you jackass! Okay, let's move out! Derno, Moosey, you two come with.”

Moosey gulped, as fear took over his mental state, and switched his pistol off the safety feature. Commander Derno did the same. Several marines followed as they jogged towards the object, which was sending purple smoke into the sky. Preox kept a stern look on his face, as Rig kept a ludicrously happy expression on his. Rig’s enthusiasm made the entire group look much less intimidating. They approached the fallen space craft, which created a forty-foot deep hole, with a forty-foot radius. The group surrounded the area, their guns pointed at the craft, ready for anything to “jump out.” It was quiet, except for the sound of fire rising from the massive object, as well as the static electricity cracking from Rig's dangerous antennae. Preox took the liberty to descend into the crash site to examine the ship. He gripped his rifle tightly once he saw Adoa symbols and colors on the launch pod. The purple smoke was thick and uncomfortable to wander through. He found the ship's front door, the latch being forcibly open from all the damage. He kept his rifle pointed on the doorway, as his free arm slowly opened the--

A female alien had her arms wrapped around Preox's neck, causing Preox to yell frantically and Moosey to nearly pass out. The rest of the surrounding group were ready to open fire at any given moment. The female

Don't Bring Milk


alien planted her lips against Preox's, making everything more questionable than it had to be. Their lips separated, giving Preox the chance to actually get a good look of who approached him in such puzzling way. It was Kriket. Her face was beaten, as usual, her armor was burnt and shredded, and her Vambit was heavily damaged. She didn't say a word, only saying “found you,” before she scoffed and walked away. Preox expected more kisses from Kriket, but he knew that Kriket was facing troubles dealing with this whole war conflict.

“Move outta mah way, Prex,” Admiral Bxir demanded as he crawled out of the launch pod. He stopped dead in his tracks, once he saw all the guns pointing at him. Zitkir was carrying an unconscious Drox over his shoulder as he pointed an Asid pistol at the humans.

“They're allies!” Preox shouted. “For tit's sake, lower your weapons! They're Asids! Zitkir, I order you to lower your weapon, now! What the hell happened!? Rig and I thought you guys were dead, once we left the planet Strom! Are there any others?! I thought I would never see any of you again, not since we were ultimately separated from that battle on Strom.”

Admiral Bxir and Zitkir stared at each other for a short moment, until the Asid approached Preox. He had a big gash on his temple, with neon pink blood oozing out. His Vambit was also heavily damaged, with the same facts applying to Zitkir and Drox. “It’s just us, Magnate. We is all dat is left, from the planet Strom. We survived tha battle an' we was evidently captured by tha Adoa, when they were scavengin' tha aftermath. Prex, Zjok is goin' crazier than ever. He has a new super weapon, other than the Misara Serum. It sucks yo’ blood an’ stuffs! They're also about ready to invade and annihilate anotha planet. It took us about a week to get here, bro. Thankfully, the Elephant ships, and other ships of the fleet, are much slower than tha launch pods. However, the Adoa could be at this planet soon. They know of yours and the Serum’s location.

Preox and looked at Kriket. She avoided him. “We were attacked from Probes just recently, Bxir, I agree with your statement. Derno, you gotta tell your human leader of what's going to happen. The Adoa is going to invade your bleedin' planet for that damn Blue Lazer, or whatever.”

“Wha'?” Admiral Bxir exclaimed.

Chapter 13


“Someone got to the Misara Serum, when Rig and I lost it, once we arrived to this planet in the light-speed ship. Zjok has gotten an efficient tracking device on it. Lord knows how long we’ve been overlooking that.”

“Damn, is tha light-speed ship okay?”

“No. We were gonna crash, so I ended up blowing it to bits so no enemies could trace us. However, and thanks to these incompetent humans, my Vambit was eventually traced from the Adoa. That’s how the Probes got here. Anyway, I propose--.”

“BOMB!” Rig yelled at the top of his lungs.

Everyone hesitated once Rig screamed, followed by the alarming sound of siren blaring from the crashed launch pod.

“Wail, shoot, I forgot the Adoa launch pods self-destruct, after they hit a surface,” Bxir explained. Preox, Kriket. Zitkir, and Bxir made their way out of the crater. The Asids, Rig, and everyone else sprinted as fast as they could before the Adoa exploded.

A deafening sound rang in everyone's ears, once the ship had finally self-destructed. They all stumbled and fell, as the ground shook, with flaming debris falling from the sky. They quickly got back up, continuing to run back to base. Once they were far away from the destruction, everyone was bunched up into a massive group.

“We gotta think of a plan to get the Adoa away from this planet! They can't even get the Serum, now that Blue Lazer has possessed it! The Serum just doesn’t SIMPLY RUN THROUGH HIS BLOOD LIKE A TYPICAL DISEASE! URRG!” Preox shouted, now carrying Kriket over his shoulder.

“I wouldn' be so sure, Prex,” Bxir replied. “Thanks to that newer super weapon that Zjok just recently invented, there is a way tah obtain tha Serum from Blue Lazer's body. It contains a special syringe that not only sucks tha life outta yeh, but it is specially make fur obtaining Drokensmur blood throughout the entire body structure. It will tear ‘im apart.”

Kriket was tending to Drox’s wound some more, as she watched Preox go into a complete rage fit. Preox noticed Rig looking at him, with a smile. Preox screamed at him, pointing his middle finger at Rig. “WHAT ARE YOU LOOKING, HUH?! YOU BRAINLESS VOID!” Everyone didn’t say a word, nor did anyone bother to help Preox to calm down. Not even Kriket.

Don't Bring Milk


“What an ass! Seriously, I hate him so much.”

“Gotta love betrayals, boy!” Bxir yelled, dodging some falling debris. “If the Adoa is gonna be here, we gots to formulate an army (Hopefully with this Blue Lazer character, also.). We has to act fast! But first, I must have some food. I is getting' sick of stale crackers.” Admiral Bxir excused himself, after a disgusting belch. Zitkir, who was now helping Kriket help Drox walk on his feet, passed by and pat Preox on the shoulder. Kriket said or did nothing. She looked at Preox for a second, an awkward second, and she looked away almost too dramatically. Preox sighed and finally folded his weapon, storing it within his armor.

“Now what?” Moosey asked.

“We need to get to Blue Lazer's location, as soon as possible. This planet is in more danger than I thought. We need all the transport we can get, to get the hell out of here. The Adoa sent Probes here because they were able to track Rig and I, and I wouldn’t be surprised if they had a lock on our position to send more. We must act quickly.”

“We’re in a remote forest in Quebec, Canada. We're not going to have enough transport within the next week,” Commander Derno added.

“Did I hesitate, Commander? You want the Adoa to rip you limb from limb, or drink a mocha with me after we annihilate them? Come on, Rig, we’re going to finish up that old Asid ship.”

“WOO! We goes to war! Me so excited.” Rig began fist pumping, as Preox started walking away from Commander Derno and Moosey. Now it was time for the good guys to use the Adoa’s slower pace to their advantage.

Meanwhile

Axyl was getting ready for school on a fine, blissful morning. Blue Lazer had been all over the news, ever since the Probe incident, which had happened in a suburban neighborhood a few days back. Even the fact that alien robots from outer space in the presence of humans was raging all over the media. Today was going to be, yet another, miserable day of high school education, however. Ever since Blue Lazer entered his life almost too unexpectedly and positively, Axyl had been doing better in school than he ever has. It was if his mysterious symptoms also developed him to become


Chapter 13


more efficient in terms of smartness. Besides that, Axyl had not heard from Holly very often, ever since the whole robot ordeal. He had seen her throughout school, but never really had the chance to talk to her. He was nervous. He has never been nervous around a girl before in his life. He was also often regretting the fact that he left Holly, who was injured at the time, in a random dumpster just to keep her from harm. Even Axyl himself thought that was pretty low. It was.

“You alright, sonny?” Jared's voice was heard, causing Axyl to look up from his bowl of cereal. He had been “zoning out.”

“Y-yeah. Erm—yeah I'm cool.”

“You're 'cool?'” Jared replied a smirk. “No, really, what is it? Is it work? School? The baseball districts? Look, I'm not mad about that, as long as the guy you socked ultimately deserved it. Which teammate was that, by the way? Your coach never really told me, just gave me a bunch of deep exhales from his frustration.”

Axyl took a spoonful of cereal and began to munch. “Cale. It was Cale Omnous.”














Jared's eyes widened, taking a sip of his coffee. “You knocked out ‘Sir Grabs-Balls-A lot?’ Ain't he your B.F.F.?”

“Not really, but yeah. Dad, I gotta go.”

“Alright, skippy, I'll be working until midnight again, selling more houses and what-not. So, help yourself to anything when you get home.”

Don't Bring Milk


Axyl nodded with a forced, faint smile and made his way out of the nice apartment complex. Just before he started up his truck in the parking garage, his phone began to blare off. It was Kyle. Axyl answered the phone.

“Yesss?”

“Bro, I never asked you, how did that thing go with Holly? I know that’s been over a week ago, but the high school play and Velouria have been keeping me occupied.”

Axyl gulped and sighed. “It was…okay.”

“She still givin' you that attitude, huh? I'm sorry, man. Maybe, it's just not meant to be, ya know?”

Axyl hated hearing those words. “Yeah, I guess. How are you and Velouria?”

“Pretty good! Going on a date after school tomorrow so that should be exhilarating. I wanna thank you, by the way, for helping me out.”

Axyl laughed. “Even though you pretty much did all the work! Twenty-five percent of me kicking ass, the other seventy-five percent of you doing all the sweet talk.”

Kyle giggled like a little girl, and he thanked Axyl sincerely. They both ended their little discussion and Axyl proceeded to make his way to Kingzing City High School. Today was wet and dreary, due to the weather's most recent rainstorm. Axyl was jammin' out to the radio, just waiting for the traffic light to turn green. He looked at his rear view mirror, adjusting the baseball cap he wears daily on his head. Once he adjusted his hat to a more comfortable size, it was already too late for him to notice a speeding vehicle headed toward the rear of his truck. “Oh.” Axyl’s body jerked forward, once the car slammed into the truck's tailgate, causing the airbag to burst from his steering wheel. Axyl moaned in pain, but could feel his body heal immediately. “W-what--?” The car behind him now had a demolished hood, which was revealed as it backed up and began to drive off. Axyl tore the airbag apart in total anger, as he watched that damn car drive away. “The hell, man! Oh, no he didn't!” Then, police sirens were heard from behind. Axyl turned his head and watched police cars drive past. By the looks of it, the KCPD was in pursuit of a heist. Axyl sighed at the top of his lungs in frustration. This looked like a job for, ugh, Blue Lazer.

Chapter 14: Afterwards










Stuart was a middle-aged, hardworking man. His husband, Kevin, was just the same. After getting together, both becoming the first married homosexual newlyweds in the history of their families', Stuart and Kevin decided to elope in the beautiful city of Kingzing. Their goal was to celebrate their honeymoon, with their fabulous wealth, which was yet to be obtained. How were they to become a wealthy couple, as anyone would ask? Well, they had to pull a few a strings, of course. On a positive note, Kevin was a pro bank robber, who was still in his prime. As for Stuart, heisting eventually became a new hobby of his, thanks to Kevin. However, Stuart was becoming a bit unstable because, at this moment, the two lovers happen to be in pursuit by the KCPD. For the pro heisters, this was pretty clumsy of them to be in pursuit by the police.

“Damn! Are you okay?” Kevin asked frantically, for he had accidentally slammed his car against the tailgate of Axyl’s Smithy’s truck. Stuart's forehead began to bleed, as he cried in agony. “Wh-why isn't there an airbag in the dashboard?!”

“It's been used before, Stu, I'm so sorry!” As Kevin drove, Stuart loaded

Chapter 14


a pistol, stuck his arm out the car window and began shooting at the law enforcement.

“Well, Kevin! Could you at least pay attention to what is on the street, whilst being chased by the local police?! I want my dream wardrobe, not a concussion!”

“I'm hurt, too!” Kevin yelled back frantically.

“Is your head bleeding, Kevin?!”

“No--.”

“Then shut up and drive, ‘cause they’re catching up to us!”

Kevin groaned angrily, as he floored the acceleration pedal. “You put the money in the trunk, right?”

Stuart laughed his ass off and replied sarcastically. “No, Kev, I left it back at the bank! I felt we could come back later, after we got a bite to eat!”

“I was just asking, Stu, jeez! You never know! Ugh, we gotta lose these cops, now. I'm getting all sweaty!”

Kevin reached in his jacket pocket, as an opposing bullet pierced through his side mirror (he shrieked frantically), and took out a grenade.

Stuart gasped with astonishment. “Oh, you sneaky devil!”

Kevin smiled, “Love you too, baby.” He tossed the grenade out the window, exploding once it hit the ground. Police cars flew and crashed, along with other vehicles, crashing into one another. The couple laughed, having watched the destruction they had caused.

“Oh, GAWD! We're so nasty!” Stuart laughed hysterically. “We're rich, Kevy-poo!” All was well for the exceptionally dangerous, gay couple. Well, for only about another minute.

“Looks like we lost 'em for good, Stu,” Kevin said happily.

“I’m thinking we could flee to Tahiti with his money!” That's when a clenched fist slammed through the roof of the car, causing the two to scream and Kevin to crash into a nearby tree. Kevin ignored the new pain, loaded his pistol, and hastily went out the car door. “Who the hail did that? Sersly?! I'm gonna blast anyone's head off, if y'all don't tell me!”

Nearby civilians put their hands in the air, with frightened looks on their faces. Stuart came out of the car also, holding a shot gun. “Hurry Kevin,


Afterwards


honey! Get the money, the car is done-for.”

“Good! Make it easier for me!” a voice coming from the tree, which Kevin had recently crashed into. The two robbers frantically shot into the branches of the tree, causing the civilians to panic.

“Come out, faggot!” Stuart yelled angrily, reloading his shotgun.

A fist slammed against Kevin's face, knocking him out instantly. Stuart turned to see Blue Lazer standing before him. Stuart squealed, trying to put more bullets in his shotgun. It was too late. Blue Lazer punched Stuart in the nose, knocking him out cold.

Blue Lazer opened the trunk of the couples' car, took out the duffle bags of stolen cash, and set them by the car. The civilians cheered for him and attempted to grab him and touch him, just like any person would do when in the presence of a famous super hero. Blue Lazer hovered in the air, so the civilians couldn't reach him. More cops had stopped by and gathered the bags of money, along with Kevin and Stuart. “Keep paying your bills, citizens! And... Yeah! Have a good day!” Before Blue Lazer flew off, he had noticed a dark green 1993 Buick that was waiting at the stop light. It was Kyle driving Holly to school. Holly's car was probably still damaged from Evil Nacho's hot, molten cheese. Kyle waved at Blue Lazer frantically. “OH MY GOD I LOVE YOU! YOU ROCK!!”

Blue Lazer found it frustrating that Holly didn't wave and scream, like a little girl, for his heroism. He did deserve it anyway, especially since he left her in a dumpster with an injured knee, “as a form of saving her life.” Blue Lazer felt really guilty about that. However, when he saw her give him a smile and a little wave, he was no longer disappointed. That was the first time Holly had ever smiled at Blue Lazer, but sadly, not at Axyl Smithy himself. Blue Lazer didn't care! He was too excited! Now, it was time for school.


Axyl walked across the school campus, feeling like he was actually going to make it to his first class on time. He felt rather peculiar about that. Ever since Blue Lazer became a part of his life, Axyl Smithy felt smarter, nicer, and responsible. Moral thoughts ran through his head, which seemed to give him a headache. He had other, more concerning, subjects to think about, other than how his moralities have become more positive than usual.

Chapter 14


















Subjects such as being attacked by random space robots!! Relating to that incident, ever since the confrontation with the Probes, Axyl couldn’t help but feel that more trouble was going to happen in the near future. That feeling quickly went away, like a raging primate with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder, when he saw Holly Ransfield walking with Kyle Manning. Kyle waved, as they both walked towards him. Holly had a stern look on her face, and was not as enthusiastic as Kyle. Axyl waved at them, with a smile, only to receive an unexpected sucker punch to the face. The force was so great, it had Axyl stumbling, followed by a loud moan of agony. Who just randomly socked Axyl in the face? It happened to be Agent Nathan12, in his full suit. Axyl recognized him immediately, though didn't say anything, as to knowing who he was; he remembered meeting the agent, shortly after he defeated the Probes. “What the hell, man?!”

“Oh, snap, I thought you were detonating a bomb of some sort,” Nathan replied. Nathan did not recognize Axyl’s appearance, for he was only familiar with the appearance of Blue Lazer. “You okay, sir?”

Axyl’s jaw popped back in place, as he nodded. “You got me good, man. Ow.” Students and school faculty stared in awe, especially Kyle and Holly. Holly looked like she was going to pee herself from laughing too hard.

Before Nathan could talk any further, the school principal intervened.

Afterwards


“Who are you and why are you obstructing my students?!”

“Sir, please don’t yell” Nathan snapped, “I simply obstructed ONE student, I did not obstruct OTHER STUDENTS! Anyway, I am... pfffttt--” Nathan was referring to Axyl “--this kid's--.”

“Axyl,” Axyl interrupted.

“—Axyl! Yes, I am Axyl’s kenpo instructor. I am simply testing Axyl if he is aware of what is to happen in the outside world! You never know who, or what, is out there and has the upmost motivation to beat you to death! Again, this was just a test of reflex. Also to conclude, Axyl here, FAILED!” Axyl made a frustrated look.

“Well, I can see that now,” the principal simply stated. “Now, I wish for you to leave this campus, and worry about Axyl’s reflexes another time.”

Nathan reached in his jacket pocket, took out his wallet, and showed him his identification. “I am also Agent Nathan12, of the A72A (Area 72 Agency), perhaps you've heard of us?” The principal shook his head awkwardly (Kyle and Holly stood nearby, watching the conversation continue). “Course you haven't! We're an agency that has to deal with paranormal activity of any sort. Activity such as, aliens, Bigfoot, the Loch Ness Monster, the planet Krypton, the last of the Time Lords, you name it. As you may have heard from the media, a massive battle went down between the local hero, Blue Lazer, and a handful of hostile robots, correct?”

“Why, yes,” the principal replied, “but that's all rubbish.”

“Conspiracy theorist! Love it!” Nathan shouted, pointing at the principal and laughed at his face. Students around the area looked at Nathan strangely, as they carried on with their day. “Anyway, Mr. Principal-Man, I have been designated to this high school campus to look for any suspicious activity, similar to every other area in the city; we do not want a pandemic like this to happen again. As for the robots, they are thought to be made from something that isn’t man-made. As you can see, on my identification card, that I do this for your country. Look at my picture, look at it, I look like poop. Anyway, I wish to proceed with my work.” The principal laughed and just walked off, believing Nathan was absolutely “bonkers.” He was, though truthful

Nathan face Axyl, observing him, and lowering his sunglasses. “You

Chapter 14


may carry on with your life, Axyl. Good day to you.”

Nathan was long gone, before Kyle and Holly had approached him. Kyle couldn’t help but laugh, as Holly herself was no longer laughing. “What was that all about? You okay?” Holly felt uncomfortable, especially now that he and Axyl were actually buddies.

“Yeah, couldn't be better,” Axyl said calmly. He looked at Holly, who tried her best to avoid eye contact with him. The school bell rang and the three students made their way to class. Axyl’s first class was Fitness, his obvious favorite; Kyle's first class was Advanced Drama, his favorite; Holly's first class was choir, her favorite. Axyl took the liberty to walk with the two, even though he knew Holly still didn't like to have him around. He seriously felt the need to talk to her, knowing she probably wouldn’t do the same. “So Kyle, my home slice, how're you and Velouria?! Eh, eh?!”

Kyle's cheeks began to blush and chuckled, like a prestigious western, well-fixed man from the 1800's. “Oh, we are, without a single doubt, just exemplary. Oh, yes, I do declare!” Holly busted up laughing, but stopped immediately, thanks to Axyl’s presence.

Axyl took all that awkwardness and replied with a normal chuckle, “That's good, bro! Happy for you two. Date tomorrow after school, right?!”

Kyle chuckled in his prestigious laugh, again. “Mmm, yes. It will be most exemplary.”

Axyl smiled. “That's great, Kyle.” Axyl caught Holly looking at him for a couple seconds, being simply astounded. He and Kyle were actually friends. “How’s the production coming along?” Axyl referred to the upcoming high school play. As said before, Kyle had mentioned about the play production of The Princess Bride to Holly and many other students alike. Although, Holly had no idea that Kyle had told Axyl about this as well. She was absolutely enthralled that the two got along so well.

“It’s awesome!” Kyle replied excitingly. “As a participant of my final high school play, it’s going very drawl, yet exciting. My theatre teacher, Paul Archibeque is more than excited to get the play going…”

Kyle continued to babble on, as the three students walked to his class. Holly was impressed with Axyl, and what she meant by that was that Axyl was “putting on a good show.” She knew exactly what was happening: The

Afterwards


idiot was love-struck and was trying to gain her trust. She wasn’t so sure, however, because Axyl did beat the hell out of his own best friend, Cale, just to save Kyle from being severely injured. This was too weird. Kyle walked into his class, where classmates were making strange, yet annoying, sounds (This is what anyone would expect when walking into a Drama class.). “See ya guys later!” The classroom door shut, leaving Axyl and Holly together.

“I better get to my class, too,” Holly said and began to walk away.

“Hashabalalbooba!” Axyl hollered at her, wanting her to stop. She did, but with the strangest expression on her face.

“Excuse me?”

“You gotta minute?”

“I suppose.”

“Soooo..?”

“Soooo..?”

Axyl was ready to pass out. “Can I just talk to you really quick?”

“I’ to go--.”

“So do I!” Axyl interrupted. “The want of really talking to someone, such as you, is like being in the extreme position of the need to go the bathroom! You just gotta let it go, you know? And, Holly, ‘I got to go,’ really badly.”

Holly smirked. “Okay. What do you want?”

“I-I wanted to know if you were alright? After all, I heard about you and that superhero guy.”

“Oh, uh, yeah. His name is Blue Lazer, by the way.”

Axyl played dumb. “Oh, that's his name! Well, I'm glad you're alright.”

“Yeah,” Holly's voice rising, “it was really intense, from what I saw that night. One moment a nacho chip pierces your leg, then you're suddenly dropped in a dumpster, after flying on a human being's backside. Blue Lazer saved me that night, even though he kinda just left me with an injured leg. I had to limp to the hospital. Thank God for insurance, right? That may have been one of the most interesting nights of my life, even though Blue Lazer was kind of a jerk about just leaving me there!”

“I'll bet,” Axyl replied, feeling guilty.

Chapter 14











“It was scary because I didn't know what was happening half of the time, you know?” she laughed a bit. “I also found it strange and hilarious, when that man, in the fancy suit, totally punched you in the face. He was one of the guys that arrived, shortly after Blue Lazer and that monster destroyed all those robot dudes. I can’t believe Greggory Stanley, from our band, was involved in that sort of thing.” Axyl pretended to react in shock. “I'm fine, now. Once I reached the hospital, I got some gnarly stitches on my left calf.” Holly rolled up one side of her pants to show a most disturbing scar, made by Evil Nacho himself. The sight almost gave Axyl a heart attack.

“Are you gonna be alright?” Axyl asked frantically, thinking of Holly's leg a hug, which would be completely unnecessary.

“Yeah, I'll be fine. Just a gnarly scar. It didn't even get infected, it just smelled like nachos for a while. You should have seen the dude that got me! He was about eight or nine feet tall! He also had these nacho chips growing all over his body! He was beastly. Oh! And Blue Lazer was pretty badass, beating the tar out of the monster, too. Don't even get me started with the robot things!”

“I think I've heard enough from the Kingzing City news team,” Axyl laughed. “Turns out there were citizens recording me—I mean Blue Lazer- on their mobile devices. The fight’s all on video!”

“Yeah! It was really crazy,” Holly laughed as Axyl felt warm inside. “Um, so I wanted to thank you for coming to my gig the other night. We raised about $500.”

“DAMN!” Axyl hollered. “That's amazing. Your outfit, by the way, was totally awesome.”

Afterwards


“With that leather jacket? That thing made me scorch up last night.”

“You looked great up there. The whole band did.”

Holly laughed and smiled, looking up at Axyl. He wanted to kiss her, but he knew she would beat the crap out of him in doing so.

“You've really changed, these past few weeks,” she said. “What is it? Is there something you’re trying to do?”

Axyl shook his head, shrugging his shoulders. “Not that I'm aware of. The only thing that's in my head is making amends with Kyle, after all I've put him through. Especially you, Holly. And I’m sorry.”

“It's 'cause you like me, huh?”

Axyl started laughing nervously. “Pffft! No! Course not!”

“During school, one day, you told me you liked me,” Holly said, crossing her arms. “Busted!”

“No I didn't,” Axyl insisted.

“Yes you did.”

“Ha, kay.”

Holly laughed. Axyl was actually keeping that easily-tempered tigress amused. “Well, I better get to class.”

“Oh man, same here. You want to talk later, maybe?”

Holly flinched when Axyl asked that question and took a deep breath. She took out a piece of paper and pen from her pocket and wrote on it. “Here. I can't believe I am doing this, but here's my phone number. I have another gig tonight with the group, so I can’t hang out. Hopefully Greggory, or Nathan, will make it. He’s been unavailable a lot, recently. Well, now that I know what he’s actually been up to, getting ahold of him shouldn’t be hard.”

She gave the small piece of paper to Axyl, who held it like he had just found the Holy Grail. He was about to shat all over the place. “Um—tah dah, okay! Well, good luck tonight.”

“Thanks. Hopefully that eight foot tall monster will stay the hell away from me. That's why I'm gonna be carpooling with Cody Gadomski, the bassist. My car is still in the shop. It’s going to take a while. Thank God for insurance! It really sucks, though. Oh, did you hear about that? That nacho dude damaged my car with hot melting cheese? Ridiculous right?! Chip-throwing douche.”

Chapter 14


“Well, I hope things really work out for you,” Axyl replied, stuffing the phone number in his pocket. “That sucks about your car.”

“Oh no, it's cool. I can just take the bus or get rides from people. I'm sorry about you and the baseball districts. Speaking of that, one more question, before we part.”

Axyl looked at her. “Yes?”

“When you beat up Cale, your best friend, just to protect Kyle and Velouria, was that worth getting suspended for the rest of your senior baseball season?”

Axyl nodded. “I know Cale. He will put a lot more harm on people than I ever could. Of course that was worth it. I gotta make it up to Kyle, somehow, right?”

Holly looked at him, not smiling. “Thank you, I'll see ya later.”

Axyl watched her walk down the hallway, catching a few glimpses of her butt. “See ya! Have a good one.” He turned the opposite direction, staring at Holly's phone number. He felt like he was going to wake up from a wonderful dream, any minute now. He began making cheerful, loud, and obnoxious noises of happiness, as he ran through the empty halls of the school.

















Just as he went around the corner, he saw Cale and Hayson Prent.

Afterwards


Axyl immediately stopped making the loud noises and carried one with his business. He could tell Cale and Hayson were staring him down. Axyl felt guilty, even though the Kingzing City Rattlesnakes won the district game on the very same night when Axyl was suspended for the rest of the season. Cale and Hayson were probably just as furious as Coach Sleeve was, however. They all passed each other, awkwardly, through the school hall, and Cale and Hayson walking the opposite direction. Axyl had made it out of the hallway and made his way to the gymnasium. He had to talk to Coach Sleeve, in his office, to actually discuss what happened over a week ago, in full detail.

He walked into the office, expecting to see Coach Sleeve. Someone else was sitting in the coach's chair. It was a girl, with perfectly platinum hair. She looked up at Axyl, “Can I help you?”

“Yeeeaaaahhh,” Axyl replied, “you're not Coach Sleeve, are you? Well, obviously, but where is he? You're his second substitute.”

The girl laughed. “Heaven's no, I'm not Coach Sleeve. I'm his niece, sadly. He asked me to cover this class before he comes to the school.”

“Um, why?”

“I'm not sure. I asked him why and he said he didn't want to see a certain student, due to some ‘circumstances’ from the baseball state districts the other night.”

Axyl felt horrible. Could his favorite coach be avoiding him? “Well, what are we going to do in class?”

“I don't care,” the girl laughed. “Play dodge ball or something. Teaching a fitness class has nothing to do with life, whatsoever, so knock yourself out in doing whatever the heck you want to do. But hey, if it gets me $150, I'll do it. You can never go wrong with money, but, I'd rather much be rehearsing in my band.”

“Damn, you play in a band, too?” Axyl asked surprised. “A friend of mine plays in a band called The Nasty Pen.”

“Someone from The Nasty Pen goes to this school?!” the girl shouted. “Who is it? Is it Cody Gadomski, the bassist?! He's such a babe!”

“Um, no, Holly Ransfield. She goes to this school.”

The girl looked disappointed. “Shiiieeettt. Well, that's cool, too. Holly's sure talented, but that Cody… MMM! Delicious.”

Chapter 14
















Axyl really couldn’t care less. “Well, that's nice. I'm Axyl, by the way.”

The girl shook his hand. “I'm Nikki. Nikki Wolf. Nice to meet you.”

Axyl walked out of the office with a farewell and, since Coach Sleeve was gone, and Nikki didn't care what the students did, Axyl decided it would be nice to shoot some hoops in the basketball court to think over some things. He went into the men's locker room to get his gym shorts on. He was alone in the locker room, once again; alone like he was when mysterious nacho cheese splattered onto the floor. He was no longer afraid of Evil Nacho, on another note. Axyl only saw him as a dangerous monster, with signs of schizophrenia. Axyl pulled down his pants, then he heard, “Oh! Don't mind me, I'm just here to watch. Did your mommy teach you how to wipe?”

Axyl squealed and turned around. It was Agent Nathan12! How the hell…?! He stood there in the corner of the locker room, chewing on bubblegum.

“What the hell, dude?!” Axyl shouted, suffering from a minor heart attack.

“Just snoopin' around. It is my job, you know,” Nathan replied. “Just to snoop, snoop, and snoop. Like Snoopy, the lovable, mischievous dog. Although, he doesn’t just snoop, he flies on his dog house. His dog house! Anyway, your name was Axyl, right?”

Axyl was stared at him blankly, with deep concern, and nodded. “Can you leave, now? You're seriously creepin'.”

Afterwards


“Oh, you'd love that, wouldn't you, Axyl?”

“Yes, I would love for you to leave. Would you like it if a random stranger, wearing a suit, just watched you change into your gym shorts?”

Nathan was silent. “Touché, I best be on my way. Oh, and one more thing, Axyl, I've got my eye on you.”

Nathan was gone, giving Axyl the impression that the A72A Agent knew that he was Blue Lazer. Great, Evil Nacho knew Blue Lazer's true identity and it was quite possible that Nathan knew the same. Might as well tell the whole world, right?

Nathan went as far away from the school campus as possible, as he dialed a phone number on his cellular device. He held it up to his ear, he casually walked on the sidewalk, with heavy traffic passing by. A lovely, welcoming voice was soon heard on Nathan's phone.

“This is Commander Derno of the Area 72 Agency, we are temporarily closed, due to certain circumstances. But, if you would like to make an appointment, please press 'one.' If you would like to report any paranormal activity, please press 'two.' Pizza delivery? Press ‘three.’”

“Derno, I know that's you!” Nathan shouted. “It's Agent Nathan12. I have a report about Kingzing City High School.”

“Oh? Whatchu got? I really gotta save people's phone numbers.”

“Uh, yeah, anyway! I haven't found anything, which had to do with space robots, out of the ordinary; especially no word from this ‘Evil Nacho’ character. However, I have reason to believe that this 'Blue Lazer' seems to be attending the high school, as a student. Commander Derno, sir, I think the powers of this Misara Serum have been embedded in the body of a normal teenager.”

“Give me that!” Preox's voice was heard, followed by the sound of a struggle, giving Nathan the notification that Preox had control over Derno's cellular device. “A teenager?! Agent Nathan, are you sure about this? Blue Lazer is a stupid, insignificant minor?!”

“I’m pretty sure, Mr. Alien.”

“Don't call me that, cat face. This human teenager must be pretty stupid and what makes you believe that he's what we and the Adoa are looking for?”

Chapter 14


“He’s got the same hair color, same body tone as Blue Lazer. Oh, and his name is Axyl. Agents are trained for identification of the body; like identifying if someone is in disguise or not. Say, for example, if we were assigned a mission to look for abominable snowman, we would be able to determine if it’s just a guy in a costume or if it’s the real deal. Anyway, I’ve applied these feats upon the teenager and his posture is more than plainly obvious that he’s actually Blue Lazer.”

Preox gasped. “Did you get a picture of him?”

Nathan blew a bubble with his gum. “I did. Took it just before I punched him in the face, for having the suspicion that he was gonna detonate a bomb. I wish I could send it, but it seems you are all lacking communication, except for Commander Derno’s old Dorkia phone. Seriously Commander, this is 2005, get a phone that can receive pictures!”

Before Preox could reply, another voice was heard. It was Rig. “LET ME TALK TO NATHAN! I MISS HEEEEMMM!”

“No! Rig, screw off!” Preox shouted. More sound of struggle was heard. It was the sound of Rig trying to grab the phone from Preox.

“Listen, Nathan, never mind the picture. This dolt won’t get off my leg.”

“Affirmative,” Nathan confirmed, “I am glad I could help.”

“GIMME THE PHOONNNE! NATHAN! I LOVE YOUR CO--.”

The phone conversation had ended, just before Rig said he loved Nathan's collar. The A72A was onto Axyl Smithy, for sure. Nathan dialed on his phone, once again, and started to call. The Agent was now walking through a remote zone of the city, where there were hardly any urban inhabitants. The streets were old and ruined, the buildings were sad and abandoned. Where was Nathan going? If he were observing any suspicious activity, a remote area seemed to be applicable by the A72A’s standards.

“Ass face?” came a voice through the phone.

“With French toast,” Nathan replied. The phrases were a part of a code greeting.

“Agent Nathan12,” said the voice, “how was today's inspection at the high school?”

“A little too well, Agent Jon43. We will discuss more, once I return to

Afterwards


our temporary safe house. This place is as sketchy as it is.”

“Sounds good,” Agent Jon43 replied. “Well, hurry back. We made a casserole.” Nathan stopped walking and paused. “YOU SERIOUS?! I'm on my way!!”

Nathan began to pick up the pace by going on a slow jog through the remote section of the city. He was sincerely craving a nice meal of casserole.


Meanwhile at Area 72.















Rig was feeling delightful, as he and Preox worked on the old Asid aircraft; the aircraft of which was surprisingly still intact, even after Adoa Probes attacked Area 72. Anyway, as for Rig's upbeat attitude, he decided to sing a song. “When I said, 'I needed yoouu.' You said you will always staaayy. It wasn't me who changed, but you, and now you've gone awaaayyy. Don't you see that now you've gone, and I'm left here on my ownn, and beg you to come hooommme? You don't have to say you love me, just be close at hand. You don't have to stay forever, I will understand. BELIEVE ME, BELIEVE ME! I CAN'T HELP BUT LOVE YOU--.”

Chapter 14


“Oh why can't the Adoa have better aim and just kill you already?!” Preox shouted, harshly. “Rig, I've put up with you long enough, especially since the day we fell into the ocean of this planet, weeks ago! For the love of GAWD, just please calm yourself?”

“Come on, Preox, he's just trying to have some fun,” Kriket came in with a smile.

“Yeah!” Rig snapped. “You is just jealous that I can sing Dusty Springfield better than you can!”

“Kriket, don't encourage him, please? I'm not in the mood.”

Kriket spat, “You're never in the mood.”

Preox looked up, shortly after connecting a few wires to one of the Retriever’s guns. He activated his jet-pack and flew towards her. “Oh, sister, I'm always in ‘the mood.’ You think this is all for fun? In case you hadn't noticed, Common Kriket, a massive Adoa fleet is on its way to this planet; the humans have zero intelligence of what's happening; we are but five Asids, with no reinforcements, and one stupid Aziquet!”

Kriket looked at Preox, his eyes were full of anguish. “Preox, I'm just messing with you. I’m clearly aware of what’s going on, but that doesn’t give me any reason to be a hard ass about everything.”

“And that's how the Adoa slaughtered so many Asids that day,” Preox replied. “We were too busy 'having fun' and we were almost annihilated by Zjok's unexpected attack. What makes you think we could have 'fun,' right now?”

Kriket was silent. She only wanted to enjoy herself with others, as much as she could. After all, she did just escape Zjok's Elephant ship of terror, let alone the fact that she saw Oil, Rav, Querznem, and Bunny die, right before her eyes. “I'm sorry, Magnate Preox.”

“Common Kriket, bug off the both of you, while I work on this ship. It will be one of the only chances we got to reach the Adoa, in time.”

“My, my,” Admiral Bxir said as he walked into the picture. He had a cookie in his hand, which caught Rig's eye.

“Where you get that?!” he shouted.

Bxir laughed, finishing his cookie. “In dah cafeteria, yeh spaz.”

Rig ran off, with Kriket slowly following. She was unhappy, indeed.

Afterwards


“So when wheel human reinforcements git here?” Bxir asked Preox.

“Within the next week, according to Derno, remember?” Preox replied. “This is ridiculous. The Adoa Probes attacked a few days ago, and your escape pod only just crash-landed here. The Adoa must be close, depending on their speed. They must be planning how they’re going to invade the planet, as we speak.”

“Got dat right, Magnate,” Bxir said, taking a bite of his cookie. “I've heard so much, comin' from Adoa Mazers, as I scrubbed their rest areas. I sure hope we can git to Blue Lazer, before thay do.”












“I think it's nothing to worry about,” Preox replied immediately. “We will get there in time. If not, I'm pretty sure that super human can slaughter the hell out of the Adoa, with the deadly symptoms of the Misara Serum, of course.”

“I wudn' be so sure,” Admiral Bxir said with confidence. “Tha fleet is substantial. They’re familiar with these symptoms. They even have weapons in dealing with that matter. Blue Lazer will need help. Also, Zjok’ army is massive, much more massive than it has bin.”

Preox closed his eyes and took a deep breath. “Don't remind me that our enemy, the enemy we've been at war with for several years with a massive number, is about to invade this planet.”

“Well, this ain't all abou' ‘fun,’ right? Yew said that yourself tew the one you once loved. Am I right?”

Preox paused, thinking of Kriket. “I still love her, you know that. It's something that I cannot concentrate on right now.”

Chapter 14


“Well she has, boy,” Bxir snapped. “She bin thinkin' abou' yew ever since tha Adoa attacked tha planet Strom. She wonderin' if yew and Rig left tha planet wit' tha Serum just to abandon her, especially us. That bein’ me, Zitkir, Drox, and the others who culdn’ make it. And I know yew dun it fer tha war, but she was torn apart after you two got separated and yew left! If yew still luv her, Prex, then start showin' it. She needs someone to look up to, she’s still an inexperienced soldier; not as experienced as you and I. Accordin’ to her, you seem tah make dah days go better when you is around’. And I totally mean this in an offensive way, but seriously, she’s crawling for you and you know that no other female would.”

Preox sighed. “Affirmative, Admiral.”

“Gewd. In tha mean time, try talkin' to Kriket, will yeh?”

Preox nodded. He had to admit, he did miss the hell out of Kriket. Over the past several years of his first war with Zjok and his Adoa Army, Preox had become more angry and moody, along with becoming more emotionally detached. He really needed to focus on what makes him happy. Admiral Bxir was one-thousand percent right about no other female falling for someone by the likes of Preox. Hell, Preox could admit that himself. Whether Preox had a pole up his ass, or wanted to play the serious game, no other Asid girl would be attracted to him. Bxir’s harsh words made the Magnate realized how much of an ass, a lucky ass at that, he was really becoming. However, for those who knew Preox and his mode of portraying his personality, no one could really blame him for always having a temper. Kriket was completely devoted to Preox, like a desperate school girl, anxiously waiting for him to turn his stupid fat head to her attention. After becoming ultimately separated from each other, during the battle of the planet Strom, Kriket had hoped for Preox’s safety more than her own. Preox was paying too much attention to the war, not towards what made him truly happy. In doing so, this was slowly turning Preox into a raging war-monger. Kriket was not only concerned for Preox and his temper, she also did not want him to go completely overboard, which was as similar as Zjok’s story when he betrayed the Asids. What Kriket really wanted to do for Preox was to just hold him closely and tell him everything was going to be alright. Preox would agree, of course, but there was more worry in him than everyone else.

Afterwards
















Derno's office was still on fire, which disappointed him. He took a fire extinguisher and sprayed out the remaining flames, which had lasted for a few days. His desk was split in two, papers and files were nothing but ashes, or just loose scraps of trash, and were roughly scattered all over the floor. Commander Derno set the extinguisher down and observed the room, taking slow steps.

“I worked hard on this office,” he said to himself. “Lots of decorating had been done.” He took notice a picture, in a broken frame, which revealed him and a girl together. He picked it up, glancing at the photo. “And those stupid robots had to ruin it all. Oh, how I miss you, Linda.”

“Captain!” came a voice, causing Derno to jump. It was a marine, holding his rifle and everything. “Someone has been looking for you.” Then, there was Agent Moosey17, his face with a blank expression. The marine was gone, once the talking moose approached Derno's office. He had certainly been through enough, which was through intense combat and being put down by everyone's harsh words. Nobody really listened to Moosey, especially when he had something important to say, even when he was actually right.

“What is it, Agent Moosey17?” Derno asked.


Chapter 14


“Just wanted to talk, Captain,” the moose replied. He was emotionless. “It's just that-- do you think it's the end of the world?”

Derno looked back at the picture he was holding, muttering “Linda” under his breath.

“'Kinda?'” Moosey thought he heard. “I sure hope it's not. I mean, we just made a discovery of many generations to come. A scary discovery.”

“That's not what I said, but I get what you're saying. It's not gonna be the end of the world, Agent. We're just in for a bumpy ride, is all.”

“When things get bumpy, I tend to throw up.”

Derno sighed. “Moosey, please don't puke on my floor.”

Moosey raised an eyebrow. “But, it's all burnt and torn--.”

“I don't wanna watch you throw up. Can you do it somewhere else?”

Moosey groaned. “Ugh, I'll try!”

Derno watched Moosey wander off, walking on his four legs. I guess he really had to throw up, Derno thought to himself. He took another glance at the picture and quickly stuffed it in his pocket. His phone began to ring, once he had set the picture aside. He took it out and answered. “Hello?”

“Captain!” came Nathan's voice. There was heavy gun-fire in the background, followed by a few screams. “There's another one of those robot things, here! Must have missed out on the fun, from earlier, and now he’s pissed!” There was a loud blast of a Probe's laser, followed by the groan of an agent getting shot down.

“Damn! Everything alright, Agent Nathan12?!”

“Not at all!” Nathan hollered. “Agent Randy39 is down. This robot is really starting to--.” The phone had hung up, Nathan was gone. Derno's stomach sunk and his back shivered. Could that have been the end of Agent Nathan12?

“What was that?” Moosey asked, returning into Commander Derno's office. Derno immediately turned to face the curious animal.

“Nothing, it was nothing. Some teenager making prank calls.”

Moosey spat “What a fart,” and left the room again. Commander Derno couldn't do anything to save Nathan. Area 72 was in Quebec, Canada and Nathan's location was in Kingzing City, Oregon. If Moosey knew about Nathan, he'd probably wail like a baby. Agent Moosey17 and Agent

Afterwards


Nathan12 have been through everything together, starting from their first mission, as they both attempted to fish out the Loch Ness monster.

Commander Derno managed to keep his cool and make his way out of his office, never to return, again.

Meanwhile, in an abandoned warehouse.















“You shot my cell phone!” Nathan yelled at the top of his lungs, as he took cover, behind a gross couch. “I hate having to get a new one!”

“Good,” the Probe replied. A72A Agents fired at the alien robot, barely causing any damage to it. “It's time you are rid of the information known!”

“Well, that's not fair, we don't even know much!” Agent Jon43 hollered.

“To me it's fair,” the Probe replied, shooting its purple laser. Nathan took several deep breaths, as he inserted another magazine of ammo in his pistol. He heard the Probe had finally stop shooting, which made him a bit puzzled. It was dead silent, a little too silent.

“Um, Nathan?” came a voice.

“Yes, Agent Sarah22?”

“Take a look at this.”

Nathan arose to his feet, where he could see three dead agents surrounding the Probe. The Probe stood still, not moving and inch. The agents pointed their guns at the robot, making no hesitant movement. The Probe twitched its head and began to talk very slowly. Its voice was different, let alone clearer, than its original.

Chapter 14

“You think you know everything?” the Probe said in Zjok's voice.

The agents stood there, dumbfounded. Nathan soon realized that someone else was in absolute control of the Probes.

“We certainly know a lot,” Zjok's voice continued, “especially when we can 'see.'”

“What?” Sarah blinked.

Zjok grew frustrated. “We have cameras in our robots, so we can see everything and I just wanted to let you know that, stupid humans.

Sarah started laughing. Zjok made the Probe blast Sarah in the chest, sending her across the room. Nathan took a shot at the Probe's face-camera, destroying it instantly.

“Jeeezz,” Jon exclaimed. Agent Sarah22 was gone, after Nathan checked for a pulse.

“Jon, do you have your cell on you?” Nathan asked.

Jon was shaking, traumatized. “N-no. Moosey ate before we left.”

Nathan sighed. “Well, whoever that was, he only gave us nothing but a warning. I don't like this one bit. Jon, keep an eye out for local media or law enforcement, I'm gonna look for a cell phone from the deceased agents, here. Jon nodded, taking a step outside the back door of the old, abandoned warehouse. There were destroyed software near where Jon was standing, software that was used for spying on Axyl Smithy or any other suspicious activity. The Probe that was firing purple lasers earlier, seemed to have risen from the ground, according to the newly dug hole in the center of the interior of the warehouse.

“These bastards just love to surprise us.” Nathan wasn't lucky enough to find a working cell phone from any of the dead A72A agents. All phones were damaged from the little incident that had just occurred. This was all over-whelming for Nathan, for he had never put up with anything this serious in his whole life, even when he had been with the Area 72 Agency for a number of years.

“Everything looks clear to me,” Jon announced. “What do we do now?”

“Clean up this mess,” Nathan replied. “Get rid of everything. We don't want another one of those things tracking us down. And we certainly don't want any panic in the city if this gruesome scene were discovered. Help me?”

Afterwards


“What're we gonna do with them?” Jon asked, referring to the dead.

“Dump the Probe and the damaged software in the waterfront, nearby. As for the bodies, eat them.”

“What?!”

Nathan laughed. “I'm just kidding'! I actually have no clue what we're gonna do with the bodies. We're gonna have to bury them, or something. Come on Jon, help me out here. This robot must be, at least, over five-hundred pounds, in case you hadn't noticed.”





































Part 4:

New Discoveries



















Chapter 15: NO WAY!










City lights were now illuminating the streets of Kingzing City, after the sun had begun to set over the distant horizon. Axyl couldn’t help but have the pleasure to experience the calm weather on the balcony of his father's apartment. He leaned back against the balcony, observing the beautiful sunset over the city, and neighboring beach.

“Isn't that a great view?” Jared asked, who was now standing beside Axyl. “Got it at the best bargained price any resident could ask for.”

“You scored,” Axyl replied with a smile. “You scored big time.”

Jared laughed. “What's with you?”

“I'm sorry?”

“You've changed, buddy-boy. A couple weeks ago, you're a hormonal brat. Couple weeks later, you're a kid with moral values. Is life finally kicking you in the ass, son?”

Chapter 15


Axyl shook his head. “Sorta, I just learned to appreciate things more.”

“Oh yeah? Like what?”

“Well, you work hard to keep this place; to pay the bills; to keep your car and my car (I will pay for the damages on my tailgate, by the way). You even busted your butt to raise me for years, especially now that Mom is probably in a camp trailer with some white-trash loser in Mississippi.”

Jared chuckled, smiled, and put his hand on Axyl’s shoulder. “I think raisin' you was a good worth of time, then. Come on, I gotchu a little surprise.”

“Aw, Dad, it's not Valentine's day, yet,” Axyl laughed as he followed his dad back into the apartment.

“Watch it, zippy.”

They both walked into the kitchen and there was a clean plate of steak, waiting for Axyl, on the dining room table. Axyl gasped with a low, frog-like mutter. “Yew got meh STEEAAAKK?! Oh, Father!”

“It’s steak night,” Jared replied with a smirk. “They are the best steaks I could find. They’re so rich, they might as well be illegal.” Axyl made another disturbing exclamation.

“Duuuudde!”

Axyl gave Jared a big hug, and he felt like he was celebrating his 19th birthday! Axyl had never felt so good about himself, before. For the first time in his life, he felt like he was a good kid. Even before he was a total jerk, Axyl had always thought of himself in that way, but this time it was with a different emphasis. He had never felt so grand, so pure, other than the feeling he had after having sexual intercourse for the first time (That's another story). He immediately thought of Holly, whom he had hoped to—OH YEAH! Axyl had Holly's phone number, now! He took it out of his pocket and waved it in the air, in front of Jared, laughing.

“Hey, there you go! You got a girl number! The old fashioned way, too, rather than asking for it online. Way to go, son! Ask her out, over the phone, you totally should!” Axyl nodded, with the most ridiculous grin spread across his face. Before he could even think for another moment, Axyl could have sworn he could smell Holly’s strawberry perfume lingering on the small

NO WAY!


piece of paper. It was “magnifi-scent.”

“But, for the love of God,” Jared finishing, “don't take a girl out wearing that expression.” He smacked his son's cheek and walked off into the kitchen.

“Aren't you eating anything?” Axyl asked.

Jared spat, as he took out his steak of the oven. “Duh! It's a special night!”

Axyl laughed, sitting down at the dining room table, taking the fork and steak knife beside his plate. Jared took a seat across from his son and did the same. “How's everything, besides school?”

Axyl already had a good portion of steak wolfed down his mouth, he was barely able to talk. “Wellf. I’vf been finking aboutf somewun.”

Jared smirked. “Oh, yeah? Is she the one who gave you that number?”

Axyl smiled, is cheeks full of food. “Her name's Holleef. She's different.”

“'Different,' eh? How so?

Axyl swallowed his steak. “She plays guitar, she’s independent, she’s cool, and she hates me.”

“That's new,” Jared said sarcastically.

Axyl gave him a look and took another bite of his steak, slightly smacking his delicious dinner. “I thought you were supposed to be nice, tonight?”

Jared laughed. “I know, I know. Okay, keep going.”

“Merrr... I'd rather not, Dad, thanks.”

“Oh come on! Don't be a pansy! At this point, I thought you would be used to my remarks by now, because you’re always doing them too!”

“It's fine, Dad. She's just another girl, who doesn’t like me, alright?”

Jared swallowed more cereal. “Alright, Harold Hormone.”

Axyl ignored that remark. “How's work?”

“Well, if you must know, it's certainly a lot better than being an elevator technician; I like being a real estate agent a lot better.

Axyl laughed and took another bite of his steak. He looked outside, gazing at the beautiful city, and he could see a billboard with Blue Lazer on it striking a pose.

Chapter 15


“That dude,” Jared said, referring to Blue Lazer, “is actually not all that bad. Did you hear about him taking down those two homosexual bank robbers? Heavy stuff. No one knows how Blue Lazer does it.”

Axyl grunted. “Ahh, maybe he has super powers?”

“Watch it, bozo,” Jared replied, pointing his finger.

Axyl laughed some more. “I was there when it happened, Dad. That’s the main reason why my tailgate is all jacked up.”

“Damn, you alright?”














“Yeah, I’m fine, I’m not in the hospital, am I? It was very startling, that’s all.”

“Well good, that means I don’t have to pay for any more bills. You got that tailgate covered, right? You have money.”

Axyl really wished he wasn’t paying for his car repairs, though he had plenty of money to splurge, thanks to his job at the supermarket. He was used to Jared taking care of everything. However, he did feel the need to be financially secure, for once Axyl nodded and drank his glass of milk, which was placed next to his dinner.


The Next Day!

It was a lovely Thursday morning in Kingzing City. Men and women were ready to conquer the day, as others were preparing to get their griping

NO WAY


children ready for school, in a most positive attitude. Not really. And even so, the homeless were feeling the confidence that they will earn a decent amount of change, from the generosity of others! Thursday was going to be a great day for everyone, including Kyle! He was in a particularly fine mood, and that was not just because he had a new, smoking hot girlfriend, but his public performance in Princess Bride was about to arrive! Kyle had woken up early, gathering announcement posters to post all over the school!




























Chapter 15


He would hang posters on doors, walls, in the bathrooms, on the urinals, the works. This was Kyle’s final high school play and he wanted to make it very special. Although, other cast members of the production went around to hang up posters, also, but Kyle took this more seriously than they did.
