Kyle had just hung up a poster in the school cafeteria, when his loving girlfriend approached him with a bright smile on her face. Now that Velouria was here, that could only mean that classes were about to begin.

“Hey cutie,” Velouria said sweetly, giving a tender kiss on Kyle’s cheek. Kyle started blushing and exclaimed like a penguin. Velouria laughed, as she gave him a gentle hug. “How long have you been here?”

Kyle, as energetic as he could, replied, “I’ve been here since six in the morning! I’m so excited for this play! The cast, Archibeque (the director), and especially me (not meaning to brag or anything) have put so much work into it. You better come! First performance is tomorrow at 7pm!”

Velouria giggled. She was always giggling. “Of course I’m coming! I just can’t come on that first night, sweetheart.”

Kyle began to pout and began to speak in French for no apparent reason. “Pour quoi?! C'est la première nuit, Velouria!”

Velouria giggled. “I didn’t know you spoke French. And I know it’s the first night of the play, but I have to babysit my cousins. I will be at the next one, for sure. I promise. Tu es un drôle de garçon.”

She kissed Kyle on the lips, making him smile. “Yes, but I’m your funny boy. No matter, there’s a Saturday matinee afterward.”

“You’re such a dork.”

“Yes, but I am also your dork.”

Velouria giggled again, as they kissed. How cute.

“Yeah,” came a voice. It was Cale, walking by. “He can be dork. As in, a whale’s penis. Ha!” Cale snorted up laughter, as the couple stared at him, in disgust. They saw Holly walk into the cafeteria, in Cale’s direction. Her face was emotionless, as usual. Cale, as stupid as ever, decided it would be fun to pick on her, also.

She began walking up to Kyle and Velouria, as Cale solemnly said, “Hey, and Ransfield, you lookin’ good. Wearing the appropriate amount of makeup, I see?”

NO WAY!






















Holly sarcastically giggled and completely ignored the buffoon. She approached Kyle and Velouria, as many other students came pouring into the cafeteria.

“Hey, lovebirds,” Holly greeted with a smile. Kyle carried his posters around, as the trio went to get some of the cheap breakfast their school had to offer. They soon found themselves sitting in a tolerable area to sit and hang out at.

“Did you see the posters?” Kyle asked, full of glee.

“What posters?” Holly replied, pealing an orange.

Kyle scoffed and took a bite out of an apple. “The play?! MY last play?! The play of which I am in?!”

“You guys are done with that already?” Holly asked, shocked.

Kyle shrugged. “It’s only been about a month and a half since I last talked to you about it. We’ve been working on this since January!”

“And you expect me to remember that? Just like you remember your lines, within a month?” Holly laughed, as she struggled to peal her orange.

Kyle rolled his eyes. “Well, will you be there? In the theatre on Friday? At 7pm?! Come on, there has to be someone I know to attend that night.”

Chapter 15


Holly sighed, as the three of them sat down at a table. “I have planned something for tomorrow night.”

Kyle whined out loud, along with Velouria giggling. “What?! You can’t come either?! At least the Saturday matinee, please?! You and Velouria are, like, my only friends ever. Ever!”

“I have band rehearsal for eight hours every Saturday, Kyle.”

Velouria took a bite of her cinnamon roll. “What about Axyl, can’t he make it?”

“OF COURSE! Axyl! Where is he?!”















Holly shrugged. “I was about to ask you the same thing.” Kyle and Velouria both reacted suddenly, then looked at each other.

Kyle, with a raised eyebrow, felt concerned. “Uh, you okay Holly? Is there something wrong with your orange?” Holly shook her head. “Oh, wow. That’s sooo surprising.”

Holly laughed. “Kyle, stop. I mean it. Have you heard from Axyl recently, Velouria? I’ve been needing to talk to him.”

Kyle choked on his food. “What?! Did you just say ‘need?!’ You need to talk to Axyl?! I mean, I love the guy, don’t get me wrong, but Holly this is Axyl Smithy you’re talking about! You hate him, remember?”

Holly nodded. “I know.”

NO WAY!


“I haven’t talked to him since the baseball districts and that was about a month ago,” Velouria answered, with a shrug. “I’m sorry, Holly. I haven’t heard from him at all, really.”

Holly thought for a bit. Where could Axyl possibly be and why does Holly “need” to talk to him?

“This is weird,” Kyle said, after a few seconds, taking a sip of his chocolate milk. “Are you planning on killing him?”

“It’s nothing, Kyle!” Holly said, raising her voice. “Forget I brought it up. And I’m sorry I can’t make it to your play. I promise, I will be there the next time it shows, after the matinee.”

“The next show starts at the same time on Saturday,” Kyle replied. “Why can’t you just skip rehearsal? This is my last play!”

“The Nasty Pen is something I get paid for, Kyle. I’m sorry.”

Kyle frowned and he was so excited for the play tonight. “Not even my parents can make it! They both went on a business trip for the rest of the week.”

Velouria gave him a kiss on the cheek. “Kyle, I’m sorry. I’ll be there on Saturday night, after the matinee, I promise. Babysitting sucks.”

Kyle smiled. “Thanks, hun.”

Holly smiled, but at the lovely couple, before she saw a familiar face in the distance. It was Axyl, walking by himself. He was wrapping his up his headphones and inserting them in his backpack when Holly excused herself from the table. Kyle and Velouria watched Holly approach Axyl, both filled with deep concern. Holly tapped Axyl on the shoulder, causing him to immediately turn around, and jolt with surprise. Kyle and Velouria laughed out loud. “He’s so nervous,” Velouria said with a giggle.

“Look at him,” Kyle said, “you can see him shaking from here! He’s about to faint. Okay, Holly’s talking to him. Axyl’s sweating, I can tell. She’s still talking, what a blabber-mouth! Okay now Axyl’s talking, with a few nods. Huh, this is interesting.”

“I wonder what they’re talking about,” Velouria replied, holding Kyle’s hand.

“Okay, now Holly’s leaving for class, I guess. And now Axyl is… just standing there like he had just seen a ghost.”

Chapter 15


“What just happened?” Velouria asked. Axyl was, indeed, standing in one spot, his face as blank as a white wall.

“I dunno,” Kyle replied, “let’s find out.”

The couple hollered for Axyl’s name, as they waved their arms frantically. Axyl looked up, saw the two, and hastily walked to their table. He sat down, across from Velouria and Kyle, wearing the same expression on his face. He looked like he had just seen something horrific, if not the glaring eyes of Holly Ransfield.

“Axyl?” Kyle said, feeling worrisome. “You okay, bro?”

“What happened with you and Holly, just now?” Velouria added.

“Nothing too bad,” Axyl responded, with a sigh. “She just asked me a question, I answered, and she continued with her day.”

Kyle was not convinced. “Then why are you as white as my bed sheets? Are you okay?” Axyl looked down, his face was not visible. He looked like he was desperately refraining to start sobbing. “What happened?! Stop doing that!”

“Are you okay, Axyl?” Velouria repeated.

Axyl looked up at the two of them, not crying. He faintly smiled, saying, “She asked me out.”

And at that moment, when Velouria was drinking her chocolate milk, spitting all of it from her mouth, all over Kyle’s shocked face. Kyle calmly wiped the milk off of Velouria’s lips, and then proceeded to wipe the milk off his face.

“Are you serious?” Kyle asked, lowering his voice. “Dude. What the hell did you do to get Holly Ransfield to do that?!”

Axyl started laughing like a mental patient. “That’s the thing! I did nothing! She walked up to me, asked me out, and left.”

“What was your answer?” Velouria asked, blankly.

“’YES!’ DUH!” both Kyle and Axyl answered.

“Jeez, sorry. Just checking. That’s so awesome, Axyl!”

“I thought she hated me,” Axyl said, with pure happiness.

“Me too, my brother,” Kyle replied. “This is wayyy better than anything else, other than the play. Oh, go to my play, please! Friday at seven!”

Axyl was so excited, yet confused. Exactly, why did Holly ask Axyl?

NO WAY!


out to a casual date? “I can’t go. Holly planned for the date to be tomorrow night.”

Kyle squealed happily, so did Axyl, and he was not upset that Axyl couldn’t make it. “So that’s why Holly can’t go tomorrow! AHH! Will you be there the next day?! During the matinee? Both Holly and Velouria can’t make it on that day either.”

“I’ll be there, bro, I promise.” The two of them squealed like little school girls, laughing happily together. Velouria couldn’t help but laugh at the two goofballs.

“Where are you two going for your hot date, by the way?!” Kyle asked, his smile growing.

Axyl responded, as if he were just dreaming. “The Dookoran.”

Velouria and Kyle’s eyes widened.

“Th-the Dookoran?” Kyle stuttered. It was the first time he had stuttered in a long time. “Axyl, you do realize that The Dookoran consists of reservations that are backed up, from weeks to months?!”

Axyl smiled brightly. “She made reservations for tomorrow, almost a week ago.”











Velouria felt like she was the guy of the group; she felt like she was watching two girls getting excited over a marriage proposal. Kyle and Axyl screamed at each other excitingly, causing other students to stare at them strangely. This day felt so surreal, and it was definitely worth screaming over.

Kyle shook Axyl’s hand, as the school bell started ringing. “Well, sir, I wish you luck on this remarkable journey you’re about to embark.”

Chapter 15


Axyl nodded in agreement. “With substantial gratification, my good sir! Well, I got Fitness class. You two have a good day.”

“And YOU have a fantastic Friday evening!” Kyle shouted back. Axyl began walking to class, as Kyle and Velouria walked in the opposite direction together. Axyl walked in a fast-paced motion to his class. He walked through the gymnasium and by Coach Sleeve’s office, whom of which was still absent. Axyl finally concluded that Coach Sleeve was probably never going to show up to class again, especially once he saw the same substitute sitting at his desk. Nikki Wolf sat at the desk, watching the clock, until Axyl casually walked in the office.

“Hello, again,” Nikki greeted. Axyl couldn’t help but giggle, like a child on Christmas morning. “What’s that all about?”

“I gotta date!” Axyl replied immediately.

“With Nasty Pen girl?!”

Axyl nodded happily, as he let out a fart. Nikki started cracking up with laughter. Axyl, who was ultimately embarrassed, calmly said, “That’s just the happiness.”

Nikki nodded in agreement, continuously laughing. “It sure sounds like it!”

“Ha, yeah.”

Nikki finally stopped laughing. “Well, I wish you luck, buddy. And if the dating continues, hook me up with that bassist, alright?”

“The bassist? Oh, right! Okay! No problem.”

“Alright, I’ll hold you to it, bro!”

Axyl left the office and he couldn’t stop smiling. Today just couldn’t get any better than this. Well, for most people, anyway.


Three hours later- Kingzing City Clockwork Hotel

Agent Nathan12 had just exited the shower when his co-worker, Agent Jon43, had changed the channel to the local news. The two agents were currently staying at a hotel in Kingzing City. It was better than staying in an

NO WAY!


Abandoned warehouse, for sure. Since the mission of spying on Axyl Smithy was ultimately foiled, thanks to the Adoa Probes, Agents Nathan and Jon’s only resort was staying in the Clockwork Hotel. Nathan’s head was swirling, like a malfunctioning dishwashing machine. He had just fought off one deadly enemy, which ultimately took down three A72A Agents. Now Nathan has been in combat before, but never has he seen so many people die in one day. It had been a day since the incident had happened and there was no questioning how Nathan, or Jon, had been feeling about the whole ordeal. They were both quiet, calm, and focused on waiting for reinforcements, even though Area 72 was currently a complete mess and under the influence of get situated before they were to actually arrive to Kingzing City. They not only focused on waiting, but they really focused on keeping their lives from getting deceased, as well.

“I wonder why those invaders aren’t sending anymore of those robot things,” Nathan said, as he dressed up in a new suit. It was a red tux with a black bow tie.

Jon shrugged. “Maybe it’s just a ‘heads up.’”

“What do you mean by that, Agent?”

“Well, maybe this Adoa sent those robot things to this particular destination to see what they could be up against? Before they were to actually invade? Or maybe it’s an unfair notification for us to prepare ourselves?











Chapter 15


Nathan thought for a bit. Jon was actually onto something. “You do have a point, but if they plan on invading the state of Oregon, do you think they could be invading Canada, also? That’s where Area 72 was attacked, also.”

“Possibly,” Jon said with a shrug. “They, the Adoa, could be looking for something, also.”

“Preox and Rig,” Nathan replied.

“I’m sorry?”

“Ever since those aliens, Preox and Rig, showed up, all this nonsense started to happen. First, there was those two, then this situation with Blue Lazer, and next thing you know, we’re getting attacked by hostile robots.”

“You think they, Preox and Rig, have something to do with this?” Jon asked.

“I’m pretty sure. I don’t know much. We left for this Blue Lazer mission, just before Area 72 was attacked.”

Jon stood up from the bed he was sitting on. “I know what we can do! Let’s call Derno! We need to give an update!”

“Brilliant idea!” Nathan shouted excitingly, giving Jon a high-five.

Jon reached into his backpack, which sat next to the bed, and took out his cellular device. Jon was just about to dial the Captain’s digits, but froze.

“Um, are you calling,” Nathan said, with disappointment.

“Ugh. I forgot to pay for minutes, this past month.”

Nathan laughed. “Well you can still call him, right? You just have to pay for the extra minutes.”

“But I don’t want to. I’m on a tight budget.”

“What budget are you on?! You’re an official, governmental agent, sort of! It’s just two lousy minutes, just call the Commander! It’s more important than you know!”

Jon groaned in a frustrating manner and started the phone call. Commander Derno had immediately picked up the phone. “Is this the president? If so, please send us some reinforcements as soon as possible. We’re still stuck in Area 72 with no transportation available.”

“This is Agent Jon43, I’m with Nathan12.”


NO WAY!









Derno gasped like a little girl. “No way?! I thought you guys died!”

“DIED?!” came Moosey’s shrilling voice in the background.

“Indeed we are not, Captain,” Nathan replied, taking possession of Jon’s phone. “My phone was shot at the moment I called you. We lost three A72A agents, sir. It’s just me and Jon, now.

“Dammit,” Derno simply said. “Well, on the brighter side, we’re getting back up on our feet. We got Preox and Rig working on the space ship, and other Asids working on our communication systems. Yay.”

“Well, that’s good,” Nathan said with a smile. “I just got back from swimming in the pool. I left there because the hotel has this event called ‘Family Time.’ I hate that time. Too many children.”

“At least you got to swim,” Derno replied.

“Anyway, can Jon and I have an update?”

Derno sighed. “Well, obviously, Area 72 is a mess and we will be arriving to you very soon.”

Nathan gobbled like a turkey. “Really?! Awesome! Does that mean the president is giving you guys more evac?”

Derno laughed painfully. “Well I was hoping he was! He said he wasn’t able to until the next week or so, due to other conflicts in the mid-east. Area 72 wasn’t always the most benefited branch of agencies. Most of the liberals don’t even believe in the things that we do. Stuff such as hunting down the Loch Ness. It sucks. If we don’t have men down here soon, we’re all going to be pretty cramped in Preox’s ship.”

Nathan slammed his palm on the desk. “But those Adoa dudes could be here any day! Hell, any hour even!”

Derno sighed once more. “I know, and Preox believes that the invasion will happen within the next two days, or so. In the meantime, I suggest

Chapter 15


you two have weapons ready. Whether we alert the governor on time or not, prepare yourselves, Agents. For now, I gotta get going.”

Nathan grunted. “Alright, be careful out there, Captain. We’ll see you soon, hopefully.”

Derno laughed once again. “Cross your fingers!”

“Cross your fingers!!!” Moosey’s voice was heard again. The phone call had ended, leaving the two Agents unsure of what was to happen next.

“Well,” Nathan finally said, “wanna get geared up?”

Jon shrugged. “Sure! Oh, let’s go get some ammunition. Lots of it. Oh, but first, we should explore the scenery of this city!”

Nathan pat Jon on the back. “You just read my mind, good sir.”


Five Hours Later – Smithy Apartment















“Maybe I’m just going crazy,” Axyl said to himself. Ever since school started and ended today, Axyl had been feeling nothing but nervousness, such as talking to himself. He felt silly! He would talk to himself about why Holly would, without hesitation, ask Axyl out on a date. Not just any date, but a date to the fanciest restaurant in Kingzing City, The Dookoran.

NO WAY!


a date to the fanciest restaurant in Kingzing City, The Dookoran.

“If I’m not going crazy,” Axyl continued, as he paced back and forth in the living room, “then this must be a wet dream come true! A powerful dream, at that! Ackpthablahahahaha! I gotta date. Oh, yes you do, Axyl. You know why? Why Axyl? ‘Cause you are handsome! Oh yes you are, mah boy! Mah buddy-boy!”

Axyl was absolutely, undeniably, going insane. Never, in his life, did he expect this to happen. In all honesty, Axyl felt like it was best to evidently give up on Holly; to stop trying to win her over. It was rather intriguing, because the one moment Axyl wasn’t trying for Holly, the unexpected actually happened. This not only surprised Axyl, but this absolutely confused the hell out him. He thought he knew all about Holly Ransfield, such as her likes and dislikes, but he couldn’t be any more distant than that.

Jared walked in through the front door, taking off his jacket, he had just gotten off work. “Hey, son. I got off work early today. Sold two houses in one day! If only your mother could see me now. Too bad that heartless wench won’t be able to, ya know what I mean?”

“I got asked out on a date, Daddy!” Axyl hollered. Jared stared at Axyl, once he took his shoes off.

“Son, what’s wrong?”

“A girl asked me out, today at school.”

Jared flinched and closed his eyes, thinking that he was hallucinating. “Aren’t YOU supposed to do that part, buddy-boy?”

Axyl giggled, like a little girl. “I know it sounds farcical, but she just randomly walked up to me and asked me on a date to The Dookoran. THE DOOKORAN, DAD!”

“The Dookoran?!”

“Yes!”

Jared approached Axyl and gave him a huge hug. “Oh, son!” Oh!”

“Yeah, I know, right?! We’re going, tomorrow night! First she gives me her number a day ago, and now she asked me out! Who woulda thought, huh?! Which reminds me, I gotta call her! Dad, I just gotta! Oh, she has the voice of an angel of some sort. Gah, I can’t believe this is happening! It’s like…gah! I gotta call her!”

Chapter 15


“Do it, my boy!” Jared shouted happily, as he made his way upstairs to his bedroom leaving Axyl, in the living room, alone. Axyl took out his cell phone and started calling Holly. His heart was racing, as if it were running a marathon.

After a few rings or so, Holly answered, “What?”

“Hey!” Axyl shouted, not realizing in doing so. “Um, exactly what time were you expecting our… um…”

“Our date to begin?”

Axyl blushed. “Yes, I was gonna say that. Ha!”

“Want to pick me up around eight, tomorrow? My car is still in the shop. I can pay you back for the gas.”

“Why?! This is a date. You’re not paying for anything, alright?”

Holly laughed a little bit. “You sure?”

Axyl smiled. That was the first time he had ever heard Holly laugh, without forcing it out of her mouth. “Yes, I’m positive.”

“Perfect,” Holly replied. “I’ll see you later, then.”

Axyl was about to die with sheer affection. He was so happy and he wasn’t exactly sure why Holly was doing this. “Sounds great. I’ll talk to you later.”

“Bye, Axyl.”

Axyl had never really heard Holly call him by his name, either. He’s more used to her calling him an asshole, tool, or a “monkey f*!&@*%ing c#$#%@ lover.” This was it, Axyl’s dream was finally coming true.













Chapter 16: An Unsettling Start













Zjok was a ferocious, dictating, and a most ambitious leader of the Adoa Military; his war tactics were merciless and demanding. Zjok, as far as most know, always had the thirst for dominance and power. Although, that’s not how Zjok was always referred to as, not when he was enrolled in the Asid Military, so many years ago. Zjok’s way of living was always difficult. In fact, some certain events that have occurred in his life have actually, and ultimately, pushed Zjok to a point where he betrayed the Asids and built an army of his own, and he couldn’t be more satisfied. Zjok wasn’t always a ferocious, dictating, and a most ambitious leader, however. As a matter of fact, he was young, he was socially disrupted, and was completely shy, as well as a happy, a most intriguing, yet determined asset to the Asid Military. Zjok was well aware of the harshness, from the Asid military’s extreme expectations of combat and strategy, however he was not aware it would be too much for his weak mind to tolerate.

Chapter 16


Planet Suzia – Almost 30 years ago

“Preox, I’ve waited one-hundred years for this moment,” Zjok said, with a smile spread across his face. He and Preox, both looking much younger than they are now, were both gazing at a massive structure before them, simply star stricken by its glowing features. The structure was built out of pure comet, and was made to look like it was built from glass. There were Asid symbols carved along the center of the structure, which was translated as “The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building.”

Preox stood by his best friend, who happened to be carrying dome-shaped containers, which carried his belongings, and pat Zjok on the shoulder. “Here we are, old chum, The AKBHE Building.” This building would bring lots of nostalgic memories to Zjok and Preox’s first years serving the Asid Military. It would take Preox and Zjok another 20 years before they would voluntarily serve as The AKBHE’s service Ravocs (in easier terms, they would voluntarily serve as drill sergeants, while being under the military rank of a Common.) The Asid’s military style was not as similar as to how the human military would function, but anyone with a low IQ should be able to understand that.

Zjok, in his younger years, was skinnier than Preox and Preox happened to be more masculine just like he was in the present time. Zjok had always wanted to not only serve the Asid Military, but it had been his passion to command and create new ideas for warfare. For Zjok’s lack in body mass and intelligence, he was often ridiculed and harassed by other Asids, alike. Preox, on the other hand, was passionate for defeating the enemy and accomplishing the mission, which most Asids took a liking for. Asids always appreciated direct heroism, super soldiers, and Preox’s mindset was always persistent. On another intriguing note, during his early years, Preox could actually maintain his anger. Of course, that was way before his life entered a new world of pandemonium.

The younger Asids (Ranging from 100-150 years old.) would camp inside The AKBHE, where they would spend a number of years training for combat, commandment, and piloting. The Asid students would be sleeping in an empty room with one small trapdoor to store belongings.


An Unsettling Start


Inside that room, during resting hours of course, Asids would have to endure different environmental weather conditions. Conditions such as colder temperatures with rain, snow, or ice, and weather such as hotter temperatures with droughts, sand, or extremely dense humidity. It’s a unique strategy to train Asids to adapt in any climate. This was a perfect advantage for those who were to struggle against the enemy throughout the days and nights.

Preox and Zjok made their way through The AKBHE, where they were escorted, with other young soldiers, by Asid Ravocs into a substantial room. The room was massive enough to store over five-hundred Asids. The room was obviously empty, due to the fact that no climate had been activated. About a hundred of young Asids made their way in, which most would call “The Storage,” in search of an appropriate place to store their belongings.

“Welcome to The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building,

you Klondikes!” shouted one of the two team leaders at the top of his lungs. “In your trapdoors, once you brats get all situated, you will find a used Vambit, which you will borrow (You will not earn your own customary Vambit, until your twenty years of education is complete.)

“You will also find, in your trapdoors, a thin blanket, a small pillow, a storage container to store personal belongings, such as food and water. Do not, and I repeat, DO NOT wolf down all of your food within one day. Your food is limited to last for a month and we will NOT give you food, until that month is over! If a fellow Asid is starving, help your fellow Asid! Reserving food is also another tactic of training you, especially if supplies were to become scarce, whilst on a dangerous mission. Write that down, kids!” The Asid Ravoc turned to the other. “Is that all?”

“Our names? Duh.” the other Ravoc responded.

“Oh, right. You, ugly Klondikes, will be calling us by Ravoc Ritnop and Ravoc Frit. I’m Ravoc Ritnop. Do I make myself clean and spiffy, ASIDS?!”

All the Asids responded, “AS ALWAYS, RAVOC RITNOP!”

“Uh huh! Now, you are only allowed four hours of sleep! So rest now when you can! Asids Warriors do not tolerate too much rest! It will only disadvantage us from defeating the enemy and the enemy will defeat you, if you do not comply! I WILL DESTROY YOU IF YOU DO NOT COMPLY!

Chapter 16


Now, prepare yourselves to be sleeping in the rainforest tonight. You are dismissed!” The two Ravocs left The Storage, allowing young Asids to get themselves situated. The Storage’s floor was perfectly constructed out of glazed silver, until blue grass began growing out of it.

Zjok knelt down, examining the grass, with sheer fascination. “Wow, it’s really turning into a rainforest! Preox, this is great!”

Preox grew frustrated, as a tree began to grow within seconds, in front of him. “Well, I was going to sleep here, but this stupid tree had to start growing. Did you open your trapdoor yet?”

Zjok shook his head, as he proceeded to open his trapdoor to find food and other supplies, which Ritnop had mentioned before. Zjok pulled out a granola bar and started eating it. He was quite satisfied with the current position that he was in.













The two best buddies had set up their rest areas, as The Storage was looking more like an exotic rainforest. Preox, who camped next to Zjok, took out his container full of water and faced his friend. “A toast, my dear friend, to a new, amazing start.” Zjok smiled, and clinked his water container next to Preox’s. “Cheers, buddy.” They took only but a sip of their water and stored it in their trapdoor and The Storage was not as empty as it was before. The climate began to feel as real as ever, as was getting colder. All of the Asids fully occupied, and the entire room was filled with wet grass, trees, and dirt.

An Unsettling Start


The “sky” was very convincing, as well.

“It looks like we’re really looking at Suzia’s night sky,” Preox said, with a chuckle. Then, “actual” rain began to fall from the ceiling of The Storage. “Wait ‘til they start using the much colder and hotter climates,” came a voice. It was an Asid who happened to be camping in front of Zjok and Preox. “They’re just letting us off easy because it’s our first night in The AKBHE. I’m Oil, by the way.”

Preox and Zjok shook his three-fingered hand and introduced themselves. Before they could talk to each other any further, as it began to pour heavy rain, several other Asids came walking by. They were larger in muscle-tone, larger than Preox himself. They began to laugh, as they pointed at Zjok. “Since when did they start recruiting pencil-shaped-type, here?” (As mentioned before, Zjok had a history of constant ridicule and cruel harassment.) Zjok didn’t say anything, though Preox did.

Chapter 16


“Oh why don’t you get off and kiss it?”

One of the bullies approached Preox, who was standing before him. The Asid was much taller than Preox, although that didn’t intimidate him one bit. “What was that?”

“You heard me, Asid,” Preox replied immediately. His glare towards the taller Asid was angry, but respectable by Zjok’s perspective.

The Asid laughed, Preox could tell that he offended him regardless. “Do you have any idea who I am?”

“No,” Preox said, keeping his glare, “and I have no interest in knowing, just like you shouldn’t have any interest in calling my friend names. Now, either you apologize or screw off, with your buddies, and never talk to us again.”

The Asid laughed again, followed by his posse. “What if I don’t?”

“I’ll have your knee caps.”

The Asid scoffed, like a spoiled, rich boy. “Is that a threat? How’s about you repeat what you said to me earlier, after I called that freak friend of yours a pencil?”

Preox’s anger began to rise. At this point in time, it was rare to see Preox in a higher temper. It was almost too unnatural, as a matter of fact. “I said, ‘Oh why don’t you get off and--.” The Asid threw a punch at Preox, but he was able to catch it in the palm of his hand. “Did I offend you, Asid? Just like you offended my friend, Zjok, here?” Oil was looking up at Preox, his eyes were wide, unlike Zjoks’s. Zjok was silent, for he was quite familiar in being picked on. Preox held the Asid’s fist in his palm, as he tried to let it free.

“Now,” Preox began, “I need you to leave.”

The bully Asid let his fist go and laughed. “You can call me Setil. Come on, Asids!” The group of Asids left Preox, Oil, and Zjok, with Preox standing in the exact same spot.

“Wow,” Oil simply exclaimed. “Uh, Preox, do you have any idea who that was?”

“Whoever he was, he was ‘Pissing Me Off.’”

“That’s Ravoc Ritnop’s younger relative.”

Preox did not react. “So? He was picking on Zjok, I wasn’t

An Unsettling Start


going to just sit there. Asid Military Text of Fine Respect, chapter eighteen, section three-point-five, paragraph three: ‘Bullying is absolutely not tolerated, under any circumstances. Those who are caught in these acts are a disgrace to the Asid Military and must be replaced, immediately. Rising up against and self-defense is highly suggested.’ I know my stuff, Oil.”

Zjok was already sleeping when it began to constantly rain. Preox knew that Setil was not going to be a friendly ally, during his and Zjok’s military journey.


Four Hours Later

Ravoc Ritnop and Frit burst into The Storage, banging pots and pans. “WAKE UP ASIDS, YOUR FIRST DAYS OF TRAINING ARE NYE, STARTING TODAY! YOU GOT THREE MINUTES! LET’S MOVE IT! GO, GO, GO! AGGHHHH! GOTTA LOVE THE ADRENALINE; I THINK I JUST POPPED A BLOOD VESSEL!”

“YEAH!” Frit added. She rarely spoke.

Young Asids were hesitantly rummaging through their things for what to bring for the day. The rainforest began to dissolve, making The Storage look like a massive, silver, and empty containment once again. Today was going to be extremely productive for Preox, Zjok, and Oil. They were going to learn the basics of combat.












Chapter 16


“Do you think we’ll get to use our Vambits?” Zjok asked Preox.

“Indeed not,” came Frit’s voice, she was taller and covered in armor (Young Asids only wore basic training armor) “You will be working on basic fighting skills, such as punching things and all that.”

Setil, whom of which was walking by with his things, pushed Zjok. “Yeah, retard.”

Preox was about ready to charge at him, but Frit stopped him. “Asid, we’re not going to be having any of that, now are we?”

“Negatory, Ravoc Frit!” Preox shouted.

“At rest, Asid. Setil is a meat head who doesn’t understand what we do here, quite yet. I know you follow the text, but please leave Setil’s actions up to us.”

Zjok didn’t hesitate to ask, “Is all of our training going to be intense like this?”

“If you’re not exactly ready for it,” Frit simply answered, “the toughest moments of your life will take place in this very building.” Zjok gulped. He was so passionate about what he was enrolled with, though he wasn’t so sure if he was exactly ready.

Preox pat Zjok on the shoulder, “You got this, Asid.”

Zjok smiled weakly.

Zjok, in his younger years, was always full of assumptions. Assumptions that other Asids were always against him, if not simply paranoid. He was also often depressed. It’s something that always came natural to Zjok and he had moments where he absolutely could not take it anymore, moments that were never heard of because Zjok would never talk to anyone about them.

Zjok, Oil, and Preox were about to train in a room, with five Probes. Although, this was a time before Probes were used as deadly weapons by the menacing Adoa. During this time, they were often used as target practice when training to fight against opposing enemies. The Probes were all situated in a line, facing a group of twenty-five Asids, including Preox, Oil, and Zjok, of course. None of the Probes were equipped with deadly rifles. They only appeared as harmless robots, wielding only robotic limbs. Despite their less-threatening appearance, they still seemed just as intimidating.

An Unsettling Start


“Today,” came in a voice of another fellow Asid. It was Admiral Bxir, but younger. “Yew unlikely Klondikes wheel be trainin’ against these Probes to practice yer close combat skeels. We know this is yer first day trainin’ at Tha AKBHE, so we won’t be surprised if ya’ll suck at this. If you suck from here on out, tha’s okay, yew wheel get better. We wheel make you get better! Do I make myself clean, Klondikes?! Now, getcher filthy selves out dere and kick some bootang!”











Five out of the twenty Asids were assigned to one of the five Probes to begin their training. Zjok, unfortunately, was assigned with Setil’s Probe, as Preox was assigned to a different one. Zjok watched Setil and Preox practice their basic fighting skills against their Probes, doing a remarkable job at doing so. Everyone else seemed to be doing exceptionally well.

Once Zjok had went up to his Probe to fight it, he didn’t do as well. The Probe actually ended up slamming its robot fist against Zjok’s jaw. All the Asids laughed, other than Preox and Oil. The Probe was set to “Level Lamna,” the lowest skill set programmed on a Probe. Level Lamna, in other words, was the easiest setting to fight a Probe, which made things more embarrassing for Zjok. Level Ion was the highest skill set.

“He can’t even dodge a hit,” Setil laughed. Zjok’s jaw hurt horribly after training with Probes for the first time. The rest of the day didn’t go so well, either. Zjok, as skinny as he was, was completely out of shape and wasn’t as fast-paced as the other Asids, especially when he had to run through the obstacle courses. Although, there was one shining moment for

Chapter 16


Zjok that not all Asids got to experience. This occurred about a couple months after his first day in The AKBHE.

Zjok was alone, with an Asid with the ranking of a Controller. This Asid in particular was the Head of The AKBHE. Zjok sat in front of a massive table with holo-graphic ships. There were two teams of ships, both representing an opposing army, on either side. There were also holo-graphic dots on the table, indicating holo-graphic infantry. “Alright, Zjok,” said the Asid. “I am Controller Claknibox and I welcome you to your first day in commandment training. You will begin on Level Lamna, and you will be competing against another young Asid, like yourself, who is also in the other room next to us. You will know who your opponent is, until the training is over. You will be commanding the opposing fleet, as the other Asid will be commanding the other. For motivation, your goal is to get your infantry past your half of the board, in order to dominate your opponent. Remember, you only have a limited number of ships and troops to command. This session will end, until there is a winner. Good luck.”

Zjok nodded. “My thanks, Controller.” His face was scratched and beaten from all the times he had been training. He has failed numerous times and he wasn’t in the mood to be a failure again, or so he thought. He felt like crying because he was so upset. Just before he was going to think more negative thoughts, he saw opposing “fighter ships” attacking Zjok’s holo-graphic fleet. Under the surveillance of Claknibox, Zjok took the controls of “his fleet” and began attacking blindly. Then, something sparked inside of Zjok’s head. A spark which consisted all the anger, sadness, happiness, and determination in his life. Zjok knew exactly what to do now. The training session consisted of gaining points and the more points a trainee would receive, the more “power-ups” the trainee would get. Sort of like a video game. Zjok concentrated, sending in a number of ships to drop off more infantry to keep the opponents from crossing Zjok’s side of the board. Zjok noticed the opposing fighters were wiping out Zjok’s infantry. Zjok sent several fighters on both sides of his half of the board, taking out the opponent’s. This resulted in Zjok gaining more points and his opponent losing more points. He smiled with happiness, once he realized that his infantry was getting closer to his opponent’s side of the table.

An Unsettling Start


















Zjok was enjoying this all too well. The loud dinging of a bell occurred and the board revealed holo-graphic text labeled, “Power Up!” He tapped on the text, showing a holo-graphic mother ship. Zjok heard Controller Claknibox gasp in surprise. Zjok activated the mother ship’s weapons, which resulted in annihilation from purple lightning. Before Zjok knew it, his infantry had crossed to the other side of the table and the training session had ended immediately. Confetti rained down on Zjok, with a robotic voice shouting, “Congrats! You won! Please take your winning tickets!”

“We don’t give out tickets anymore,” Claknibox said. “Anyway, congrats, Zjok. Impressive work, I must say. Not many Asids can activate power-ups on their first training session. Splendid work, Asid. You are now dismissed.”

“My thanks, Controller!” Zjok left the room before he could grin. Before he could give himself a personal celebration, he saw Setil walk out of the other room. He was Zjok’s opponent all along.

“You,” he said. “How the hell did you do that, cheater?”

“I didn’t cheat, I just played by the rules. I beat you. All is fair.”

“Nobody beats me,” Setil stated, approaching Zjok. “Especially not from a scrawny, little cheater like you. You got that, buddy-boy?!” Setil pushed Zjok, which made him back up a few feet. The bully laughed. “You

Chapter 16


weigh lighter than a turd! What’re you gonna do about it?” Zjok didn’t say a word. “Huh?! Come on, you pansy!”

Zjok was getting more than just upset. He was getting pissed, just like Preox would. “Knock it off.”

Setil laughed and before he could say another word, Zjok decked him in the face. His punches weren’t be as effective as what Setil was capable of. Setil continued laughing as he slammed his fist into Zjok’s gut. He gasped for air, but couldn’t once Setil kneed him right in the forehead. Zjok’s flailed body went backward on the floor, with Setil laughing at him. “You’re so pathetic. Might as well kill yourself now. Look at yourself!” Setil left Zjok, laying in the empty hallway of The AKBHE Building. Zjok coughed up some neon-pink blood. Then, he began to sob. His negative thoughts of being worthless came back to him, once again, pulling him deeper into his deadly mindset.


Five Minutes Later


After a dreadful moment of sobbing, Zjok made it back to The Storage, where it was chilly and full of snow; the environment was set to a forest in the winter season. All the Asids were looking up at the sky, observing the gorgeous night sky, as they listened to a recording over many intercoms. The recording continuously explained as to why the Asids had a longing for protection, domination, persistence, and destiny, all of that crap.

Zjok wandered through The Storage, his mouth still bleeding. Some of the other Asids had noticed the disturbing sight of Zjok, though decided not to help him. Zjok felt worthless. He succeeded once today, but the fact that he had failed yet again poisoned his brain. Zjok found Preox, Oil, and the recently acquainted Zitkir, at their little camp site. A green fire was blazing, keeping the Asids warm, just like all the others. Preox took his eye off the massive television screen, looking up at Zjok. “Done with training? Took you a while. Where’d you get the wounds?” Preox’s face was beaten also, but that was due to the fact that he was training in the combat zone for the past week.

An Unsettling Start


“Ah, it’s just from all the training this week,” Zjok said quietly. Before he could sit down, Preox stood up and approached him. “Your mouth is freshly cut, Jokky. What happened? I know you weren’t doing any combat training today, so don’t lie to me. What happened?” Zjok coughed, getting a few drops of blood on Preox’s armor. Zitkir and Oil were looking at them.

“Are you sick, bud?” Zitkir asked.

Zjok didn’t say a word, just took deep breaths. Preox stared at his eyes and immediately made an angry expression. He knew exactly what had happened. “I thought I told that Setil to back off.”

“Seems like he hasn’t for the past two months,” Oil replied. “Look at him.” Zjok was blank and emotionless. Preox started marching his way to Setil’s camp, with Zitkir and Oil hesitantly following him.

“Uh, Preox, I wouldn’t,” Zitkir said, trying to stop his buddy.

“Oh, come off,” Preox scoffed, “if someone messes with Zjok, that someone is messing with me.”

Preox found Setil’s camp and kicked over all his things. Surrounding Asids were completely startled. “You had to do it again, Asid?!”

“What the hell, Asid?!” Setil shouted. He decided to play stupid. “What’s the big idea?!”

Preox shoved him. “Oh, shut it, you blithering cretin. I told you to back off from Zjok!”

Setil’s group of Asids stood up, ready to bring Preox down to the ground. “No, don’t, I have this one.”

All the others exclaimed, as the Preox and Setil stood in front of each other, their fists clenched.

“You should have backed off,” Setil said, giving Preox a grin.

“Shut your fat-ass mouth and throw a punch, already,” Preox replied with disgust. Setil hooked a punch at Preox but ultimately dodged it. “Wrong move, moron!” Preox swung his arm and jabbed a powerful punch in Setil’s face. Setil moaned as stumbled, all while trying to trip Preox. Preox avoided this next move and kicked the bully in the chest, sending him backward in the snow. Some Asids were chanting for Preox, as they watched him beat Setil over and over. No matter what move Setil made, Preox owned him again and again.

Chapter 16

















Setil had been beaten, by the time Ravoc Ritnop came and pulled Preox away. “The hell you doin,’ Asid?! This is HAPPY RADIO TIME’, not FIGHT CLUB! What makes you think it’s okay to wail on my younger blood, Asid?!”

Preox broke loose from him. “RRGH! He will not stay away from Zjok! I dunno if you noticed, Ravoc, but his face has been beaten for as long as I can remember!”

“You’re supposed to have wounds, Asid!” hollered Ritnop. “It’s all a part of the training process! It’s a sign of achievement! And who cares about what condition Zjok is in?! He hasn’t said a word about it, has he?”

“You can’t expect he’s okay if he doesn’t say anything! Did you not read your copy of Asid Military Text of Fine Respect?!”

Ritnop scoffed. “You’re supposed to be helping other Asids out, not beating them! That’s what it says in the text, right?”

“I was helping Zjok, you dildo-headed freak!” Preox shouted. “Your idiot brother should know this too. Oh, but wait, he can’t read can he?!”

Ritnop swung his fist, knocking Preox down to the ground. “That’s two days in the Detention Precinct, Asid Preox.” Preox barely got up, before

An Unsettling Start


Ritnop took him by the arm and began escorting him.

Preox looked at Zjok, his face was beaten more than it was before. “Zjok, the next time Setil taunts you or hits you, fight back dammit! Kill him if you have to!”

When Preox said “to kill,” he meant it in a sarcastic manner; to boost Zjok’s momentum, for once. Oh, and did that boost Zjok’s momentum, indeed. According to Zjok, actually killing Setil sounded like a most vigorous idea.















Planet Suzia – 22 years After the Preox and Setil Incident

Zjok’s first decade attending at The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building was a real hell. The constant battle of fighting his overwhelming emotions made it difficult for him to focus on his pursuit of becoming ranked as a Common. Alas, Zjok had made it possible to overcome this, once he eventually fulfilled his goal. Once Zjok became a Common, Setil been moved to a different section of The AKBHE Building. Thank God.

After another 2 years, and eventually fighting in a couple battles against enemies in small conflicts, Preox and Zjok had become 2nd Class Envoy Officers.

Chapter 16


Now, it is 22 years after Preox’s conflict with Setil, which is also almost a year before Zjok’s unexpected uprising.

Today was a very special day for Preox and Zjok, for today was their first day serving as Ravocs for The AKBHE. Zjok, in particular, was thrilled about this voluntary service. For the past 22 years, Zjok had been getting stronger, faster, and more efficient in his military status. Right now, Zjok was drawing near his first day as a Ravoc and it couldn’t possibly go wrong. Newer, and younger, Asids had entered The Storage, which was completely empty, just like it was when Zjok first stepped inside it.

















Preox, who was in a full suit of armor and was wearing his very own certified Vambit, hollered at the young Asids to grab their attention. “Welcome to The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building,

you Klondikes!” Preox shouted at the top of his lungs. “In your trapdoors, once you brats get all situated, you will find a used Vambit, which you will borrow (You will not earn your own customary Vambit until your education is complete.). You will also find, in your trapdoors, a blanket, a pillow, a storage container to store food and water. Do not, and I repeat, DO NOT wolf down all of your food within one day. Your food is limited to last at least one

Chapter 16


month and we will NOT give you food, until that month is over! If a fellow Asid is starving or facing ANY OTHER CONFLICTS, help him or her out! You are all a team! If you fail to do this and you’re found guilty, I promise I will beat you and send you to the Detention Precinct! You will also call us Ravoc Preox and Ravoc Zjok! Do I make myself crystal-clean, Asids?!”

The young Asids responded, “ALWAYS, RAVOC PREOX!”

“Good! Expect The Storage to transform into a rainforest, within the hour! You are all expected four hours of sleep! See you tomorrow. You are dismissed!” The new Ravocs began to exit, as Zjok noticed some of the Asids looking at him. Some were even smirking at him and giving soft laughs. Zjok gave them a sharp look to cease them from smirking. Zjok was not going to tolerate bullshit, any longer.

“Ravoc Preox!” came a voice. It was a more feminine voice, innocent. It was the first time Preox had ever heard Kriket call his name.

“Yes, Asid Kriket?” Preox responded. Kriket looked at him in a way that she would look at him forever. From this moment on, Kriket had a huge crush on Preox, despite the fact that she was 100 years-old and Preox was 121.

“I-I can’t find my water container, Ravoc,” she stuttered. However, she knew exactly where that water container was. Zjok knew she was up to something insidious.

Preox sighed. He didn’t seem to show her any affection, at this moment. “Asid, it’s in this trapdoor! I assume that this is your trapdoor to store your belongings, am I correct?!”

Kriket had paused, gazing into Preox’s eyes. “Uh, yes, Ravoc.”

Zjok started laughing a bit, causing Preox to face him. “What’s so funny, Ravoc?” Zjok shrugged and kept quiet, looking around at the other Asids who were all getting situated. Preox knelt down Kriket’s trapdoor and opened it. “What the hell, where is it?!” Zjok laughed silently because he knew Kriket was messing with Preox. As Preox stuck his head inside the trapdoor, looking for Kriket’s stupid container, Zjok watched Kriket write down the code embedded on Preox’s Vambit, on her hand. She looked at Zjok, with a menacing smile (The code embedded on Preox’s Vambit was his

An Unsettling Start


“communication code.” It was basically as similar as having a phone number.) Zjok kept quiet for her, trying his hardest not to laugh his ass off. Preox rummaged through Kriket’s trapdoor for another few seconds, before he finally found the water container.

“It’s almost as if someone just decided to deliberately hide it in there!” Preox hollered frustratingly and gave it to Kriket. “Remember, we have a neat fountain to refill your container with.”

Kriket laughed. “I know, Ravoc, thank you.”

Preox laughed a bit, also, with a smirk. “You’re dismissed, Asid, we will see you tomorrow.”

Kriket bit her lip as she watched Preox and Zjok leave, as she started to situate herself, just before the rainforest was activated. Preox went to a control panel, next to the entrance of The Storage, and dialed a few buttons. “There we are, Zjok, the rainforest is now activated. Let’s head back to our rooms. What was so funny, earlier?”

Zjok snickered. “All I know is that you’ll get a surprise, sooner or later.”

“I hope so,” Preox replied, laughing. “I need a break.”




Chapter 17: Everything is Fine

















Preox found it quite peculiar about Zjok’s silly behavior, after they had stumbled upon Kriket. He didn’t let that bother him for too long, until about three hours into his sleep duration. Preox slept in the same room as Zjok, sleeping in luxurious and exotic cots, which was much better than sleeping through environmental changes of The Storage. The two Team Leaders kept their Vambits stored in their very own high-security cabinet, which also contained their full suit of armor and weapons. Although, the cabinets weren’t exactly sound proof. The sound of an obnoxiously loud rock tune alarmed Preox from his bunk, awakening immediately. This made Zjok wake up, as well. “What the hell is that?” Zjok said weakly. He did not want to be woken up. He rubbed his eyes and looked across the small room, watching Preox slowly rise up from his cot.

Chapter 17


“Rrrggh,” Preox grunted. “It’s my Vambit. What does Admiral Bxir want now?! He needs to learn how to make bagels on his own time!”

Preox weakly approached his high-security cabinet and opened it, after swiping his index finger in a crisscross motion. The rock music got louder, once the cabinet had opened, causing Zjok to wrap his pillow around his face. Preox set his Vambit on his bed and activated its main controls. The rock music stopped, finally. A holo-graphic screen appeared before Preox, as he set the Vambit on the front pedestal of his cot and sat inside it. A small selection of holo-graphic buttons was on the screen, asking whether to “answer the incoming call” or “ignore.” Preox found it strange that it wasn’t Admiral Bxir actually calling him, this time. Full of curiosity, Preox selected “answer the incoming call.” It was Kriket. Her young face filled the screen. Preox was surprised, gasping in shock, as he whispered, “What?! Asid Kriket! What’re you doing?! You’re not supposed to be using your Vambit, yet! I’m gonna have to report you and beat you senseless!”

Kriket laughed. Preox could see that The Storage had completely been transformed into a rainforest. “We both know you wouldn’t do that, Ravoc Preox.”

“Oh?! Don’t test me, Asid. I am your Ravoc. You either hang up now, or spend two days in the Detention Precinct! How the hell did you figure out to use a Vambit, anyway?!”

“Hell yeah, you’re my Ravoc! And, have you ever had relatives who once served the Asid Military?” Kriket asked with a smirk.

Preox shook his head. “I’m one of the first of my relatives to attend The AKBHE.”

“Wow, really? Well, I’m the second Asid to--.”

“Yeah, yeah, I get it,” Preox interrupted. “Now, how did you learn to use a Vambit, considering it’s your first night at this facility? I want some answers, Asid.”

Kriket sighed. “Well, since I’m the one who called you, one of my ancestors was Kranzir Blorton and my other relatives have kept his Vambit, since his death and I’ve learned to use it.”

Preox’s eyes widened. His attention was completely caught. “Nuh uh! The Kranzir Blorton?! The savior of our race?! You’re related to him?!”

Everything is Fine


Kriket nodded with a smile. “Yep! And my relatives used his Vambit for everyday use. Of course, the Vambit is a much older model. The one I’m using now, which is more modern, I’m still getting used to.”

Preox gasped again. “Your family is naughty!”

Kriket laughed. “Yeah, all of my relatives, including me, are kind of rebellious.”

“Kind of?! More like… A LOT REBELLIOUS!”















Preox controlled his voice, he had completely forgotten that Zjok was trying to sleep. “Look, Kriket, you gotta get off the Vambit. Now! It’s really awesome that Kranzir Blorton happens to be an ancestor of yours, but I’m gonna have to report you if you don’t deactivate that Vambit.”

Kriket pouted. “Aw, come on, Ravoc. Just a little longer?”

Preox gave her a frustrated look. He was going to disapprove, until Zjok butted in. “Preox, talk to her. When was the last time you even talked to a female?”

Preox answered that sad question in his head and sighed. Female Asids never really took interest in Preox, at least he didn’t think so. He looked back at Kriket and sighed out loud. It wasn’t only a sigh of frustration, but a sigh of slight affection also.

Chapter 17


“I won’t tell anyone else about this, Preox,” Zjok said, raising a thumbs-up.

Preox looked into Kriket’s eyes. They were dazzling in the holo-graphic light. “Alright, Kriket, how’re you doin’?”

Zjok listened to the two of them talk and talk, keeping his focus on hopefully falling asleep. Then, these thoughts of negativity started taking over his brain, again. He had wished that a beautiful, young female Asid would pay this much attention to him. In fact, he had wished he didn’t have to feel so alone, all the time. He had Preox as a best friend, but he couldn’t help but feel this way. He felt a little sad now and he was just about to drift into a deep sleep, until he heard someone say his name. “Zjok, wake up. You’re sooo cooool.”

Zjok lifted his head up. “Preox, was that you?” Preox was asleep. Two hours had already past, since Preox stopped talking to Kriket. It would be about an hour before they all had to wake up and start the first day of training the new young Asids. Zjok grunted and laid back down. “Not funny Preox.”

“I’m not Preoooxxxx,” the voice came again, scaring the holy hell out of poor Zjok. He just wanted some sleep!

“Okay,” Zjok responded. “Then who are you?” Zjok got up and checked his high-security cabinet, expecting his Vambit to be the cause of this mysterious voice. Then again, Vambits were not programmed to talk; Zjok’s Vambit was completely silent.

“Nor am I your pretty thingy,” the voice came again, referring to Zjok’s Vambit. “Come outside to this land mass and seeee meeeee.”

“Oh, shut it,” Zjok replied. He felt pretty silly that he was talking to himself, or at least he thought he was. “Stop messing with me, Admiral Bxir. I’m tired, I want sleep! Enough with the pranks!”

“I’m not Admiral!” roared the voice, making Zjok jump. He was surprised that Preox hadn’t woken up from all this. Was this all happening in Zjok’s head? The voice continued, “Meet me outsiiiddde.”

Zjok immediately thought of the mischievous Adoa. Could they have hacked into The AKBHE’s main communications? Zjok wasn’t so sure, though he went ahead and put on his full suit of armor along with his Vambit. It was time to go investigate!

Everything is Fine


Zjok decided to not use the building’s elevator systems, for he didn’t want to cause too much commotion. If Zjok were caught out of bounds, without a permit, he would be declined from his Ravoc duties, especially without a reasonable explanation. The Asid continuously worried about getting spotted outside his boundaries. He felt ridiculous to be on the expedition for something that was most likely taking place in his head. He had to be sure he wasn’t day dreaming this or that he could potentially facing a threat.

Zjok, curiosity taking over his mind, opened a nearby window in the hallway. He activated it with the swipe of his index finger and jumped out. He was free-falling from over 2,000 feet in the air, which was only a quarter of The AKBHE Building’s maximum height. He activated his jet-pack and blissfully soared through the air. The weather was rather cozy, warm, and no wind was detected. The view from thousands of feet in the air was magnificent and unforgettable. It viewed masses of Suzia’s blue grass and its beautiful exotic trees, which were all slightly illuminated by beauteous stars and the several moons that rotated the planet’s orbit.

The curious Asid wasn’t so sure where the mysterious voice wanted to “meet him,” until the voice occurred once more. “Over heeerrre.” This spooked Zjok a little too much. It was as though the voice was all coming from his mind, but Zjok believed it was more than just an illusion. He made it to the surface of Suzia, landing on the fresh blue grass. He was surprised that he did not see any Asid guards patrolling the area. Why weren’t there any? This was all too mysterious and unnatural! On top of that mysterious and unnatural atmosphere, it was silent. Too silent. He stretched his armor-plated arm, and a rifle unfolded itself from the armor. Zjok held the weapon tightly.


Chapter 17


Over the two decades of training at The AKBHE, Zjok had become very efficient in combat and endurance. However, when Zjok faced the real proportion of ultra-violence and warfare, fear would always consume him. Of all that training and hard work, Zjok will always loathe facing a concerning conflict, let alone death. “Alright, you weirdo, either you’re making me insane or you’re a crazy demon that I shall eliminate.”

“Over herrrrreee,” the voice said again. Swirling amounts of red smoke started rising from the blue grass. Zjok pointed his rifle where the smoke was coming from and before he knew it, the red smoke formed an over-sized figure. It did not look like an Asid, nor did it look like it was any creature he had ever seen. It was at least twelve feet tall and it left Zjok speechless. The figure appeared harmless, yet intimidating. “I am the last of the Drokensmur.”

Zjok could barely speak a word. He was the first of many Asids to see a Drokensmur alive and this rare occasion was completely overwhelming. (For a little background information, the Drokensmur were a superior race on the planet Suzia. They roamed the planet for thousands of years before the first Asid was born. The Drokensmur were known for using telepathic abilities and evaporating themselves to avoid threat or when travelling. The Drokensmur were a powerful and demanding race. They’re blood has also been preferably known as the most rare and most powerful material in the universe. Drokensmur were never hostile and they were just about as peaceful as the average dolphin. “H-how…?” Zjok stammered. He lowered his rifle from pointing it at the legendary beast.









Everything is Fine


“I have been traveling for centuries and centuries,” the Drokensmur replied. “You can see, I no longer have flesh on my bones.”

Zjok nodded. He was actually little scared. “Y-yeah, I can see that. Why have you been calling me?”

The Drokensmur coughed hoarsely and Zjok took notice that he was on the verge of death. The Drokensmur calmly sat on a rock nearby and began to explain. “I’ve been wandering around this universe looking for someone worthy, someone worthy for carrying on the Drokensmur legacy. Without the power of the Drokensmur, our legacy will be forgotten. So, I’ve been looking for a worthy, healthy, and passionate being. Someone who is able to extract my blood and create a concoction. A concoction so powerful, that it will protect any planet from any harm. After countless years of searching, I found you. You are worthy”

Zjok immediately thought of the enemies of the Asids and their ongoing attempts to destroy them, so they can all continue their reign of domination. Enemies especially known as the Adoa. “How powerful, Drokensmur?”

The Drokensmur looked at him. “Very powerful. It’s so powerful, it’ll rock your sock off, my boy! It will help you protect not just your planet, but also yourself, the others who care for you, and other planets alike. When I found you, Zjok, you seemed lonely, depressed, and always felt like you weren’t a part of anything.”

Zjok tried his best not to cry. “Y-yeah, that’s true. But why me?”

“I believe you’re worthy of performing this task, with the use of Drokensmur blood, the mixing of hot boiling lava, and cold ice from a comet. All of these combined will create a Serum, combining all the powers used from the mighty Drokensmur god. The Drokensmur god known as Misara.”

“Misara?” Zjok seemed puzzled. “What would you want me to do with it?”

“Show it to your fellow Asids. This will be a revolutionary outbreak for your weapons, for centuries to come. It will give you power and the ability for you to annihilate your enemies and save your race from facing any more harm. This is not only the perfect advantage to use against your enemies, but it’s also a great advantage to prove yourself who you really are, especially to all of those who have wronged you! Extract my blood now, Zjok.”

Chapter 17


“You be better not be messing with me, man,” Zjok said with a laugh. He was so thrilled about this new idea of total annihilation, all against the enemies of the Asids and that it will keep Suzia and other planets safe.

“No, dude,” the Drokensmur replied, “I am so not messing with you. Now, hurry, and fulfill your destiny. Take out your water container.”

Zjok hastily took out his container from his Vambit, opened it, and emptied all the water from it. Even though he had just been rid of all the water he had for the entire month, Zjok did not care. The Drokensmur leaned over, the sound of his bones cracking and falling apart. The beast opened his mouth and out poured beautiful, blue blood. The blood perfectly poured into the container, which was only to hold a small portion of the substance. Once the container was full, the Drokensmur coughed up the rest of the blood, thus collapsing into a pool of it.

“Are you okay?!”

The Drokensmur coughed. “Indeed, Asid. Carry on the Drokensmur legacy, fulfill my wish, and fulfill your happiness.”

Zjok stored the container back inside his Vambit, standing over the Drokensmur. “Anything else? Anything at all?”

“Remember,” the Drokensmur replied weakly, “if the blood is used improperly, in any way, against my wishes, a great consequence will fall upon you. The blood, which you now possess, is now indestructible. Only the blood can be destroyed by improper use and disgraceful acts.”

Zjok understood this completely and nodded. “Yes, Drokensmur.”

“Thank you, for all you do. Everything is fine, now.”

The Drokensmur made one last dying breath and had passed on. His body disintegrated, along with his blood which he was laying in. Zjok was now the holder of the remaining Drokensmur blood. He sure felt special! Zjok activated his jet-pack and flew back to his designated area, before any Asid guards were to discover him. Zjok couldn’t wait to show this to the Main Council of The AKBHE Building. This was wonderful!! He fell asleep in his bed for only fifteen minutes, before the young Asids were to begin their first hours of basic military training. Zjok kept the Drokensmur blood sealed tight in his black water container, which was being kept safe in his Vambit. Zjok didn’t feel like a loser, anymore, and he knew he was a hero.

Everything is Fine


Many Months Later

Zjok didn’t say a word about the Last Drokensmur’s visit. He wanted to wait before he was to be with the Asids’ own Main Core. He couldn’t hold still because he was so excited, and Preox thought his new behavior was quite peculiar.

“Are you okay, Jokky?” Preox asked, as they watched Asids practice their skills with the Probes.

Zjok looked and smiled at him. “I’m great! How’s you and…?”

Preox raised an eyebrow. “Oh! Kriket? Oh, yes well, I-I’m going to call her tonight, as a matter of fact. She may be younger, but she’s exceptionally intriguing.”

“I hear you on that,” Zjok laughed.

“So, are you still waiting for the Main Core to get back to you? It’s been weeks since you last contacted them, which is understandable; the Main Core had always been busier than any of us ever have. They’re the ones who practically control the entire planet, you know.”

This was true. The Main Core did not take well with appointments with a single Asid. The Asids’ Main Core was always extremely busy with commanding ships and preparing other decisions for warfare, as well as other duteous chores for proper treatment of planet Suzia and its inhabitants. It would be a long while before Zjok could show off his Drokensmur blood discovery. Zjok had kept the blood safely hidden away in his cabinet, making sure that no one would see a simple hint of the substance. Zjok had often worried that someone would find the Drokensmur blood, laugh in Zjok’s face, and take all the credit in his new discovery. This was Zjok’s time now, his time to shine!

“I’m hoping I hear from the Core today,” Zjok replied, with a smile.

“What is that you wish to present to the Main Core?” Preox asked.

Zjok laughed a bit. “Oh you’ll see! You’re gonna love it.”

“If it’s worth waiting for that long, then I’m sure I will,” Preox said with a smile. They watched the young Kriket beat one of the practice Probes, without getting a single scratch. She faced Preox, waving at him. Preox

Chapter 17


smirked and waved back.

Zjok began to tease him. “Awwww! Preox and Kriket, so lovely!”

“Oh, shut your trap, Jokky.” This particularly fine moments was one of the last, before Preox became one of Zjok’s mortal enemies.

The end of the Asids first year of training was getting closer and closer. This got Preox excited because he would see Kriket more often, rather than only talking to her from Vambit-to-Vambit. Everything was going great for Preox, Kriket, and especially Zjok, indeed. One day, Zjok was sitting alone in his room, on the edge of his bed, twiddling his thumbs. He wasn’t sure what else to do today. Go eat? Go on a walk? Training was over for the day and Zjok had nothing to do. Preox had snuck into The Storage to be with Kriket, which seemed to give Zjok the impression that he was “busy.” Not only was Preox being a sneaky shit, but Ravocs having special relationships with any other Asid soldier was highly illegal. Looks like Kriket pushed him over the borderline. “Borderliinnne!”

Then, the unexpected happened, as Zjok’s Vambit began to make a ringing noise. Someone was summoning him. He activated his Vambit and a holo-graphic image appeared before him, revealing Admiral Bxir’s face. “Hay, skippy! Come on down to tha Main Core! I knu you has been waitin’ for us tah call ya down, so hurry up!”

“It’s been six months,” Zjok replied.

“Indeed! Now come here. Yew are dismissed.”

Zjok left his room immediately, with pure excitement. After taking his container full of Drokensmur fluids, he properly took the elevator down to the main floor of The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building. He left the elevator and took a right, only to see a massive door, plated with crystal. The door was see-through and Zjok could see Claknibox and Admiral Bxir beside it. “’Bout time you showed up, sissy sis!” Bxir shouted.

“I appreciate your attendance, Ravoc Zjok,” Claknibox said.

Zjok smiled, he was so nervous. “Thank you, Magnate.”

“Now,” Bxir began, puffing a cigar, “let’s see whatchu got, boy.”

Zjok was seated at a small table, sitting before the Core. There were about twenty members in total, excluding the two Asid guards, who stood

Everything is Fine


inside their own Main Core pedestals. It was as if Zjok was at a personal court hearing. One of the guards, standing next to Zjok, happened to Setil, the Asid who used to bully Zjok in his past time. Setil looked down at him, snickering. Zjok did not feel like seeing his face, nor hearing his voice. This was his moment, dammit!

The head Core member happened to be Setil’s brother, Ritnop, Zjok’s first Ravoc. He looked much taller and his Vambit was enormous.

“Alrighty,” Ritnop first said, once all Core members took their designated seats. Magnate Claknibox was on one side of Ritnop, as Admiral Bxir was designated on the other. “Zjok, the Main Core has called you today because you have scheduled an appointment with us exactly six months and two days ago. We do apologize for the long wait, things have been a little hectic. From what all Core members understand, however, we expect you to have something intriguing to share with us all. Go ahead, Ravoc.”

Zjok stood up and gulped. He was almost sweating. He was facing one of three Asid Military Main Cores of the entire planet of Suzia. This was as important as meeting with the president of the United States. Not really, but Zjok was under a great deal of sheer nervousness. “Uh yes, Head Ritnop, I have discovered something of extreme value. I discovered it a day before I requested this meeting. I believe it will be the ultimate solution against the Adoa, as well as many other enemies alike, and protecting this planet for centuries to come.” Zjok continued to talk about how he had discovered the Last Drokensmur, who was willing to allow Zjok to extract his blood and create a powerful concoction. The guards, standing next to him, couldn’t help but laugh, especially Setil.

“Head Ritnop,” Setil began, “the Drokensmur have been deceased for centuries. There’s no way, in hell, that this blithering moron could’ve met one!”

Zjok’s temper rose. “Confined ham, it’s true! Drokensmur can live for millions of years, if they consistently remain in their evaporated state.”

“This is true,” Ritnop replied, with a sarcastic smile. He and the rest of the Core members thought that Zjok was pulling their legs. This would eventually get Zjok into a lot trouble, but Ritnop wanted to see what was “really going on,” before they were to do so. “You seem so confident in your

Chapter 17


discovery, young Envoy. Would you be comfortable in showing the entire Main Core what you’ve obtained?”

Zjok was shaking, as he took the container full of Drokensmur blood and gave it to Setil. Setil took a look at the container, smirked, activated his jet-pack, and flew up to Ritnop’s pedestal. Ritnop opened the container, expecting for Zjok’s claim to be a bunch of bullshit. The blue blood shined bright on his face, startling the Core members. Setil looked over his shoulder with wide eyes. Ritnop showed an expression of true fear on his face. He turned to his brother and gave him the container. “Take this away for high-security isolation and inspection.”

“Yes, Head Ritnop,” Setil obeyed and began to take off with the container. Zjok got very confused.
















“WAIT, WHAT?!” he shouted, causing everyone to look at him. “W-what happened?! What’s wrong?”

Ritnop stood up behind his pedestal. “The substance you’ve obtained is strictly prohibited to be in this vicinity. It has to be disposed of properly, before it is used as something far more dangerous.”

Zjok couldn’t speak. He was too shocked, angry, and utterly upset.

Everything is Fine


“Look at him,” Zjok heard Setil laugh, “he’s gonna cry!”

“Zjok, your idea is absurd and threatening against this planet,” Ritnop announced. “I suggest you leave the premises, now. Anyone should know that the substance of the Drokensmur was the most powerful material in the universe. Who called in this dummy, anyway?”

Zjok didn’t move, as a tear rolled down his cheek. He felt like a failure, once again, just like he always had been.

“Look at him! You big cry baby!” shouted Setil, who was hovering with his Vambit, holding the container. “A second class Envoy Officer is crying, before the Main Core of Suzia! This Asid is nothing more than a pathetic failure!”

“That’s enough, you flag-nugget!” Bxir shouted at Setil.

Zjok’s eye twitched, and he began to cry harder, as he grinded his teeth. He was not sad, at all. He was deathly inflamed. All that anger, sadness, and inner deep thoughts of failure and dissatisfaction, revolved in his head like a hurricane. Zjok had been a ticking bomb and it was time for the explosion.

“Zjok,” Claknibox stood up from his pedestal, also ordering Setil to shut up. “Are you alright, Asid?”

Zjok looked up at him, crying and smiling at the same time. It was a disturbing sight. “Sure, Magnate Claknibox! Everything is fine! Everything is just FINE AND DANDY!”

Before the other guard, could escort the Asid out of the Core, Zjok punched him in the face, taking his rifle and shooting him down. It was all slow motion for Zjok, especially since he had just killed one of his kind. Setil open fire on Zjok, who was a horrible shot. Zjok shot his Vambit, causing Setil to fall fifty feet to the concrete floor. Zjok activated his jet-pack and auto-turrets in his Vambit and unleashed a hailstorm of heavy fire-power, before the rest of the Main Core could fire upon him. Zjok was screaming at the top of his lungs, as he watched Ritnop, Claknibox, and other Cores fall from their pedestals to their deaths. Zjok felt a rush of excitement taking over his mind. He was completely engulfed with pure self-satisfaction. This was his destiny! He finally ceased fire, as a loud siren began blaring, and Zjok laughed devilishly. “Oh, you putrid animals!” He found the container, near Setil and was still alive, just barely. Zjok approached him, with a frown on

Chapter 17


his face. “Aw, poor widdle Setil! Did he get a boo-boo?!” Setil moaned weakly, trying to get up. “Pitiful boon. You should’ve listened to me. Instead, you ridiculed me. This will cease, along with your death!”

Zjok shot Setil in the stomach, allowing his enemy to suffer an agonizing death. Zjok screamed again, crying and laughing at the same time. “Oh, dearest me! There’s going to be reinforcements! Whatever shall I do?! Oh, I know! Each Core member’s pedestal is also a special launch pod! I shall use this for my escape from this pathetic place! Let me work on a few schematics and switches! Oh, I almost forget my blood!”

Zjok picked up his container full of Drokensmur blood and realized that nothing out of the ordinary was happening. He had remembered that there would be “dire consequences if the blood was to be used improperly.” “Oh, I see. The Drokensmur wanted me to realize that the Asids were the true enemy! HA! This is my destiny! Thank you, mighty Drokensmur!”

Zjok went to Claknibox’s pedestal and activated the controls for the launch pod. He sat calmly in the seat of the pedestal, as the pedestal transformed into a launch pod. It lifted up from the ground, at maximum speed, thus crashing through The AKBHE’s ceiling. Zjok was no longer a part of the Asid Military. He was now a most threatening nemesis. He had no idea where to go next, either. As long as he was far away from Suzia, he was happy. “If the Main Core thought my idea was dreadful, then many others might as well think so, too. Asids, you will receive your punishment. I promise you this.”


Everything is Fine


Many Hours Later


When Preox heard the news, he couldn’t believe it, until he actually saw what had happened. He and Kriket had made it to the first floor of The AKBHE Building, where many Ravocs, Commons, Guards, Envoys, Heads, Magnates, and Admirals were inside the Main Core room. Preox and Kriket watched, in horror, as Medical Asids carried dead Core members out of the area.

“Preox,” Kriket said, it was the first time she had called him by his real name, other than just calling him “Ravoc Preox.” Preox didn’t turn his attention to her, he was too busy paying attention to what has happened. He couldn’t believe that his best friend had betrayed the Asid Military. He and Kriket watched Asids take Admiral Bxir away, who seemed to be miraculously alive.

“Oh my God,” Preox said under his breath and followed the Asids carrying the Admiral away. “Admiral! It’s Ravoc Preox, what happened?!”

“Oh, put me down, Guards!” Bxir ordered. The Guards set him down.















“As yew can see, Asids!” Bxir yelled angrily. “I is okay! Jist a broken back, is all!”

Chapter 17


“We thought you were dead, Admiral,” Preox said with hesitance.

“Wail, then,” Bxir said, coughing up tremendous amounts of blood. “I is okay, Prex! Simmer down, now! Anyway, from what I can remember is tha’ I play’d dead, so I can avoid gittin’ kill’d! Zjok went absolutely ape-shit in this joint. He start’d to cry a bit, then he gone kill Magnate Claknibox r-right in front of meh…” Admiral Bxir broke down and sat on the floor, sobbing. Kriket and Preox knelt beside him. Kriket began to cry, too. Preox showed no emotion. “Zjok is… absolutely evil, y’all.”

“Why?” Preox asked. He really couldn’t think of anything else to say.

“H-he jist snapped,” Bxir added. “I’m gone keel that prick tha next time I see ‘im!” Preox thought deep inside his head, thinking about all the moments when Zjok was ridiculed, humiliated, and teased, ever since they first arrived at The AKBHE Building. Zjok was finally pushed over the edge of sanity. There was no telling what he would do now.

“Oh,” Bxir exclaimed, finally getting up weakly. “That dirt bag brought somethin’ an’ took it wit’ him, when he escaped in tha launch pawd. We din’t believe him at first, but it was Drokensmur blood. None of the other Asids know of this, but, Drokensmur blood is tha most dangerous and powerful substance, known to tha universe. We don’t even know what it can do!

“I know that,” Preox added. “I’ve done much research.”

Kriket, who was still sobbing, still had the strength to tease Preox. “You nerd.”

Bxir faced Preox and Kriket, the three of them standing up again. “Yer Zjok’s best friend righ,’ Prex?”

“Oh, I’m not. He betrayed us, Bxir.” It almost physically hurt Preox to say those words about Zjok. This was all hurtful for him and many others.

“We have tah git that blood out of his hands, Prex. Quick, do you still have ‘im tracked on yer Vambit? Yew tew were both Ravocs together, righ’? Check yer Vambit, hopefully he hasn’t gone too far or deactivated his tracking system.”
