Preox activated his Vambit and up came a holo-graphic image, showing a yellow dot in the middle of the screen. Zjok was not far.

“It looks like the launch pod had taken Zjok to…Oh no.”

Kriket looked at the screen and gasped. “Planet Fleek.”

Everything is Fine


“Tha home of tha Adoa…” Bxir finished.

Then, that was when Preox’s Vambit started to ring. Zjok was calling him.

“It’s Zjok,” Preox said, as his temper was rising. Other Asids surrounded them, watching Preox’s Vambit. They were all angry and full of hatred towards the new traitor. Preox answered the call.

“Hey, Preox, ol’ pal! It’s Zjok! Oh, I see you’ve got the whole family with ya! Too bad they couldn’t be my family! Hell, none of you were in the first place, by the looks of it. Well, how do ya like me now, Asids?! I have what you want, don’t I? Well, come get it.”

“Zjok, you’re on a planet infested with Adoa Mazers and Strikers,” Preox replied, “what makes you think you won’t be dead, within the next few seconds?”

Zjok started laughing hoarsely. As he did, Admiral Bxir took some of Preox’s data to get the information where Zjok was calling from. This would be of great use for when they actually go to planet Fleek and steal the Drokensmur blood from Zjok.

“Oh, Preox!” Zjok shouted. “You have no idea how much luck I’ve had on this planet! Apparently, the Adoa realize how much I hate all of you and they would certainly love to help me accomplish the task I am going to perform, starting with this container full of Drokensmur blood.”

“You’re bluffing,” Preox replied.

“Oh, no siree! See for yourself! Come here, Galg!” Galg, the Chief of the Mazers, was now on the image, waving at the Asids. Everyone gasped in horror, as Zjok and Galg laughed their evil laughs. “Can you believe that all of this happened within hours?! Damn, I’m good! All that training really pulled through, didn’t it?! At least I am accepted here!”

Preox ended the call and started walking away, with an angry expression on his face. Kriket and Bxir followed him.

“We have to go get that blood,” Bxir said, “who knows what Zjok is capable of, now.”

“Admiral, you do realize that would be a suicide mission, correct? The Adoa have always been a common enemy of the Asids. You can’t possibly believe we can retrieve the remnants of the Drokensmur so easily?”

Chapter 17


“Indeed,” Bxir answered, “although, we may have a new partner fer you to aide you in this mission, which will take place within months, Prex.”

“Me?!” Kriket shouted happily.

“NO!” Preox shouted. “Kriket, hunny-poop, you’re not even a Common! This is not a mission for you.”

“Hate tah break it to yah, sis,” Bxir said

, “Prex is right! Here, let’s take tha elevators.”

The three Asids took the elevator, going up several floors in The ABKHE Building. Preox found it strange that he already had a new partner, within hours since Zjok had betrayed the Asids. “Admiral, who’s my ‘new partner?’”

“The Main Core wasn’t so sure how he was recruited into this vicinity, concerning the fact that he’s an Aziquet,” Bxir answered.

“Who is he?”

“A special feller, by tha name of Rig.”

“Hmm, interesting,” Preox replied with a shrug. “Hopefully he isn’t a crazy maniac, like Zjok. Jeez, I can’t believe this is happening.”

“Believe it, Envoy Officer,” Bxir concluded.




















Everything is Fine


Meanwhile, outside Planet Fleek

Zjok wandered around the massive Adoa base, orbiting the planet, known as Fleek. He loved how every Adoa Mazer and Striker saluted to him. Galg followed him, carrying a massive rifle.

“You fools really didn’t have a leader?”

“Yes,” Galg replied, “we were almost too helpless, before you came along. Zjok, sir, you do realize that if you’re tricking us, we will all bring you down within a second?”

Zjok cackled. “Oh, is it proof that you need?!” He took off his Vambit, threw it on the floor, took Galg’s rifle, and blasted it to bits.

Galg laughed. “What is your first order of business, Master Zjok?”

“First,” Zjok began, “make me a new Vambit. Next, we’re going to build our own, customary Adoa Probes. They can be used as exceptional soldiers. And finally, help me obtain hot lava and ice from a comet. We’re going to make good use of this Drokensmur blood. The concoction we will create shall be called, The Misara Serum. It will be the weapon of ultimate destruction, containing powers of massive annihilation. We must protect the blood, for the concoction will take a couple years to create. In the meantime, I will strive to create newer colonies with this amazing army of mine. I deserve all this power, not the Asids, not anyone!”

“Beautiful,” Galg replied. “Anything else, sir?”

“Does this place have vending machines?”

“Why, of course.”

“Take me to them!”

Another Couple Weeks Later: Adoa Invasion on Suzia – Before Preox and Rig’s Expedition to Retrieve the Misara Serum.

Preox was pissed, and far beyond it! Zjok thought it would be fun to surprise planet Suzia with a daring attack. Not only attack, but to take down The AKBHE Building. This was long before Preox and Rig were to venture out into space to retrieve Zjok’s super weapon. Unfortunately, thanks to Zjok’s efficient strategically enhanced brain, Zjok was one step ahead of the Asids. Zjok knew that the Asids were going to attempt to steal his weapon of mass destruction. So Zjok invaded Suzia, starting with The AKBHE Building.

Chapter 17

Just moments after Preox been rudely interrupted from his slumber by the sounds of disturbing explosions, teamed up with Rig and Kriket who were all ready for some combat. His only means of escape was to venture through the entire building before it were to collapse into rubble. Preox could not risk getting shot down by any ships or any Adoa Probes that lingered through the air. He wasn’t so sure about the plan, either, though he knew it would be enough time to escape from Zjok’s clutches. Preox was definitely wrong on that part.

Alongside the fact that Preox thought that planet Strom would be a great idea to rendezvous to, he, Kriket, and Rig were running to Bxir’s ship on the surface of Suzia, once finally escaping from their enemies Preox and Kriket turned and looked up, for the Adoa was constantly striking The AKBHE Building, with their deadly fighter ships. More Mazers exited the building, firing their rifles at them. Preox fired continuous rounds from his rifle and Vambit, killing as many enemies as he could.

“WOO! Go Preox!” Rig shouted excitingly, blowing Mazer brains away.

“Brilliant work, Rig!” Preox shouted, firing his rifle at Probes which were flying by, shooting down only a couple. “Come on, guys! We’re almost to the ship. We got to get to planet Strom, now! It should give us some time to eventually lose the Adoa from tracking us down. In the meantime, Kriket, I wanna—.” PEEEEW!

Purple fire-power flashed in Preox’s eyes and the next thing he knew, he was on the ground and being picked up by Rig. Was struggling to breathe. The searing pain in his throat was extraordinary. He couldn’t scream in agony, nor could he speak. He throat was ultimately shot, by one lucky shot. He couldn’t hear a thing and he could see Kriket crying out for him, as she was shooting down more Adoa Mazers.

“MAGNATE PREOX IS DOWN! I R-REPEAT, MAGNATE PR-PREOX IS DOWN! Oh, God, hang in there honey, please don’t go anywhere, please. DIE, YOU UGLY BASTARDS!” Bxir’s ship took off at last, barely escaping the Adoa’s clutches. As they left, The AKBHE Building began to slowly collapse, from the thousands of feet it once stood.


Everything is Fine


Several Days Later


After Preox’s throat was shot, he miraculously recovered, even though he ended up in a deep coma for about a week. He made it to planet Strom, all thanks to Bxir, but planet Strom wasn’t the first thought that occurred to him when he finally awoke. He saw a nice pair of Asid female breasts, as he weakly opened his eyes. They weren’t bare breasts, though plenty of cleavage was revealed. This made Preox think, Am I in heaven? What is this amazing view over my face? This certainly does not feel like I am dead, however my blood seems to flowing well. A little TOO well.

It was Kriket. She happened to be leaning over Preox, as he lay in a most comforting cot, working on machines that kept Preox’s health stable. She gasped with surprise and lunged herself at Preox.

“Owwwwww!” Preox shouted, reacting to the pain from his body, but quickly shut his mouth. His voice. It was raspy and hoarse. It sounded terrible. He felt his throat, which was patched up very professionally. “Kriket, w-what happened? W-why is my voice like this?”

















Chapter 17


“You were shot,” Kriket immediately answered. “You were shot almost a week ago, as we were escaping from the Adoa. We left the planet as soon as we could. Luckily, thanks to your idea, we lost them. We’ve been stationed on Strom for a while now, though I doubt we will stay any longer. Thank God it wasn’t just us who got away. Anyway, Bxir allowed me to fix you up. I trained for the medical programs, back before The AKBHE was destroyed, and I have become efficient enough to actually work on patients. On top of that, Admiral Bxir promoted me to be a Common 19 years early. Awesome, right? As for your voice, sweetie, it will no longer be the same, like it was before. I did all I could, but you’re going to sound raspy and hoarse for the rest of your life.”

Preox was silent. He couldn’t believe all of this had happened. It was like Zjok was never best friend. He was just a stranger, an awful stranger. “What about my Vambit? Kriket, we need to stop Zjok. We need to get the Misara Serum. We need to dispose of it properly.”

“That’s what Bxir was focusing on before The AKBHE was attacked. Surely, you can’t go on your own?”

“Of course not. Rig seems like the valuable asset to help me. We must make this possible; we must put an end to all of this. Drokensmur blood is powerful, beyond any proportion. We have no idea what it’s capable of in any other bodily system, other than the Drokensmur themselves. I don’t like this, I don’t like this one bit. We must stop Zjok before he decides to use the Serum into full effect. I-I… O-oh God, my voice.”

“Oh, hun,” Kriket replied, as she sat on Preox’s bed. She put her hand over his, but he moved it casually. Preox was in no mood for affection.

“Thank you, Kriket,” Preox said silently. He was having a silent meltdown and Kriket knew that.

“You can thank Rig, too,” she replied. “Do you know what else what we can do? With the Serum? With the Adoa? With Zjok?”

Preox didn’t look at her like she was looking at him. “Honestly, Kriket, I have no idea. It would have to take something extraordinary to help us fix this problem. Something super.”

Chapter 18: Oh, Great!















Kriket could not believe how productive the Area 72 cafeteria was, on this particular night. Good food was made, although it was foreign for those who have never been on Earth’s surface before. Kriket decided to get some food with Rig, who happened to be standing in line with a lunch tray in his hands. He looked filthy, for he and many others have been working on the old Asid ship, let alone restoring general functions of the only Area 72 facility in existence.

“Hey, Krikey!” Rig shouted enthusiastically. “Fancy seeing you here, pretty lady.”

Kriket smiled, for the first time in a long time. Rig was always happy, even when there was devastating chaos! “Hello, Rig. How’s the ship coming along?”

“Good, I suppose,” Rig replied, grabbing a cinnamon roll. “It isn’t able to be up and running yet, because it hasn’t been used in a long time, I guess. It’s also been a pain because most of the researcher dudes took several of the


Chapter 18


parts, which was originally needed for the ship, to different areas across the planet. You know how humans are and their needful research! Bxir believes that we won’t be able to finish it in time, since the Adoa could be at the Misara Serum’s destination, in any minute. But hey, at least we got food. I like food.”

“How is Preox?” Kriket asked, once her and Rig were seated to a table.

“Cranky as an old man,” Rig smiled with a giggle, as he wolfed down his cinnamon rolls. “How’re you, Krikey? You been lookin’ all sad ‘n’ stuff, lately.”

Kriket didn’t want to answer that question; it would lead to talking about her and Preox’s personal life together, long before all this madness began. This was Rig she was talking to. He’d probably just start teasing her or start singing a love song. So, Kriket definitely decided to change the subject. “Are you okay with the way he treats you? He’s constantly yelling at you and calling you names.”

Rig giggled some more, as food fell out of his mouth. “I know I hasn’t been in Preox’s life for over a year, but I know that he’s constantly hurt every day. He doesn’t like to talk about what’s bugging him, but that’s okay. I’m fine with the way he talks to me. It’s better than not having him talk to me at all, especially when all this… dooty-poop… is happening.”

“Zjok was like that,” Kriket replied. “He was constantly upset about something, but he never wanted to talk about it. I feel worried that Preox might snap, like Zjok did.”

Rig downed two cartons of milk, before he replied. “I know Preox wouldn’t do that. You knows that, Krikey! Try talking to him, alrighty? Even if he pushes you away. YELL AT HIM, if you have to, hahahaha! This food is so good. I’m happy to be making poop again, it’s been a real privilege.” Kriket looked at the Aziquet strangely, as she took a bite out of her pasta. She seemed to really enjoy human food

Preox approached the two of them, carrying a plate of salad. He calmly set his food on the table, next to Rig, and sat down. He looked about as worn-out as anybody else was. “Bxir ordered me to take a break. The ship is not even functional, yet! He insisted for me to grab a bite to eat because he believes that we have ‘enough time.’ We have no idea when the Adoa is

Oh, Great!













entering this planet! Rrgh, that Admiral, I swear!”

“Jeez, Preox,” Rig replied, “calm your testicular devices, dude. Chill out, brah! Here, have a sunflower seed.”

“Rig…” Preox began, but didn’t finish. He just stared at Rig and took a bite out of his salad. “Common Kriket, I’ve been wanting to talk to you. In private.”

Kriket smiled faintly, though pretended to sound upset. What could Preox possibly want to talk about? “What is it, Magnate Preox?”

Preox got chills, once Kriket called him by his formal rank. It actually got him a little excited, really excited. “Just talk to me in private, Common. Rig, you stay here and play with yourself.”

“Yes, sir!” Rig shouted with a salute and began to play with his antennae, like a kitten playing with string. Preox stood up from his seat, followed by Kriket. Kriket felt the need to seduce Preox, despite the fact that she missed him dearly. Kriket was always the mischievous, little she-devil, especially around Preox. However, Kriket wanted to play “hard-to-get” because of Preox’s recent ignorance against her. Preox and Kriket wandered through the partially damaged hallways of the vicinity. Damages created by those bad Probes.

Chapter 18


“What is that you want to talk about?” Kriket asked innocently, once there weren’t any humans or Asids around.

Preox sighed, as he stopped and took a look at the younger Asid, her eyes as clear as the beautiful skies of planet Suzia. “Kriket, I want to apologize for my upmost temper these last few weeks. I also, strongly, apologize that I left you and the others on Strom, instead of searching for you, after we got separated from that immense amount debris. I hope you understand that we’re facing an extreme conflict beyond measure. Not only are we but five Asids, and one ill-minded Aziquet, facing an entire enemy fleet, but we are also under the responsibility of saving this planet from facing its doom.”

Preox continued to talk about everything that was happening. Kriket found it boring, for she already knew what was going on, obviously. So why was she just standing there, listening to her Magnate babble on and on? She asked herself this question, also, right before she lunged herself onto Preox, kissing him deeply on his pale-green lips. Holy crap. Preox struggled to keep talking, but immediately gave in. He hadn’t felt the touch of Kriket’s soft lips in months. It was refreshing, yet motivating.

They stopped kissing for a moment, so Kriket could talk. “You talk too much, Magnate, you know that? Of course I forgive you, hon.’ I understand that you and Rig had to leave Strom in such haste, I really do. I’m also more than happy to see you again, face-to-face… bodies touching…”

Preox got chills running down his spine, smiling for the first time in a long while. “Let’s go find a more secluded place, though, alright? I wouldn’t want anyone learning from our secret moves.”

“Why, of course.” The two redeemed lovers started making out again, which seemed to be quite sloppy.

“Oh, fer the love of cranberry sauce!” Bxir’s voice rang, alarming both Preox and Kriket. “Prex, I know I sed to take a break, but if you wanna do this, please do it somewhere else.”

“We were only kissing, Admiral,” Kriket replied.

Bxir happened to be with Zitkir and Drox, as well. “I know, Common, but I don’t wanna git all jealous an’ what-not, like I already am, righ’ now.”

Oh, Great!


“Our apologies, Admiral Bxir,” Preox said. “We will go perform our provocative actions, elsewhere.”

“Well don’t tell us, either!” Bxir shouted and walked away with Zitkir and Drox, who were snickering. Preox and Kriket were just about to leave the premises, until Kriket’s Vambit began making extremely crude sounds. The noises caused Bxir, Zitkir, and Drox to approach them, once again. “Wha’ tha hail is that noise, Common?!”

Preox started looking at Kriket’s Vambit, whose lights were flashing rapidly. “Oh, damn, Kriket, your Vambit is getting hacked. I can stop it if I can restart the system, but that would risk your Vambit of total deactivation. What I need is--.”

Preox was ultimately interrupted when Kriket’s Vambit wielded two of the turrets built inside it. The turrets pointed at Bxir, Zitkir, and Drox, who immediately raised their hands in the air.

“Kriket! Don’t point those things at us!” Drox shouted in alarm. Agents and marines came in the hallway from the cafeteria, pointing their guns at poor Kriket.

“I’m not doing this! Someone hacked into my Vambit!”

“That I did, Common Kriket,” came Zjok’s devil-like voice. His face was seen on a large holo-graphic image, which was projecting over Kriket’s Vambit.














Chapter 18

HA!”

“Good thing I hacked into Kriket’s Vambit, when we had the chance,” Galg said, with a laugh.

“What was that?” Zjok startled. “You mean, ‘good thing I hacked into you and all the other Asids’ Vambits, when we had the chance?’”

Galg remained silent and Zjok knew that he messed up. “I thought you only told me to hack into Kriket’s.”

Zjok scratched his head, not making a sound. “Galg. I know that you’re the Chieftain of the Mazers and Strikers for one simple reason! And that reason was to be SMART! Rrgh! Anyway, before I POP A BLOOD VESSEL, I am grateful to say that we’re almost to Earth! I think things will get a bit spicier, when my enemies know of my current position ahead of time. It makes everything more fun, especially when I will be busy annihilating this filthy planet, which we already know so much about!

“On another note, I’m glad that you guys actually survived my Probe attack, earlier, because that was merely an inspection! Having those Probes are so helpful to see what we, the Adoa, are going to be up against! I mean, I know the Adoa had colonized many planets in the past, before I ‘took the throne,’ but these Probes have been so helpful, don’t you think?! Now, this time, I will kill all who is facing my face, by the use of this young Asid’s Vambit. Oh, I do love killing the things I hate! As a reminder, I am getting closer to Earth, you guys! We will be where the Misara Serum is located! Be there, or be square, or be dead! Zjok, out!”

Preox deactivated the Vambit, right before Kriket’s hacked auto-turrets were about to open fire. Her Vambit sparked, indicating dysfunction. He took it off Kriket, before she hugged him tight. “It wasn’t my fault, I swear.”

“Yeah, it was that butthole’s fault!” Rig shouted, who had just had a late appearance into the scene.

“Rig, shut up,” Preox simply replied. It was time to take action.

Oh, Great!














Eating food and making out was no longer necessary. There was simply no telling exactly when the Adoa would invade Earth. They all had to leave Area 72 as, soon as possible.

“Okay,” Preox continued, as marines and agents stood in front of him. “Kriket, I’m sorry, but we’re going to have to repair your Vambit. I’m not sure when that will happen because we are neck-deep in shit right now! Anyway, Bxir, Zitkir, Drox, and Rig, get back to the Asid ship. We’re going to fix it, even if it takes us all night. Commander Derno! Are you here?”

“Here,” Derno was heard, as he was making his way through the small crowd. “I got good news and bad news.”

“SPIT IT OUT!” Preox hollered, spitting in Derno’s face.

“The good news is that Area 72’s communications are up and running again. The bad news is that I called the president, told him about what is about to go down, he doesn’t believe me, and won’t send me any reinforcements, until next week. Area 72 is hardly ever respected.”

The hallway was silent, especially Preox, until he approached Derno. “Your president is a lubricated moron.” Rig started laughing obnoxiously. “Although, the Asid ship can carry up to fifty, along with heavy artillery. What I suggest we do, now, is get all the weaponry we can possibly find, especially armor (We will need armor and lots of it.). As for those who will join us in this fight, who will? Anyone?”

Chapter 18

















Many of the agents and marines rose their hands. There were at least twenty of them, which was a good start. “Alright, we must alert the others on this base about this, also.”

“I’ll go,” came a voice. It was a familiar, high-pitched kid-like voice. It was Agent Moosey17.

Everyone laughed, except Moosey, who was on all four of his legs. He made a stern look and stood on his hind legs, standing as tall as Preox. “I know I have messed up before, but hey, people make mistakes. And so do moose, like me. I’m willing to not only fight for this planet, but for me as well. Chapter 19: Secret Ulterior Motives













Oh, lovely, a gang war broke out in a suburban neighborhood. Not just any suburban neighborhood, but a “ghetto” suburban neighborhood. As members of opposing gangs used illegal weaponry against each other, the Kingzing City Police Department got caught in the middle of the outbreak. “You know, if you police crabs would stay out of this, this wouldn’t have happened!’” shouted a gang member, who constantly fired a golden AK-47, as well as taking cover behind a trash can. Things were starting to get a bit hardcore, especially since there were a few dead gang members lying in the street. Looks like Kingzing City needed a hero.

“This is Officer Crabapple,” spoke an officer into his walkie-talkie. He spoke, as he took cover behind his car with two more officers. “We got a 10-71, we are under heavy fire, and we need back-up on the double! I should be celebrating my birthday, instead of this crap.”

Chapter 19


“This is your lovely hero, Blue Lazer, back-up is on the way!

The cop seemed puzzled, “Blue Lazer? How’d you get a neat and awesome walkie-talkie, like mine?”

“Look behind you, buddy-boy!” Blue Lazer’s voice came in again. Officer Crabapple turned around to see Blue Lazer had taken cover with the three desperate officers. He was holding one the officer’s walkie-talkies, giving a thumbs up. “He let me use it! Isn’t it cool?!” A bullet ended up piercing in Blue Lazer’s arm, followed by a grunt of agony.

“Oh, jeez!” shouted Officer Crabapple. “Are you okay?!”

Blue Lazer grunted again, as his arm began to rapidly heal. “Rrrgh, yeah. You get used to the pain after a while. Now, I’m pissed because I promised myself to not get blood on my shirt today!”

Another officer started laughing, as bullets hit the other side of their cover. “You remind me of my marriage.”

Blue Lazer ignored that. “Okay, officers, I got it from here alright?”

“Thanks, man,” Officer Crabapple replied, with a sigh of relief. Blue Lazer took the shotgun from Crabapple’s hands and took a few shells with him. Before he left from cover, Crabapple informed the hero. “Blue Lazer, those gang members aren’t scared of anything, be careful.”

Blue Lazer pumped the shotgun. “Oh, there will be a Code Brown level of fright, tonight!” Despite the fact that it was, indeed, night time on a Friday night, Blue Lazer came out of cover and pointed his shot gun at the gang members.

“Okay, buddy-boys! This is Blue Lazer, so you’re all pretty much screwed! Put down you’re weapons, shut up, and prepare to go to the Happy Land of PRISON! Thanks to the Misara Serum, Blue Lazer’s body had become used to getting seriously injured to a point where no gunshot wounds were fatal. Blue Lazer was almost invulnerable. Blue Lazer continued to fight off the gang members, who desperately tried their best to take him down, as the KCPD observed the scene.

Secret Ulterior Motives















Blue Lazer finished off the last gang member by kicking him in the stomach and karate-chopping his neck. “WOO! I always wanted to karate-chop someone. wangsters need to learn some manners.”

Blue Lazer laughed. “Indeed, officer. It’s my pleasure to have helped! I’ll see you around.”

Blue Lazer flew off into the beautiful Kingzing City night sky. He flew all the way to Axyl Smithy’s apartment, landing on the balcony. He opened the sliding door and walked into the quiet home. He took off his cheesy ninja mask and cape, thus transforming back into the typical teenager of Axyl Matthew Smithy. “Oh, man. I better wash my clothes before Dad gets home. He would absolutely freak out if he saw blood-stained clothes in the house. He might even think ‘I’m on my period’, or something.”

Chapter 19


Axyl laughed to himself and paused. “Yeah, he would definitely think that.” Axyl took his Blue Lazer outfit and stuffed it into the washing machine, along with other clothes. Once the laundry started, Axyl wandered off -only wearing boxer briefs-, slouched on the living room couch, and turned on the TV. “Oh, jeez, what a rough day. One moment I’m filling out a Biology exam and the next thing I know, I’m in the middle of a gang war. I ought to write that one down in my diary! Haha… Diary. Diarrhea. God, I’m tired. I wonder what time it is.”

Axyl took his phone out of his boxers and looked at the time. It was 7:45, which was not a good sign. Axyl had a date tonight with Holly, at eight! “Holy, Stromboli! I gotta get ready within fifteen minutes!” Despite the fact that Axyl just did math, for the first time all week, he hastily got up from the couch, and ran upstairs into his bedroom.


Holly’s House.


Meanwhile, at Holly’s house, which was located exactly two miles from Axyl’s apartment, Holly Ransfield was making a few finishing touches with her makeup and hair. She stared at herself in a mirror, whilst standing in her messy room. She wore a typical jacket and denim jeans. Then, she began to talk to herself, out of pure anxiety. “Alright, please don’t look fat. This is Axyl Smithy that you’re going out with, tonight. I know that makes my eye twitch, but what he did was unforgettable and awesome. Remember that, Holly, REMEMBER IT!”

Holly seemed to be alone in her house, due to the awkward silence, after she had yelled at herself in the mirror. She looked beautiful, her hair was carefully curled, and her lips were glistening with gloss. She sighed with distress. She had never felt so nervous before in her entire life. She had never been on a date before, either. She sighed deeply as she often wished that she never reserved the date in the first place, especially at the critically-acclaimed restaurant known as The Dookoran. It was in her nature to despise Axyl and for all the things he’s done to her and Kyle in the past. Alas, Holly couldn’t just cancel, even though her crude and bitchy attitude most certainly would.

Secret Ulterior Motives


Holly had a reason for going on a date with Axyl tonight and that was only to be revealed when the time was right, according to her. “Ugh, that’s it, I’m changing.” She took off her jacket, her shirt, along with her pants, and opened her closet. Her closet was lacking in clothes, as other clothes were sprawled on her carpet. Her room was a mess and the quality was below average















Holly carefully examined her closest, thinking about what exactly she should wear. “Dammit, Axyl. I hate you, I hate you so much.” And at that moment, when she was really starting to despise Axyl and his unexpected charm, Holly had found something perfect that she could wear for the unexpected date. Axyl was wearing a typical flannel, tucked into a pair of jeans. He felt giddy and was absolutely full of excitement. It was now 7:55 and he had to leave, pronto! He put on his shoes and left the apartment, with his wallet in his back pocket. Tonight, Axyl’s wallet was his best friend. He made it into the parking garage, approaching his pick-up truck. He sighed with discontent, looking at his demolished tail-gate. Axyl got his car started and his phone started ringing. It was Kyle. Axyl drove out of the garage and answered the phone.

Chapter 19


“’Ay, buddy-boy! I’m on my way to Holly’s house.”

Axyl shook his head. “Yeah, I get it. What’re you up to tonight?”

Kyle sighed. “Performing my play, remember? I’m backstage right now, waiting for my next cue. There’s hardly anyone here!”

“I’m sorry, bro. I’ll be there, for sure, tomorrow!”

Kyle laughed. “You better be! Oh, snappy-poop, I’m up! Good luck, Axyl! Oh, and be careful.”

“Yes, Captain Crunch!”

“What?”

“Captain Crunch? The guy from Star Trek?”

Kyle sighed. “You mean Captain Kirk?!”

“Or something…?”

“Alright, I gotta go. I’ll talk to you later, bro!”

Axyl shrugged and hung up, as he drove up to Holly’s neighborhood street. The neighborhood was small and slightly deteriorated. One-story houses sat quietly in the brown grassy yards. From what Axyl saw so far, the neighborhood seemed to be helpless; abandoned for that matter. Axyl couldn’t help but feel slightly concerned.

He found her house. It was petite, with a light shade of pink. A small garden laid beneath the patio, adding emphasis to the house’s slight cuteness. Axyl’s palms began to sweat, his cheeks beginning to blush, and he felt like a sissy. Just months ago, he was a heartless dirt bag, and now he was practically ill of anxiety from taking a gorgeous girl out on a date. He felt as though he needed to punch flowers, in order to become a man again. Axyl looked closely at the small house, for he couldn’t tell if anyone truly lived there, or not. It was quiet and it looked like it was not inhabited (Axyl wouldn’t be surprised if Holly was playing a trick on him, anyway.). He pulled up on the driveway, took out the ignition, and exited the vehicle. The weather outside was absolutely fascinating, calm and windless.

He also could have sworn that the lightning was purple. As peculiar as that seemed, Axyl decided to shrug it off and carried on with his business.
