Axyl was widely impressed, for he had never been to a play before. “Wow, it’s like a theater or something but for real.” The audience started to grow and with only five minutes before the play were to take its course and begin its performance, Axyl began to look through the play program, which revealed the drama students’ role in the production.

Several of the cast members Axyl had recognized as them being victims of his past days of bullying. “Ha. I remember you. I hope you got new underwear, after that day. Hmm, I better apologize to you, too.” Axyl felt extremely pumped, for some reason. After having sexual interactions with his high school crush, Axyl wanted to get in a mutual fight. He, basically, was so happy that he could punch someone in the face. Axyl was slightly startled when the lights in the theatre came to a dim, for the play was about to begin, followed by a giddy middle-aged man walking on the stage.

Buddy-boy Better Watch It


“Hello, everyone, thank you for coming to tonight’s performance. I am Paul Archibeque, the director, and I just want to give a little speech before we plow on through this play. First things first…”

Paul Archibeque, the school’s most unique drama teacher, continued to rant on about who did what during the creation of the production, and who he was thankful for (such as the cast and crew members). He ended his speech, concluding that all cameras should be off “flash” and that all cell phones needed to be turned off. However, in this case, Axyl was not paying attention, for he was shooting text messages to his dad and to Holly. Axyl immediately stopped using his phone when the audience began to applaud and renaissance music began to play. Axyl, out of respect for Paul Archibeque, shut off his cell phone and watched the play commence. He and many others were completely unaware as to what was about to happen.














Just above Earth’s Orbit


Zjok sat in a typical lounge chair, eating crackers from a box, observing Earth’s beautiful site from the cockpit. He looked determined, keeping his eyes on the planet, shoving handfuls of crackers in his mouth. Jorfb, who happened to be standing next to him, officially broke the silence.

Chapter 20


“Uh, s-sir?” the Mazer stuttered. Zjok, with a quick reflex, slapped Jorfb across the face and looked up at him, his evil eyes glaring at him. A devilish smile spread across his face, which terrified most of the Adoa. “Are you excited as I am, Jorfb-y Poo? Lookit!” Zjok guided Jorfb, beside him, to the massive window, which was bestowed in front of the cockpit. Zjok, smiling brightly, squeezed Jorfb’s cheeks, as they focused on Earth. “Lookit how filthy that planet is. It’s completely overrun by insignificant, naked mole rats and a few disgusting Asids. We must eliminate them, Jorfb. However we must perform a different act, before-hand. Remind me, Jorfb, what will that be?”

“Recover the Misara Serum?” Jorfb answered, in the form of a question, he was never so sure what Zjok wanted or wanted to hear.

Zjok squeezed his cheeks harder, making Jorfb whimper. “EXACTLY!” After yelling, a few Mazers jumped in fear. “You, Jorfb, are so smart! You surely have made yourself worthy, ever since you brought milk into my presence. You know that milk and The Carpenters are both the banes of my existence, correct?” Jorfb nodded weakly and Zjok released his grasp from his sore cheeks. Jorfb sighed with relief, as he soothed his cheeks, hardly noticing Zjok grabbing a rifle from a nearby gun rack. He pointed the rifle with one hand (shoving more crackers in his mouth with the other), directly at the massive glass window. He pretended to shoot at Earth, muttering “pew pew pew.”

“HA!” he hollered, jump-scaring the Mazers, once again. “Many lives will be slaughtered, today, my fair lovelies. “Pew pew pew! Die, Earth, die!” He continued to pretend-shoot the Earth and, rather unexpectedly, pointed the rifle at Jorfb and fired… for reals. The blast was as loud as Zjok’s bellowing and made a few Mazers shriek in terror. Zjok had shot Jorfb directly in his temple, blowing his brains out. Jorfb’s dead body collapsed on the floor, his gray blood oozing on the walls and floor. “Oh, Jorfb, you ignorant boob. I hold grudges, like no other. You should have not brought the milk. Mazers, here are your new orders, before you mourn for Jorfb’s fate. I want you to clean this bloody mess and send in the first wave of troops, immediately. Galg and Yayvox will be ready, so don’t hesitate like Jorfb has done.” He walked closer to the massive window, munching on his crackers. “Hello,

Buddy-boy Better Watch It


Earth! You’re mine, now. I call dibsies!”


Kingzing City – 3:00 pm


“Hello, Officer Axtman,” a beautiful middle-aged woman said gleefully, approaching the officer. The woman and Axtman were in the attendance of a hotdog stand. The officer, who was fairly acquainted with Blue Lazer, was currently purchasing a delicious hotdog when the woman approached him.

“Good afternoon, Sue,” Axtman replied with a smile, after he bought his hotdog. “You look beautiful, as usual.”

Sue was wearing a professional black suit and a blinding smile. “Oh, officer, you’re always a gentleman. Are you on your lunch break?” Axtman took a bite of his hotdog and nodded, with a smile and hot dog-stuffed cheeks. “Well, officer Axtman, you mind if I joined you?”

“This one is on me,” Axtman replied and ordered another hotdog for Sue. She smiled happily and it was obvious that the two really, really liked each other. They might as well get married!

As hot dog man made Sue’s lunch (whose name was Ed), he took a slight glance at the sky, then again, with wide eyes. “What the hell is that?”

Confused, yet concerned, Officer Axtman and Sue looked up at the sky, seeing mysterious objects descend from the gloomy clouds. They were hurdling rapidly towards the city, which seemed threatening to many citizens. “What are those things?!” Sue exclaimed.

“A massive flock of geese?” Axtman suggested. The officer was dead wrong; especially when the objects in the sky seemed bigger as they descended closer towards the city. Citizens looked up at the sky in absolute awe. That all went away, quickly, when a scorching, green beam erected from one of the objects. The beam struck Ed’s hotdog stand, disintegrating it immediately. “Bro! Not my hotdogs!”

Citizens screamed and ran in horror, as more green beams of light struck buildings, cars, and even people. Axtman took Sue’s hand and they began to book it through the onslaught of a vicious, unexpected nightmare. “This is Officer Axtman, if you can hear what is happening through my

Chapter 20


walkie-talkie?! We’re in deep doo-doo, sports fans! I need backup, now! Kingzing City is under attack! I repeat, Kingzing City is under attack!”

“Who is attacking?” the officer on the other line, replied.

“THINGS! SEND IN BACKUP! LOTS OF IT! MORE BACKUP THAN YOUR MOTHER!”

A beam of light struck the ground, near Axtman and Sue’s feet, sending the couple flying. They landed harshly on the ground, as the city turned into an immediate war zone.















Axtman moaned in agony, slowly standing up to help Sue. “Oh God, Sue, are you alright?”

Sue got up, “Yeah, I think so. I mean, my outfit is kind of ruined.” The occurrence of extreme firepower stopped, once the objects were soaring at least ten feet over the streets of Kingzing City. Weird, alien beings, with massive guns, were descended from the objects, and began patrolling the area. Their stature was much taller than that of the humans; at least standing eight feet tall each. The aliens growled and roared viciously at the humans, as some shot and vaporized few. Axtman and Sue took off, as fast as they could, far away from the alien ships. As the two ran frantically, as terrified citizens, they saw another group of ships descend into the city. However, these ships appeared to be travelling in a different direction.

Buddy-boy Better Watch It


“Don’t be alarmed, humans,” bellowed a voice in an echo, “we only just want to kill you all!” It was Galg’s voice, projecting from one of the ships. “Bring us Blue Lazer! Bring him to us and you lucky few will be spared! We are the Adoa and we will always remain dominant! Though not in the kinky way! Well, I guess in a kinky way.” Axtman and Sue ended up hiding in a dumpster in a small alley way.

“Blue Lazer,” Axtman whispered in the dumpster, “please help us.”


Meanwhile


Axyl was laughing his ass off! He just loved watching Kyle perform on stage, wielding a sword and getting in “sword-fights,” as a part of the play’s choreography. Along with Axyl, the rest of audience was roaring with laughter, as Kyle and another actor dueled with “prop swords.” Of course the crappy choreography was intentional for comedy, however the swords that the two actors were using looked extremely realistic and dangerous. At one point, Axyl was convinced that Kyle’s neck was going to get slit. Although the sword fight was ridiculous, the two actors seemed to handle it very professionally. It was impressive and fun to watch.

“Where did you take the princess?” demanded the actor, portraying the character of Prince William (his real name being Andrew Castro).

Kyle’s character, Inigo Montoya, scoffed, “Wouldn’t you like to know? At least your loved one isn’t dead, like my father. He was killed by a six-fingered man!” Andrew swung his sword upward on Kyle’s, causing him to “drop it” on the ground. He pointed his sword at Kyle, who raised his hands in a form of surrender.

“Your father was killed by a six-fingered man?”

Kyle nodded, as he defiantly retrieved his sword and stood in a defiantly independent stance, and ranted a speech. “Yes, when I was a boy. You see the scars on my cheeks? That was him. Someday, I will find the six-fingered man and you know what I will say to him?”

Andrew kept his focus on Kyle, pointing his sword at him. “What will you say to him?”


Chapter 20














“I will say to the six-fingered man, ‘Hello, my name is Inigo Montoya, you killed my father. Prepare to--.’”

“DIE!” yelled a horrific voice, which startled many because it didn’t come from Kyle’s prepubescent voice. A small explosion occurred, blowing away the theatre entry doors. The audience screamed in terror, as Andrew and Kyle stood there in terror. A group of at least twenty Mazers entered the auditorium, aiming their rifles at everyone. A few more appeared from the backstage of the auditorium.

“Stay where you are, primitive screw heads,” announced an Adoa Mazer. “I am Ghed. My group of Mazers, and I, will take part in slaughtering each and every one of you, if you do not comply with our demands! You see, we are after something, something of virtue! And that virtue is Blue Lazer! Now, I must ask of you, where the hell is he?!”

“Screw this!” yelled another voice. It was Cale Omnous, who happened to be in the audience. He had gotten up out of his seat and began to make a run for it.

“Shoot,” Ghed ordered and a few Mazers immediately fired their rifles, killing Cale instantly. Axyl clung onto his seat, in complete shock. Cale was gone; those alien things killed him. What did Cale do to deserve that? Anger and hatred rose in Axyl’s mind, body, and soul. Cale was always his best friend and those alien bastards cut their friendship short. As the Adoa laughed at Cale’s dead, roasted body, Axyl quietly slipped under the auditorium seats.

Buddy-boy Better Watch It


“Was that Blue Lazer?” a Mazer asked Ghed. “That was awfully easy.”

“No it wasn’t, you boof,” Ghed replied. “Zjok simply stated that Blue Lazer would be tough to take down. Just another stupid civilian, I suppose. Okay! HUMANS! Do you not realize that all of your lives are fragile, putrid, and worthless? For we, the Adoa Empire, can diminish all of your lives, within an instant? And does it look like we would care? Of course not!”

“Sir, why don’t we just shoot them all?” the same Mazer asked.

“I like your idea, Mazer, however that is another stupid idea. Do you want to get shot, too?”

“NO! Um, no. Magnate Ghed, this is a concealed room, the humans are defenseless. Let’s just kill them all and if one of them is still standing, we’ll know who Super Twat is.”

Ghed grinned. “Mazer, I am impressed with your sudden increase in IQ. Change of plan, humans! I’m sorry, yet not sorry, to say that all of your lives are going to end, as of now. I’m going to start off with this little pipsqueak, here,” Ghed aimed his rifle at Kyle, “then the rest of you, Mazers, can have your fun.”

Kyle’s mind was full of panic and fear. “Oh, God, I’m gonna die.”

“Yeah,” Ghed laughed, “entertaining isn’t it?” For another split second, with most perfect timing, someone had called Ghed a “douche-plug.” Confusion and anger was shown on Ghed’s face, as he, and the other Mazers, turned to see Blue Lazer himself pointing the tips of his elbows at the whole lot of them. “What did you call me?”

Blue Lazer smiled. “You heard me, buddy-boy. Shoot down one more ‘primitive screw head’ and I will take you to my town.” The citizens ran out of the auditorium frantically, thanking Blue Lazer. There was a long silence, until the last audience member was out of sight.

Ghed smiled, once again. “Blue Lazer, I assume?”

He nodded. “Buddy-boy gets it, now. Damn, I sure wish you guys could hide those disgusting rows of teeth.”

Mazers growled in anger, including Ghed who proceeded to talk to Blue Lazer. “You are needed, Blue Lazer. Turn yourself in, pay for your consequences, and we will spare your race.”


Chapter 20

Blue Lazer laughed hysterically. “I just saw you gross turds shoot down an innocent teenager. You honestly think I’m that stupid? C’mon, you guys have already dug your graves, now it’s time to put you to rest.”

Ghed snarled angrily, gripping onto his rifle. “Call me a douche-plug… one more time.”

Blue Lazer laughed, once again, lowering his elbows and casually walked up to the Adoa Magnate, with the others still focusing on him. Blue Lazer was much shorter than the Mazers, which did not intimidate him one bit. “You know, if I didn’t have these cool powers, I could still take all of you. It would just take me a lil more time, is all.” Blue Lazer started licking Ghed’s rifle, which astounded the Mazers. “MM! Your fancy gun is less distasteful than the sight of you! Come on, buddy-boy, shoot me! Oh, wait, I didn’t say the magic word, did I? Shoot me, douche-plug!” It all went so fast, within a blink of an eye, when Blue Lazer slammed his foot onto the ground. The impact of his foot created a sonic boom, which sent all the Mazers flying in all different directions. “COME AT ME, CHUMPS!!!”

The Adoa frantically got up and began shooting at Blue Lazer, who flew around the auditorium, shooting his elbow lasers, throwing punches, and swinging powerful kicks.

“KILL HIM!” yelled Ghed angrily. Fire-power struck Blue Lazer, which didn’t seem to bother him at all. No matter how much blood of his was being spilled, Blue Lazer knew he would heal up. He took the pain, like a man, as he crushed Mazer skulls with his fists. Blue Lazer fought, realizing that he was in a serious conflict, a conflict between ugly beings that he had never seen before.

Throughout his new career of being a super hero, Blue Lazer was used to beating down bad guys, sending them to jail, etc. He had never actually ended a life, with his own fists, or his own super powers for that matter. Adrenaline rushed through his physically fit body, not only beating the Mazers to a pulp, but brutally slaying them. The Mazers had to be taken down, especially since they threatened to kill many innocent people, including Cale Omnous. Blue Lazer wanted to cry for the loss of his best friend. Instead of crying, he yelled furiously, as he blasted a laser through a Mazer’s chest.

Buddy-boy Better Watch It














“He’s too strong!!” wailed a hopeless Mazer, before he got punched hard and all of his teeth flew out.

“Yeah, boyyy!” Blue Lazer yelled. “How does that bite?!” Blue Lazer did not notice the Magnate Ghed stumble upon the stage of the auditorium, aiming his rifle at Blue Lazer’s temple. He fired, striking Blue Lazer’s skull after he had slain another Mazer. Pain seared through his cranium, as if someone had set his brain into a kiln. He moaned angrily, though continued to put up a fight.

Ghed laughed to himself. “Heh, how typical. Headshots are your weakness.” He fired his rifle again, which led to another great hit on the hero’s skull. Blue Lazer could feel his heal desperately try to heal itself, as it began to collapse at the same time. Ghed shot him again after he slammed a Mazer against the ground, until the alien was nothing but a pool of gray blood. Blue Lazer’s legs began to collapse, he surely could not take this anymore. He focused his elbow on Ghed, but Ghed fired his rifle quickly before Blue Lazer could blast him off the stage.

Blue Lazer yelled angrily. “You space turd! You’re really giving me a headache!”

Chapter 20

Ghed laughed evilly and fired, once more, knocking Blue Lazer to the ground. The other few surviving Mazers started beating the hero with their rifles and kicking him with their armor-plated boots. Blood oozed out of Blue Lazer’s temple and it could not fully heal, due to all of the blows he had been receiving.

“Finish him,” Ghed ordered. As soon as he commanded his Mazers to kill Blue Lazer, it turned out to be his commandment. A fierce pain rose through his alien body. The pain came from a sharp sword, seeping through his organs, in between his plates of armor. It was Kyle, who was driving the sword through Ghed’s body. Kyle did not look happy at all.

Ghed dropped his rifle, coughing up blood, dying slowly. “Well… Ow.”














“My name is Kyle Manning,” Kyle whispered, “you ruined my play. Prepare to die.” Kyle drove and jerked the sword all around the interior of Ghed’s body. After a few screams and gurgles, the rest of the Adoa noticed Kyle had killed their leader. They stopped beating Blue Lazer and fired their weapons at Kyle, who ran into the play set in absolute fear. The Mazers turned back to finish off Blue Lazer, though were immediately obliterated by his lasers.

Blue Lazer weakly got up, allowing his body to heal, which was a mere twenty seconds. “Ow, God, that hurt. That really, really hurt.”

“Are they all dead?” Kyle’s voice echoed through the auditorium.

Buddy-boy Better Watch It


Blue Lazer examined the surrounding area, which consisted of large amounts of gray blood spilled all over, including the dead bodies of the ultimately slaughtered Adoa. Blue Lazer laughed a little too hysterically. “Yep! Sure looks like it, buddy-boy! Wow! Did you see that? Did we…Did I…Just?! Space aliens?! What?!”

Kyle stumbled out of the set, retrieving his sword out of Ghed’s dead body. The sword was soaked in gray blood, which disgusted Kyle entirely. “Blue Lazer, you’re like my hero. Thanks for saving the day.”

Blue Lazer sighed deeply. “Oh, lord, Kyle. I think it’s time you knew, buddy-boy.” Blue Lazer took off his cheesy ninja mask, revealing his true identity, which made Kyle look like he pooped his pants.

“A-Axyl?” Kyle stuttered, descending from the stage. They both stood in front of each other, surrounded by dead alien bodies. Kyle smiled happily and he literally couldn’t say a thing. “Wha--?! How?!”

Axyl sighed. “It’s a long story, man, and it all started when Cale and I…” Axyl paused and immediately ran over to Cale’s body, which laid in a pool of his own blood. Axyl’s lips were trembling (Kyle stood by), his hands over his mouth. Axyl shook his best friend aggressively, “Hey, asshole, you’re fine. Just… ugh… please wake up, bro.”

Cale coughed hoarsely, which gave Axyl a sign of relief. “Wuh?” Thank God, he was still alive!

“Y-you’re going to be okay, buddy-boy. J-just hold on, alright?”

Cale laughed harshly. “Oh, s-spare me with the depressing c-crap, bro; especially when I’m ab-about to dead…”

“Die?”

“Y-yes! Ugh! I just got shot a bazillion times… d-do you expect me to be the master of w-words?”

Axyl pressed hard on Cale’s wounds, trying to stop the bleeding. It wasn’t doing him or Cale any good. Kyle was sitting in a nearby chair, letting Axyl have his last moment with his friend. Axyl laughed. “Look, man, I’m sorry things turned out the way they did after the baseball game.”

Cale replied, “Dude, y-you kicked my ass that night. No worries, man, no w-worries.” Cale coughed harshly, blood spewing out of his mouth. “Blood does not taste good, at all.”

Chapter 20


Axyl shrugged, he couldn’t agree more with that. “True that, man.”

Cale laughed, coughed harder, and was surely about to die. “Si-since when were you Blue Lazer, man? No wonder you took me down that night.”

The two both laughed saying, “That’s what she saaaiiid!”

Axyl wasn’t crying, though he felt like he was. “Omnous, it’s a long story.”

“Tell me in y-your prayers, man,” Cale coughed. That last statement struck Axyl in the heart, with a soft tear rolling down his cheek. Cale weakly rose his head up, looking at Kyle. “Hey, twerp…”

Kyle stood up, stuttering like he used to. “Y-yeah, C-cale?”

“You did a pretty good job, up there on stage. I- I’m sorry for the crap I’ve c-caused you.

Kyle sighed deeply and smiled. “No worries, man.”

“Cool, now I can die with no regrets. Axyl, I want you to do me a favor.”

Axyl, holding Cale’s bloody body in his arms. “What is it, man?”

“Those alien freaks destroyed my outrageously sexy body. If there’s more, take ‘em all down for me.”

Axyl promised his best friend that he will fulfill Cale’s final wish. Cale did not die at that point, for he and Axyl had enough time to have a long and meaningful conversation, before he passed. They both talked about the good times they had together, as they laughed about the bad times, all ending with one final “bro hug,” right around the time Cale’s lungs were filling up with death. Axyl could feel Cale’s massively toned body turn extremely cold, as more blood was lost from his entire anatomy.

“B-bros for life,” Cale whispered.

“Bros for life,” Axyl replied, holding his best friend tightly, until Cale’s muscles were finally relaxed and limp, like a firm pillow. Cale was gone.

Axyl let go of him gently, wiping a tear from his face. “Ugh, damn, I never cry. I think I’ve actually bled more than I’ve actually shed salt water from my eyes.”

Kyle hugged him tightly, after he had stood back up. “Axyl, what’re we going to do?”


Buddy-boy Better Watch It


Before Axyl answered that difficult question, he got back into his Blue Lazer outfit. “That, Kyle, I do not know. At this point, there should be some police officers, or something.” Kyle agreed with that, until they both heard an explosion coming from the outside.

Kyle gripped his sword. “I don’t like that sound. Oh, jeez, if I die today, I better lose my virginity, now.” Kyle gasped. “Oh, God! Velouria! Axyl, we gotta go find her!!”

Blue Lazer shushed him, as they listened to another explosion. “Dude, there’s more of those things. If we’re going to face them, outside, we have to get the right equipment.”













“Axyl, I’m sorry that you lost Cale, but I need to get to Velouria now!”

“And die trying?! I know where to get more supplies, supplies to screw those assholes! And we’re not using their weapons, we’re doing this the AMERICAN WAY! Then we’ll get Velouria, no problem!”

Kyle paused. “Some people, like Vel, are just worth dying for, you know? I go through every day thinking about her, because you never know when it may be your last chance to think about the people you truly love. I mean… I thought of her when I performed that play, even when I sliced up the innards of a crazy, space-freak, tyrannical jackass, who was about to blow everyone’s brains out! What I’m trying to say is that she means the whole world to me and I will do whatever it takes to make her happy and anything else that is like… very un-sad and stuff. Y-you feel me?”

Chapter 20


Blue Lazer sighed, deeply. “Dude, you’re sooo dramatic! You two haven’t even been dating for two months!! If you wanna go after her, you won’t be able to go on your own. You need to stick with me, bro. I have the over-powering abilities, remember? Not meaning to sound like a jackass, but you need me.”

Kyle scoffed. “Oh, and you need me?!”

“Well you did save my life not ten minutes ago…”

Kyle looked at his sword. “Okay, you gotta point. Axyl, we have to be super-fast with this, since we’re going to get weapons and look for Velouria.”

Blue Lazer laughed, as they left the theatre building. “Dude, I can fly.” They walked outside the building, only to see the high school half-demolished. Hesitantly, both Blue Lazer and Kyle looked around the campus, only to see nothing but destruction and silence. Blue Lazer and Kyle couldn’t believe their eyes. Was this really happening? Blue Lazer remembered the last time he dealt with something this destructive, referencing back to when he fought the Adoa Probes. Blue Lazer believed that there was more trouble yet to come, however. Trouble that was fouler, vicious, and just plain mean, rather than a typical Adoa Probe. He was devastated that he couldn’t help Cale, when he could. He felt inhuman that he couldn’t dispose of Cale’s body properly, but the auditorium seemed to be the best spot compared to the current destruction. By the looks of it, from how Blue Lazer saw it, these alien freaks had more intentions.

Blue Lazer had to get rid of these lipless ass wipes, before anyone else were to parish. Ever since Cale died, Blue Lazer became extremely determined to annihilate every single Adoa soldier in his path. Kyle, who was worried sick about his lover, and even his parents, was determined to do the same. This predicament was not only about saving the world, it was about revenge and Blue Lazer was determined to do that. Lost in a train of thought, Blue Lazer finally spoke up. “Okay, these alien guys are real pricks.”

Kyle started laughing, which made the whole situation much darker than it needed to be. It wasn’t Kyle’s fault, however, for this whole situation still hasn’t hit the emotional portion of his innocent, little mind. However, he was fully aware that he could die any minute, so he kept his sword close. On another fearful note, Kyle had wished he had another pair of pants.

Buddy-boy Better Watch It


“And I thought you were the worst of them all,” Kyle replied. Blue Lazer punched him lightly on the arm, as they both laughed.

“Better watch it, buddy-boy. Okay, we gotta go to my work. My co-worker, Von Alan, runs the fire arms department. Hopefully these alien bastards haven’t gotten there, yet. It’s just south of the school. Jeez, I can’t believe this is happening. I guess this is a job for Blue Lazer, once again.”

Kyle cut in. “Uh, excuse me? Kyle Manning, too. This is a job for Kyle Manning and Blue Lazer.”

Blue Lazer argued. “Okay, we can include your name, but not your name before mine! And why use your real name?! That’s so not superhero worthy!”

“Bitch, please! Kyle Manning is who I be!”

“Why not someone like Ultra Kylie?”

“That’s a girl’s name!”

“Super heroes don’t complain, Kylie. So, let’s just stick to ‘This is a job for Blue Lazer,’ alright?”

The two continued to argue, as Kyle got on Blue Lazer’s back and they flew off from the school towards the Cheese and Crackers Supermarket. Kingzing City was under great peril, a peril that no one has ever expected or seen. It would take more than a super-powered teenager and a teenager dressed up in a play costume, with a sword, to save not only the city but the entire planet. This was going to be one hell of a ride.






Part 5:

Just a Perfect

Day



Chapter 21: Unexpected Alliance

















Yayvox charged on through the walls of a Kingzing City

High School classroom, roaring with determination (All while Ghed invaded the school auditorium, Yayvox had proceeded onward to search rest of the school.). Unfortunately for him, the massive Adoa Striker had no such luck in finding Zjok’s most loathed nemesis, let alone find anyone other human being, at all. The entire school was empty! Of course, it was a Saturday so no other high school student was seen in the premises, other than being well-occupied in the auditorium for the school play, of course. Yayvox roared once again, as he destroyed brick walls, demolishing school lockers, etc. He unfolded a massive Striker carbine, which known for being an extremely dangerous weapon, and spoke into it.


Chapter 21


“Magnate Ghed, this is First Magnate Yayvox, reporting from the interior of the school. I am on the second story of the building; at least five-hundred yards from your standing position. Have you found Blue Lazer, that rat-nosed brat?” As Yayvox (standing over fifteen feet tall) waited for a response from Ghed, he attempted to sit in a classroom desk. He was obviously too over-weight and the desk was obviously crushed into pieces. “Well thought I would try it out.” Realizing he hadn’t received a response from Ghed, Yayvox spoke into his carbine once more. “Yo, Magnate, where you at? If you’re killing everything in there, I’m demoting you for not inviting me. All I see in here are desks, supplies, and copies of 1984, which is (spoiler alert) is the worst novel of all time. So, you can pretty much say I’m pretty damn bored.” There was no response, which made Yayvox begin to worry. He growled, getting the feeling that his platoon was entirely wiped out. He spoke into the carbine, “Ghed?! You better not be dead! I will kill you, if you are!” Yayvox roared angrily, firing his massive carbine at the outer walls of the classroom, blowing it to pieces. Yayvox jumped out of the opening, landed with a thud on the soft grass, and made his way towards the auditorium.

Zjok, at the time, was just above Earth’s orbit, along with the rest of his army. He was feasting on more crackers in the cockpit, while some Mazers were scrubbing away Jorfb’s deceased blood and. Zjok was feeling happier about the current invasion of planet Earth, up until he got a call from First Magnate Yayvox. “This is Zjok and the Adoa Armada,” Zjok spoke into the transmission armor on his finger, “where everything is magical and deathly.”

“Zjok, sir,” Yayvox sounded angry, “that blithering, teenage bastard killed my entire platoon, including Ghed. Vanish was right about Blue Lazer being in the school; he was here, alright.”

Zjok screamed and threw his crackers on the ground. “Why can’t I have any fun?! Yayvox, your life WILL be terminated if you do not get to Blue Lazer and annihilate him! Rejoin with Galg and his platoon in the city, kill anything in your path, until you find that infuriating little shit!! If anything gets worse, alert me immediately and the entire fleet will scourge the entire city. IS THAT CLEAR, YOU INSIGNIFICANT TOE-SUCKER?!”

Unexpected Alliance


“YES, ZJOK, YOUR HIGHNESS! I WILL MAKE YOU PROUDER THAN A CHILD DRAWING YOU A PRETTY PICTURE!”

“MAKE IT EXCEPTIONALLY PRETTY, MAGNATE!”

And that was it for the last conversation between Zjok and Yayvox.


Holly’s House (10 Minutes before the Adoa Onslaught)










Holly Ransfield was always a terrific guitarist! Ever since she was the age of three, she would strum away on some good tuning with any form of guitar. Aside from that, knowing Holly Ransfield (the hottest chick of all time), many people would think that Holly would surround herself by a lot of loud music; especially when she would perform with The Nasty Pen. Those many people are absolutely correct and they would also think that Holly would have some sort of hearing issue, due to her constant visitation with loud music. Many people were wrong on that part; Holly could hear just fine. However, Holly is about to experience something so deafening, yet terrifying, her questionable ability to hear will slowly rise to its peak. This will happen


Chapter 21


in about two minutes, which will be exactly eight minutes before the Adoa bombards Kingzing City. During these two minutes of wonderful silence, Holly was getting ready for her band rehearsal that she was almost late for. Anyone who knew Holly, would find it highly misunderstandable to know that the sexy vixen would appear anywhere, along the lines of “late.” It was the thought of Axyl that clogged her mind from doing what really had to be done. It wasn’t her fault, however, it was that jerk-face Axyl Matthew Smithy for putting a “spell” on her. She really didn’t mind it, either, on a surprising note. Their moments together, during their date, made Holly realize that she and Axyl were finally on good terms. Really good terms. The fact that Holly had strong feelings for Axyl was very difficult to process through her head. Evil Nacho was about to change all that, as being one major distraction.

Holly, who had finally finished about an hour-worth of makeup and hair-curling, had walked out of her bathroom, casually shutting the door. Charlie, her cat, perched on the arm of her couch, making a “nervous meowing” sound. “Oh, Charlie, what is it, now? I just got you tuna, so why aren’t you satisfied with your life, now?” The poor cat hissed at her, scampering away. Holly laughed and shook her head. “Don’t worry, Charlie, Momma still loves you.” Holly was just about ready to head out the door, until a deafening explosion was heard from the inside of her bathroom. The explosion, almost blowing the bathroom door from its hinges, made Holly collapse and frantically run to her kitchen, to her pantry. She reached inside the pantry, pulling out a fully-loaded 12-guage shotgun. She took it off “safety,” pumped a shotgun shell, and stood in the kitchen pointing the gun at the bathroom door. Whether the explosion was an accident or not, she was ready for someone to eat led. Holly didn’t seem the slightest bit frightened, at all, as she kept her focus on the door. Orange smoke, seeped through the gaps of the door and Holly’s blood began to rush through her body, keeping her index finger over the hair trigger of her shotgun. “Come on out, jerk.” After several seconds of silence, the door began to slowly open; the orange smoke made its way through the entire interior of the house, causing Holly to cover her nose and mouth to avoid excessive lung damage.

Unexpected Alliance


“Okay, dark turd,” Holly said out loud, “come on out and try explaining why you blew up my bathroom within three seconds. Once those three seconds are up, just pray you will still have a head.”

Evil Nacho, taking heavy steps out of the bathroom, with is grin spread widely across his face, simply replied with a cunning laugh. “Oh, I do apologize, but I’m afraid my ‘atomic diarrhea’ has become a reality.”

Holly, still showing no fear, and without showing any hesitation, fired her weapon, shredding flesh from Evil Nacho’s body. The monster stepped back and roared angrily, as Holly pumped her shotgun and fired once again.

“Okay! Stop it, you putrid morsel!” Evil Nacho ordered. Charlie was crying frantically, desperately trying to find a way out of the house. Evil Nacho lunged at Holly and she quickly dodged out of the way, diving into the living room with a thud. Holly ran into the across the area, pumped her shotgun, and fired another round in the monster’s side. He screamed angrily, coughing up nacho cheese.

Seeing that Evil Nacho was actually wounded, Holly quickly opened the front door, motioning Charlie to run. “Get out of here, Charlie-boy, Momma’s gonna be busy.” Evil Nacho had gotten up, once he started throwing deadly nacho chips at her (all while his wounds significantly healed). Fortunately he missed several times, the nacho chips were pinning themselves into the wall. Holly ran out the door after her kitty, pumping her next shotgun shell into the barrel. “Okay, you cheesy piece of crap, I’m taking you down this time!”

“Is that a date, you ignorant lamb?! Hahahaha!” Evil Nacho yelled back, crashing through her front door, taking another lunge at her. Holly shrieked, swinging the shotgun against Evil Nacho’s face. Evil Nacho grabbed it from her and threw it aside. He made an attempt to grab her, which she quickly denied him by karate-chopping his forearm and kicking him swiftly in the groin. Evil Nacho groaned in pain and Holly made a go for her shotgun. However, Evil Nacho was too quick as he grabbed her by the ankle and threw her in the air, onto her lawn. Holly moaned painfully, once she hit the ground. Evil Nacho rushed over to her and set his massive foot on Holly’s temple, keeping her pinned to the ground. “You ugly pimple! I must say you got some pretty sexy moves. But to bring a shotgun into the fight? Sheesh.”

Chapter 21

“Ugh, g-get off me, you dick,” Holly replied, spitting grass out of her mouth.

“Insult me all you want,” Evil Nacho laughed, “none of it will get you out of me smashing your brains in.”

Holly laughed. “Well, you are what you eat.”

Evil Nacho growled angrily, adding pressure, from his foot, to Holly’s head. She moaned in agony, feeling like her head was about to explode. She then heard loud blast of fire-power, which knocked Evil Nacho back on his ass.
















Holly first thought it was Blue Lazer coming to save the day, though she was dead wrong. Evil Nacho, growling angrily like a dog, frantically got up on his feet. “Who keeps interrupting my satisfaction?! OH! Well, hello there!”

Holly had gotten up, looking up at the sky, to see Adoa ships, soaring over their heads. They were all headed towards Kingzing City, which was close to Holly’s home, using immense and highly-powered weaponry.

An Adoa Bat Ship was hurdling towards Holly and Evil Nacho’s location, firing its guns. Holly ran for cover, after taking her shotgun, as Evil

Unexpected Alliance


Nacho screamed angrily, jumped high into the air and latched himself on the Bat. Holly watched the monster throw Mazer pilots out of the Bat, their bodies being crushed from the impact against the concrete. Evil Nacho landed back on the ground and the Bat crash-landed near him. One of the Mazers, who was barely alive, lay nearby crying in pain. Evil Nacho walked towards the Mazer and stomped on his head until its alien brains were scattered all over the concrete.

Holly, on the other hand, kept her shotgun close to her and aimed at Evil Nacho. She wasn’t sure what the hell she was currently witnessing. First, a mutated monstrosity blows up her bathroom and now space aliens were attacking the city. She could hear the terrified screams of citizens, as she also watched neighbors around her home making their way out of the neighborhood in their vehicles.

“Oh, stop pointing your gun at me, bimbo,” Evil Nacho said, wiping his bloody foot in the grass. “You’re now the least of my troubles, now. I’M SERIOUSLY TIRED OF BEING INTERRUPTED!”

The two of them watched citizens leave their homes, as they also watched more Adoa Bats and Mohawks (drop ships) make their way through the city. “How can I trust you, then?” Holly asked, lowering her weapon. “How do I know you’re not behind all of the whacked-up crap that’s happening, right now?!”

Evil Nacho laughed. “Did you not just see me slaughter some of these idiots?!” An explosion was heard from inside the city, along with police sirens echoing throughout. Kingzing City was under attack and it was not Evil Nacho’s fault.

Holly sighed. “God, what the hell is this?”

Evil Nacho cackled. “Why, it’s evil, of course! As much as I adore evil, however, and as much as I love watching people get hurt, no moron deserves to interrupt me. I’m frankly tired of it, you know? I was about to kill you, but then these space-monkeys had to ruin the whole thing! I now have a pure hatred for them. And if I’m ever going to kill you, or Blue Lazer, I’m going to have to wipe out these losers, first.”

Holly realized what Evil Nacho was saying. “So, we’re teaming up?”

Evil Nacho sighed angrily. “In a sense, I suppose. I never fought with

Chapter 21


an ally; especially with a bimbo like you.”

Holly wanted to shoot Evil Nacho in the face, but that wouldn’t solve anything. “Okay, well is an unexpected alliance. Nacho, since you’re now my ally, do you think you can take me to the Cheese and Crackers Supermarket? If we’re going to be slaughtering any aliens, today, I want to gear up. Plus, I need to find my friends. I have to make sure they’re okay.”

Evil Nacho thought for a moment. “On second thought, I’m better on my own. See you later, you dumb bimbo! You actually think I’m going to take you out for shopping?! AS IF! HAHAHAHA!”

Evil Nacho ran off, jumping high in the air and out of Holly’s sight. She gasped in anger, wishing she had shot the monster in the mouth when she had the chance. “That ungrateful piece of… URGH!” Holly had to make quick haste to get more fire-arms and ammunition, in order to survive this frightful day. However, her 1985 Volvo was still in the car shop. She took her phone out from her pocket (to call Axyl or Kyle), only to see that it was permanently broken, from when Evil Nacho recently attacked her. “I’m going to kill that Nacho Bastard!” Holly then realized that breaking into someone else’s car seemed to be a more reasonable solution. She looked around her area frantically and saw no cars around her. “Damn!” Holly then made a final decision to run for the supermarket, which lay a couple miles away from the city. Holly sighed deeply and started making her way to the city, feeling slightly frightened. With only five rounds left in her shotgun, Holly started her small journey to the supermarket. She was praying that she would come across Axyl , Kyle, or anyone else who would be willing to help her get to the supermarket faster.

Everything was happening so fast and it was difficult for Holly to process that through her head. She felt confused, terrified, and fully on alert. However, that’s how everyone felt when the Adoa finally made it to Earth and started enduring the wrath of Zjok. Everyone was in some sort of pickle and it wasn’t going to be easy to slip out of it.


Meanwhile (Present Time)

Unexpected Alliance


As Blue Lazer and Kyle flew through the rural areas, Blue Lazer was desperately trying to get ahold of Jared, Holly, and even Velouria. Jared Smithy, Holly Ransfield, and even Velouria Lancelot were unavailable through voice calling.

“Velouria is unavailable, too” Blue Lazer replied to Kyle’s questioning about his girlfriend.

Kyle was getting extremely worried. “B-but, Velouria always has her phone on her! Oh God, I think I’m gonna throw up.”

Blue Lazer laughed sarcastically, as they finally approached the Cheese and Crackers Supermarket. “Uh, could you not, bro? Okay, come on, let’s take as much weaponry and ammunition as we can.”

Citizens were rushing in and out of the supermarket, grabbing as many supplies as they could. The Adoa was all over the local news and it was all being widely spread, so people could evacuate as fast as possible. And then, the fearful residents cheered happily when they saw Blue Lazer walking through the parking lot.

“YAY! Blue Lazer is here! We can actually hope for things, now!” yelled one citizen, happily.














“Hey! Don’t give me all the credit!” Blue Lazer yelled right back. “I would like all of you guys to meet my new side-kick, Super Lyle!”

Chapter 21


Kyle stared blankly at Blue Lazer, once he represented him. “Really, dude?”

“What?” Blue Lazer being dumb. “It’s better than ‘Ultra Kylie,’ isn’t it?”

Kyle shrugged. “I would’ve gone for something other than sounding like a lazy super hero. I mean… ‘Lyle’ seems so ‘slack-ish.’”

The citizens watched the two of them argue in the parking lot, with deep concern. “So, you would rather be named Lazy Lyle?”

Kyle laughed, “That’s not what I said! You suck at arguing. Plus, I’d rather go with something like, The Silver Swordsman.”

Thinking that was the most “Lyle” name he had ever heard of, Blue Lazer decided to laugh off the argument and continued walking, signing a few autographs for some of the local fans. “You just keep believing what you believe in, alright buddy-boy?”

Kyle followed him. “Ha. Well, The Silver Swordsman is better than Axyl. Did you know Axyl is slang for ‘a heavy smoker’ in Scotland?”

“Oh, shut up! Come on, Silver Vagina, let’s go get our supplies. Citizens of Kingzing City, I employ you all to be safe and secure! In the meantime,” pointing his finger at the Adoa ships in the distance, “those suckers are going down!”

The citizens applauded and cheered for Blue Lazer, as he and Kyle walked into the supermarket. “You’re such a push-over.”

Blue Lazer smirked. “Well, how do you expect me to save the day? You want me to help them pack, or something?”

In the sky

Preox, Kriket, Rig, and the others have finally managed to get the old Asid spacecraft up and running. However, it still wasn’t in the best condition. Imagine driving an older car model, with a stick-shift, that has not been driven for the past few decades. That’s what it was like to fly the stupid thing.

Four Asids alone were the ones to pilot the massive ship, whereas one other Asid maintained all of the ship’s gun turrets. The ship was much slower than an average Adoa fighter, though it was fast enough to get Preox and the

Unexpected Alliance


others to the destination they needed to reach, which was Kingzing City of course. Other companions joined in with the group. Moosey, Commander Derno, Agent Eugene7, and many other American soldiers and A72A Agents joined the small party of rebellion against the Adoa. Soldiers and agents sat in rows of seats in the back of the ship, whilst the Asids and Aziquet managed the cockpit.

They were just approaching the state of Oregon when Rig blurted, “Gee, I sure do miss Area 72!”

“Oh, cut your persistent whining,” Preox pleaded. “If it weren’t for that ignorant moose, we would have had possession of the Misara Serum far from now.”

“Just doing my job,” Moosey interrupted; Preox shushed him.

“Commander Derno!” Preox hollered. “Status report on the city of Kingzing?”

Derno was skimming through his laptop, sipping a cup of coffee nearby, when he answered, “Kingzing City is now under attack. The news has gone viral within ten minutes and it’s all over international media. Honestly Preox, do you think we have what it takes?”

“Of course not,” Preox responded. Rig started laughing hysterically. “There’s only five Asids, one Misara infected idiot, and a group of inexperienced humans.”

“The military is already working on fighting back the alien force in the city,” Derno replied right back.

“Did you hear me not say ‘inexperienced humans?’ Commander Derno, the Adoa is ten times more powerful than that of your putrid militia. I’m sorry to say, but without the proper tactics, you humans will be merely nothing but a bag-full of fun, compared to the Adoa. However, I am hoping that this Blue Lazer will put up a huge fight against Zjok. In all honesty, hearing from what Blue Lazer has done to those Adoa Probes, makes me even more hopeful that we have a slight chance against an entire army that is pursuing a full-on invasion upon this planet. Trust me, these guys have done it before and it never looks pretty, even when they’ve lost. If a small group of Probes can destroy three-fourths of your A72A base, imagine what many Probes could do to a city.”

Chapter 21













“Is there at least some good news?” Moosey asked.

“Yes,” Kriket answered for Preox. “At least the Adoa is unable to bring their entire military to one planet. Their army is separated into three, similar to that of your military branches on Earth.”

“Regardless, HOW IS THIS GOOD NEWS?! You mean there’s more than what we’re dealing with now?!” Eugene shrieked.

“You got it, buck-o,” Admiral Bxir said. “There’s Zjok and two other malicious, dictatin’ leaders by tha names of Drank and Livier. The Adoa is a common enemy fer many diff’rent planets. Zjok’s military branch is at war against us, tha Asids, and of course tha humans. Thankfully, not all of tha Adoa’s planetary forces are against us. If they were, all of us would probly bin dead, by now. As for us Asids, our planet consists of one branch, which we have bin purty successful with.”

“How much of Zjok’s military are we dealing with, here?” Derno asked.

“Oh,” Bxir laughed, “approximately two-thirds of it. From what I seen, when Kriket, Zitkir, Drox, and I were all captur’d by Zjok, there was too many tah count.”

Moosey gulped, as they flew threw a thick sheet of clouds.

“We’re almost there,” Preox announced, looking at a nearby radar. “We’re getting closer to where the Misara Serum is located. I pray to God that the Serum isn’t all consumed by that nautical teenager.”

“Well it still wouldn’t help to check, regardless,” Drox said.

Unexpected Alliance


















The ship was finally out of the dense clouds and there was a lovely view of Kingzing City, below them. They could see the few ships that were roamed all over the streets, damaging the city and taking civilians hostage.

“Doesn’t look ‘two-thirds’ to me,” Preox said, with an emphasis of sass, towards Admiral Bxir.

“Tha rest must be waitin’ somewhere above Earth’s o’bit,” Bxir replied, with the same amount of sass. “Zjok jist might want the Misara Serum, instead.”

“Yes, but they’re attacking the city,” Zitkir cut in. “They’re attacking the humans, so this really shouldn’t be the Asids, or Rig’s, problem anyway!”

Preox set the ship on auto-pilot. “There, I’ve set the Serum’s coordinates into the ship. We should be there any minute (thank God the Adoa can’t track our older models). Oh, and Zitkir, I have a bone to pick with you.” Preox got up and so did Zitkir. Rig started to giggle under his breath, revealing that Zitkir was in a heap of trouble. Preox shushed him and Rig was silenced immediately.

“Zitkir, as an Envoy Officer, I would expect you to be more mature about this whole ordeal,” Preox said with an uptight accent in his raspy voice.

“Oh, I’m the one who’s immature?! Look at Rig!”

Chapter 21

“Rig is Rig,” Preox replied, “there’s seriously no helping him. And Zitkir, I don’t want you to breathe another word about the Adoa not being our problem, you got that? Rig and I were the ones to settle on this planet, in the first place. We brought the Misara Serum, here, and now the Adoa is attacking the city. How can you not say that this is our problem, also?”

“It’s basically just your fault, then,” Zitkir snapped back. Everyone in the ship gasped.

“Zitkir, what the hell?” Kriket was angry. “If you think about it, it’s all pretty much our fault that this is happening. (1) Zjok betrayed us and made the Serum, (2) our race stole that weapon under dire circumstances, (3) Preox and Rig lost it, due to an unstable light-speed ship, and (4) the moose and the humans captured Preox and Rig, thus delaying them in their efforts to take back the Serum.”

“It’s Agent Moosey17, by the way.”

“Shut it, moose,” Kriket snapped. “So, Zitkir, before you start going off like a confused, meat-shoving frat boy, think about what’s really going on.”

Zitkir was quiet, as was everyone else. “Alright, I’m sorry, Magnate Preox.”

“It’s fine, I guess,” Preox responded, watching the Adoa roaming over the city. “This whole ordeal became more disastrous than I thought, more disastrous than anyone thought. It’s rather annoying, if you ask me.”

“I wasn’t going to,” Rig replied, behaving like a smart-ass. Preox shot him a disgusted look. If anything else was going to be more annoying than the Adoa, it would be Rig. “I think you’re very pretty when you’re angry, Preox. I’m happy for you.”

Before Preox could say anything, Commander Derno changed the subject. “Well, if you say that ‘we humans’ are inexperienced with the Adoa version(s) of warfare, I cannot wait to prove you wrong! You’ll just wait and see how cool we really are! Anyway, it seems that the ship is descending about your designated location. I’m going to go back to the troops and get them ready.”

Preox nodded in agreement, taking his seat back in the cockpit. He kept the ship on auto-pilot, as he and the others kept a sharp eye out for any Adoa.

Unexpected Alliance


“Zitkir, keep your eye out for any infantry. Blast any Mazer or Striker in sight.”

“We gonna shoot at infants?!” Rig shouted horrifically, startling Kriket.

“You incompetent dolt,” Preox said under his breath, angrily and switch on his sarcasm. “Yes, Rig, we’re gonna kill a bunch of defenseless babies! Because they are far more dangerous than Zjok, himself! Get your electric stem ready, because those defenseless babies will kill you!”

“I seriously thought you were serious,” Agent Eugene7 replied, in a serious tone. Preox’s eye twitched. He surely had enough with everyone’s nonsense, especially the nonsense coming from Zjok and his Adoa army.

Once the old ship had landed, which was in the Kingzing City High School parking lot, Preox and the others took cautious movements when exiting the aircraft. Preox had his rifle unfolded, keeping his combat posture at its best, as he examined his surroundings. The campus was completely empty, though it wasn’t quiet. Citizens all over the nearby area were fleeing the city, along with military services.

“Looks like the city has already went under martial law,” Commander Derno said, holding a shotgun.

“See, we told you our military was prepared for this!” Moosey shouted, resulting everyone to shush him, immediately.

“Will you keep your damn voice down?!” Preox said in a lower voice, trying his best not to yell right back.

“Oh, it’s not like the Adoa is not gonna find us anyway,” Kriket snapped, as she finally walked out of the ship. Preox was about to argue with her, until he saw something unique about her appearance. Kriket had cut her hair, down to where humans would have their ears.

“You cut your hair?!”

Kriket unfolded a massive gun. “Well, yeah. I’m tired of my hair always getting in the way, during combat. I’m surprised it hasn’t gotten me killed, seeing that how long it was. Does it look okay?”

“You look prettier than me,” Rig replied, before Preox could answer.

“Heh, thanks Rig. I was talking to Preox.”

“Oh, I know.”

“Um, okay?”

Chapter 21

Preox wanted to shoot Rig’s head off. “Kriket, you look fantastic. Now, let’s move out, before anything else distracts me like your hair just did. Oh, and for those who don’t know what Adoa look like: If you see an 8-foot (or more) tall, pale-skinned, slightly hairy brute with no lips, and is shooting at you, blow their brains out.”

“They have no lips?” Moosey asked, as they all began to move out, including other agents and marines. Preox responded affirmatively. “Oh, wow, I wonder how they kiss.”

“With their own assholes,” Bxir replied, puffing a cigar, making everyone laugh, except for Preox. A blaring noise erupted from Preox’s Vambit, flashing neon-green lights, which startled everyone. “Damn, Prex. You tells us tah be quiet an’ you end up bein’ tha loudest outta alluh us!”

“Well, this is mandatory,” Preox said, as the sound got louder. “The container of the Misara Serum is close now. It should be about--.”

“THERE!” Rig shouted, pointing at Axyl Smithy’s pick-up truck, which was parked neatly in the massive parking lot. “Sorry! I just wanted to be the loudest one!”













Preox shut off the blaring siren, as they all approached Axyl’s truck cautiously. Rig took the liberty of slamming his fist against Axyl’s passenger

Unexpected Alliance


window, shattering it completely. He took out the Misara Serum, smiling brightly at it. “HEY! I remember this thing!” The container was open, which didn’t surprise Preox. The Serum had been missing for so long, so why wouldn’t it be empty?

Preox snatched the container from Rig, giving him a glare. “You do, Rig? How about you be as loud as you want, while you’re at it?” He shook the container. No hints of Misara Serum. “Well, that does not surprise me. Hell that was even the last of the Drokensmur blood, in existence.” The only most dangerous weapon we have discovered is now in the bodily fluids of a human teenager, who probably doesn’t even recognize why the Adoa is attacking his home.”

“Dang,” Bxir exclaimed. “Woulda bin great if we culda all jest took a sample of that Serum an’ this job woulda bin a whole lot easier.”

Preox thought for a moment. “Actually, you’re right, Admiral. I wish we could have just skipped the scientific testing and programming. I mean, the Serum has certainly taken a positive toll on this idiot, here.”

“That’s me!” Rig blurted.

“Yes… that’s you. Anyway, I just wish we didn’t have to be so technical about this stupid weapon and should have just annihilated Zjok’s Adoa when we had the chance. Now look what’s happening.”

“Wail,” Bxir resting his hand on Preox, “if I wuz a magic lil genie, from the ‘70s, I would have granted yer precious widdle wish! Lez get to it, folks! Blue Lazer is out thair, somewheres! All we gots to do is regroup wid ‘im and just maybe we’ll be able to put an end to Zjok’s invasion.”

“Oh, God, I smell awful,” Drox said.

“That’s fear, boy!” shouted Bxir. “Mazers and Strikers can smell dat!”

All of the sudden, Derno’s phone began to go off, along with a hysterical ringtone. His eyes widened when he took it out of his suit pocket, answering the phone immediately. “Nathan! Where the hell have you been?”

“Ooo!” Moosey shouted. “Put it on speaker phone!” Derno did so and everyone kept their ears open, as they kept an eye out for bad guys.

“Agent Jon43 and I are stuck in Corman Square, approximately a half-mile from the city’s waterfront. We are under heavy fire and I’ve never been so scared in my whole life! Commander, we need back up, and I mean now!

Chapter 21


These butt-faces are way too strong for this platoon. We’re losing lots of men and we need help, now!”















Preox chimmed in. “We just soared near the city, there’s not a lot of Adoa ships, down there. Nathan, how many of those ass-birds are there?!”

“You’re right, Preox! There’s only a few ships!” Nathan replied immediately. “There’s only a few ships, though there are many troops, and we’re getting slaughtered over here! We’re trying our best to get out of Corman Square and it’s not working out too well; we’re sitting ducks! I expected these guys to be a little more— WHAT?! WHAT IS THAT?! THERE’S MORE OF THEM, BUT THEY’RE HUGE! AT LEAST FIFTEEN FEET TALL!”

“Nathan, those are Adoa Strikers,” Kriket answering, “get out of there, now! Strikers are much more persistent and brutal! Run, just run!”

There was the sound of a few explosions and roars all coming from the Adoa, along with the sound of Nathan’s struggling. “Okay, we’re getting out of here. Jon is hit but he’s going to be okay. You gotta get to the city, guys! We can no longer keep these monsters busy; tanks and army platoons are being wiped out. I think there’s going to be fighter jets swooping in, though I doubt that’s gonna do any good. Hurry your--.” The line cut off. Moosey was almost in a state of shock, as was Agent Eugene7.


Unexpected Alliance


“We gotta go,” Admiral Bxir said. “Forget lookin’ fur Blue Lazer. We gots tah help those who don’ have mutant abilities. Ev’ryone, get back to the ship, we’re making a hot landing in the city; it’s not going to be easy, so prepare yerselves. Once we get to the city, we all have some ideas to approach dis battle! Got that?!”

“’Bout time I’m not the only one making orders,” Preox said, deploying his turrets from his Vambit and two more weapon add-ons were also released. The Asid attached the exotic objects to his rifle, serving as two more barrels for his weapon.

“Ooooh, Preox isn’t messing around,” Zitkir said with a smirk. The whole team was ready, ready to take down some Adoa! They all got into the old ship and took off to make their way to the city, as fast as possible.


Cheese & Crackers Supermarket


The more Blue Lazer and Kyle entered the supermarket, the more people had left. Shelves from all of the aisles were practically empty; many people had obtained the sources that they needed. Blue Lazer and Kyle were making their way to the firearms department when Blue Lazer decided to ask, “Since when was your sword real, Kyle? I thought play productions use a lot of fake stuff from thrift stores.”

Kyle had taken a candy bar from one of the shelves and started eating it. “Mr. Archibeque, the theatre teacher, doesn’t mess around when he’s directing a play. He likes using real swords, but no real guns, no real knives. Just real swords. He’ll say that they are fake every now and then, but that’s just because he doesn’t want the school board hearing about it. Please don’t tell the school board what I just told you.”

“Dang, what a badass. Wish he was here. Maybe he would have more swords. You know how sick that would be?! Using swords against these alien boars? Super sick.”

“Yeah, I kinda get to do that and you don’t,” Kyle boasted.


Chapter 21


“I could just take it away from you, you know that?” Blue Lazer mentioned. “I could blast you away with an awesome elbow laser, kill you in one punch, and even puke lava on your face.”

Kyle paused when they both approached the firearms (There was barely any left; everyone had been taking them all for protection.). “Wait. Puke lava? Can you really do that?”

Blue Lazer rolled his eyes. “Okay, I take that back. I can do that, but it’s just the worst pain in the world.”

Blue Lazer was going to hop over the front counter of the firearms department, until Von Alan burst out of the back room aiming a bow and arrow at him. “I know you’re Blue Lazer and everything, but back the hell up, now!”

“Von, relax!” Blue Lazer shouted, hesitantly taking off his mask and showing his true self.

“Oh, Jesus, Axyl! You coulda gotten an arrow in your face.”

“Lava could be worse,” Kyle replied.

Von lowered his arrow and hugged Axyl. The fact that Axyl was Blue Lazer seemed to not surprise him. He was more concerned about Kingzing City being under attack, of course. “Man, am I glad to see you. Everyone robbed me of all my weapons! Even the ones I had in the back. All I have left are these shotguns, a couple combat pistols, a few semi-automatics, and several grenades. This is like… the end of the world and stuff!

“You think that’s not much?!” Blue Lazer shouted happily, after hearing the news about the weapons. He took a shotgun and loaded it with shells. “See?! We’re gonna be fine!”

“I don’t know, man,” Von replied, straightening his hunters’ cap. “I saw those weird things all over the news. What if they’re to come here?!”

“Then we’ll be ready,” Blue Lazer replied, loading a magazine in a semi-automatic rifle, strapping it around his torso. “Are you good with that bow? We need to get going, soon.”

“Hell yeah,” Von replied with a smile. “I’m pretty scared though, you see, I got a wife and kids to get to.”

“You’ll get to them. Are you about done getting ready, Kyle?”


Unexpected Alliance

“What?” Kyle was startled. He wore a white ninja mask and his sword appeared to be squeaky clean. “Sorry, I wanted to focus on my look, since we’re going to go attempt at this battle thing.”

“Well, you kind of need a weapon for longer ranges, rather than the range of a sword.”

Kyle smiled confidently. “Oh, I’ll be fine.”

The obnoxious sound of a small explosion and constant, monster-like jabbering was heard from the entrance of the supermarket. Citizens were screaming in fear, as blasts of alien weapons were sounded.

“On second thought,” Kyle gulped, “maybe a semi-automatic pistol would be nice. Do you have any suppressors? I like suppressors. They’re fun to use and suppress things.”

“There’s not enough time for that!” Von shouted, pulling back his bow.

“Yeah, Kyle,” Blue Lazer scoffed, aiming his elbow and shotgun, “get your poop together. Okay, boys, I’m going to interrogate those poop-heads!”











“Where is Blue Lazer?!” a Mazer shouted, at the top of his lungs, as he and his Mazers blasted their way through the supermarket. His name was Loof-koff. “Magnate Galg will not be pleased with this report, if we do not find him here!” There were several other Mazers following Loof-koff and none of them seemed to be happy, as a matter of fact.

Chapter 21


“Maybe we’re just not looking hard enough,” suggested a Mazer.

“You’re probably right, Obit,” Loof-koff agreed. “Mazers, spread out! Kill anything in sight! If someone happens to not die, then it is Blue Lazer! Remember, make sure you watch your—.”


PEEW!


Loof-koff’s head was ultimately blown to bits, by an unexpected blast of laser, causing his Mazers to duck and cover.

“He’s here, alright!” Obit shouted. “Mazers, kill him!”

Blue Lazer was under heavy fire, though that did not stop him from slamming the butt of his shotgun against Obit’s skull in and then shooting a few rounds at any other Mazer that stood within his radius. “Oh I hardly think that’s gonna happen, buddy-boys! C’mon, show me what you got!” After slamming another Mazers body to the ground, Blue Lazer noticed more Mazers coming in from the other sides of the vicinity. “Oh damn, there’s more of you. Well, I do like a challenge! Hey, Kyle, Von, you got company coming at ya!!”

Back at the firearms department, where they could hear Blue Lazer yelling and fighting, Von kept his bow steady for any Mazers to enter his line of sight. As for Kyle, he hid behind a shelf in one of the store aisles, just waiting to pierce his sword through the innards of an unsuspecting Adoa Mazer.

“You ready for this?” Von said, keeping his concentration.

Kyle gripped both his sword and semi-automatic pistol, sweating continuously out of pure fear. “If I die, I want you to tell Axyl to tell Velouria that I love her. Oh jeez, I can see them coming. I don’t think I can do this! Oh, jeez!”

“More humans!” hollered a Mazer, who was now in Von’s sight. He released his arrow, striking the Mazer in the mouth. The monster gagged and collapsed, as another began shooting at Von. Von ducked for cover, loading another arrow onto his bow. Kyle yelled ferociously, left his hiding spot, and swung his sword against the Mazer’s neck. Gray blood flowed immensely.

Unexpected Alliance


Kyle pulled his sword out of the dead alien’s body, as three more Mazers made their way towards them. One of them shot at Kyle, only striking his sword which was shattered, immediately. Scared out of his wits, Kyle fired his pistol, shredding the Mazer’s entire face with hot bullets. Von shot another arrow, striking another bad guy in the eye. The third Mazer had gotten behind Kyle and kicked the scrawny teenager to the ground, hitting his jaw on the hard floor. The Mazer fired at Von, causing him to duck behind the counter. Kyle crawled helplessly for the gun and the Mazer kicked him once more.

“You ugly thing, time to put you out of your misery.” Kyle looked up at his enemy, helplessly. The Mazer aimed his rifle against Kyle’s forehead. “Any last words, boy?!”

“I’ve got a couple,” came a voice and it was not Blue Lazer’s. The Mazer turned to see Holly Ransfield, with her shotgun aimed at his head. “Fuck off.” Before the Mazer could even do anything, Holly had pulled the trigger. The Mazer’s brains were completely blown out of his skull, splashing onto Kyle, and the dead Mazer collapsed onto the ground with a giant thud. Holly stood over Kyle, smiling at him brightly as she pumped another shotgun shell into the chamber. She quickly helped Kyle back on his feet, as he struggled to catch his breath from his recent beating.

“Why am I always getting kicked?” Kyle said, gasping for air.

“Hold that thought, hun,” Holly said, standing in front of her wounded friend. Von was able to release another arrow at another Mazer, striking him in the chest, thus led to Holly kicking him in the face. After the alien was killed, that was the last of what they were dealing with. Von, Holly, and Kyle could all hear Blue Lazer fighting off the rest of the small group of Adoa.

Kyle and Holly were both taking cover behind the counter, as Von kept an eye out for any more bad guys. “Holly, since when did you get here?”

She shrugged. “Oh, Kyle, I walked. I needed to look for you guys; especially since all of this crazy stuff is going on. Are you doing alright? I can get a medical kit.”

“Nah, I’m fine. The only thing I need to worry about is either getting shot, pissing my pants, and Velouria.”

“I guess we both have someone special to look after,” Holly smiled.

Chapter 21















“Why are you smiling?” Kyle laughed, coughing a bit. “You never smile.” Holly smiled again, not having the ability to contain it, and bit her bottom lip gently. Kyle gasped, his eyes widening. “You and Axyl?! Wow! Don’t tell me how it was, please.”

Holly snorted. “You wish! It’s just weird, yet awesome at the same time.”

“I think it’s called ‘liking someone,’” Kyle responded, sarcastically.

“Or it’s called ‘being a smart-ass,’” Holly snapped, giving him a look. “You know how Axyl and I were before I started evolving affections for him, right? It’s just weird, yet awesome.”

Kyle rolled his eyes, smiling. “Yeah, yeah.”

Before Holly could be any more annoying about her feelings, according to Kyle, they heard a loud, abruptive roar of something that certainly was not a Mazer. Von had gotten down into hiding with Kyle and Holly, his eyes widened. “I don’t know what that was and I don’t want to know.”

Kyle and Holly were both nervous and they huddled closer to the counter, once they all heard an explosion from the inside of the super market. It was a deafening noise, which eventually shook the ground. The sound of a giant gun blared throughout the building, which was frightening for the three of them. What the hell was it? Then there was hard thud, slamming against the other side of the counter, which made Kyle squeal like a baby.

Unexpected Alliance

They could hear Blue Lazer moaning in agony on the ground, which motivated them to stand right up from their position. From seeing Blue Lazer on the ground, beaten, bloody, and consistently healing, there stood an Adoa Striker. Not just any Adoa Striker, but Magnate Yayvox himself. Yayvox was angry, as he roared and fired his massive Adoa weapon at them. This caused Holly, Von, and Kyle scrambled to get out of the firearms department. “The back door!” Von suggested, before Yayvox could fire his weapon once more.

“What about Axyl?!” Holly shouted, fully worrisome.

“HE CAN HANDLE HIMSELF!” Kyle screamed frightfully.

The three of them ran for their lives through the back door, away from Yayvox’s distant roars of anger. Yayvox did not chase after them, however. The monster stayed behind, for he wanted to destroy Blue Lazer and bring him to Zjok as soon as possible. Blue Lazer groaned in pain, quickly getting up, before Yayvox were to reach him, all while allowing his broken leg to heal. “Come on, you stupid leg, heal!” Blue Lazer hovered in the air, almost forgetting the fact that he could fly and loaded his semi-automatic rifle, before he actually faced the Striker once again.

“You can’t hide from me, Blue Lazer!” Yayvox laughing. “In fact, you can’t hide anywhere! Our army is all here! We will destroy all of you! No mercy! You are the poop-head!”

“You have a big mouth, fatty!” Blue Lazer yelled defiantly, firing his lasers at him, as well as his rifle. Barely doing little damage to Yayvox, the Striker laughing evilly, grabbed Blue Lazer and threw him across the interior of the supermarket. The hero maintained his balance, charging at the Striker once more, with Yayvox firing his rifle at him. Streaks of purple globs of lava streaked from Yayvox’s rifle, just barely scratching Blue Lazer’s body. Blue Lazer punched the Striker in the eye, getting on top of his head. Yayvox groaned angrily, covering his eye with his furry hand.

“URG! Get off me, you bug!”

Blue Lazer started tearing out Yayvox’s thick coat of fur and slammed his fists on his face. Yayvox was not in pain, though he was ultimately annoyed. Frustrated, Blue Lazer dug his elbow into Yayvox’s fur and was about to shred Yayvox’s brains with a powerful laser, until Yayvox grabbed him once more and slammed him hard against the floor. Ignoring the

Chapter 21


pain. Blue Lazer fired lasers from both of his elbows (while still lying on the ground), yelling angrily, before Yayvox was to stomp on him like an insect. Yayvox roared louder than ever, when a lasers pierced through the thick layers of his fur and into his body and destroying his rifle. Blue Lazer then took a swift and mighty kick from the Striker, which sent him across the supermarket once again. The hero failed to maintain his balance this time, as he crash-landed into a cash register.

“Ow,” he groaned, coughing up dust and debris. Blue Lazer couldn’t take this anymore; just one Striker was kicking him to the curb! He found it disappointing that he can slaughter any Mazer in sight. Though when it came to fighting this one Striker, fighting couldn’t be any more difficult. Blue Lazer had to act fast, especially when he heard Yayvox charging toward his position. “Jeez, he’s still not dead?!” Blue Lazer had no idea how strong Yayvox was. His fur and his body build was about as thick as metal.

Blue Lazer’s new plan was to fire more lasers and kick the shit out of Yayvox, but he fell into a different predicament. His foot was caught in some of the buildings wiring, which led him to be momentarily stuck. “Oh, come on! Not now, he’s about to stomp my head in!” Yayvox was getting close to him and Blue Lazer’s foot would not release from the wires. Once he finally tore the wires from grasping his foot, Blue Lazer quickly stood up ready to open fire. Before he could do that, a massive downpour of hot, molten cheese crashed from the supermarket’s ceiling, pouring onto Yayvox.

Knowing that extremely hot cheese was not a good sign, Blue Lazer scrambled to get up and stay out of the way. There was enough melted cheese to cover Yayvox’s entire body, which led him to a searing and burning pain beyond experience.

Yayvox was not roaring, but screaming like a lobster being boiled on a stove. “NOO! Not the cheese, not the cheese!! AIIIEE, AGGH!”

Blue Lazer stood in front of Yayvox, aiming his two elbows at him. The teenager smirked confidently, saying “No mercy, buddy-boy,” and fired infinite bursts of blue laser at the Striker’s burning body. Yayvox screamed for another few seconds, until his voice became gurgled, as he also began to drown in the immense amount of cheese. Within the next minute, Yayvox was defeated with his body completely covered in burning cheese and his

Unexpected Alliance


became fried from the large amount of lasers that pierced through his skin. He was barely alive, until Evil Nacho himself made an entrance through the disrupted ceiling. The nacho monster laughed manically as he took a sharp nacho chip and dug it into Yayvox’s cranium. Gray blood poured from his head, mixing in with the nacho cheese. Yayvox finally had his last, dying and gurgled breath.

Blue Lazer aimed his elbow at Evil Nacho, who smiled devilishly. “Just when I was starting to forget you, cheesy-boy.”














The monster cackled, spewing small amounts of cheese from his rotten mouth. “Oh, I’ve miss you so, Blue Hemroid! No need to fire those dreadful lasers at me. Today I’m letting you off the hook, from facing a cheesy death, like this bastard did here.”

Blue Lazer lowered his lasers gently. “What’re you saying, player?”

Evil Nacho walked up to him, standing at least two feet taller. “What do you think I’m saying, you ignoramus? Those uglies are destroying my city. MY CITY!”

Evil Nacho had spewed small amounts of cheese onto Blue Lazer’s face. He flinched weakly, wiping the cheese off. “No need to yell, bro. As if that beast’s roars weren’t enough.”

Evil Nacho continued to grin, for he was always satisfied. “They’re also intervening with my sewer system. You see, I have gallons and gallons of

Chapter 21


nacho cheese flowing underneath the city. It’s my way of living and my way of dominating--.”

“Ooo, kinky.”

“Interrupt me again and you’ll find a nacho chip jammed inside your brain, also.”

“Bring it, buddy-boy.”

Evil Nacho cackled. “We make terrifying enemies, you and I. Although, we can be definite allies.”

“Well I can see how your ‘sewer system’ can help, although it does give me another reason to kick your ass. That’s if you use it against the city, also.”

Evil Nacho continued to laugh. “The city is already under a Blue Lazer of destruction, Blue Lazer. I’m afraid it’s well worth the risk, if you are to save not only your loved ones and the city, but possibly the entire nation. I don’t know if your noticed, primate, but there’s more of them out there. They’re intention is way beyond than just destroying the city.” Blue Lazer thought for a moment.

“Accept it,” Evil Nacho continued, “and may today be the only day that you and I work together to stop these posers.”

Blue Lazer nodded in agreement. He couldn’t believe he was actually considering this. Although, he had to do this, even if it meant facing more enemies, like those who killed Cale Omnous. “Never in my life did I think you were going to use the word ‘poser.’ Anyway, Nacho, looks like you got a deal. This is quite the unexpected alliance.”

Evil Nacho grinned, shaking Blue Lazer’s hand. His monster’s hand felt clammy, warm, and greasy. Blue Lazer felt like he was shaking hands with a plate of nachos. “Quite the unexpected, indeed. Oh, and it’s Evil Nacho.”

you two just did. But no, he bailed out on me the minute I wanted to come here to the supermarket.”
