Blue Lazer felt concerned. “Wait, where’s Von? Wasn’t he with you guys?”

“He left to join the others being evacuated,” Kyle answered, watching Evil Nacho tore a nacho off his body and eat it. He found Evil Nacho’s appearance to be very hilarious.

“Well, he did have family to get to,” Blue Lazer shrugged, “even though he was a great team player. Well Kyle wants to find his girlfriend, Violet—I mean, Velouria—and I think it would be pretty cool to save the city.”

“You make me sound like a selfish jerk,” Kyle complained.

“No complaining, please, Kyle?”

“I—.”

“Shh!”

Holly looked at Blue Lazer and she was not happy with the way he’s been treating them. He looked back at her, smiling. She scoffed and walked back to Kyle. “Well, come on guys, let’s go save Velouria. She could be with the military, Kyle.”

“What’s your problem?” Blue Lazer asked, his hands on his hips.

Holly turned around. “Excuse me?”

“Uh oh,” Kyle exclaimed, slowly walking away. Evil Nacho was snickering continuously.

“You’re all, like, dramatic,” Blue Lazer said. He sincerely believed that he wasn’t acting like a jerk. He also thought that since he and Holly had more than a mutual relationship, he could say whatever the hell he wanted to her. Once again, Axyl was misbehaving like an ignorant tool.

Holly slowly walked up to him, with stern eyes. “Oh, I’m being dramatic?! Look who’s being the dill weed, being rude to Kyle like that!”



Chapter 21

















Blue Lazer spat laughter. “I was just messin’ with him! Wasn’t I, Kyle?”

Kyle didn’t say anything, though Holly answered for him. “Why mess with someone when we’re in the middle of a catastrophe?! There are aliens, ALIENS, attacking the city and hurting those we love! We are all worried sick about Velouria, and Cale is dead! Yeah, Kyle told me, and you don’t seem at all effected by your own friend’s death!”

“Now, hold on--.” Blue Lazer started, but Holly did not let him finish.

“Just because you have ‘cool laser powers’ and you can fly higher than a kite, doesn’t make reality a fun one! This is not a time to mess around! I was just about as worried as Kyle was for Velouria when I was looking for you, after all this craziness started! DID YOU EVEN THINK ABOUT ANYONE BESIDES YOURSELF WHEN YOU WERE SLAUGHTERING THOSE UGLY THINGS?!”

Blue Lazer looked at her. “You were looking for me?”

“YES! ‘Cause I care about you, you inconsiderate dumbass! However, I’m really starting to regret that I do, because it all seems a waste of my time! It’s like you never changed! You may have had your moments where you’re the sweetest guy ever, but you’re still that one meat-headed jerk that’s always thinking about himself! News flash for you, Axyl: The whole damn world doesn’t revolve around you! You need to face reality. The city is under attack, our loved ones’ whereabouts are unknown, and we are close to death!”

Chapter 21


“I—.”

Holly paused, her face in a somewhat state of shock. “That night, when those robots attacked us, WHY DID YOU LEAVE ME IN A DUMPSTER?!”

Blue Lazer was puzzled, though he remembered, as Evil Nacho laughed so hard that cheese spew out from his nose.

“Zip it cheeseball,” Blue Lazer replied sharply and turned back to Holly. “Holly, I put you there to keep you safe, remember?!”

“BUT YOU FORGOT ME! IT TOOK ME ALMOST AN HOUR TO GET OUT OF THAT THING! THANKFULLY IT WASN’T FULL OF GARBAGE, OR I’D BE SHOVING MY FOOT SO FAR UP YOUR—UGH! SHUT UP! JUST SHUT UP! COME ON, KYLE, WE’RE LOOKING FOR YOUR GIRLFRIEND! I’M NOT GONNA STAND HERE AND WAIT FOR THIS IDIOT TO COME THROUGH HIS SENSES!! WE’D PROBABLY BE DEAD, BY THE TIME THAT HAPPENS! RRRGGHH!”

Holly stomped on Blue Lazer’s foot hard, which actually caused a lot of pain. The hero groaned in pain, as Evil Nacho laughed. Holly gave Evil Nacho no satisfaction and she stormed off, with Kyle following her. Before Kyle left, he went up to Blue Lazer. “I knew you were just messin’ with me, bro. Whether you’re kidding or not, man, it’s time to get serious. I mean, just because you have powers and you can’t really die, doesn’t mean we can’t really die, either. Let’s go. We gotta find Velouria. I’m going to try calling her.”

As Kyle walked off, he took out his cellphone and frantically dialed Velouria’s number, just praying that she was okay. Blue Lazer and Evil Nacho followed, as they began to head toward Velouria’s neighborhood, which was nearby the supermarket. Flying seemed more appropriate, but being detected by more Adoa was the last thing to achieve. Blue Lazer remained quiet and he really needed to. He didn’t mean to constantly think about himself and only himself. He was just too stupid to realize it. In conclusion, he couldn’t be more grateful to be around Holly. If it weren’t for her, Blue Lazer would never realize how much an incompetent ape he really was.




Chapter 22: Epic Congregation















“Zjok, sir,” Galg’s voice came over Zjok’s communication device, bestowed in his armor. “No sign of Blue Lazer, or Asids, in the area. We’re blasting through everything we can and even our Probes have not detected anything. Furthermore, and I hate to say this because it makes me sad, Magnate Yayvox is dead. Well, presumably dead. We no longer have contact with him, Loof-koff, Ghed, or any other Mazer that was in Yayvox’s group. I had just sent a chunk of my team to a distant supermarket to see what they could find there and so far we have not heard anything.”

“Keep scourging the Earth,” Zjok ordered, without actually having the will to raise his voice. “Chances are Yayvox and the others are dead. Perhaps Blue Lazer is responsible for that. The Misara Serum is a powerful


Chapter 22


substance. I must have that Serum. My future depends on it! I must not upset the Drokensmur.”

“Yes, sir,” Galg replied. “For now the only conflict my group faces is the human military. They’re not doing so great, of course.”

“Good,” Zjok said casually. “Those pathetic homosapiens should give up, while they still have the chance.”

Zjok started laughing devilishly, and so did Galg, along with other Mazers and Strikers.













“Anything else, sir?” Galg replied.

Zjok took a sip of Kool-Aid. “Eliminate them. Eliminate them all. Show no mercy; only show death.

“Indeed, sir. Easy as pie.”


Kyle’s Neighborhood


Walking through Kyle’s neighborhood was like running through an empty one. In fact, this was literally the statement! The neighborhood was completely empty! Everyone who resided in the neighborhood had fled, abandoning their homes to the Adoa.



Epic Congregation


Kyle was busy calling Velouria on his cell phone for the past ten minutes. None of the calls resulted Velouria actually answering. Kyle was becoming anxious, scared, and more worried than he ever has been. Evil Nacho and Blue Lazer were both quiet. After Holly’s recent rage quit, Blue Lazer didn’t dare make another word. He felt awful and he was completely angry with himself. Being silent was his own personal punishment.

“Kyle,” Holly said, holding her shotgun tight.

Kyle sniffled desperately, calling Velouria once more. “Ugh, w-what?”

“You’ve been calling her, like, 27 times. Aren’t you worried about your parents, too?” Kyle was starting to sob, though not completely. “Kyle, honey, what’s wrong?”

Kyle was frantically waiting for an answer from Velouria. He was in no mood to talk to anyone, unless it was his girlfriend. The only sound Kyle made were gasps of anxiety and faint sobbing. After another thirty seconds of being on the phone… no answer. Everyone could hear the voicemail from his phone. That’s when Kyle went on a slight rampage, slamming his phone on the concrete, yelling angrily. He turned and looked at the view of Kingzing City, looking at the distant Adoa Ships. He raised his hand in the air, flipping the bird intentionally towards the bad guys attacking the city.

“Hold this,” Holly ordered, handing Blue Lazer her shotgun and comforted Kyle. Kyle shoved her away with an angry grunt. “Kyle, please. I know you’re upset. The neighborhood is empty. Velouria said she would be home on this day anyway, remember? She’s probably with her family, out of this city, safe and sound. I’m sure she’s out there. And you can call her on Axyl’s phone, right Axyl?”

Blue Lazer took out his cell. It appeared to be severely damaged and unable to operate. “That giant thing really got me good.”

Kyle started crying more, picking up his cell phone which he had thrown on the ground. “W-why did I do that? Oh, God, Velouria I’m so s-sorry.”

Holly knelt down beside him, rubbing his back gently. “Kyle, I know it’s hard.”

Chapter 22


“She’s my first girlfriend. She’s the only girl that’s actually ever liked me, let alone think I’m good looking.”

Blue Lazer snickered. Holly looked at him angrily. “Sorry! That’s just something that Zoolander would say. The ‘good looking’ part, that is.”

Kyle sniffled, laughing weakly. “Ha. Zoolander would say something like that.”

“So, you’re okay?” Holly asked.

Kyle stood up. “Not really, but I’m gonna consider what you said. Velouria did say she was home today. She’s probably all right. Although, we really should check her house. Holly, thank you.”

Holly smiled, giving her best friend a hug. “Anything for you, love.”

At that moment, a sudden, new event had occurred. Blasts of alien ammunition struck the concrete, barely missing Kyle. There were two Adoa Bats hurdling toward them, with two more people running in front of them.














It was Agents Nathan12 and Jon43 running from the Adoa.

“Run!” Nathan yelled frantically, dodging the firepower. “If you were as smart as I am, I would run like hell!” Holly and Kyle began running, as Blue Lazer and Evil Nacho stood in their place, even when lava bullets would strike them.

“Let’s do this, buddy-boy,” Blue Lazer confidently declared, tossing Holly’s shotgun aside. Evil Nacho roared with sheer evil, and leaped into the

Epic Congregation


air, latching himself onto one of the Bats. As he did that, Blue Lazer wielded both his elbows, shooting down the other Bat with his lasers. The ship crashed into the street before him, as Evil Nacho tore apart the other one thus landing into a nearby house. The ship exploded and the house caught fire.

“I was hoping to eat their faces off,” Evil Nacho said with a cackle, as he approached Blue Lazer.

“Yeah, that was a lot quicker than I thought. Anyone alright?”

Holly, Jon, Nathan, and Kyle were all standing in a distance behind them, catching their breath.

“A bit reckless, wouldn’t you think?” Jon replied.

“Hey!” Blue Lazer snapped. “They’ve caused enough damage as is! You’re just jealous!”

“Oh, who would be jealous of you?” Holly laughed, picking up her shotgun.

Blue Lazer stuttered, for he was still a little frightened to talk to her. “Uh, t-them?! Duh!”

Nathan took out his pistol, loading another magazine into it. “Okay, can we all please pipe down? Jon and I just got out of the city. Those two ships followed once we passed the pier at the waterfront. For those who do not know, it’s hell down there. The city is theirs’, now.”

“So what do we do, then?” Kyle asked. “Just wait until they leave?”

“They won’t ever leave,” Jon said. “They’re here for good. They’re here to wipe us all out. They’re also looking for something, or someone.”

“Well,” Holly stepping in, “then who?”

Jon sighed deeply and pointed at Blue Lazer. “It’s your powers, Blue Lazer. They want them. Apparently, you stole what was theirs and they want it back. At first we thought they were also after two more known aliens, known as Preox and Rig. But nope! They just want you.”

“B-but, what?!” Blue Lazer was more confused than ever. Then, it hit him, remembering back to when he first consumed the Misara Serum, all when he thought it was a simple energy drink called Boiling Blood. “You mean these powers that I have, it’s theirs? That’s why they’re here?!”

Chapter 22


“Basically, yeah,” Nathan replied. “Now they’re all just here to kill all of us, also. Apparently, they want to make Earth a new territory or some poop, like that. But, they want to start off with getting to you, first.”

















“So there’s no way in negotiating with these space turds?” Kyle asked frantically, though he was pretty sure he knew the answer. “So, we’re basically screwed.”

“I guess,” Nathan replied.

Blue Lazer took a deep breath, tightening the ninja mask around his head. “Alright, well I’m not giving up this easily. And I think it’s time for me to go on a rant!”

“Oh, jeez, not one of those,” Kyle rolled his eyes.

Blue Lazer ignored him and continued. “For years I’ve been an ungrateful ignoramus. For years I’ve been picking on the victims, I’ve been nothing but a troublemaker, a player, a liar, a cheater… and a loser. And now that things have literally gone to hell, within the past hour, this is no time to be an ungrateful ignoramus. However, I should never be an ungrateful ignoramus. Ever since I became Blue Lazer, I forgot how important it was to have good friends, a good father, and a great life. Holly, I know you want to kick me in the balls as hard as you can, but I want to let you know how sorry


Epic Congregation


I am. I mean it, from the very pit from where you want to kick me. Holly and I had sex last night and it was wonderful--.”

“Oh, come on!” Holly shouted, as everyone else started laughing. Evil Nacho was laughing the hardest, with nacho cheese drooling out of his nose. “Axyl, can you at least say we just went to dinner?!”

“She ain’t denyin’!” Jon laughed.

“Shame, shame, know your name!” Nathan laughed.

Blue Lazer shushed everyone. “Okay! Okay, so it’s true that Holly and I totally did it and that it was totally awesome, but that doesn’t disrupt the fact that I realized something that night.” He looked over at Holly, she had her arms crossed and avoided eye contact. “Spending time with Holly last night was probably one of the best times I’ve ever had. There was her concert and Kyle’s play, of course, but knowing that Holly really likes (or liked) me made me feel how lucky I was. I have these superpowers, I have a job, I have a wonderful home to live in, and you might say that’s ‘lucky.’ Although, knowing that Holly actually wanted to spend time with me made me feel like the luckiest person in the world.

“Holly, you’re seriously the hottest chick I’ve ever seen. What I really like about you is that you’re constantly independent and you’re always on top of things (like me for instance, but that’s beside the point.). What I’m really trying to say is that when I was with you last night, all of that laughter, the good food, the good sex-making, it all made me realize how undeserving I am. I don’t deserve you at all. I’m a slime-ball who deserves to be put in a wood chipper, like that guy from Fargo.”

Holly, who was completely touched by what Blue Lazer said, calmly replied with the middle finger. “Yes, yes you do deserve that.”

Blue Lazer nodded in agreement. “Well thank you, Holly. Anyway, I want to prove myself worthy of you. I’ve tried countless times before, with Kyle helping of course! And Kyle, I’m sorry for everything. I don’t know how many times I’ve given you a black eye in the past, but I promise you it will never happen again.

Kyle smiled and gave him a thumbs up. Blue Lazer then finished with a determined conclusion. “Now, I want to do this again, without screwing up, starting with protecting the people I care about. It’s not about me, anymore!

Chapter 22


It’s about us, all of us, forming together to fight back against what we’re standing up to. These alien dudes are really starting to piss me off. They killed my best friend, they almost killed these two agents here, they ruined Kyle’s play, and they’re destroying our home. Alright, buddies, let’s go kick some alien ass! Let’s rip ‘em up to shreds and give them no mercy, until we have the city back!”

“I’m actually really pumped for this,” Evil Nacho said with a grin.

Holly ran at Blue Lazer, kissing him full on the lips. Everyone gasped in surprise, except Evil Nacho. Holly parted lips with Axyl, slapping him across the face. “You are one lucky guy, you idiot.”

“So what’s the plan?” Kyle asked. “We can’t just walk into the city and expect to not get obliterated. Remember, Axyl, we can all die easily.”

Blue Lazer thought for a bit. “Well, we could go back to the Cheese and Crackers Supermarket, gear up as fast as possible, and make our way to the Dansko Bridge. We passed it, two miles out, and it seemed to be untouched.”

“Sounds decent,” Nathan replied. “I could go for a machete and a bullet-proof vest, right about now. That is… if bullet-proof vests can withstand these guys’ firepower.”

Blue Lazer was as blunt as an atom bomb. “Doubt it! Worth a try! Okay, guys, let’s rock and roll!”

Dansko Bridge. Status: Guarded by several Mazers.









Epic Congregation


The Dansko Bridge, which connects to and from the city, was inhabited by several Adoa Mazers. Their only objective, up until they were to find Blue Lazer, was to keep the Dansko Bridge until the Elephant ships were to arrive. The Dansko Bridge was smothered with obliterated vehicles and even some dead bodies. It was a disturbing sight to see. However, since the Adoa had invaded the city, which was over the course of two hours now, it had been extremely calm. Citizens of the city were either dead, evacuated, or simply forced into hiding throughout the city.

Two Mazers were walking along the Dansko Bridge, walking past a destroyed army tank, keeping an eye out for their surroundings. One Mazer, whose name was Ip, looked back at Kingzing City and gazed. Adoa ships were soaring around the city, like gentle birds. Some of the ships were firing their weapons upon buildings, as others were scavenging especially for searching Blue Lazer. Ip looked back at the other Mazer he was paired with, whose name was Bee, and examined his body armor in a questionable motion.

“What’re you looking at?” Bee said.

“You look good, today, Bee,” Ip replied almost immediately. “I know that’s a little creepy, but there’s something about your appearance that makes you look spectacular.”

Flattered, yet concerned, “Oh, thank you Ip. Yeah, I brushed my teeth today, they were turning yellow-colored. Too much coffee, you know what I mean?”

Ip nodded, keeping his rifle held tight as he felt his teeth. “Yeah, I feel ya. I should have brushed mine, too. Jeez, ever since we arrived to this planet, my job has gotten so much easier.”

“Right?!” Bee agreed, he licked his teeth and moaned with satisfaction. “These humans are as easy to shred as paper! The young ones are annoying when they’re dying, though, so I guess that can be the only downside to everything.”

Ip thought for a moment and casually nodded in agreement, with a slight chuckle. Then he thought some more, based on a different subject. “Hmm, I wonder where Yayvox could be. He said he was invading on the


Chapter 22


other side of the bridge, near this city called Marsing. I wonder where he could be.”

“He’s up your ass, bear face,” came a familiar voice, a voice filled with confidence. It was Blue Lazer who had defiantly insulted Ip. Kyle, Holly, Jon, and Nathan all approached them, aiming their rifles at their enemies. As for Evil Nacho, his adrenaline was fully prepared, similar to that of a loaded rifle. The humans were completely loaded with ammunition, also wearing bullet-proof vests and other protection gear. Blue Lazer had no weapons. He only wore a bullet-proof vest, decorated with the custom writing of the initials “S.J.,” with a small doodle of himself. The Mazers growled, raising their hands in the air as a sign of surrender.

“You are aware that there are more of us at this bridge’s exit, do you not?” Ip asked. Blue Lazer and the others were standing at least five feet away from them, now. “All of Zjok’s troops are going to annihilate all of you, there’s nothing you can do! Killing us will change nothing, it will never bring back the death toll we have given you! So go ahead, shoot me, Blue Waffle! I dare you!” Blue Lazer was silent, but kept the tips of his elbows pointed directly at the two Mazers. “Shoot us, you masked prick! You wanna know something? I bet you can’t do it! You can’t do it! Would you like Bee and I to kill you, then?! We will feast on your flesh, victoriously, just like we’ve done to the precious citizens of your city! There’s one thing I love nothing more than killing and that is the taste of your human meat! So, what’s it gonna be, Ult--.”

PEEW!

The laser split the Mazer in two. Without hesitation, Blue Lazer lunged at Bee and started slamming his fist against his face.

“N-no, not my clean t-teeth,” Bee moaned in pain, before Blue Lazer threw him over the bridge and into the cold water, which separated the city from the urban area.

“I’m a man of action, not words,” Blue Lazer announced, watching the Mazer plummet into the water. “Okay!”


Epic Congregation


“I don’t think the rest of them are very happy,” Nathan said, pointing toward the distant Mazers charging at them. “Everyone should take cover behind anything that is durable!”

They weren’t the best at using guns. However, that wasn’t their fault considering the fact that they never really needed to use a gun for anything.

“I need to get better at this!” Holly yelled angrily.

The shattering glass of a car window showered over Kyle, as he curled into a ball while reloading his weapon. “I barely even know how to use this!”

“Pretend it’s a natural body movement!” Nathan suggested, after putting a bullet into a Mazer’s chest. “Don’t think about the recoil, just pretend it’s all natural! You’ll get the hang of it!”

“Gee, thanks, Mr. Best Advice Giver In the World!” Holly shouted right back, for she thought Nathan’s advice was clearly unhelpful.

“Well, sorry! Agh! That one almost got me!”

Evil Nacho came from behind them, bellowing in a screech-like manner. The enemy Mazers showed true fear towards him, as the monster pierced their skulls with nacho chips and throwing them high into the sky.













Chapter 22

Blue Lazer grabbed a Mazer by the leg, slamming the enemy against the concrete and the disturbing noise of bones breaking ran effectively along with the sound of firepower. Blue Lazer destroyed the rest of them with his lasers, fists, and beating them with their own weapons.

An Adoa Bat came hurdling by, firing its guns at them. Evil Nacho flung a nacho chip through the fighter’s window and thus digging into the brain of the pilot. The Bat crashed into the water, with other pilot desperately trying to get out of his ship, but Holly put a bullet in his head.

“That’s better!” Nathan shouted excitingly. “Oh no, I see more of them!”

Blue Lazer took flight, firing his lasers down at the Adoa infantry. Evil Nacho erupted hot nacho cheese from his gaping mouth, incinerating the aliens with its intense heat. The rest of the small, yet powerful group took cover behind more massive debris, shooting at any enemy they see. Kyle, at one point, fired his gun and accidently struck Evil Nacho in the back of the head.

“OW! Watch your shooting, you sag-bellied weasel!”

peak from behind the car, seeing everyone fight, and analyzed an Adoa Mazer’s movement with his massive rifle. Confused as to how the Mazer actually used his weapon, Jon loaded his by lifting a small latch on the side and pushed a blue button. The Mazer fell, gurgling weakly, and died almost immediately. “Well, this is gonna take some getting used to!”

“It better!” Nathan yelled, taking cover behind another car. “I see more of them!” Blue Lazer continued to fight and fight, using his lasers of mass destruction, creating sonic booms to send his enemies flying, and ultimately beating the Mazers senseless. “Chief Galg, we need your assistance, now! There’s only six of them and we’re getting slaughtered down here! I’m calling from the bridge, one of the entrances to the city. Help us! Help us n---grkrkrk!!”

Holly had kicked the Mazer in the groin area, which made him collapse to his knees. She kicked him in the face, shattering the alien’s teeth. The Mazer, gasping for air and coughing up blood, reached for his gun. Holly, however, was quicker than he was as she fired several rounds into his face. Another Mazer roared at Holly in anger, and she attempted to fire more rounds at him, also. Alas, Holly was finally out of ammo. “Oh, damn.” The Mazer laughed manically, firing a few rounds into Holly’s chest, sending her backward onto the concrete.

Her vision was blurred, her head was throbbing in pain, and her body was experiencing some searing pain other than natural matters. She tried to breathe, but that action turned out to be the most difficult. She could feel the lava ammunition, lodged deep inside her body, burn immensely on the inside and outside. It was all so quick and Holly had almost no idea what had hit her, until she first screamed in agony. The battle on the Dansko bridge continued to wage on and Holly could faintly hear the Mazer (who had shot her) laugh. The Mazer then coughed on his own blood, which was a part of the effect from Holly kicking him in the groin with extreme power. The Mazer began to walk towards the vulnerable Holly, ready to finish her off.

“I know, I know,” Blue Lazer said, hastily wiping off the lava from her stomach which was an easy task. He didn’t mind the burning sensation of the lava. He knew he was going to heal right up from that. However, Holly wasn’t and Blue Lazer wasn’t quite sure what to do about the flaming hot bullets lodged into Holly’s skin. and released a pile of hot boiling lava. Kyle shrieked like a girl, as did Nathan. She screamed in agony, once the last drop of lava escaped from her mouth. finished off the rest of the Adoa with his lasers, along with Evil Nacho and his deadly chips. The Asid ship moved on to finish off the remaining Adoa Mohawk, which was desperate to shoot them down. Bxir! How many minutes do you think the rest of Zjok’s fleet could reach orbit?”

“Well she did just puke lava,” Moosey snapped, who held onto his pistol. “If I were to puke lava, I would probably be a little traumatized, too.”

Preox shook his head. “I don’t think this human is under any traumatic disorder. It seems like she’s transforming. Only the Misara Serum can do something like that. The real question is… how did she get the Serum inside her, just now? The Serum doesn’t fully kick in, after several hours.”

“So what,” Blue Lazer spat, “you’re some space nerd who happens to know everything?”

“It’s called research, you lip-noodle. Give me attitude one more time, I will graze you like cheese.”

Evil Nacho exclaimed happily, licking his lips. “You just read my mind!”

Preox looked up at Evil Nacho, finally taking notice of him. He stood before him, standing at the same height as the monster himself. “Who are you? Is the Serum a part of you?”

Evil Nacho looked into Preox’s eyes, grinning. “No, no. I’m going to be blunt. My story is just another one.”

Preox nodded, shrugged, not sure what Evil Nacho meant, and turned to Blue Lazer. “You. We know you obtained the Misara Serum, which gave you the abilities you have used against the Adoa. I may have all the answers, but not all of them. I have a question for you. Did--.”

Suddenly, Galg had climbed from the side of the Dansko Bridge and began shooting at everyone. Apparently, his ship had gone down during the

Epic Congregation


most recent battle. He had a special cannon-blaster atop of his shoulder armor, which could release flaming balls of fire.

Their ammunition was rebounding off of Galg, revealing a force-field surrounding his figure. Galg roared angrily, shooting down a few marines and agents, making his way toward Blue Lazer and the others. Evil Nacho spew more nacho cheese, which Galg was completely immune to.

“Buzz off, nacho boy,” Galg laughed, shooting a fireball into Evil Nacho’s face, thus exploding on impact. Evil Nacho was sent flying into the water, below the Dansko Bridge.

Preox took cover, for he couldn’t do a thing. “Ugh! Will someone please, whose more powerful than the average creature, take him down?! His shield can only deflect non-living objects. Blue Lazer, see if you can get close, disable the shield and/or beat the holy hell out of that joke.”

“What’s a joke is your naïve perspective!” Galg laughed at Blue Lazer.

Blue Lazer gasped. “Oh no you didn’t!” He charged at Galg, throwing a fist at his face. Galg caught his fist, swiftly, gripping it tight. Galg’s fireball cannon was automatic, shooting fireballs at anyone who was surrounding the two. No one could jump in and help. Now, Axyl, consider your last moment come to an end.” Before Blue Lazer could fire a laser in his face, Galg held on onto him tightly, firing many rounds into his stomach. Blue Lazer couldn’t get free, Galg was way too strong. The fireball cannon kept everyone under heavy fire, as Galg continued to fire his rifle into Blue Lazer’s stomach. Blood was spilling everywhere and Blue Lazer was screaming in agony. He shut his eyes tight, just wishing and hoping the pain would end. Was this the end of Blue Lazer?

Chapter 22














Kyle was coiled into a ball, as he held onto Holly’s unconscious body. He kept quiet, amongst the screaming and warfare. While this was happening, the sun had come out from the storm clouds, its light shining upon Holly.

“Holly! Get down! You’ll die!”

“Stay where you are,” she simply said, taking off her leather jacket. She now only wore a distracting tank top, her black jeans, and her black leather boots that she usually wears for The Nasty Pen. She walked in a fast-pace, towards Galg and Blue Lazer. The fireball cannon blasted at her, causing not even the slightest damage to her skin. She was completely immune to fire! Galg finally took notice of Holly, when she grabbed ahold of the cannon, tearing it off his armor. She also had super strength! Preox ordered everyone to ceased fire.

“Hold it, guys,” he said, “we’re about to watch a great show.”

“Oh, snap!” Drox shouted excitedly.

Holly was super pissed and Galg knew that he was in some trouble. Galg let go of Blue Lazer, pushing him into the concrete. He weakly crawled to safety, just barely breathing, allowing his body to heal as fast as it could.

Epic Congregation.


Galg roared at her, attempting to shoot Holly. She snatched it from him, snapping his rifle in half with her bare hands. Instead of simply kicking him in the face, Holly stretched out her arm with her fingertips spread apart. Ridiculously thick and sharp rose thorns grew from her skin as she grabbed Galg’s throat and squeezed it hard. The thorns dug into Galg’s sensitive skin and blood began to slowly ooze. From a nonchalant expression to a deeply angry one, Holly’s face was full of the following expressions, she tightened the grip on Galg’s throat. Everyone surrounding them all watched in pure amazement. Galg was roaring, not just in anger, but now in excruciating pain. Holly brought the Chief Mazer towards her, looking up at him with no remorse.

Galg gurgled. “Y-you will never stand a chance against the mighty Z-Zjok! Urgg, d-do your worst human! I-I dare you!”

There was silence, other than the vines tightening around Galg. Holly stared at her enemy, drawing him closer to where their faces were close to touching one another’s. After a couple more seconds, Holly saying “With pleasure,” she opened her mouth and out came a jet of searing solar flares, blazing against Galg’s skin. Galg couldn’t scream or say any last words, as his face had disintegrated into nothing. Galg’s head was completely burnt off, with flames erupting from where it once was. Galg’s utterly brutal death was thus ended after Holly smashed it against the ground, causing cracks to erode into the concrete. Her thorny vines were then retracted into her arms and her eyes went back to normal.

She looked up at the sky, gazing at the now sunny sky. She remained emotionless, as beautiful orange tiger lilies grew along her forearms and one white rose growing from the side of her temple. Her bruises and bullet wounds had disappeared, as if they were never there. Her hair had become curly and wavy, as if Mother Nature had given her a sudden make-over. She sighed deeply and slowly turned around, facing the others. Everyone’s jaw was dropped, eve from the ones who were wounded to fatally wounded.

“I hate how pretty she is,” Kriket said quietly, in jealousy, towards Admiral Bxir.

Bxir was practically drooling for Holly, he was hardly paying any attention. “Oh, I’m sorry, whut?” Kyle got up and hugged Holly tightly.

Chapter 22


“Holly,” he whispered in her ear, “that was wicked. More wicked than the actual Wicked Broadway musical.”

Chapter 23: Infinite Valor














Heroes of Kingzing City were here to save the day, at last. However, they weren’t welcome with cheerful chants and hugs. They were welcomed into Kingzing City with tragic upsets and a massive portion of the city was heavily damaged. Some smaller buildings were ready to collapse any minute, as some others were heavily damaged and partially in flames.

Vehicles were flipped over, roads were beaten and cracked, and many citizens were either seriously injured or dead (Many of them were ultimately unable to escape the Adoa’s clutches.). Most of them were able to flee because they were on the other side of the Dansko Bridge. The civilians directly inside the city, however, faced a deadly struggle; especially with human military forces who desperately tried to fight the Adoa. several Adoa Bats and human military jets that have crash-landed into buildings or in the middle of the street.
