Nowndu, get ready for this ship to station itself to their


Infinite Valor


main power plant. We will be extracting their electricity from there. The other mother ships will be stationed in the small island close to the city and above that obnoxiously tall building in the middle of the city, itself.”

“I think that building is actually called the Obnoxious Tower, sir. It’s the tallest building in the city.”

“Oh is it, now? Hmm, well, that’s pretty cool. Too bad we have to destroy it. Anyway, I want you to adjust the lightning cannons to full throttle, spread the word.”

Nowndu reacted innocently. “I’m the new Chieftain, sir?”

Zjok nodded. “Now go, before I kill you. If anything gets catastrophic in my eyes, I will notify you to release the Neeka.”

Nowndu gulped. “Are you sure you want to do that? I mean, the Neeka is a powerful, powerful creature.”

“Oh yes, I’m sure of it, and the Neeka will be released, if the time comes of course. Blue Lazer will not save the day, I can assure you.”

Nowndu was terrified, not just about the Neeka, but he was frightened of Zjok’s daring decision on bringing it into battle in the first place!


Before the Elephants descended, everyone said their farewells at The Dookoran. Their good-byes were short, although they still had some emotion carried throughout.

“Kick their teeth in, buddies. Good luck,” Blue Lazer said to Holly and Kyle, hugging them both.

“Ditto!” Holly and Kyle hollered. Moosey and Nathan said goodbye, in the hopes of chewing more bubble gum together. Preox and Kriket said goodbye to Admiral Bxir and Envoy Zitkir, just before they had all split into their groups.

“Keep us posted and good luck, Magnate,” Bxir said.

“Will do,” Preox responded with a nod. He turned to Kriket, looking into her eyes, “Let’s go, sweet thing.” Kriket began blushing uncontrollably.

“Aww, that’s so cute!” Rig shouted happily, hugging Preox from behind.

“I’ll see you soon, Rig, you insignificant oaf.”

Chapter 23


Preox, Kriket, and Drox, activated the jet-packs on their Vambits and took off into the air, making their way to the Funky Munkey Café. As for the rest of their group, Moosey offered Kyle a “moose ride,” knowing the fact they couldn’t fly at all. Kyle looked up at the sky, as he got onto Moosey’s furry back, seeing the immense amount of Adoa ships closing in on the city. He kept his rifle close, made sure it was loaded, and held it tight. “You sure this is okay, moose?”

Moosey laughed. “Of course, pal! I’ve given plenty of ‘moose rides!’ You’re about as weightless as a patch of cloth, so I’ll be fine!”

“Not sure whether to take that as a compliment, or not?”

Kyle found it somewhat awkward that he was getting a ride from a talking moose, wearing a professional outfit. In fact, he found it almost completely ridiculous. Considering the position he was in, Kyle wasn’t sure whether to feel frightened or to laugh his ass off; the two emotions did not mix well. Moosey took off on his four legs, running as fast as he could through the city. He tried his best to keep up the pace with the three Asids, although he didn’t worry about it too much because Kyle knew exactly where the coffee shop was located. The sound of thunder, erupting from the Elephants’ lightning cannons, grew louder as the massive amount of Adoa ships drew closer. Kyle gripped his rifle tightly, ready for any hostility to approach.

“I won’t be able to fight while running!” Moosey shouted, as they ran through the other side of the city. They took a slight detour, other than the Dansko Bridge. “If you see any bad guys, shoot them!!”

“What a coach you are!”

“Hey! Watch it, Sammy Sarcasm!”

Kyle started laughing, for the first time in hours. He had a good time laughing, until he saw one of the Elephants appearing from out of the massive clouds. His jaw dropped. “DUDE! WHAT THE HELL IS THAT?!”

Moosey looked up and he was close to whimpering, like a sad puppy. “VERY, VERY BAD THING!” Right at that precise moment of disturbing discovery, purple lightning shot out of the Elephant’s cannon, striking the ground in scattered directions, striking houses, trees, and ultimately destroying anything it touched. The lightning was also striking the concrete,

Infinite Valor


close to Moosey and Kyle. They screamed frantically, as Moosey tried his best to avoid getting blown up.














A rod of powerful lightning struck a few yards from Moosey, the explosion spewing dirt in his face. “Eew! Dirt! Yucky!”

“First world problems!” Kyle shrieked in sarcasm, holding onto Moosey, as tight as he could. “Okay, we’re drawing near the Funky Munkey Café, do you see Preox and the others?!”

“NO!” Moosey replied. He was beginning to really freak out.

Kyle grunted angrily and he was really worried about Velouria. The thought of her getting viciously murdered by a clan of ugly alien beings, poisoned his brain into complete rage. “Then, they must be in there, already!”

“You don’t know that!” Moosey yelled. A massive rod of lightning struck the ground from behind them. Moosey and Kyle were getting very scared, now.

“I-I don’t care! I have to save Velouria! Whether the Asids are there or not, we’re crashing through the big window of the Café! Come on, Moosey, let’s be heroes for once!”

“ARE YOU TITTING ME?! HELL NO! WE’RE STICKING TO THE PLAN!”

“What plan?! Preox didn’t exactly elaborate what we had to do when we got there! He was too rushed to get into it!”

Chapter 23


Moosey laughed. “Ha! That’s what she said! Oh, Kyle, I don’t know! I’m really scared!”

Kyle spat, as they dodged more strikes of lightning. “Don’t be scared, Moosey! I know, all of this warfare is scary as hell, I’m scared too, but that should never tell you to stand down! Moosey, you’re an awesome agent. I know we just met, but I can tell you work hard in what you do and that you would do anything for your career, even if it risked your life!”

“I am a hard worker!” Moosey agreed.

“And you’re a freakin’ moose! Moose are the most violent, most brutal, most badass wildlife there is! You can ram those aliens to death! Moosey, don’t doubt yourself…” they were approaching straight towards the Funky Munkey Café “…don’t let your fears conquer your mindset! Moosey, we’re almost there, you got this!”

“I GOT THIS! AGGGGHHHH!”

A few Mazers, who were guarding the entrance, were completely thrown off guard by the sight of Moosey and Kyle. Kyle aimed his rifle, as Moosey ran faster, and opened fire. “AGGGHHHHH!!” Bullets pierced through the Mazers’ skulls, killing them all instantly, as Moosey’s horns shattered the glass of the massive Café. Glass shattered all over the floor, sprinkling on the Mazers and hostages inside. Before Kyle and Moosey knew it, they had their guns raised and pointed at the bad guys surrounding them. Mazers squealed, aiming their Adoa rifles at the two. Kyle had his gun aimed at Uug, the Striker he had seen through Kriket’s Vambit before.

“LET THESE PEOPLE GO, NOW!” Kyle was not only scared, but insanely pissed. Moosey was also in a moose rage, as he pointed his pistol at a standing Mazer. There were at least two other Mazers and just one Striker. There were only a few hostages, hostages including Velouria and even Axyl’s father. Their faces were beaten, scratched, and their clothes were torn; they all laid flat on the Café’s concrete floor. The Asids were also nowhere to be seen, but that didn’t bother Kyle one bit.

Uug looked down at Kyle, who was standing at least ten feet over his tiny head. “I was going to have my lunch break. However, now that you’re here, I guess that’ll have to wait. Do you have what we want? Surrender Blue Lazer; surrender him and we will let these primates leave.”

Infinite Valor


Kyle looked over at Velouria, who was weakly lifting her head, looking back at him. She shook her head “no” at him, as she had looked like she was crying. Kyle gave Uug an angry look. “You liar. I’m ending this, now.”

“Whoa, whoa, easy there buzzard,” Uug laughed. The Striker tapped a few buttons on his armor and several blue lights were illuminated throughout the Funky Munkey’s interior. “You shoot me dead, the whole place explodes!” The sound of thunder and lightning obstructing the city was overheard, as Uug gave his little speech. “Once I am dead, the bio signature implanted in my armor will know, sending the message of ‘activation’ to each one of these blue-illuminated bombs, which are along these walls.”

Kyle sighed deeply, lowering his weapon. “Fine, whatever. Moosey, lower your gun.”

Moosey growled angrily, setting his weapon on the ground.

Uug gasped. “You’re the little turd who tried to grab at me through that holo-gram, earlier! Oh, wow! This is rich! Hahahaha! I wonder if… oh… you were, or still are, angry about something other than us keeping these hostages, aren’t you? You mentioned someone’s name. A hostage’s name.”

“No I didn’t,” Kyle lied.

“Yes you did!”

“No I did not, sir.”

“YES YOU DID! YOU’RE THE ONE WHO’S LYING!” Uug roared angrily. The Striker detached a section of armor from his side, unfolding it into a massive Striker beam gun. Moosey’s eyes widened, as did Kyle’s and the poor hostages’. The other two Mazers focused their crosshairs on the hostages, as Uug focused his beam rifle on them, also. “Who was it that you mentioned in our minor conversation?! Tell me now, or I will kill all of you, and the deal for handing over Blue Lazer will be no more!”

The massive beam rifle’s barrel, about the diameter of a log, was just inches from Kyle’s face. Kyle was too afraid to blink. He was afraid that if he blinked, it would be the last time he ever did blink. Then, before he could answer Uug, Velouria herself did.

“H-here,” she stuttered, laying down on the cold hard floor. She was breathing heavily, praying that Uug wouldn’t stomp on her petite body.

Uug laughed once more, turning back at Velouria.

Chapter 23

















Uug, with an ugly expression of which he himself found attractive, turned back to Kyle. “Looks like I can have my lunch break, after all!” Uug started walking towards Velouria. “Don’t worry, sweetheart, I’ll try to make this as painful as possible.” Uug opened his gaping mouth and he was going to eat Velouria. She was too petrified to get up and run, although if she had done so, she would be dead just as easily.

“DON’T YOU LAY A FAT, FURRY FINGER ON HER!!” Kyle shouted. He wanted to run at the Striker, but the Mazers kept him in check. If Kyle, Moosey, or any of hostages, dared to move at this point, the two Mazers would blast them to bits. Velouria started crying as Uug drew closer and closer, close enough to where she could smell Uug’s ugly breath. All hope was lost when the three Asids burst into the scene, through the broken window. Kriket and Drox focused on the two Mazers, Preox kept his focus on Uug.

“Step back from the lady, fatty,” Preox demanded.

Uug immediately turned around, aiming his massive beam gun at Preox. “Well! If it isn’t Preox! The last time I saw you was planet Strom!”

“Enough chit chat, bonehead, give us the girl and the other hostages, now. Do it before I blow your brains out.”

Uug laughed manically. “Oh, Zjok would love your attitude! In fact, he thinks you’re dead! I better give him a call, now.”


Infinite Valor


“Don’t you dare,” Preox ordered. “If you so as contact that hypocritical monster, your head will explode.”

“You tell ‘em, Preox!” Drox said happily. He had always looked up to Preox as some sort of role model.

“Oh?” Uug playing stupid. “Oh, Preox, you’re digging your own grave and your friends. If I die, these bombs will go--.”

Preox had shot him dead in the mouth, which happened to be a Striker’s primary weakness. (A Striker’s thick skin and fur was the equivalent to that of typical body armor, though a straight shot in the mouth would splice a Striker’s brain, no matter what.)

It all happened so quickly. While Uug was falling to the ground, dead, Kriket and Drox shot down the two Mazers, before they could even react to their leader’s death. An obnoxious siren blared throughout the interior of the Funky Munkey Café, indicating that the bombs Uug had set were about to ignite. Preox told everyone, including his team, to run like hell. Kyle ran for Velouria, slightly climbing over Uug’s massive dead body. Preox was yelling at him to move quickly, as the sirens blared louder and louder. Kyle picked up Velouria in his arms, knowing the fact she was too heavy for his thin biceps to carry, and ran as fast as he could. Velouria’s leg was seriously injured and her face was beaten harshly. They had made it out of the Café, along with the others, or so they thought of course. Jared Smithy was the last to make it out of there, running as fast as he could with the others. Moosey was giving the hostages a moose ride, as Preox and Kriket made sure that the others were okay. They were all able to make it to the next block, before a deafening and blinding explosion erupted, from where the Café once stood. Brick, chunks of concrete, and large amounts of flaming dirt and wood were sent flying into the air and landing heavily onto the ground. The explosion made everyone collapse, temporarily hurting themselves. Preox coughed up some dirt, realizing that his bottom lip was bleeding. “Ow, that could have gone smoother.” The Funky Munkey Café was completely destroyed to crumbles of debris.

Kriket weakly got up on her feet and immediately began aiding the people they had saved. “Preox, I would like to say that was a stupid move you made, but it was really the only thing that could be done.”

Chapter 23


“They were gonna kill us, either way,” Jared stepped in. “Hi, I’m Jared Smithy.”

Preox felt dubious when he shook Jared’s hand. It was a bit off-putting, yet somewhat pleasant. He wasn’t staring at Preox like any human being would, if he or she were to actually see an alien from outer space, face-to-face. “I’m Preox, the Asid,” Preox replied, with a side dish of sarcasm. “Is everyone okay? Anyone hurt?!” Adoa Bats and Mohawks were seen flying by. Preox was seriously hoping that the explosion wasn’t the reason why they were flying so close to their position. “Alright, we all have to get you out of the city, now! There’s a military check-point at your waterfront pier, they will take you from the city, along with other civilians, on their cruisers.”

Kyle had sat Velouria up, who screamed in pain, sitting her on a curb next to the street. She had been shot in the thigh, moments before he and Moosey had come to save her. “Preox, you should have told us where and when exactly where to meet outside the Café, before all of this happened!!”

“Don’t start with me, human!” Preox snapped back. “I’m sorry we’re late! But just because we were, doesn’t give you the permission to just jump right into things! You and that moose could have been killed over there! Thankfully, the Adoa were stupid enough to not shoot you when they had the chance.” Preox was right and that really bothered Kyle. Kyle was just trying to save his girlfriend from suffering a horrible fate, anyway. Kriket came beside Velouria, and started tending to her thigh. She was shot by a lava bullet, leaving a brutal and gaping wound. Smoke was still rising from the wound and it was burning her. Kriket took off her Vambit, took out a glass vile of alcohol and dabbed a few drops on Velouria’s wound. Velouria screamed, crying her eyes out.

“Kyle, I’m gonna need you to stand back, please,” Kriket said calmly, as she was working her. “Don’t worry, sweetheart, this will only sting for only a minute. I promise, the pain will go away, once I take the bullet out.”

“N-no, please,” Velouria begged. Kyle stood by, trembling in tears. He didn’t like to see Velouria like this. Kriket was taking out an exotic tool, of what seemed to be a massive syringe. The syringe looked about as familiar as the syringes used for Zjok’s Steamy Vampire B-105, though a lot smaller.

Infinite Valor


“Sweetie, I promise the pain will go away once I inject the wound with this needle. The bullet is still pouring lava inside your thigh and within the next minute or so, you could lose your entire leg, if not more.”

“I-it hurts,” Velouria cried.

“Just do it, Kriket!” Preox demanded. “This isn’t a medical lesson, we’ve got to move!”

“You’re the one who decided to go out and save these hostages!” Kriket shouted right back. “So shut up and let me work at my own pace!”

Preox was silent. Moosey snickered at him, as he helped some of the hostages get back on their feet.

“Okay, Velouria, this is probably going to hurt a lot worse,” Kriket said, as subtle as she could be. She didn’t want to lie to her patients, anyway. “Just close your eyes and I will be numbing the pain before you know it. The syringe is going to disintegrate the bullet and suck in all of the harmful material that’s not welcome inside your body. You ready? Just try to be perfectly still.”

“Kyle, get over here, please,” Velouria requested. Kyle knelt beside her, holding her hand tightly.

Kriket held the syringe firmly, counted from three, and aggressively slammed the syringe into the bullet wound. A gut-wrenching, ongoing shriek came from Velouria’s voice box, causing searing pain to Kyle’s ear and hand, as she squeezed his hand tightly.




Chapter 23


The syringe made the noise of an alarm clock, along with a robotic voice shouting “SUCK IT!” and Kriket immediately did the job. The bullet’s remains were sucked into the syringe, along with a small portion of unwanted magma. Once the syringe was full, Kriket took it out of the wound, set it aside and rubbed more alcohol on it. The screaming wouldn’t stop, until Kriket took out another glass vile, pouring a few drops on Velouria’s boo-boo. Velouria immediately started to calm down at last, as Kriket hastily wrapped a plastic bandage around her thigh.

“Are you okay? Not sure if my hand is.” Kyle asked, quietly. Velouria nodded, kissing Kyle’s hand.

“Thank you, Kriket,” Velouria smiled brightly. Kriket smiled back.

Kyle slowly helped Velouria back on her feet. She could no longer feel the pain, thanks to the numbing, although she still had trouble walking.

“You should be able to walk normally soon,” Kriket informed. The Asid woman looked around her, checking if anyone else was suffering any pain similar to Velouria’s. Everyone else was either scratched or slightly beaten. They were more than okay to move on, which was great for the heroes because they had to move quickly. Everything seemed to be in perfect check, until Kriket realized that someone was missing from the group. “Preox, where’s Drox?”

Chills ran up his alien spine. Preox had not realized that Drox was nowhere to be seen. The others took it as a surprise also.

“Is that him?” Jared asked, pointing in the direction to the other side of the road. Kriket gasped horrifyingly, seeing Drox laying on the corroded sidewalk.

“DROX?!” Kriket hollered running frantically to Drox. He wasn’t moving, his body was covered in neon-pink blood, and he certainly did not reply to Kriket’s calling. The others followed her, approaching Drox’s side, who lay face up on the concrete. His eyes were squinted and blood was pouring from his fatal wounds.

“No,” was that Preox could say, when Kriket got down on her knees and shook Drox aggressively.

“The explosion,” Kriket sobbed, after checking the Asid’s pulse. Drox was gone from blood loss, broken bones, as well as any other external and

Infinite Valor


and internal injuries. Drox’s blood was also sprayed out on the street, indicating that he was sent flying from the recent explosion, which lead to the Funky Munkey Café’s demolition.

“He must have been the last one out,” Preox said, showing no expressed emotion. Kriket sobbed her eyes out, after closing Drox’s dead eyes, gently. Preox took a piece of Drox’s destroyed Vambit, which was crushed on impact from the explosion. They didn’t know what else to do with the body, because the Adoa was already here and that would only slow them down. Preox set Drox’s body in an upright posture, sitting up against a building nearby. Now, it appeared that Drox was only resting. Preox tapped the transmission button on his armor and spoke. “Admiral Bxir, this is Magnate Preox, we have saved the hostages. We’re making our way to take them to safety. Drox is down, he was taken out by an explosion set by an Adoa Striker.”

“Damn,” Bxir said, for that’s all he could really say about Drox’s death. “I’m just here with Blue Lazer, Derno, and Zitkir. We’s waitin’ on where our Elephant is gon’ be stationed for creatin’ their shield generators. We have reinforcements, also. I suggest you find some, yerself; the Adoa ain’t gon’ play nicely.”

“Zjok was always serious, so it doesn’t surprise me. I’ll update the rest of our group and I’m not sure what we’re going to do about Zjok’s Elephant, since the plan is practically taking care of the first two and remaining civilians.”

“We’ll play it by year,” Bxir stated and the transmission ended. Preox loaded his rifle and turned to the rest of his team.

“Alright, we gotta get you civilians with the army. Battleships and a carrier have made it to the city’s waterfront. They will take you away from the city there. However, I am afraid that we’ll be running into more obstacles than we have, before.

One of the civilians, whose name was Bobcat, spoke. “Well this isn’t as simple as bit coins, that’s for sure. Do you guys have anything to defend ourselves with?” Kriket and Preox gave Bobcat and Jared their Asid combat pistols. Velouria took the liberty to take Kyle’s semi-automatic handgun.

“I wanna stay with Kyle,” she announced. She was limping on her leg, but didn’t show she was in great pain.

Chapter 23


















“Oh, and you’re just not gonna get shot again?!” Preox sarcastically reacted. “You think you’re just, all of the sudden, fit for this team to destroy a whole Adoa fleet?! I’m sorry, tootsie roll, but that ain’t gonna happen. And you’re lucky, Kyle, that you’re even involved in this!”

“I may not be ‘fit,’ by your standards,” Velouria said, shooting her semi-automatic at a nearby stop sign, perfectly hitting the center of the letter O, “but I am fit to stand by the one who saved my life, the one who’s always been there for me. And he’s the one I love, no matter what conflicts lie ahead of me. I would like to let you know that I took shooting classes with my uncle, I have a gun license, and that thing who shot me just got lucky that he got away with that.”

Kyle looked at her. “You just got 1,000,000% more attractive.”

Velouria giggled, her cheeks beginning to flush. “Oh, thank you sweetie.”

Before Preox could respond to Velouria’s minor speech, Adoa Probes came marching around the corner. They spotted them and pointed their laser guns at the Asids and humans.

“Oh, shoot!” a Probe shouted. “Fire! Those are Asids, alright!” Instead of retreating or taking fire, everyone including the saved civilians shot at the robots, taking them all down immediately. Preox began running down the street, shooting down any enemies that stood in the way.

Infinite Valor

“They’re here! Concentrate your fire on them and only them! We must rendezvous to the waterfront!!”

“I kinda just wanna stay here and shoot these bastards,” Bobcat replied, putting a few lava bullets in a Probe’s face. Jared had almost gotten shot in the head, before taking down a Mazer. Kyle and Velouria held hands, blasting their weapons with their other hands. Kriket deployed her auto turrets, which rapidly fired lava bullets with an extremely loud very repetitive recoil. Moosey roared angrily, ramming a Mazer with is horns and taking that Mazers rifle, thus taking down the ones surrounding him. Preox leapt on one Striker, wielding a massive dagger from his forearm armor, jamming it into the Striker’s head.

Preox jumped back into combat with Kriket, killing off more bad guys. “That was pretty hot of you.”

Preox chuckled slightly. “Gee thanks. Well, since these rescued civilians want to stay with us, I think taking them to safety is not an issue.”

“So what do we do now?” Kriket asked, kicking a Mazer’s teeth in. Another Mazer had pushed Kyle down, Velouria killed the enemy as a Probe attempted to silence her. Kyle quickly got up, shooting the robot down.

“I think we have to meet the battleships and carrier, regardless we have rescued civilians or not,” Preox answered, pointing up in the sky. “Check it out.” An Elephant mother ship was hovering over a distant island, at least five miles away from the city’s waterfront. Purple and pink lightning surrounded the area, striking the water and causing massive waves to erupt.

“There must be a major power supply on that island,” Preox continued. “That’s really close to where the civilians are being taken for evac. I suggest we should defend the bay area where the civilians are being taken, as Admiral Bxir’s group takes care of that mother ship. The other mother ship is hovering over the tallest building in the city. The plan should go accordingly. BUT, I have no damn clue where Zjok’s Elephant is at.”

“How can you tell the difference?!” Moosey frantically asked, putting a few rounds in a Mazer’s skull. “The first two both look the same!”

“Zjok’s mother ship has a massive compartment on the back side,” Kriket answered.

“Any idea what the compartment is for?” Preox asked.

Chapter 23



















The enemies within their range were all deceased, as more infantry would come soon. Adoa Bats and Mohawks went around the city, blasting at buildings and fighting military jets and helicopters. Kriket reloaded her E.A.R. gun and looked up at Preox, as they all continued to run. “I honestly have no damned clue what’s in that compartment. I don’t think it’s good, either.”

“GET DOWN!” Kyle shouted. A Bat was swooping low on their position, opening fire upon them. They all dove and took cover, leaving Kyle the only one standing in the middle of the street. He fired his weapon, yelling as loud as he could. Bullets pierced through the Bat’s pilot window, killing the pilots instantly. The Bat steered out of control and crashed into the street, behind Kyle, exploding on impact.

“Nice one, Kyle!” Preox complimented. “Now let’s move it, now!”

“Kyle, I’m so making out with you after all of this madness,” Velouria said. She had no struggle of running; her leg may have not been in the best condition, for she completely ignored that, but it was still mobile to bust a move. She was surely in no mood for dying.

Kyle smiled brightly. “I’ve never made out, before.”

“It’s pretty fun, hunny!!”

Infinite Valor


Holly led the way through the center of the city, taking down any enemy that stood in her path. Once they saw one of the Elephants make its way to the tallest tower in Kingzing City, the Obnoxious Tower, Holly and her team made their way to take it down. Holly wasn’t as annoyed with Rig, like Preox would be, surprisingly enough. In fact, she found him quite useful with his lightning abilities. Since Preox wasn’t able to elaborate what he had planned for the split teams, Holly took the liberty to do things her way. She ordered Rig to take out as many aircrafts as he possibly could, followed by a concerning question as to whether he had the ability to fly.

“NOPE!” Rig answered enthusiastically, blasting enemies with his lightning (One rod of Rig’s lightning hit a Mazer so hard, the Mazer blew up into nothing but blood and guts.).

“Have you ever tried it?” Holly asked calmly, gouging the eyes out of another Mazer with her thorn-filled fists (Agents Jon, Eugene, and Nathan had no trouble when they had to focus on keeping up with the ones with super abilities.). Holly and Rig led the way, slaughtering every bad guy before any of the three agents could put a bullet in them. The United States Army was in with the battle also, even though they were not a part of Holly’s team.

“Well, not really! All I really know is that I can kills the bad guys and lift heavy things! Like rhinos!” Rig replied, his smiling growing.

“Give it a try, now,” Holly commanded, “we need someone in the air to watch out for the ones on the ground; I had no idea this would be such an issue; not every military jet or helicopter can help us out!!”

“Okey! I do as you please!!” Rig ran up the hood of a car and jumped as high as he could. Something rather peculiar happened while the Aziquet was in the air, however. He actually became afloat, not in his actually body form, but as a thin cloud of blue smoke.

Holly looked up in the air, concerned. “What the hell did he do?”

“WOO! I can fly! Like a wee, little cloud!” Rig’s voice was heard. Referencing the moment when Zjok was acquainted with the Drokensmur, Rig seemed to have the power of the Drokensmur’s transportation ability. When Drokensmur wanted to travel through space or around other worlds, it would evaporate into a temporary state of red smoke for smoother travelling.

Chapter 23


Rig not only possessed this unique ability, he could also strike lighting upon his enemies, all while being in this “cloudy state.” It was quite similar to that of a storm cloud of complete ludicrous. “WEEEE!!” Rig rapidly swerved through the air, striking down Adoa Bats and even a Mohawk. Ships crashed into the streets and buildings of Kingzing City, all by the causation of Rig. Rig may have been increasing the significant damage to the city, but how else would he get rid of the Adoa invading the planet?

The Elephant mother ship lingered above the Obnoxious Tower, consuming the structure with thick lightning. Once Holly and the others were close enough, Mazers were crawling out of the building. There were so many of them that not even Holly or Rig could put up with them, which meant bad news for the agents and the marines who followed. Holly ordered the others to find some cover, while she and Rig put up with the sudden increase of enemy reinforcements.

“Stand back, we’ll take care of it!”

“As usual!!” Nathan yelled back with sarcasm.

Holly knelt down on the concrete, in front of the oncoming Mazers and Probes, as Rig fought them off with his lightning, and unleashed the deadly solar flares from her mouth. The solar flares which impacted the closest enemy would ignite him on fire, causing a searing burning pain. As this happened, Holly dug her fingers into the concrete and ridiculously strong branches rose from the ground, strangling and slashing her enemies. Before Holly knew it, over-sized daisies grew along her vines, which each evolved into a walking and moving individual flower. Thousands of live, little daisies over-powered the remaining Mazers and Probes, making a clear path for the allies to make their way inside the Obnoxious Tower.

“How the hell did you do that?!” Nathan asked excitingly, returning into combat when the crossfires came to a minimum. “That was awesome! Look at the little flowers go!”

“I honestly have no idea how that happened,” Holly said, standing up. Rig returned into his regular Aziquet form, taking a Mazer’s rifle, and shooting up a Probe who lingered atop a nearby building. Along with the blood and gore, Holly was ultimately responsible for leaving dozens of flowers in the area. The scene was quite dark.

Infinite Valor


“Let’s follow the pretty, walking flowers!!” Rig shouted, running into the Obnoxious Tower, stepping on the dead bodies of the Adoa. Thorny vines, branches, and especially leaves, laid all over the ground, which was a mess Holly could admit to.















Combat was gradually beginning to rush at a faster rate, which led to some major difficulty for the agents, marines, and anyone else who didn’t have any cool super powers, like Holly or Rig.

“I’m running low on ammo!” Eugene shouted hesitantly, taking cover behind a vending machine. Once they entered the lobby of the Obnoxious Tower, several dozen Probes encountered them.

“Use their weapons!” Jon shouted, taking down a Probe.

Eugene whined a little bit, taking a Mazer’s abandoned rifle, which laid on the ground nearby. Before he could complain about the gun’s massive weight, Eugene was already killing off some Mazers. He laughed a little bit, and with determination. Lights throughout the tower began to flicker violently, to the point where they would evidently explode. The Elephant was using the tower’s power, which effected other buildings surrounding it. Branches of lightning streamed downward from the very top of the building, causing damage to the interior. Massive debris fell from the floors above the lobby, blocking the way of which allies had entered.

Chapter 23


“We better hurry!” Nathan suggested, once they approached the elevators. There were four elevators in total, enough for everyone to make one trip to the very top of the tower and meet at the same time. “I’m not sure about these elevators, considering the state that the building is in.”

“Let’s just try, anyway,” Holly replied, smashing a Mazer to the ground with her long legs of sexiness. “We won’t get up there in time if we take the stairs!”

“Preox said to only go for the engines, right?”

Holly looked at Nathan. “What?”

“I’m just making sure. Preox said to only go for the engines, not their self-destruct sequence(s). He said that if we destroy the engines, the Elephant will only fall to the ground, causing much less damage to the city. If we hit the self-destruct sequence… yeah! We don’t want to do that. Were you paying attention to Preox when he was babbling about his plan in the Dookoran?!”

Holly felt too guilty to answer, for she had been too busy talking to Blue Lazer inside her head. Before they knew it, an Adoa Striker came charging at them as they waited for the elevators. The Striker had no beam gun, but instead used his arms and mouth as his only means of combat. The little daisies attempted to destroy the Striker. Being a group of delicate flowers, the Striker smashed them with his feet and fists. Holly ordered everyone to stay bunched up against the elevators, while she took care of the Striker.












Infinite Valor


“Aw, what’s wrong furry-boy?” Holly asked pleasantly. “You don’t like flowers?” Her forearm began to mutate, which astounded her allies. The Striker stood there defiantly, as Holly took steps closer to him. Her forearm began to transform into a thick tree branch, with a sharply-pointed tip; it was similar to that of a sword. “Do flowers give you allergies?”

The Striker snarled at her. “Horrible catch phrase!”

“Oh?” Holly raised her eyebrow. “Come at me.”

The Striker roared, making the ground shake, and charged at Holly. Holly ran towards him, wrapping vines from her fingertips, around the Striker’s neck before he could get his hands on her. She threw enough force against the Striker, that the beast fell to the ground, gasping for air. She leapt on top of the beast, choking him out until she finished him off by digging her tree branch arm deep into his skull. Gray blood spilled all over the Striker’s face and onto the floor. Holly pulled her arm out of the Striker’s head and formed it back into her regular forearm. She wiped all of the blood and tissue on her leggings. She stepped off of the Striker and regrouped with the others, just in time for the elevators to take them over seventy stories high.

“I didn’t know I could do that either,” Holly said, as the elevator took them all up the Obnoxious Tower.

Rig laughed of sheer immaturity. “Haha! You have wood.”

“Jeez, are you five?” a marine asked. It was AJ.

“Nope! Just awesome!”

“How would a five-year old know about ‘wood,’ anyway?” Nathan asked, concerned.

“I was talking about his immaturity level, not five-year olds in general!”

“Are you asking for a debate?”

AJ laughed. “No! But I think you’re asking for an ass-kicking.”

“Is that a threat?!”

AJ smirked at Nathan. “United States Marine versus a puny A72A Agent; come at me, bro!”

“STOP!” Holly screamed as loud as she could. “You’re all acting much younger than five! The last thing we need is a fight in a damaged elevator!! Look at yourselves, we’ve lost people we’ve cared about dearly! Do you really think going at each other will defeat the enemy any sooner? Jeez!

Chapter 23


Anyway, I could beat all of you guys up, with or without my powers, so I suggest you all shut up before it gets ugly!”

It got silent, until Jon broke the silence. “I would let you ‘beat me up.’”

Before Holly could say anything, a talking daisy climbed up Holly’s shoulder and sat down. “Dude! Have some manners for the lady!”

“You survived?” Holly questioned the daisy.

The daisy nodded. “Yep! Since you’ve created me, I’ve been your humble servant and I always will be.”

“Why, thank you, Mr. Daisy,” Holly said with a giggle. She enjoyed this flower’s company.

“May I ask you of a favor, Miss Holly?” Mr. Daisy asked.

“Go ahead. Make it quick, we’re almost to the top.”

“Please don’t call me Mr. Daisy? I just prefer Mr. Flower. Oh, and another favor to ask of you: Could you make me a bodacious rose? I will need a mate, sooner or later. Roses are beautiful, but they’re really feisty. I like me a little ‘flowery kink.’”

Holly was a little creeped out. “Yeah, sure thing, Mr. Flower. Hey, Nathan, where would the engines of this Elephant be, anyway?”

“They should be just below the cockpit,” Nathan answered. “It will be quite the trip. The Elephant is bigger than several skyscrapers put together.” Holly sighed deeply. “Well this should be fun!!”

*Ding!* The four elevators opened, the allies opened fire upon nothing, and all were dumbstruck to see no enemies. They could see the entire view of the city, watching opposing forces fight each other. Almost a sixth of the city was destroyed. At least twenty feet above them was the bottom of the first Elephant, which exceeded the Obnoxious Tower’s width. They all looked up at it in amazement, not sure of what to say about it. The Elephant was massive and what lay beneath it was twice as awesome. Between the rooftop and the bottom of the Elephant, was a plastic red slide leading from an entrance to the ship. The slide was about as wide as a two-lane street and it looked extremely fun.

“They have a slide?!” Rig shouted happily! “Let’s go up it!!”

Holly and the others followed the blithering idiot, as she gazed at the lighting striking downward upon the city. “This is too much, man.”

Infinite Valor


















Meanwhile

The battle between the city’s waterfront and the Trans Island (where the other Elephant was stationed) was becoming a bit too much. The Adoa was attempting to breach the waterfront, while Admiral Bxir’s team attempted to breach the small island. An immense amount of civilians were to be taken away from the city, via the waterfront, in order to be evacuated. However, the Elephant approached the island before the navy carrier could launch.

Ever since battleships showed up and the carrier went under protection, holding about a thousand civilians in the hopes of escaping this apocalyptic crisis, Preox, Kriket, Kyle, Velouria, Bobcat, and Jared were helping alongside the human infantry to take out the Adoa who dare to attack the carrier. The civilians were kept safely inside the carrier, as those who were willing to fight, stayed outside. A couple of the battleships were already destroyed, slowly sinking into the Pacific Ocean. It was only a matter of time before the Adoa ships could actually reach the carrier and started attacking it, as well. Followed by the one and only Asid ship, as piloted by Admiral Bxir and Zitkir, Blue Lazer flew through the skies attacking any Bat or Mohawk who all opposed him. Blue Lazer latched himself onto a Mohawk, tearing away its armor and blasting it with his lasers of death.

Chapter 23


Hell, he even descended into the Mohawk, taking out all of the Mazers and Probes who resided inside it. The Mohawk crashed into the water, once Blue Lazer was finished with it, and he proceeded onward with his other opponents. Blue Lazer wore a special ear piece, made from Asid technology, and it was used for him to keep communications with Admiral Bxir and the rest of the team who were inside the Asid ship. As Blue Lazer was fighting a group of flying Adoa Probes, Admiral Bxir’s voice rang in his ear like a blaring siren.

“Ay, boy! Take it easy out dare! We wanna take down some ships, too!”

“Okay, Barry Banshee!” Blue Lazer shouted right back. “There are plenty of these buddy-boys to go through! Also, you don’t need to yell, I can hear you just fine!” Blue Lazer decided to gain speed, as did Admiral Bxir and his crew. The crossfire between human military and the Adoa was getting heavier, as they drew closer to the Elephant. (For hydroelectricity means, the Adoa seemed to find this Trans Island very valuable.)

“That Elephant will continue to fire its lightning cannons,” Zitkir told Blue Lazer. “The lightning can detect harmful fire-power, thus will deflect any ammunition that attempts to penetrate it. You’ll need to get in close in order to get to the engines. Simply entering the main doorway will be too much work, especially under all of this heavy firepower.”

Blue Lazer shot down a few Bats before responding affirmatively to Zitkir, followed by calling him “buddy-boy.” The masked teenager flew as fast as a rocket, approaching before the Elephant within seconds. “Alright, where exactly were these engines, again?”

“Just below that massive window where the cockpit is located,” Zitkir answered.

“And what if you’re wrong?”

“I’m not, I was held prisoner in one of those!”

“Seriously, what’s with the yelling? Is that what it’s like when you aliens dudes talk to each other on a regular basis? I’d probably tape Holly’s mouth if she talked like that all the time.” Blue Lazer smiled and he was almost about to cause some damage to the Elephant, until he was ultimately struck by its powerful lightning. Thousands of volts of electricity ran through his entire body, the burning sensation almost too great for his own.

Infinite Valor


Before he knew what had happened, Blue Lazer had plummeted deep into the ocean. After his body had twitched and jerked for a few seconds, from the electricity, Blue Lazer opened his eyes. He could see a sunken battleship, along with sunken Adoa ships, deep inside the water. He could see dead bodies, broken machinery, and all sorts of other broken things. Deep inside his thoughts, Blue Lazer was feeling absolute remorse for those who have fallen against the Adoa; especially for his best friend Cale, who had perished under the same hands. However, Blue Lazer found it acceptable to not let all of the emotional trauma consume his mind. He felt his body completely heal from the heavy damage, and began to swim back to the surface of the ocean.

Blue Lazer held his breath for a long time, even when a great white shark was drawing near. He unleashed a muffled, underwater scream and blasted the shark with his elbow laser. The shark died instantly, with blood flowing from its gaping laser wound. Blue Lazer gasped for air, once he reached the surface of the Pacific Ocean. Everything was loud and abrupt from the constant battle. Blue Lazer took notice that he was close to Trans Island (just a few kilometers away from the Elephant.). “Woo!! You guys should have seen that! I just shot a laser at a shark, right in the face!!”

“No need tah yell!” Bxir replied, mocking Blue Lazer’s voice, which didn’t bother him one bit. He was very excited about his recent shark killing. “Get back up thar, now, boy! The Adoa knows you’re here trying to destroy the Elephant, so getting hit by that lightnin’ was nawt an accident.”

“Yeah!” Derno said, for that’s all he could really say at this point. He and Zitkir were too busy fighting off ships with the Asid ship’s guns. Before Blue Lazer could spring back into action, an Adoa Mohawk crash-landed, into the water, behind him causing a massive wave to over-power him. Blue Lazer then realized that the Elephant was just barely floating above the water, rather than the actual island itself.

“Wait, buddy-boys,” he said, flying out of the massive waves and making his way back to the Elephant. “So if I take these engines out, this bad boy won’t explode, right?”

“Preox said it would cause the least amount of damage if we did so,” Zitkir replied immediately.

Chapter 23


“Ugh, he might as well be telling us to recycle.”

“Takin’ out the engines is our best bit,” Bxir said. He swerved the Asid ship between two opposing Bats, when Derno and Zitkir shot them down. “We ain’t got much time! The Adoa has almost over-thrown tha forces on tha waterfront.”

“But if I take down this baby, it would flood the city, right?”

“Yes, you dumb idiot!” Derno shouted. “It’s our best option! Now getcher ass up there, befo—.” Blue Lazer had lost communications with the Asid ship and immediately began to worry. He was just about to break into the Elephant, though he couldn’t help but see that the Asid ship (from a distance) was up in flames, hurdling through the sky. A Mohawk was shooting at Admiral Bxir and the others, causing Blue Lazer to fly as fast as he could to them.

“Get outta here, boy!” Bxir yelled furiously. “Derno is down! He’s… just gone! I dunno ware he went. The ship was hit and now he’s just gone. He must have been exploded, or evaporated? I dunno! Derno is gone, Blue Laser, and I have a glass shard in my stomach, and Zitkir is gone too becuz he gone git shot in dah head. I know this is sudden for you, kiddo, but life’s got alotta su’prises! Jesus, I always knew this would all come down to this… but not like this!”

“Let me help you!” Blue Lazer yelled back, taking down a few ships. There were so many ships that Blue Lazer could not keep a close eye out for Bxir’s. He couldn’t believe this was happening. He couldn’t concentrate on what was reality and what seemed like an unsettling dream. He found the ship again, which was bursting in flames and headed towards the Elephant.

Blue Lazer screamed angrily, once a Bat intentionally fly right into him. He crushed the ship with fists and took its wings and destroyed other ships that followed. He began making his way to catch the Asid ship, again, for he had to save Bxir and Zitkir from this, yet somewhat expected, pickle. That’s when a group of Probes began flying after Blue Lazer, firing their laser weapons at him.

As Blue Lazer fought off the annoying Probes, Bxir’s voice came through the ear piece. He sounded like he was about to die. “Don’t worry ‘bout me, princess. They’s nothin’ else you can do here. This ship has enough mass to cause an explosion to actually damage the Elephant’s exterior. I’m headed toward tha engines’ location, now. Once I crash this ship, yew should be able tah git in wit’ no time, at all. It will make tha job a whole lawt easier. It’s bin good servin’ wit’ yew for the first ‘nd last time, Blue Lazer. Try nawt tah be a total smart ass for the rest of yer life. Oh hey! Tell Preox that he’s a lil bitch! Haha! Just kiddin’, tell him that he’s tha best damn Magnate I ever saw; tell Kriket she’s hawt as hail. YEEE HAW! GET ALONG, UGLIES! ADMIRAL BXIR IS HERE TAH KICK YER ASS FER THA LAST TIME, BABY!! YEEEEE-HAW! Ow, my stomach!”

Blue Lazer never heard so much enthusiasm from someone, who was on the brink of his death. It was kind of funny, yet sad at the same time, because he knew he was never going to hear that kind of humor, ever again. And neither was Preox, Rig, Kriket, or anyone else who knew Admiral Bxir, by heart. Commander Derno was gone, also, as was Zitkir. He had just barely met the two and he could only imagine their peers’ reactions. It wasn’t going to be easy giving them the news, because Blue Lazer knew what it was like. Once he realized that, as he flew as fast as he could to save Bxir, the ship had exploded on impact. Bxir’s final words of useful information were correct, fortunately. The ship did create significant damage to the Elephant. However, Blue Lazer couldn’t help but feel like he could have done more. Maybe if he wasn’t too damn busy blasting a shark to death, with his lasers, maybe this wouldn’t have happened. The hero did not go to the extent of blaming himself. He knew this wasn’t his fault. It was the Adoa’s. It was all of their fault and that made Blue Lazer extremely angrily. He flew faster and faster towards the damaged patch of the Elephant, making swift maneuvers to avoid from getting struck by any more lightning.

He had become well-aware of his surroundings, by the time he had realized that he was the only one left in his team. He not only felt remorse for the ones who were just tragically lost, but he had much more remorse for those who knew the recently deceased much better than he did. For example, Moosey will never take orders from Commander Derno, again, let alone receive his ridiculing insults whenever Moosey would mess up or get too annoying; Preox and the other Asids will never hear Admiral Bxir’s thick southern accent whenever he had something awesome to say, or have another friendly moment with 2nd Envoy Officer, Zitkir.

Chapter 23


The eighteen year-old, overly-confident, dork smiled brightly before smashing through the Elephant’s exterior. “Alright, buddy-boys. Let’s go.”




Chapter 24: The Fall of Two Elephants















Preox knew that the Adoa would attack any part of the city, rather than just attacking the waterfront. However, saving the civilians aboard the Navy carrier was his number one priority. He felt slightly confident about his “master plan,” even though about twenty-five percent was elaborated. The fact that he had never worked with Holly, Blue Lazer, Kyle, or anyone else new to his presence, was what worried Preox the most. He was hoping they could get a good grip on not only this plan of his, but the entire, general battle against the Adoa. Agent Moosey17 and the rest of the A72A took forever to realize that aliens were going to invade their planet and completely tear them a new one. If a “professional, secret government agency” wasn’t capable of getting their heads in the game, Preox had every right to worry about random teenagers, whom he had just met and had just teamed up with him.

The Navy carrier was still docked at Pier 87, alongside the city’s water-


Chapter 24


front, currently unable to launch. Several battleships were there to aid the carrier, fighting off the Adoa which came from Trans Island. Luckily, for those on the carrier, taking out the Adoa was more simplistic; the fact that the carrier was being heavily defended, made things easier for those who were actually operating the guns on the massive ship. Another fortunate trait of this conflict was the fact that the civilians were kept safe and secure inside the carrier itself. Unfortunately, however, the carrier could no way, in hell, move from its position. Those operating the Navy carrier did not want to risk getting bludgeoned from an onslaught of purple and pink lightning, from the Elephant hovering above Trans Island.

What was also unfortunate was the fact that the carrier’s safety was only temporary and Preox knew that to be very true. There was another Elephant hovering above the Obnoxious Tower, so who’s to know when the reinforcements from that Elephant will be approaching from the other side? Preox wished he had more time to actually plan against Zjok’s branch of the Adoa Army as he, Kriket, Kyle, Velouria, Bobcat, Moosey and Jared assisted the battle on the carrier’s bridge.

Preox was relieved to see that not as many Adoa ships were flying close to the carrier. He was able to catch his breath, reload, and make his way to the bridge. Once he reached the bridge, leaving Kriket in temporary commandment of his team and waited outside, Preox approached Colonel Grandpa. The entire interior of the bridge was a mess! Shattered glass was spread across the floor and some Navy soldiers were on the ground, being tended to their injuries.

“At least it isn’t as horrid as it is on the battleships,” Col. Grandpa limped towards Preox. He was a middle-aged, skinnier man, who had a bum knee. “The entire enhanced flight deck is either empty, or full of war debris. I’m sure you’ve noticed.”

“I did kind of shoot down a couple Bats on that deck,” Preox responded. “You wanted to speak to me, Colonel? I understand your distress and I, we, are here to help.”

“Duh!” Grandpa shouted. “When can we get out of the waterfront?! Two battleships have gone down. I don’t think the rest can hold those alien freaks, any longer. That Elephant thing is MASSIVE and so is that

The Fall of Two Elephants


lightning! Preox, for the first time, in any of my military experience, I am actually really scared tit-less.”

Preox couldn’t tolerate this pansy. He sighed deeply and responded in a most calming manner. “Colonel, I’m about as worried as anyone else on this carrier. I’m worried about the civilians, I’m worried about the soldiers, and I’m worried about the Adoa’s annoyance. However, I have two very trusted teams taking care of this sort of ordeal, as we speak. Admiral Bxir, I told you about him, the red guy, said he will contact me the moment they descend into that Elephant, right there!!” Preox pointed at the Elephant hovering above Trans Island, which seemed to have a hint of bright light on the top of it.

Preox and Colonel Grandpa both reacted, as Grandpa lit a cigarette. “Damn, Preox. I guess you were right.”

“That’s where the ship’s engines are located!” Preox exclaimed, taking Grandpa’s binoculars, which hung around his neck.

“Careful with my binoculars! Those were Grandpa Grandpa’s!”

“Shut it, pencil-boy! Why didn’t Admiral Bxir get ahold of me? Must have lost communications. Anyway, Colonel Gripe, launch this carrier. This Elephant could probably end up in the water, creating a massive wave that could potentially hit the city with full force. We couldn’t just blow the Elephant up from using its self-destruction.”

“Well why not?!” Grandpa shouted.

“Please don’t shout at me! And would you rather have massive amounts of debris damaging your carrier?!”

“Well, the carrier isn’t exactly ‘MASSIVE WAVE-PROOF!’”

Preox did not stand down with this argument. “Well maybe if you moved your ass, maybe your carrier won’t be affected! When it comes to destroying these Elephants, I try my best to do as little damage as possible. If my calculations are correct, once the massive wave hits the city, the wave would be at least 20-feet tall. So stop crying and get this ship moving! Do it for Grandpa Grandpa!”

“Now, let’s talk about the finances--!”

“I DON’T WANT TO TALK ABOUT THE BLOODY FINANCES!!! MOVE IT! THAT’S AN ORDER, YOU SCRAWNY TART!”


Chapter 24


Grandpa jolted in hesitation after Preox yelled at him for the last time. Preox knew that the Elephant was going down and it was time to get moving.













As Colonel Grandpa gave the order to move the carrier. Some Adoa firepower started streaming through the bridge, once again. Preox unfolded his customary rifle and ran outside, talking to Kriket with his Vambit.

“Common Kriket! Time to bail this puppy! The Elephant is going down! I repeat, the Elephant is going down! I suggest we make our way to the nearest, tallest building. Oof!” A glass window had been broken, with shards scratching the side of Preox’s face. He groaned angrily and found Kriket right nearby.

“I thought I told you to move it,” Preox said, wiping blood off his face. “I’m obviously in love with you, so I’m obviously not going to leave you,” Kriket said. She, Jared, Velouria, Moosey, and Kyle followed Preox through their way to leave the ship. Bats were coming close to the carrier, firing upon the gallery deck. “Oh hunny, your face is all scratched up. Are you okay?” Kriket opened fire, with her auto-turrets, as they all ran.

“Yes, yes, I’m fine! Better than being shot in the damn neck! Come on, let’s move it! The Elephant is going to crash any time, soon. Where’s the other civilian we saved?! Bobcat?!”

“He found his wife on the carrier,” Moosey replied, loading a small,

The Fall of Two Elephants


nine-millimeter, semi-automatic.

“What about you, Jared?” a curious Kyle asked.

“Well, I still need to look for my son,” Jared said. “I’m not leaving without my buddy-boy.”

From hearing Jared say the hyphenated, familiar word of “buddy-boy,” Kyle could get a pretty good idea of Jared’s biography. “Holy! Are you Axyl’s dad?!”

“How’d you know his name?!”

“I’m his friend, Kyle!”

“Weird! He’s never told me about you! I didn’t know Axyl had friends!”

Kyle scoffed, as Velouria giggled. “He’s never mentioned me?!”

“Sorry, dude! But do you have any idea where he is?”

Jared was feeling hopeful, as Kyle was hesitant to tell Axyl’s father that Axyl, himself, was actually Blue Lazer. “Uh, you know that Blue Lazer guy?”

“HA! That silly looney that saves the city? I haven’t even seen that guy, in this battle at all! He must have chickened out!”

Kyle made a disagreeing grunt. “Ugh, not exactly. However, your son is kind of… him.”

Jared laughed. “Are you serious? No son of mine would ever wear a girly, little mask like that.”

Preox snickered, as they all approached Pier 87. They were back to running through the streets of an empty, yet partially damaged, part of Kingzing City.

“Kyle, I’m afraid I’m gonna have to man-handle you,” Preox said.

“What?!” A distant explosion was heard, faintly, from a distance. Kyle and the others looked back to see the massive Elephant, above Trans Island, gradually declining from altitude. They could see purple flames emitting from the top. The lightning cannons had ceased fire and they could see other Adoa ships desperately get out of the way.

“The ship is going into the ocean!” Preox shouted. “It’s gonna send us a big, friggin’ wave! So let me carry you up a building, so we don’t get caught in it!”


Chapter 24

















That’s when a random group of gangsters came running out of a nearby alley way. One of them, holding a golden combat gun, grabbed Velouria by the arm and held the gun against her temple.

“Give us yo’ weapons, y’all!”

“Kyle, help!”

Kyle and Moosey kept their aim set on the guy holding his girlfriend. “Seriously! What the hell is happening?! LET HER GO!”

“Ain’t happenin’, G!” shouted another gangster, who held a bat wrapped in barbed wire. There were six other gangsters, all holding blunt objects as weapons.

“We want yo’ alien guns!” shouted the leader, as Velouria struggled to get free.

“Well you’re looking down the barrels of them, you incompetent slug!” Preox shouted angrily, pointing his rifle at the leader as well as the others. “You don’t understand this pickle we’re in! Put your weapons down, now, or I will take the bloody innards of your fat ass and make your entire gang wear it as modern apparel!!”

A giant splash was then heard from the distance of Trans Island. They all saw the Elephant hit the water, on its horizontal side. There was going to be a high tide, soon enough.

The lead gangster held tight to Velouria and cocked his gun.

The Fall of Two Elephants


“Aw, come on, I don’t want to kill humans, now!” Kyle shouted furiously.

“Just give us your weapons, Jolly Green Giant!” shouted the gang leader. Preox could see the massive wave, hurdling towards the city, as his blood began to boil. His face turned from anger to complete and total rage.

“LISTEN HERE, YOU UNKNOWLEGABLE FUCK!!! I’M A MAGNATE OF THE ASID ARMY! IF YOU WEREN’T BEING AN ANNOYING, PUTRID BUG, I WOULD TIE YOUR BALLS SO TIGHTLY AROUND YOUR NECK, EVERYONE WILL THINK YOU’RE WEARING A FANCY FLESH TIE! PUT THE GUN DOWN, GIVE US THE HUMAN FEMALE, OR I WILL PERSONALLY ERADICATE YOU!”

Kriket, keeping her focus on the gangsters, could not believe what she was hearing. Sure, she’s seen Preox angry before, but she’s never seen him blow up beyond proportion. It appeared to her that Preox was going to kill them. In fact, he was!

The gang leader laughed. “Yo’! yellin’ ain’t gonna cut it, home. Give--.”

“Kriket, kill them now.”

“Yes, Magnate.”

Before the gangsters could even react, because of course they were all hesitant in facing aliens in the first place, they were all full of Asid bullets. Bullets made from hints of acid. The lead gangster was unable to hurt Velouria, because he was dead before he had hit the ground. Velouria stood there, cringed. Kriket and Preox’s aim were top notch. She opened her eyes, out of certain fear, and looked around to see the dead gang sprawled out on the concrete. “P-please… that was scary.”

“I’m sorry, Velouria,” Kriket said, folding up her rifle. Preox wasn’t saying a word, especially when he kicked the leader’s dead body.

“P-Preox,” Kyle stuttered. “L-Look, we can take the stairs up this bank. We’ll be fine. Promise.”

The wave was getting closer to the city, as Preox looked at him. “Fine. But don’t start crying when you need my help.”

The humans and moose broke their way into a Money Poop Bank, as Preox and Kriket flew up to the rooftop. They stood on the rooftop, together, watching the Elephant completely sink into the water. They also watched the

Chapter 24


Navy carrier make its way out the reaches of the tidal wave and the Adoa. The civilians were safe, at last, and Preox’s plan was working perfectly. Well, sort of. The wave crashed through the water front, damaging smaller buildings, or shredding them into pieces. Once the wave hit the bank, the building slightly shook, but withstood the wave’s massive impact. Kyle and the other two humans scrambled out of the roof’s entrance, joining Kriket and Preox. Kriket took Preox’s hand and held it tightly. She looked up at him, though he didn’t look back.

“Preox? Are you alright?”

Preox looked down at her and unexpectedly kissed her on the lips. She blushed like crazy. “I’m fine, Kriket. Thank you.” The city was being filled with salt water, which destroyed anything that was under twenty feet. Preox heard yet another distant explosion, which came approximately south from their location. They all turned to see the second Elephant, hovering above the Obnoxious Tower, which had the same purple ignition that resulted in the first Elephant’s demise. However, it was merely near the engine’s exact location and only Preox knew that.

“Well that Elephant is going down, too.”

“That’s good!” Moosey said happily. “Only one more to go, right? This is easy!”

“Yeah, I would double-think that,” Preox replied. “You see, that explosion is not coming from the engine’s location. It’s coming from the cockpit. Someone screwed up and activated that Elephant’s self-destruct sequence.” The Elephant was now having numerous, scattered explosions coming from all around it and was ultimately falling apart. “Once that Elephant completely destructs itself, we’re going to have a lot of heavy debris. The explosion will be a thousand yards wide, so being caught in the radius is iminent. Urg! Damn it, Rig!! HE did this! This is going to cause significant damage to your city. We need to get in the building, now!”

Everyone had done so, once an extremely loud and thunderous explosion had occurred. The Elephant had completely destructed, followed by many collapses of buildings. Kyle and the others prayed that Holly’s team was able to get out of there in time. Preox, however, wasn’t so sure about them. The Elephant’s destruction could destroy anything within its obnoxious radius.

The Fall of Two Elephants


Twenty Minutes before Preox’s Team had made refuge in the Money Poop Bank.









Blue Lazer found it a real pain in the ass to get into the Elephant that once hovered above Trans Island. He clambered through the debris, left from the heavy damage of the crashed Asid ship. He lifted all of the heavy objects that were in his way, and destroyed anything else with his fists.

“Jeez, this is pretty annoying, venturing through all of this,” Blue Lazer said to himself. He burst through a metallic wall, which startled many Adoa Mazers.

“Oh, dios mio! It’s Blue Lazer! Annihilate him, Mazers!”

“Can you not?” Blue Lazer took a deep sigh and fought around in a seemingly long corridor. He kind of figured why there were so many Mazers in this particular area. Most likely because, well, Admiral Bxir crashed a ship (the size of a bus) into their very own Elephant mothership. He used a Mazer as a shield, once the others had opened fire upon him. Using the Mazer shield with one arm, Blue Lazer fired his lasers with the other. A gun rack had caught his eye, as he fought valiantly, and noticed that the Adoa had their own customary grenades. The grenades were red and pear-shaped, sitting on a shelf that labelled, “Explode-y Things.”


Chapter 24


“Heads up, chumps!” Blue Lazer shouted, followed by a hysterical laugh.

It took him a few seconds to get the idea of how the Adoa’s grenades were to actually be activated. He actually had to twist the darned thing, like a glow stick. He chucked a couple grenades at a few Mazers, chucked them like he would throw a baseball in a district game. The Mazers failed to take cover in time, before an implosion blast, of a great radius, shredded Blue Lazer’s enemies and any other object that was caught in the grenades’ wrath. Blue Lazer ended up getting a big gash on his forearm from one of the imploded blasts. He didn’t care, he was going to heal right up, anyway.

He shouted at the top of his lungs, in confidence, after using as many of the grenades as he possibly could. He ran all around through the ship’s corridors, looking for where the Elephant’s engines could be. He couldn’t find them, which was really irritating. Bxir had just gotten himself killed, helping Blue Lazer get to the engines, and he couldn’t even find the damned things. “Okay, think dammit! Urg! I wonder if Preox gave a precise location as to where these engines are, while I was not paying attention. I shouldn’t have been looking at Holly’s chest the entire time we were at that meeting. Actually, I take that back! Come on, SJ, think. Think of what Preox was saying, not of Holly’s chest. Ugh, no, the wondrous image of what has been seen cannot simply be unseen! I feel like Superman. His weakness is being touched by kryptonite, as my weakness is think of Holly Ransfield’s boobies! Hell, even if I am to touch those miraculous thingies of existence, there still would be no hope for me.”

“What the hell are you talking about?” a Mazer asked Blue Lazer, whom he had been passing by. The Mazer didn’t even come close to thinking of shooting the superhero. Instead, he asks him this dull question, as Blue Lazer himself passes by.

“I’m talking about boobs, buddy-boy,” Blue Lazer replied, blasting the Mazer in the stomach, slamming the alien against the metallic interior of the ship. “Boobs are a great thing. It’s sad to see you dying, not knowing of their existence, their fantastic warmth, their fine delicacy, and over-whelming—okay, now I really gotta stop before I start throbbing…” Blue Lazer noticed


The Fall of Two Elephants


that his elbow laser created a massive blast radius in the metallic wall, revealing another room.

“…oh hey! Another room I haven’t been in!” He punched his way through of what was left from the blasted wall and stumbled into the engine room. The room was massive, with flashing green lights illuminating the area. Strikers were keeping the area heavily guarded, which gave Blue Lazer the idea he had never thought he would come close to thinking of. “Oh boy, here we go.” Blue Lazer flew all over the room, firing his lasers at the angry Strikers. The Strikers roared, as they fired their massive carbines. The carbine’s blasts were so powerful, Blue Lazer took the advantage of making the Strikers accidentally shoot at the massive engines throughout the massive room. There were several engines on the floor, ceiling, and both sides of the room, causing Blue Lazer to literally move all over the place, like an annoying horse fly. Fortunately, Blue Lazer’s little tactic eventually worked. The Strikers were in fact obnoxious and abruptly stupid enough to miss a few rounds on Blue Lazer, thus hitting the engines instead.

However, though the carbine ammunition was powerful, the firepower was not able to pierce through the engines’ heavy-plated armor. Blue Lazer rolled his eyes and groaned in disgust. “Why must I have to do everything?”

“Because you’re ugly!” a Striker immediately replied, before Blue Lazer smashed his cranium. He lifted the Striker’s dead body and remembered the time when he first became Blue Lazer. He remembered lifting that heavy thug, above his shoulders, before smashing the guy on his 1999 white Camaro. The Striker was the thug, the engines were the white Camaro. He smiled brightly, remembering that he was meant to do hardcore stuff like, and smashed the one ton brute against the first couple of engines, until they were in critical condition.

Blue Lazer finished the rest of them off by throwing Adoa grenades and firing his lasers. He had beaten all of the engines to a pulp and the first thing he said was, “Okay! Now what?!” Before Blue Lazer knew exactly what had happened, he was flying through the sky, after seeing nothing but a quick flash and felt a massive force push him clear out of the Elephant. He could barely see himself passing by the city and he felt like he should be dead.


Chapter 24


He could feel the Serum healing his body, but for now it wasn’t enough for him to control himself; he had no idea that the engines were all going to explode, the minute he had destroyed all of them. That wasn’t his fault. If only Preox was more elaborate when he instructed his and Bxir’s formulated plan to take out Zjok’s Adoa.














Blue Lazer noticed that his body was completely covered in blood and he was no longer conscious, after he had noticed the Elephant descending into the Pacific Ocean. He had done it. The first Elephant had gone down.


While Blue Lazer was Destroying Trans Island’s Elephant…

Holly, who had not listened to Preox either, relied on Rig’s below basic IQ. Rig seemed to be the only one who was actually paying attention to Preox. Despite the fact that Preox yelled and insulted Rig every so often, Rig looked up to Preox like a father. Rig was always paying attention to Preox and he knew exactly where the engines were. Sort of.

“So where the hell are these engine things, anyway?” Holly said, after killing off the last Mazer in within their area. Holly, Rig, Nathan, Mr. Flower, Clarke, Jon, and a few marines (including AJ) were all sitting ducks in a convenient Adoa-inspired cafeteria. The place was full of dead, bludgeoned,

The Fall of Two Elephants


bloodied bodies of the Adoa. There were dead Mazers, for the most part, a dead Striker, and a few broken Probes. They really did a work on this place. The seats to each table, in the cafeteria, each had a pointed tip and they looked incredibly uncomfortable to sit in.

“Are these chairs? And do these freaks sit in these?” AJ asked Rig. Rig became the most resourceful when it came to learning about the Adoa.

“YES!” Rig shouted, happily.

AJ rose an eyebrow. “Looks kinky.”

“Where should we go now?” Mr. Flower asked Holly. The little, living daisy was holding an Adoa rifle. He was one strong flower. “I’m only gonna talk to you because, well, you’re cooler. And where’s my rose?”

“I’ll create you a sexy, bodacious one if you shut up,” Holly replied.

“With lots of thorns?”

“Yes, now shut up.”

“I know we’re close to the engine room!” Rig shouted. Everyone gathered in.

“TELL US, OH GREAT COMMANDER!” Clarke yelled.

“Shut up, Clarke!” Holly ordered.

“Sorry, pretty lady.”

Rig giggled. “Anyway! I’m sure more bad guys will be there, once we get there! HA! The engines should be above us!”

They ventured out of the cafeteria, taking down any bad guys that got in their way. As they fought through corridors of the Elephant, along with a couple marines getting killed, Holly couldn’t help by think about Blue Lazer. All of this violence, killing, and invading, all made her think of the one idiot who really understood her. Somehow. Of course she had Kyle as her best friend, but something about Blue Lazer really made her feel special. She was starting to really like the jackass.

Mr. Flower shouted excitedly, bringing down Mazers with his rifle and punching in their faces. Mr. Flower seemed to have super strength, given by the Misara Serum. “I really miss the other flowers I was with!” He put a few bullets in a few Mazer heads, as Holly slaughtered more with her vines.

“I’ll gather more flowers to aid you, when we get to the engines!” Holly replied.

Chapter 24


“You know what the engines look like, right Rig?” Holly asked appropriately.

Rig nodded and turned into a cloud of blue smoke. “Come on guys! Let’s go! Hooray!”

Nathan laughed hysterically, as they ran around a corner to see the massive center area of the entire ship. There were massive pipes and structures ranging the height, length, and width of the Elephant. They all stopped for a moment, gazing at the magnificent view.














They could see the very ceiling of the top of the Elephant and far down below was everything else. They could see ships moving around the interior, as well as many, many troops.

“Let’s hurry this up,” Holly whispered. “We don’t want ALL of those guys coming up at us.”

Several Mazers came piling out of one area, which seemed to be coming from a familiar room. Holly opened her eyes wide, as everyone opened fire. She stood back and unleashed her army of strong-powered daisies. Mr. Flower shouted victoriously, as he and the other flowers attacked their enemies, diminishing them within seconds. the edge over what was the rest of the Elephant. Some of the daisies were sent over the edge, plummeting thousands of feet from their position. “Nathan! Be careful, that railing is not in stable condition! Everyone, fall back into that room, over there. There are reinforcements coming!”

Bat flew by and was ready to open fire, until Rig struck it down with his lightning. The Bat went down, getting blown to pieces as it hit parts of the Elephant’s interior. Agent Nathan12 noticed that Agent Clarke10 was under a lot of stress from the oncoming firepower of a Probe. Nathan took notice of this and fired too gun shots to the Probe’s face.

Clarke breathed heavily. “Woo, thanks Nathan! I could have dieded!”

Nathan laughed. “Don’t worry about it, Agent! Nathan is always here to save the da--.”

Thrown completely off guard by a Mazer, who pushed Nathan over the edge of the Adoa-made cliff, Nathan was falling to his death, as the Mazer laughed in victory. Holly gasped, forming her arm into her tree sword, piecing it through the Mazer’s skull. As she did so, she stretched out her other arm, trying her hardest to catch Nathan from falling. Unfortunately, it was far too late for even her vines to reach. “Nathan. Oh, God, I’m so sorry.”

“TELL MOOSEY HE’S AWESOME AND I WILL ALWAYS LOVE THAT BALL OF FURRRRRRRR!” Nathan’s voice was heard for the last time. They didn’t see him die, nor did they see him hit the very bottom of the Elephant; engulfed in the dense interior. However, Nathan was gone, Jon and Clarke were not taking it very lightly, either. Clarke and Jon raged in fury, killing all of the Mazer’s who stood in the room where Holly said to go. After all of the people they’ve lost, after the loss of a great A72A Agent, after all of the anguish the Adoa has given them, everyone went into rage mode. Holly, too, went into rage mode, as her eyes transformed into the glowing of the sun. The only person who didn’t seem to go into rage mode was Rig. He went back into his normal state, shouting frantically. They all ignored him, as they continued their onslaught in the massive room. Holly and the others could see many controls, gadgets, and switches. Beyond that was a massive

Chapter 24


and gorgeous window, viewing half of the entire city. The window also allowed Holly to see a beautiful sunset, setting over the Pacific Ocean. She could see the first Elephant, which hovered over Trans Island, fall down into the water, sending a massive wave into the city itself. She then proceeded to open her mouth and release her solar flare breath, igniting the many controls into flames. Rig was shouting Holly and he sounded frantic. Holly turned around. “What’s the big deal, Rig?”
