BEFORE WE ALL USE THE UMBRELLA OF GREAT UNCONCIOUSNESS AND WAFFLE TACOS! ‘A LION AMONG LADIES, IS A MOST DREADFUL THING; FOR THERE IS NOT A MORE FEARFUL WILD-FOWL THAN YOUR LION LIVING; AND WE OUGHT TO LOOK TO IT!!!’ WE HAVE TO JUMP, YOU GUYS!!!”

Knowing that Rig just quoted Shakespeare, Holly wanted to cry her eyes out. She had remembered of Preox’s warning about the Elephant’s self-destruct sequence. They could all feel the Elephant shake and crumble apart.

“I kind of don’t want to die!!” AJ shouted, fearfully.

“You be okay! Holly and I will catches you!” Rig nodded positively. “Come on, Holly, let’s go! This is all your fault and now we have to go!”

Mr. Flower hopped onto Holly’s shoulder and a tear ran down her cheek. The daisy looked at her and smiled weakly. “It’s okay, sweet cheeks. It happens to the best of us. Let’s get out of here. From what I’ve learned about your powers, they have a safety mechanism for if you were to fall from an astounding height. Does that make you feel better?”

The Fall of Two Elephants


Holly sniffled, beginning to cry. “Not one bit, Mr. Flower.” The daisy frowned and Holly jumped out of the massive cockpit window, following the others who had jumped out. Holly could hear the Elephant falling apart, as large amounts of debris passed by her and the others, as they fell. Mr. Flower held onto her tightly, a few of his flower petals chipping away from the great gust that passed through him as they fell. Once they got closer the streets of Kingzing City, Holly struck out her wrist and a massive, massive leaf erupted from it.

They landed onto the thick, comfortable leaf, getting back on the street and running as fast as they could.

“That was fun!!” Rig shouted happily. Everyone was too freaked out from what was happening, they really couldn’t say anything out of the ordinary. Immense amounts of debris continuously fell from the ship, crunching down on buildings and on the street.

“KEEP RUNNING!” Holly shouted, fighting back the tears. More explosions erupted from the damaged ship and all Holly could absolutely remember is a massive flash, lighting up their entire surroundings. A great force from the Elephant’s vertical explosion sent everyone flying into the air and evidently smack their skulls hard against the concrete. Unfortunately, they were all sprawled out on the concrete, unconscious, as the explosion the second Elephant continued its destruction. The Obnoxious Tower, which was once the tallest building in the city, had collapsed into the dirt. Other buildings around the area soon followed their own fate.



Chapter 25: The Neeka
















Stupendous National Forest is due north from Kingzing City and, just south of its neighbor, Marsing City. Stupendous Forest is a great place to go camping with your family, friends, boyfriend, girlfriend, hand, pet, anything and anyone! Stupendous grants its visitors amazing views of the Triplet Falls, trees ranging from one hundred feet and beyond, as well as the beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean. It’s a tourist paradise!

However, just a quarter mile from the forest itself, resides a hydroelectricity plant! On an impressive note, most of the electricity is obtained from Kingzing City. Marsing City gets a fair share of this, also. Unfortunately, Zjok’s Elephant is going to pay this impressive electricity plant a visit! Zjok’s Elephant is much bigger, stronger, and more resistant. The military base on Trans Island and the Obnoxious Tower were all amazing sources of energy for the first two Elephants, though Zjok found it extremely appropriate to settle his Elephant further away from the city. Reasons, for that being said, are various.

Chapter 25


“I think the humans are very mean,” Nowndu simply said, as he walked with Zjok through the long corridor, before they were to actually walk back to the cockpit (Zjok wanted to get a tasty snack from the vending machine.) The tyrannical leader was “too stressed” and too angry to even function. Ever since the two Elephants were destroyed, which was about an hour ago, Zjok tried his best to not lose his temper and kill any more of his Adoa. Nowndu’s life was more likely to be deceased by Zjok, rather than being diminished by opposing forced.

“I seem to be quite mistaken,” Zjok simply said, looking out of the massive window, which expanded along the corridor. He kept his eyes focused on Kingzing City, which was now up in smoke and flames. He looked to the left and could see one Elephant partially sunk in the ocean and it was completely unable to rise. Zjok looked at area in disgust. “I have underestimated my enemies, Nowndu. I should have killed Admiral Bxir and his crew, rather than just keep them prisoner. There’s a lesson in this, Mazer.”

“What is that, sir?”

“To not be SO NAÏVE! AGGGHHHH!” Zjok punched Nowndu in the face, knocking the Mazer down to the ground. Zjok stood over him, stomping his face in, until there was nothing but a bloody mess. Mazers avoided Zjok as much as they could, now that they’ve seen him kill Nowndu. “Get back to work! YOU! MAZER! COME HERE!”

A Mazer, by the name of Gfejio, approached the tyrant hesitantly.

“Gfejio,” Zjok started, looking down at Nowndu’s dead body. “I want you to find Vanish. The last time I talked to him, I had given him the tactical permission to send the rest of the fleet unto the city. I need him, once again.”

“For what, sir? If you don’t mind me askin’!”

“Tell Vanish to transfer as much information, about our conflict, towards the Neeka. The Neeka must know who he’s hunting for, before I move this Elephant into the city. Tell Vanish to get information on Blue Lazer, Rig, and our newest common enemy… Holly. She seemed to have obtained the Misara Serum, under physical circumstances, according to the Probes. Tell Vanish to print out still images of these three, incompetent, annoying frog turds, so he can show them to the Neeka. Once the Neeka is aware, he’ll proceed from there.”

The Neeka


“The Neeka will try to kill Vanish, though,” Gfejio inquired.

Zjok took a deep breath and replied with a sarcastic tone. “No, Gfejio, yah think so?! However, that’s not the case. You see, I’ve programmed the Neeka to only do my bidding and Vanish’s bidding.”

“What about Jorfb, before he died?! Didn’t you ask him to release the Neeka, when the time was necessary, in the first place? Including Nowndu?”

Zjok shrugged. “They both needed death, anyways. Anyway, go tell Vanish the news, please, and to make his way down to the Neeka’s storage compartment. The compartment should be detached within the next half hour. I have attached a bomb to the Neeka’s brain, so when it finds and destroys the three buttholes, I will detonate the bomb. After having killed the Neeka, my fleet will move into the city and take over from there. Get yourself ready, Mazer. AND DON’T YOU EVER QUESTION ME, AGAIN!”

Gfejio squealed and took a deep breath, saluting to his leader. “Yes, your awesomeness! I will have my Mazers and Strikers ready!”

Zjok smiled. “Good! Now, off with you. I want to gaze at this horrible view and enjoy it! RRGH! HAHA! Oh, if only the Drokensmur were here, now. He would be so proud of me!”

“What’s Drokensmur?”

Zjok snarled at him. “Get the hell out of my sight, before I kill you too.”

Money Poop Bank – 9:08 pm

Once the Elephant in Kingzing City exploded, the explosion sent a massive, pushing force, which sent many buildings to lean over and/or ultimately collapse. The radius of that force was about ten miles in diameter, whereas the blast radius, being vertically-shaped, was only one block wide. The pushing force caused critical damage to Kingzing City, including the Money Poop bank (the building of which Preox’s team took refuge.) Once the pushing force struck the bank, the bank was ultimately pushed slightly against another building. If it weren’t for that building, the bank and its entirety almost collapsed into rubble. After about an hour since the explosion, the flooding from the other Elephant’s impact had decreased, as the water

Chapter 25


spread all throughout the city and beyond. The water had only reached up to two feet in depth, over this long amount of time.















Fortunately enough, Preox and the others were only knocked out into unconsciousness and were completely separated from each other, throughout the four story building. Kyle and Velouria were sprawled out on a massive piece of cement debris, within the first floor of the bank. The bank was partially flooded with ocean water, with the interior in a complete mess. The ceilings above them were askew, the walls were severely cracked and/or punctured, and everything else was horribly damaged and torn apart. (Interestingly enough, this was the same bank where the homosexual couple, Stuart and Kevin, robbed money for their honeymoon.)

Kyle was dreaming about marshmallows, until he woke up to his palm resting upon Velouria’s breast. When he took a few first blinks, realizing he had been knocked unconscious, he could feel the warmth and tenderness of the boob. “Oh, thank goodness, she’s not dead.”

Velouria woke up slowly, noticing Kyle’s position with hers. He quickly took his palm of her chest and she giggled gently. She sounded so cute when she was tired. “Well, hello there.”

Kyle, now blushing, “I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to!”

The Neeka


Kyle fell, from the massive piece of cement, into the short depth of water. He frantically got up, exclaiming from the cold of the water. Velouria laughed hysterically. “You’re such a goof! I don’t mind you touching me there.”

Kyle quickly got back on the piece of debris, drying his soaked rifle with his Inigo Montoya costume. He set his rifle on top of the deposit counter, which was nearby, and wore an expression of surprise. “Wait, really?”

Velouria nodded. “Well you are my boyfriend, you silly poop!”

Kyle leaned in to touch her boob again, until suddenly the ceiling above them collapsed, followed by a falling Moosey. Debris of the ceiling, along with the seven foot tall mammal, created a massive splash in the shallow water, completely soaking Velouria. She shrieked, once the cold water completely drenched her chest. Today was Kyle’s “lucky day.”

Moosey groaned in agony, staggering as he got up on his two hind legs. His A72A outfit was ruined, torn, and toasted. Moosey took out of his jacket pocket of what seemed to be his Area 72 Agent badge. He looked at it, his eyes faintly opened, gazing at the soaked picture of his smiling face. “I got this on the first day I was promoted to an actual agent, back in 1994. I look so happy.”

“Are you not?” Kyle asked, catching a few glimpses of Velouria’s chest.

Moosey was interrupted by Kriket’s entrance, behind the deposit counter. Kyle, Velouria, and Moosey shrieked in surprise. Kriket jumped in surprise from all of the screaming, as she climbed over the counter and got on her feet. Her body and armor was beaten, and her Vambit was busted. She leaned against the counter, moaning slightly from the pain in her cranium her bulging, large head.

“So, that happened! Urg! God, my head feels like burning concrete!”

“What?” Moosey replied, walking through the shallow water. “I forgot what happened.”

“The Elephant exploded,” Kriket said, rubbing her head. Her searing migraine made her want to punch someone. “This building must have taken a toll from it. This isn’t good. And if anyone says ‘duh,’ I’m killing them!”

“It’s night time,” Kyle said, looking at the massive, shattered windows.

Chapter 25


Jared stumbled from the staircase of the bank, hitting his head on the wall. Everyone was startled and, after Jared had stumbled, Kriket solely reminded herself to unfold her rifle and kept it close. She was thankful the rifle wasn’t broken, also.

Jared rose upon his feet weakly, finding a lead pipe next nearby. He gripped it tightly. “I can’t find my gun. It’s kind of gone. You know, that cool alien one Preox gave me…”

“You lost my hand gun?” Preox’s voice came through the interior of the building. They didn’t see him, until he walked out of the janitor’s closet, nearby. “I really liked that gun.”

Kriket splashed through the water, giving Preox a big-ass hug. He appeared to be in better shape than everyone else. In fact, he appeared to have been on his feet longer than everyone else. Kriket figured that Preox allowed everyone to rest, knowing that they were all okay. However, Moosey was continuously complaining about his, after falling from the second story. “I can fix your Vambit, Kriket. Damn, those things seem to be more delicate than I thought.”

“I know, right?”

A soft, hovering noise, sounding like the rapid beating of a human heart, was heard from the outside. Preox shushed everyone from talking any further. “Everyone, behind the counter, now.” They could see a bright green light, shining upon the flooded street. The water looked gorgeous as it was illuminated with the light, though the slow-moving Mohawk completely ruined the experience. Moosey tried his best to make sure his horns didn’t become a dead giveaway, as he was constantly moving around in the water. Preox shushed him again, especially when they could see two Strikers walking though the street. Each step they took resulted in a massive splash, from their massive feet. The Strikers, and Mohawk, seemed to have been searching the city. Searching for survivors? Searching for enemies? Searching for Preox’s, Admiral Bxir’s, or even Holly’s team?

“Am I fat?” the Striker asked the other.

“You look fab,” the other answered. “Guess what?”

“What?”

“You’re beautiful, just the way you are.”

The Neeka


“Dude, thank you. Thank you so much.”

Preox’s team could hear the splashes from their feet get quieter and quieter, along with the hovering sound coming from the Mohawk. They were completely gone, until Preox got up from behind the deposit counter and unfolded his customary rifle. The rifle glowed a light blue in the night, as Preox switched on the flashlights on his Vambit. He motioned everyone to stay behind the counter, as he went and investigated the scene. The cool breeze rushed through the shattered and broken windows and it was disturbingly quiet. There were a few occurrences of distant fire power, however, concluding that there were plenty of remaining Adoa who were still putting up a tough fight. Fortunately enough, the distant firepower was far beyond Preox’s team’s location. It was something to worry about, although it really wasn’t. Kyle and Velouria were starting to make out, Kriket told them to stop immediately.

“Well we could die, tonight,” Kyle whispered in complete sass, sticking his tongue at her. They heard Preox return to the deposit counter, due to the sound of splashing water.

“Alright,” he started, “the Mohawk proceeded eastward. There are several other ships, scavenging the area near the waterfront, so we should be okay. There’s water everywhere, so we have to be very freaking quiet! Stick close to me and if you find a gun, I highly suggest you take it with you!”

Jared and Moosey seemed to be the only ones without a gun of any sort. They took what they could (that being a lead pipe and a rock) and they proceeded out of the building, as quiet as they could be. They made it to the street in front of the bank, seeing that their surroundings were in ruins. Some buildings were either collapsed to the ground, or just about as damaged as the bank itself. Vehicles found were crucially destroyed and in flames. A crashed military jet, completely on fire, was even seen lodged inside a nearby building. Those who were inexperienced with warfare, and aliens from outer space, were completely stunned and fearful once they saw the destruction of Kingzing City. It was depressing, shocking, and it felt so unreal. However, their feelings were ultimately liberated after seeing some buildings which remained illuminated with the night sky. They could also see the beautiful night sky, filled with bright stars. It was a rather bitter-sweet experience.

Chapter 25


“Okay, Klondikes,” Preox whispered. “We’re going to head toward where Holly’s Elephant exploded. I have no doubt her team survived. Stick to the alley ways, the Adoa is very lazy when scavenging the battle field--.”

“Not really,” Kriket said. “When Bxir, myself, and the others were on the planet Strom, they found us no problem. Well, the Probes did, anyway.”

“That military base on Strom was the only piece of architecture on that rubbish planet,” Preox snapped, “so it’s obvious that the Adoa knew where to look. This is a whole new planet to Zjok and his army. This city is massive, so the remaining Adoa from the two destroyed Elephants will not find us unless we’re super quiet and we stick to the alleys. We have to move quickly, at least before Zjok’s Elephant moves in.”

“I forgot there was another one of those,” Kyle complained.

“We can do this,” Preox said with determination. “If we can destroy two Elephants with such a small crew and a small army of militants, we can sure as hell take down three.”

“If it weren’t for Rig, Holly, and Blue Lazer, we’d be screwed,” Kriket said. Preox nodded in agreement.

“But let’s not forget us, also, in successfully protecting the Navy carrier. It is now far beyond the Zjok’s reach.”

“So what do we do after we find this Holly woman?” Jared asked. “It’s funny. Axyl mentioned talking to a girl by that name, before.”













The Neeka


“After we find Holly, it’s back to the waterfront,” Preox said.

“Are you crazy?” Moosey said, louder than everyone else. They shushed him, once again. “I’m sorry! But did you not say there were more of them near the waterfront? I could have sworn you did!”

“They should be well-scattered throughout the city, by the time we get to the Elephant’s destruction,” Preox answered immediately. “After we find Holly and the others, which we will (I promise), we will go to the waterfront, in search of Admiral Bxir and his crew.”

“You couldn’t get ahold of any of them?” Kriket asked, with deep concern. “Not even Rig?”

“Not even Rig.”

“But… he loves talking to you.”

Preox sighed deeply. “I know and that’s why we gotta go find them. I sure do hope Blue Lazer is looking for us. His ability to fly is such an advantage and finding him will be an easier task.”

“This all too much,” Kyle complained. Velouria pulled him over for a kiss and he felt better. “Thanks, babe.”

Before Preox could make a final statement, the Money Poop bank completely collapsed into a giant pile of rubble. The entire building collapsing to the ground was simply loud and atrocious. It alarmed everyone, including Preox himself. “Okay, we gotta go now! Stick to the alley ways! If you see a Mazer, Striker, Probe, any of that sort, steer clear before they see you! The Adoa may be terrible at finding things, but not all are incompetent!


Meanwhile


Two campers, by the names of Carl and Ophelia Minor, have been married for over thirty years. After flying from Maryland, Carl and Ophelia had finally reached the beautiful coast of Oregon. For their vacation, the couple decided to elope at the Stupendous National Forest. After all that has happened on this apocalyptic day, Carl and Ophelia have actually heard no word of it. After a great session of hiking and visiting hot springs, Carl and Ophelia had finally made it back to camp. It was time for supper!

Chapter 25


“Oh, sweet Ophelia,” Carl said, as he held his wife’s hand. The two of them were at least in their mid-fifties and they both seemed to be in good shape.

“What is it, sweet Carl?” Ophelia responded, smiling brightly at her husband.

“It’s time for some soup. I am Hungary, like a Hungarian.” Ophelia laughed at Carl’s embarrassing pun and the two finally settled down, once the two made it to their tent. They both gathered around their campfire, which illuminated the dark of the forest, and began cooking some delicious crème soup. Once the soup was finished, the married couple immediately began devouring their main course. The soup was deliciously refreshing.

“The last time I had this soup was the summer of ’74,” Carl said with a smile.

Ophelia smiled. “I remember that day. That was the last time I had this soup, also. I remember finding an engagement ring in my bowl.”

Carl laughed. “Oh yeah! And you almost choked to death on it.”

“Oh my, those was good times.”

Carl chuckled lightly. “I miss those times. I’m going to go potty in the woods.”

Ophelia laughed. Carl would talk like a child every-so-often, which she often enjoyed. (Being a fifty-seven year-old man, Carl never seemed to care about the way he talked or behaved.) Ophelia proceeded to eat her tiny bowl of soup, gazing at the night sky, as Carl proceeded with his natural, bodily functions. She watched her husband return to the camp, with great haste, wearing a concerned expression on his face.

“Are you okay, sweetie?”

Carl had tightened his belt when he replied. “I think I found someone. A young man. I think he’s Blue Lazer? You know, the crazy ninja-dude who has been known for, around in these parts.”

“Nuh uh,” Ophelia said, standing up. “Let me see! Where is he?”

“He’s lying in the ground, a few yards from behind the tent. It looks like he, I don’t know, ‘crash landed,’ or something.”

It was in fact Blue Lazer, who was sprawled like an old rag doll, in the soil of the national forest.

The Neeka


By the looks of it, Blue Lazer appeared to have crash-landed into the forest shortly after he was ejected from a massive explosion of the Elephant’s engines, which he had recently destroyed. His clothing was dirty, bloody, and torn, although his physical body appeared to be in perfect, healthy condition. However, he also appeared to be sleeping rather than appearing to be unconscious.

“Is he dead?” Ophelia questioned. She really couldn’t believe what she was witnessing.

“Of course not!” Carl snapped. “He’s Blue Lazer! He can’t die! It looks like he’s just sleeping.”

“But he’s covered in blood! Should we help him?”

“Of course we should!”

Blue Lazer woke up slowly, about ten minutes after he was moved into the Minors’ tent. A hot, wet towel was displayed on his forehead and he felt just fine. He realized he was laying on an air mattress, covered in several blankets, with his head rested on a fluffy pillow. Once he was aware that he was in a tent, he noticed a bowl full of soup sat next to the mattress. The soup was fresh and warm, with a sticky note was displayed on it saying “EAT ME!”











Feeling somewhat obligated to do so, Blue Lazer started devouring the soup. It was yummy. “This is hella good, man.” Then, after a few moments of careful listening, he could hear Carl and Ophelia chattering outside. Blue Lazer felt content with this sudden hospitality, and he did not feel threatened of any sort.

Chapter 25

After a long day of battling with alien douches, Blue Lazer was glad to be resting. However, he was worried about his friends, especially Holly Ransfield. He had to leave the forest and help them out with whatever they needed. For all he knew, Holly and everyone else could be in grave danger.

Blue Lazer stumbled lightly, out of the tent, to see Carl and Ophelia sitting in lawn chairs just talking to one another. They had finished their soup and could do nothing but talk and look at the stars. The campfire lit up their small campsite, making the area seem warm and cozy.

“Oh!” Carl exclaimed, scrambling out from his seat, after seeing Blue Lazer approach them. He shook his hand violently, which Blue Lazer did not expect. “Big fan, Mr. Lazer!”

“Hey, thanks bro. It’s good to hear from a fan; especially now, anyway.”

“Why? Not a lot of people like you anymore?”

Blue Lazer shook his head. “Have you not heard of what’s been going on, buddy-boy?”

“Oh jeez, Ophelia, he called me ‘buddy-boy!’ That’s what he says to people! Oh this is so exciting! And no, I have not heard of ‘what’s been going on.’ What’s going on, myyyy broooo?” Blue Lazer finished eating his soup, once he had explained everything: The aliens, the sudden battle of Kingzing City, his worries about Holly and how hot she was. A shocked expression spread over Carl’s face.

“So what should we do?” Ophelia stands up. “Should we just leave?”

“Well, I would!” Blue Lazer replied immediately. “Hey, you guys don’t happen to have a cellphone on you, by any chance?”

Carl laughed. “Who do you think we are?! I mean, no disrespect to your awesome stature, but Ophelia and I don’t believe in those things. We’re fine with the ones we have, now. The ones with the cords and such.”

“Why don’t you fly to the city and look for whoever you’re looking for?”

Blue Lazer paused. Ophelia did raise a good point for that. “Oh, yeah! I forgot I could do that. Well, on second thought, I’ll just fly back to the city, then! Right before that, I have to go to the bathroom.

Before Blue Lazer marched away from the campsite to take a raging piss, there was the sound of a loud BOOM!

The Neeka


Followed by that obnoxious “boom,” a screeching (yet rather disturbing) roar came from beyond the trees. Blue Lazer had chills down his spine, for he had heard nothing like it. Carl and Ophelia felt the same way, for they have never heard anything of a screech like that.

“That didn’t sound very friendly,” Carl said, taking his wife’s hand. “Ophelia, I think it’s best to leave here, now.”

“It was nice meeting you, Blue Lazer,” Ophelia said pleasantly, as the couple went into their car. They didn’t even bother to do any packing. They were soon in a hurry, once the screeching sound was heard from again. Blue Lazer did not like this one bit.

“Yeah, nice meeting you guys!” Blue Lazer’s stomach sunk, once he saw a few evergreen trees in front of him collapse to the ground, before him. Whatever was making the awful screeching sound, it was coming towards Blue Lazer. “Okay, buddy boy, what and where the hell are you?”

He unzipped his pants and urinated on the camp fire to burn it out. Once the fire was out, the screeching noise had occurred again, this time it being much closer. The sound of falling trees echoed throughout the forest, and the sound of massive footsteps were stepping on them, bark cracking and breaking. Blue Lazer took a deep breath, after zipping up his jeans, and decided to fly upward to see what was going on.

Once he had exceeded the height of the tall, tall trees, he saw something very disturbing and he was about ready to crap his pants. “O-ohhh, oh no. Ohhh, not g-good. Very ugly. Oh my God, oh my God.”

The Neeka, standing over one-hundred and twenty-five feet tall, was wandering through the forest of the hundred-foot tall trees. Its eyes were devilish, its teeth were illuminated by the lights displayed on his armor, and its body mass looked almost indestructible. It was a monster! Blue Lazer hovered in air, dumbfounded. Blue Lazer couldn’t say a word, regardless whether the Neeka would hear him or not. He was literally scared shitless. “Oh, my Lord, is this really happening?”

The Neeka had seen him. He looked directly at Blue Lazer and screeched, once more, followed by a chilling message. “BLUE LAZER! DIE NOW, PUNY HAMSTER!”


Chapter 25


“I-I’m not a h-hamster,” Blue Lazer replied, wiping the sweat off his forehead.

“YES YOU ARE,” the Neeka snapped right back. His intimidation towards the superhero was unnerving. “YOU DIE! ZJOK WILL BE PLEASED!” The Neeka stretched out its massive arm, his fingers tightly pressed together. Before Blue Lazer knew it, blue flashes of plasma firepower escaped his fingertips, soaring towards Blue Lazer with increasing speed.

“Oh, dear God! AGGH!” Blue Lazer screamed as he darted away to dodge the massive blobs of searing, burning light from hitting him.

“WORTHY OPPONENT MUST BE DIMINISHED!”

Blue Lazer couldn’t do nothing but fly away as fast as he could, shooting as many lasers as he could at the terrifying Neeka. The Neeka laughed evilly, as he chased Blue Lazer, running through and ultimately destroying the forest in his path. This was not good, not one bit. What Blue Lazer really had to do was to keep the Neeka as far away from the city as possible.


Meanwhile @ the Remains of the Obnoxious Tower














The Neeka


Holly could smell the disgusting odor of the Adoa, after being rudely awaken by a Mazer, who jabbed her in the stomach with his rifle. “Hey, fatty! Wake up! You’re under arrest for being a human!”

Holly scoffed at him, getting up slowly. Mr. Flower stood proudly on her shoulder. She noticed that none of her team were in the area. Where could Rig, Clarke, Jon, AJ, and the other marines, be? Her clothes were torn, though her skin and face was perfectly healthy-looking, thanks to the immense healing of the Misara Serum. However, she was excruciatingly offended when the Mazer called her fat.

“It’s okay, Holly,” said Mr. Flower, “we’ll get out of this.” There were only a few Mazers; Holly could easily take down these jerk wads. As Mr. Flower had spoken to her, Holly looked up at the night sky and all around herself. Behind her, about two blocks away, were the ruins of the Obnoxious Tower and Elephant mothership. They had done it! The Elephant was destroyed, but all of the buildings around her were diminished to the ground. It was a rather disturbing setting to be a part of, especially since it was pretty much all of Holly’s fault. Like before, she wanted to cry again. However, with her motivation to destroy the enemy, she would rather bleed than shed one more tear. Ever since Agent Nathan12, along with several other marines, had died Holly just snapped, which is why she went berserk and annihilated the cockpit without a second thought or hesitation. She snapped, similar to that when Preox snapped when he killed the gangsters.

“Shut up, daisy!” the Mazer ordered, aiming his rifle at the two. The other Mazers around the area were searching through the great amount of debris, looking for any other survivors.

“What’d you say to me?” Mr. Flower said, his rage beginning to rise.

Holly’s eyes turned into sunlight, the light blinding the Mazer. He cried in agonizing pain, as Holly’s eyes illuminated the dark of the ruined city. She opened her mouth, breathing her deadly solar flares at the rest of the Mazers, disintegrating them immediately. “Yeah, Holly!” Mr. Flower shouted proudly, who chose to stay on her shoulder. She had just noticed she was standing in a small, shallow amount of ocean water. The massive wave had reached her area, as well. Holly transformed her arm into the deadly, wooden stake, calling out for her team. “Jon?! Eugene?! Rig?!”

Chapter 25

















Right at that moment, an Adoa Mohawk had approached Holly; its hovering sound ceasing the quiet of the night. The ship’s (being about the size of a whale) green lights shined upon Holly’s face.

“Oh, jeez,” Mr. Flower said with uncertainty.

“Don’t worry, Mr. Flower,” Holly said, as tiger lilies grew throughout her body, “we can take ‘em.”

“ON THE CONTRARY!” came Rig’s voice. A cloud of blue smoke swirled around the ship, striking it with lightning. Mazers desperately tried to escape the Mohawk, but Preox and Kriket had made into the scene, just in time to shoot eliminate the infantry.

Holly turned around to see Moosey, roaring at the top of his lungs, running on his four legs, and charging at the Mazers thus knocking them flat on the ground. The enraged moose stomped on his enemies and took care of the rest with a Mazer’s rifle. The Mohawk was in crucial damage and went down, as it went up in flames. Rig returned to his Aziquet form, knocking out any bad guys he forgot to destroy.

The small battle was over and all Preox could do was yell. “OKAY! WHO DID THIS?! WHO MADE THIS HAPPEN?! I TOLD YOU ALL TO SPECIFICALLY DESTROY THE ENGINES, AND TO NOT BLOW UP THE ENTIRE SHIP!”


The Neeka


“Okay, Preox, calm down,” Kriket suggested. Preox wanted to yell at her also, but he really couldn’t. He loved her too much to do so.

“RIG, YOU IMCOMPITENT SACK OF LARD! WHAT HAPPENED?! DID YOU NOT LISTEN TO MY PLAN?! IN CASE YOU HADN’T NOTICED, THAT ELEPHANT DESTROYED NEARLY A QUARTER OF THE CITY!”

“It was me, Preox,” Holly said abruptly, “and for Christ’s sake, will you shut up? You don’t want more of those grotesque cows coming at us, do you?”

“Y-you did this?!” Preox shouted right back. “Oh, and forgive me, Miss Sammy Sass, I didn’t know I was being such a loud mouth. As if we haven’t caused enough commotion, as is! We just destroyed a Mohawk, along with other idiots who were mercilessly killed by our hands. There’s going to be more coming and I’m pretty sure they know of our location, by now!”

“Then why are we standing here and yelling at Holly for?!” Kyle snapped. “How about we move our asses, for once, look for Blue Lazer, and the others?!”

“Don’t start with me, talking pencil! You’re lucky you’re still alive, if it weren’t for me, of course.”

Kyle was getting a raging headache, he couldn’t take much more of this. “Bull tits! There have been plenty of times where me, Velouria, Kriket, and even you could have gotten killed! All you do is talk and you never do anything, without delivering a redundant insult!”

“Why you little--.”

“SEE?!” Kyle shouted, laughing hysterically and pointing his finger at Preox’s face. “You’re doing it again! Why don’t you just shut up and do something about it, for once, instead of just calling me names or saying ‘what you’re gonna do to me?!’”

Preox yelled angrily and began strutting forward to Kyle, about ready to punch his lights out. Holly grabbed him with her vines, pulling him back. Kriket gasped, as Preox ripped the vines off, unfolding his rifle and pointing it at Holly. Her eyes turned into sunlight, once again. Preox was breathing heavily with anger. Holly stood there, as calm as a sheep. “You don’t want to do that, dude. And I know I screwed up. I’m sorry.”

Chapter 25


“Preox, stop it!” Kriket yelled, saliva spewing out from her lips. Preox listened and he stored his rifle, as Holly’s eyes returned to normal. Velouria went up and held Kyle tightly. As for the others, including the marines, the other A72A agents, and Jared, all stood and watched.

Preox looked around at everyone, who all just stared at him in disgust. Never, in his career of being an Asid Magnate, had he experienced this much embarrassment. He looked like he was about to break down and cry. Before he could do that, Kriket went up and hugged him tightly. “Preox, honey, it’s okay. We have to keep moving, alright? No more yelling, no more calling names. We have to keep moving. Please?”

Preox looked down at her. “I’m so sorry. Ahem. Everyone, please excuse me for my rude behavior; especially to Kyle and Holly. We have to keep moving. I’m pretty sure the Adoa are inevitably in the center of the city, looking for casualties. I’m not sure when Zjok’s Elephant will show up, but we must make it to the waterfront and look for Admiral Bxir’s team. Everyone, we’ve made quite a bit of commotion just recently, so I suggest we be as quiet as possible.”

Everyone agreed, including Holly and Kyle, who have forgave Preox for his formal apology.

“Why not use the sewers?” came a sinister, yet familiar, voice.















The Neeka


A sewer lid had been opened, sucking in flooded water, and there stood Evil Nacho, grinning as usual. “I couldn’t help but overhear your distress.”

“Where the hell have you been?!” literally everyone asked him, besides Jared and the other marines. Those guys just looked at him, deciding whether or not to shoot Evil Nacho or not. Evil Nacho was back, from whatever he was up to.

“Oh, I’ve been working on a little project,” Evil Nacho said with a laugh. “Down to the sewers we go and those idiots will never find us.”

“And what if they do?” Preox said.

Evil Nacho laughed again. “You guys have been battling this whole time and not once have this Adoa even remotely thought of using scavenging strategies through the sewers.

“What were you doing the whole time we were all busy?!” Holly shouted, angrily.

Evil Nacho smiled. “You’ll see.”

They wandered through the sewer system, Evil Nacho’s sewer system, seeing that all of the waste was reduced to nothing but a river of nacho cheese. Evil Nacho’s plan was to use the sewer systems as geysers (of nacho cheese) and super weapons to take down the Adoa. In conclusion to that, Preox thought this “super weapon” idea was surprisingly brilliant.

As they ventured through the sewer, Moosey went up to Holly and asked her a question. “Hey. Holly, is it? Um, where’s Nathan? He’s my A72A partner.”

Holly felt sorry for the moose and she stopped walking, as did Moosey. His face looked poor and miserable. He had already known what had happened, just by looking at Holly’s face.

“Hey, you guys coming or what?!” Jared yelled.

“Yes, just give us a second,” Holly said calmly, looking up at Moosey’s sad, furry face.

“He’s gone, huh?” Moosey said quietly. Holly nodded weakly, as Moosey began to cry. He was really going to miss his partner in the A72A. “I’ll never forget him and his continuous chewing of bubblegum.” Moosey knelt down and gave Holly a big hug, before the two continued to move on.

Chapter 25


Near Kyle and Velouria’s Neighborhood!

Blue Lazer’s adrenaline was at a maximum, once the Neeka began to chase him. The monster’s horrifying powers were unlike anything he had ever seen, before. The plasma blasts ejecting out of the fingertips, of the Neeka, were powerful enough to make Blue Lazer explode on impact! He had to destroy the Neeka, and running away from it was not the best option. However, comparing Blue Lazer’s size to that of the Neeka, fleeing the city and forgetting everything that ever happened seemed like a great idea at the time. He was flying, not at his fastest speed, although he was fast enough to keep the Neeka’s attention and continue following him. Firing as many lasers as possible, his primary weapons seemed to do very little damage to the Neeka, which gave Blue Lazer a massive anxiety attack. “Aggh! What do I do? What do I do?!”

Blue Lazer tried his constant best to stay out of reach from the Neeka, who plowed through the forest like snow, and tried his best to keep the Neeka away from any rural areas. If this thing was in the city, things would go absolutely haywire.

“I KILL YOU NOW!” the Neeka yelled furiously, as red blobs of pure plasma leaked out of the Neeka’s back. The hot, boiling blobs of plasma followed Blue Lazer like heat-seeking missiles. Blue Lazer couldn’t help but maneuver, as well as scream like a little girl.

“Stop doing this, please?!”













The Neeka


“HA! THE NEEKA WILL DESTROY, WITHOUT MERCY!”

Blue Lazer swerved and did his best to avoid getting hit from the crazy amount of plasma. He was doing exceptionally well, until two blobs of heat-seeking plasma imploded against one another, causing a blast radius big enough to send Blue Lazer straight into a house. After crashing through the roof and landing on the carpet of the seemingly inhabitable home, Blue Lazer weakly got up as his body healed as fast as it could. “Wait, what? Is this Velouria’s house? Wow, looks like they renovated big time!”

The Neeka’s massive fist slammed through the interior of the house, like a wrecking ball, critically damaging Velouria’s house. Blue Lazer climbed onto the fist, quickly, and ran up the Neeka’s arm. The Neeka screeched angrily, after Blue Lazer slammed his fists on the monster’s forearm, thus destroying pieces of his armor. “Okay, all I gotta do is keep hitting and maybe—OOF!” The Neeka back-handed the hero away, sending him straight into the middle of a local neighborhood (The neighborhood of which Kyle lived in. Some civilians were still inside their homes, leaving them frantically.) Blue Lazer quickly got up, as the Neeka fired more plasma and stormed through the houses of the neighborhood. The hero lifted up an entirely damaged vehicle and threw it as hard as he could, at his enemy.

The vehicle slammed against the Neeka’s face. He screeched ferociously, stomping his feet on the concrete and shaking the earth. Blue Lazer took another nearby car, flew up to the Neeka, and intended to smash it on his skull, though was completely rejected by another onslaught of plasma. One blob of plasma hit the vehicle he was holding, blasting him away. With the vehicle completely destroyed, Blue Lazer groaned in pain as he struggled to keep up in the air. “Okay, buddy-boy, you’ve pissed me off long enough!”

Blue Lazer darted as fast as he could, clenching his fist and slamming it against the Neeka’s teeth, shattering one of them. The Neeka screamed in agony. “OWWW!! STOP WHAT YOU ARE DOING! ACCEPT YOUR FATE! DIE NOW, RUDE IGUANA!!” The monster fired more plasma, desperately trying to eliminate Blue Lazer. The masked teenager, being swift and cunning, stomped on the Neeka’s head, thus creating a sonic boom of mass proportions.


Chapter 25


He had not done his sonic boom power in a long time, and he felt good that he was able to get the hang of it. The sonic boom was powerful enough to send the Neeka to face plant on the concrete. Blue Lazer climbed on top of him, punching away and firing lasers on him and his armor. The Neeka screamed angrily, firing a few plasma bursts at a house, right next to them. The house exploded, where the force of the explosion sent Blue Lazer flying involuntarily, once more. The Neeka grabbed him and slammed him hard against the street. The sudden pain from harsh impact was really giving Blue Lazer some hardcore pain. He laid there, groaning slowly, as the Neeka pointed his fingers at him. The Neeka was finally going to kill Blue Lazer. “ANY LAST WORDS, HUMAN?!”

Blue Lazer coughed up some rocks, feeling a burning pain from his stomach. It was a pain that did not come with the great slamming against the road. It was a far more different pain, yet vaguely familiar. Now, Blue Lazer felt like he was going to throw up. Oh, God, not this again! “Yeah! I got a few for yah, buddy-boy! Eat this!”

Blue Lazer opened his mouth and out spewed a geyser of hot, molten lava. The lava levitated enough to burn the Neeka’s face. They both found themselves screaming in pain. The Neeka was screaming from the pain of the lava obstructing his face, while Blue Lazer screamed from feeling the hot lava pass through his interiority. He stopped puking lava, rolled back up onto his feet before the Neeka could shoot him with his plasma, and leapt onto the Neeka’s back. The Neeka was really pissed now, as he tried to get Blue Lazer off and get the lava off his face. Blue Lazer thrashed at the Neeka’s armor, trying his best to stay on his back. Amongst all of the thrashing and tearing at the monster’s armor, Blue Lazer discovered something rather peculiar. He could see continuously flashing, blue lights under the Neeka’s skin.

Blue Lazer puked more lava on the Neeka’s back, the monster screaming as loud as it could. Not realizing that the object inside the Neeka’s body was in fact a bomb, Blue Lazer tore it out of his body, gripping the massive explosive tight. The Neeka was now on his knees, gasping for air, as the lava burned his face and back. Blue Lazer intended to hover above the



The Neeka


dying Neeka and slam the object onto his head, one last time, with as much force as he could. “Any last words?!” Blue Lazer had asked, hovering at least twenty feet above the massive creature.

“M-mercy…” the Neeka said weakly.

Blue Lazer raised the object over his head, still completely unaware that the object in his hands was a bomb, and simply said, “Sike!”

Once the explosion occurred, which almost reached Blue Lazer, though not quite, the Neeka’s green blood and guts were sprayed all over him. He fell back on the ground and into the lawn of a property owner. Over half of the neighborhood went through destruction. The Neeka was destroyed and Blue Lazer just laid in the grass, almost too stunned to say any words after what had just happened. “This night… is the night. Wow.”

Blue Lazer rested for another two minutes, until he saw a flash of lightning, and heard a distant crackling. “Oh, God, I forgot there was another one of those ships. Can I just go home, now? Please?” Blue Lazer whined and complained, once he got up and watched the third Elephant, make its way into the distant forest. “Of course, the hydroelectricity plant.” Blue Lazer could barely see more Adoa ships following along with the Elephant. Blue Lazer looked around himself, he was covered in blood from three different species, including his own, his cape and mask were torn to the point where he just didn’t want to wear them anymore. He took off his intriguing costume for the last time, and put on his baseball cap, which he had kept in his back pocket during his whole time of battling the Adoa. He walked slowly through the neighborhood streets, once he noticed a clean baseball bat laying in the middle of it.

Axyl Smithy picked up the bat, holding it firmly in his hands, and smiled. “You know, I never really got to finish this season of varsity baseball. I think it’s time to show off that they really needed me that night.” Axyl looked up into the night sky, eyeing the Adoa ships with sincerity. “Alright, freaks, let’s get freaky one last time.” Taking the baseball bat with him, Axyl took flight and flew as fast as he could toward Zjok’s Elephant. It was time for him and Zjok to face off, at last.










Part 6:

It Could Have Been Worse



Chapter 26: Zjok’s Providence














Approximately five minutes before Axyl decided to take on the last Elephant, with sheer confidence, everyone else was still venturing through Evil Nacho’s sewers. Evil Nacho’s plan to wipe out the rest of the oncoming Adoa was simple; especially when they were to approach the city’s waterfront once again. Kriket looked up at Preox, taking his hand, as they followed Evil Nacho through the cheese-infested vicinity, and made sure he was alright. Preox has had a few moments where he would absolutely snap and it often worried others, especially Kriket. She was completely devoted to him, no matter how war-mongering he was.

“Preox, are you doing okay?”

Preox took a few seconds to answer, and Kriket knew he was about to lie to her face. “Yes, I am fine, Kriket.”

“Please don’t lie to me.”

Evil Nacho muttered a soft “Ooo,” teasing Preox.


Chapter 26














“Preox, don’t. I’ve seen you break down far too many times, now. You can’t keep all of your emotions inside you.”

“He’s clearly expressed enough, as is,” Kyle chortled.

“I’ll get over it, Kriket, alright?” Preox gave Kyle a glare.

“I’m pretty sure Zjok was the same way, before he went ape shit,” Kriket replied immediately. Evil Nacho hawked up a wad of snot and phlegm, projecting into the river of nacho cheese, as Kriket talked to Preox. “Please, Preox. Please talk to me. You’ll feel better.”

“B-but…”

“Right now is a perfect time to do so, sweetheart.”

Preox blushed a little bit, though kept a serious face. His blushing cheeks had won. “Thank you, Kriket.”

“No problem, my sexy ‘Jolly Green Giant,” Kriket giggled. Preox started laughing, also.

“You know you didn’t have to pester Preox like that,” Velouria whispered to Kyle. “You really pissed him off back there.”

Kyle sighed. “I know. I don’t know what came over me. Haha, ‘came.’” Velouria laughed at Kyle’s immaturity, but drew back to the seriousness of the subject matter. “Kyle, you need to apologize, alright?”

“Do I have toooo?” Kyle whined.

“Hey, Axyl apologized for all the years he’s picked on you, right?”

Kyle groaned gently. “Jeez, you had to pull that card?”

Zjok’s Providence


Velouria nodded, staring at him. Kyle sighed and smiled at her. “Okay, I will apologize. You’re right, you always are. We’ve all seen so much, today.”

“So have I,” Velouria said, which was hilariously redundant.

Kyle held her hand, tightly. “At least we have each other.”


“Is that really what Nathan said, before he died?” Moosey asked, quite excitingly, as he walked with Holly, Jon, Clarke, and the marines.

“Hell yeah!” Jon said. “I’m gonna miss that guy.”

Moosey looked down at Holly. “Thank you for trying to save him.”

Finding Moosey’s act of thankfulness to be full of awkward, Holly smiled at him. “You’re welcome.”

“Hey Moosey, buddy,” Mr. Flower said, getting on Moosey’s shoulder, “if you ever need a pal, I’m here.”

“Thanks, Mr. Flower!”

“Whatchu wanna talk about?!”

“Well,” Moosey thought for a moment, “I really hate stinky socks.”

Mr. Flower. “Me too! That’s why I don’t wear them!”

“Haha, neither do I! We should try to find the stinkiest sock in existence.”

Mr. Flower laughed, slightly disagreeing with that idea. “Haha, sure! Let’s do it! It will be our own ‘Stinky Sock Adventure!’”

The two of them laughed more and before they knew it, Evil Nacho had climbed through the ladder of a sewage entrance and climbed out, followed by everyone else. The entire waterfront was a washed up mess and there was no sign of the Adoa. The only essence of Adoa was only coming from their destroyed aircrafts in the water, or in the ruins of the city. Preox noticed that a few battleships were still afloat in the Pacific Ocean. Lights were lit up on the ships, indicating life. “Look at that. The battleships are still at the waterfront. Now that’s commitment.”

“Maybe something big is about to happen,” Jared said, clutching his weapon of a Mazer rifle.

Chapter 26


According to the aptly named Sergeant Murphy, reinforcements have snuck into the city moments after the two Elephants went down. There were Humvees and many Bell Boeing helicopters docked on the piers of the waterfront. They were getting ready for another, attack.

“The third Elephant ship has already started descending, Sergeant Murphy,” Preox responded. Zjok’s Elephant could be seen in plain sight, very high in the sky.

“We’ve heard plenty of rumors,” Murphy replied. She was just about as serious as Preox was and he could actually tolerate it. “Rumors that you said that there is in fact another Elephant we must destroy. However, I can’t help but think of the remaining enemies who are all in the heart of the city. How shall we deal with them?”

“POOP ON THEIR FACES!!” Rig shouted, randomly.

“He does that,” Preox answered, before Sergeant Murphy could ask.
















As Preox conversed with Murphy, standing with the rest of the team, Holly looked up in the sky to see an object hurdling towards the Elephant. Holly was looking up at the sky. “I can see Axyl, I found him.”

“Can he do it?”

“Absolutely not,” Preox immediately replied. “Zjok has something planned, I just know it. After all this time of knowing who Blue Lazer was, there’s no doubt in my mind that Zjok had prepared something special for him. Something to use to his advantage against the prepubescent prick, himself.”

Holly got a little worried. “What do you mean?”

“Maybe a weapon that could extract his powers,” Preox said with a shrug. “It wouldn’t surprise me if he created any material that was against Blue Lazer’s super-powered advantages.”

Holly looked up at the sky again. “The ship is over the Stupendous Forest. Must be after the energy from the hydroelectricity plant.”

“Please don’t go,” Kyle begged. “I don’t wanna lose you!”

Chapter 26


he’s been plenty of sweet to me (even though he can be a raging jerk) and I don’t think I can find anyone else like that. He’s never insulted me, never called me out on my anger, and especially my hatred towards him. He’s practically my bitch, but it’s cute –in a sense.”

Holly laughed back, so did some of the others. “I guess I can go find a car and drive my way down there.”

“Oh, that won’t be necessary,” Sergeant Murphy cut in, “I can lend you one of my Humvees.”

“You’re one of the nicest Sergeants in the history of ever,” AJ said with a chuckle. Holly thanked Murphy with great sincerity and before she was to take off in the Humvee, she said her goodbyes to her team. She gave Kyle a big-ass hug, telling him that they’ll always be best friends forever.

“We should get friendship necklaces when this is all over,” Kyle said, holding Holly close.

almost no time, at all. “First he destroys one my Elephants, then my Neeka! The tyrant slouched back in his lawn chair, eye-balling the forest and the entire city below him. graph to the other. The Mazers, Strikers, and Probes, watched their leader cautiously.

Inside a Mohawk


“Stahp!” the Mazer Pilot yelled angrily, as Axyl tore apart the ship from the inside. The rest of the Mazers were all diminished, by the time Axyl grabbed the Pilot by the throat and smashed his head against the Mohawk’s controls. Axyl leapt out of the ship, allowing it to freefall and crash into the ground. Axyl gripped his metal baseball bat firmly, shooting elbows out of his other arm, as he flew from one Adoa ship to the other, destroying them.

Axyl detached the razor sharp wings of a Bat ship, splicing two more with them. Before he knew it, Axyl was right in front of the massive Elephant ship, with no idea as to how he could get in. There was too much firepower to even concentrate. As some lucky bullets would hit Axyl, he really didn’t mind the pain. However, getting shot all the time was really starting to get old. He swiftly flew under the ship, which was where all of the Bats and Mohawks were coming from and about a dozen auto turrets opened fire upon Axyl, which was something innovative to him. He had never seen so many auto turrets! Not on the Elephant he had destroyed, at least.

















Chapter 26


Axyl fought his way around the turrets, either crushing them with his bat or blasting them to shreds with his elbow lasers. Axyl had never realized how incredibly awesome his combat really was, up until he started fighting the Neeka. Of course, his combat was great, but ever since Axyl defeated the Neeka, he felt ten-thousand times more powerful than he had been, before. He felt like he was on ecstasy, though he really wasn’t. After punching his way through another damned Mohawk that tried to leave the Elephant, Axyl found himself inside a massive hangar, stretching the entire height of the Elephant. There were many floors, many corridors, many EVERYTHING!!!

Axyl rolled his eyes, as he kicked a Mazer in face, once he had landed on a shipping dock. “Jeez, could this thing get any bigger? Blah! That’s what she said!”

Axyl darted through a massive corridor, next to where all of the Bats and Mohawks would leave the Elephant. No bad guys had noticed the eighteen year-old sneak into the corridor, so that was a good sign on his part. Unfortunately, Axyl really needed another way to get to the ship’s engines, instead of just flying through a hefty amount of firepower from every enemy inside the Elephant. Axyl couldn’t just make his way through the top, like he did before. The armor was too thick and it would take too much time for him to eventually get into the engine room, without getting blasted to death. “Okay, where the hell do I go? There has to map or something.”

“No maps! You must surrender yourself! Surrender yourself or you will die! I promise you this, loser!” a Mazer yelled, shooting lava bullets at Axyl.

“Only if you surrender your mom!” Axyl shouted, dodging the bullets and bashing the Mazer’s skull into oblivion with his metal baseball bat. A small group of Probes came from behind, firing their deadly purple lasers. Axyl smiled at them, strutting casually towards them, while firing his blue lasers. Once he got close enough, he beat the snot out of the space robots with his bat. Not taking the notice of the Adoa Striker behind him, the Striker fired its colossal Adoa carbine, sending Axyl in the air and smashing his body against a staircase. “Ugh! OW?! You, sir, have a much bigger gun! Why you no play fair?!”

The Striker laughed, firing another round from the carbine, sending

Zjok’s Providence


the teenager to fly and slam against the wall. He felt his body flail, like a rag doll, as he fell down the flight of stairs. “AGGGH! MY SEEING BALL! SON OF UH--.” Axyl slammed his fist on the Striker’s teeth, shattering them to pieces. The carbine was about the size of him and Axyl decided to bring it along with him, rather than having the baseball bat.

“I think I can get through here a lot easier if I use this. Damn! This thing is so O.P.!”















Pier 87 – Kingzing City Waterfront

“Kyle, Velouria, Jared, you will take refuge in Marsing. That’s where more militants and medics will be stationed.” Preox had noticed Kyle and Velouria’s ultimate stress towards this miniature war. Kyle and Velouria may have been swift shots, but Preox surely knew they weren’t fit for what they

Chapter 26

were dealing with. He was about to explain why he wanted the two of them to take a break, up until Kyle said something he didn’t agree to.

“But what if you need us?” Velouria said. She was determined to fight, but not entirely.

Preox shook his head. “We’ll be fine. We have enough troops. Now, make your way to 2nd and Umbrella Avenue. There will be a bus to pick up you and Kyle. There will be other civilians, also.”

“I’ll stay and fight,” Jared said. He actually really wanted to, while Kyle and Velouria slightly pretended to be persistent with Preox. “I didn’t live in this city for twenty-five years just to see it crumble to the ground by a bunch of narcissistic space shits.”

Preox looked at him. Jared was wearing a bullet proof vest, hockey pads, and was holding a military SAR-21 assault rifle. With the hockey pads, Preox thought he looked ridiculous. “Ha. You’re kidding me, right?”

Jared was confused. “I don’t think so?”

“Murphy did.”

Chapter 26

Zjok’s Elephant

Zjok’s Providence

Axyl smashed a Mazer’s skull with is bat before asking, “Where are your guys’ engines?”

“Up your ass!” a Striker replied angrily, before Axyl put a bullet in the Striker’s chest. Axyl was starting to feel somewhat psychotic and merciless. This did not reveal as a negative aspect that would haunt him and others surrounding, however Axyl found it somewhat interesting. He never thought he would be killing bad guys at two in the morning. He then started thinking about graduating high school, which was about a month from now! Was he still going to graduate, or were these alien primates going to ruin that also? Ever since he became Blue Lazer, Axyl raised his grade point average to a decent 2.5. It was much better than having a 0.0. Axyl then realized that graduating was really important, especially if he wanted to do something cool with his life.

“You know, jerk faces,” Axyl said, as he was fighting Adoa, “maybe someday I wanna be a famous person for a certain profession. Maybe I could be a businessman, a scientist, a zoo person, maybe even a lawn mower enthusiast! And you guys are trying to ruin all of that! It’s really annoying!

Chapter 26


No, you know what? I should coach baseball! Yeah, that’s what I’ll do! Jeez, what’s wrong with me? I’m talking about my future goals in life, as I shoot the heads of aliens. Who knew I would project this ethical, yet psychotic, soliloquy! Did I just say a fancy word? I did (Soliloquy sounds a lot like soliloqueef!) Okay, going back to the baseball coach subject, do any of you idiots think it could be a good idea to do that? I love baseball, I really do. I’m just not sure if it would be a profession for the rest of my life, you know? I’m eighteen, I’m doing better in school, and it’s great! What do you guys think? Oh, you’re all dead. That’s a shame.”

“Brilliant soliloquy!” Zjok said with a sincere phase of laughter. He overlooked Axyl on the next floor of the hangar. Axyl was now confused. What was another Asid doing on the Elephant?

Axyl aimed his Striker carbine at Zjok. “Who the hell are you, buddy-boy?”

Zjok’s eye ultimately twitched, remembering the times when Setil used to call him by the name of “buddy-boy.” Zjok was then joined by several Mazers, who stood by his side. Zjok stood about fifty meters away from Axyl, standing on the other side of the hangar. “I am the rightful owner of the unique abilities you obtain, you insignificant piece of salami. Hand over your blood to me, now.”

Axyl laughed. “No way, creeper, but do you mind me driving this rifle up your ass?”

One of the Mazers laughed and really couldn’t stop. After Axyl’s remark, Zjok took the laughing Mazer’s rifle and shot him to death. Axyl had never seen anyone shoot his own allies. Axyl then realized that Zjok was probably more psychotic than he was.

“Sorry, will you please repeat that?!” Zjok hollered across the hangar.

Axyl laughed and started flying towards the bad guy. He aimed his Striker carbine, shooting a few rounds. The bullets didn’t even hit Zjok, nor



Zjok’s Providence


did they remotely approach him within a foot of distance. The tyrant laughed hysterically, wielding a mini gun flamethrower. Axyl exclaimed frantically, as a massive wave of flames erupted from the small gun, almost catching him on fire. The human flew about the hangar, firing his lasers at Zjok. Axyl found it very frustrating that Zjok’s armor was far too strong. He wouldn’t be surprised if his armor was stronger than that of the Neeka’s!













Zjok held the Steamy Vampire B-105 gun, gripped it tightly behind his back, as Axyl decided to make another go in tackling him. Chapter 26


Zjok laughed, activated his massive Vambit and took off into the next floor of the hangar. Zjok was gone, like how a coward would leave, although he was surely to return. Axyl was aroused, once he had seen Holly. “H-Holly, what are you doing here?”

Holly walked up to Axyl, smacking a huge kiss on his lips. “I’ll explain, later, idiot. Do you need help finding the engines? I did go inside one of the Elephants, so I kinda remember what to do.”

Axyl spat and repeated what Holly had said in a maniacal tone. Holly slapped him, and a wide string of drool oozed out of his mouth. “Ow, jeez! What was that for?”

“I came here to help you!” Holly shouted angrily. “Now, come on, let’s go. I think we’re close.”

“Oh, like you know this ship so well,” Axyl replied sarcastically, following Holly through the ship.

“I actually do!” Holly shouted back. “You should know it well, too!”

“Well, someone kind of guided me to the engines, right before they crashed and exploded into oblivion.”

Holly stopped. “Wait, the rest of your team isn’t here? They’re--?”

Axyl nodded, taking a deep breath. “Yeah. I was the only one who wasn’t on that alien ship we had. You remember that?”

“Yeah,” Holly nodded, giving Axyl a hug. “I’m so sorry, Axyl.”

“It’s just weird, you know? I didn’t even know these guys and it feels like I lost a group of friends. Great, now I’m thinking about Cale, again.”

Holly started running through the ship, as Axyl followed, once again. “Oh, Preox and the other alien dudes aren’t going to like this news.”

“You’re telling me. That Prox guy is really moody.”

“I don’t think Preox really means to be moody,” Holly said, correcting Axyl. “All of this fighting, destruction, and pain has certainly taken a toll on all of us, like when I destroyed the Elephant.”

Axyl was confused, blasting a Mazer with his laser. “Wait, isn’t that a good thing?”

“No,” Holly said, laughing, “I completely blew it up. I destroyed the cockpit, instead of the engine room. For the time in my life, after how hard I’ve tried, I managed to screw something up. And it had to be that.”

Zjok’s Providence


Axyl could see that Holly was about to cry, as he watched her drive her timber fore-arm into a Mazer’s gut. He had never thought of Holly actually messing something up; especially blowing up a 70-story ship into pieces, without even realizing it until it was too late.

“Holly,” he said, taking a Mazer’s rifle, taking down a few more. “Holly, if you can forgive me for being an inconceivable asshole after all these years, you can forgive yourself.”

Holly didn’t respond, though she did scream angrily, as she fired her solar flares out of her gaping mouth. “Axyl, for once in your life, thank you for taking me seriously. Come on, let’s keep going, we’re almost there.”

The duo continued to fight onward, destroying their enemies, and gradually getting closer and closer to the engine room. Holly and Axyl could notice more Adoa ships were descending the massive hangar that ran along the entire ship. The Adoa must have been sending in more reinforcements to the city’s waterfront.



Near the waterfront

Evil Nacho could hear the combat, amongst the waterfront, from behind and he was sure that many other Adoa would be planning to attack from the inner-most part of the city. Evil Nacho was ready and he was ready for ultimate, cheesy destruction. He stood on top of a tall building, overlooking the region where he could see a wave of enemies, slowly making their way to the city. Under the assumption of the evil monster, the Adoa seemed to be attempting to sneak up on the humans, who were all busy fighting the Adoa invading the west side. Evil Nacho laughed maniacally, as he slowly stretched his orange arms out. He could feel the rumbling coming from the ground below, as every sewer lid popped off from their entrances. Some of the sewer lids would slice right through Adoa Bats or knock the hell out of some infantry.

The Adoa was slightly confused as to what was going on, but Evil Nacho proceeded to do what he was planning for such a long time. “Heh, I haven’t done this since 1974. It’s good to be evil.”

Chapter 26


Then, within that moment, when Evil Nacho’s eyes turned pure red with massive black pupils, geysers of hot molten nacho cheese erupted instantly from the sewers. The monster held his head high, roaring loud enough for the entire city to hear. Gallons of nacho cheese rushed through the flooded streets, striking Adoa ships and taking out any infantry. The cheese was about as hot as molten lava and all it did was tear enemies apart and cause searing pain.












Evil Nacho descended from the building and made his way into the city to approach his element of surprise. Mazers, Strikers, and Probes were ultimately caught by surprise, once Evil Nacho roared viciously and physically tore them apart, all while the hot nacho cheese rained down on the city. “Agh! What is that thing?! Fall back, fall back!” Even the desperate plea for mercy wasn’t good enough to be spared by the Evil Nacho.

By the time Evil Nacho had taken down the last Mazer, who was unable to escape the monster’s wrath, the hot nacho cheese had mixed in perfectly with the flooded water that covered the streets of Kingzing City. Evil Nacho slowly trudged back towards the waterfront, through the nacho cheese, wearing his most evil grin yet. Evil Nacho had succeeded and now it was up to him and the others to be rid of the Adoa on the other side. More nacho chips grew on Evil Nacho and he appeared to increase in height. He returned to battle, once he had made it to the waterfront, taking down another Adoa Bat.

Zjok’s Providence


Zjok’s Cockpit

Zjok growled with fury, once entering inside the cockpit. He observed the latest footage from the Adoa Probes, seeing only that Evil Nacho was the one responsible for the depletion of his troops on the east side of the city. “Blue Lazer and Super Blondie are here, Adoa,” Zjok said, “prepare yourselves, because this is going to be a bumpy ride.”

Zjok was just about to get to the ship’s main controls, with his main intention to move the Elephant to the waterfront, when Axyl and Holly entered inside, beating the snot out of his Mazers.

“This isn’t the place! Axyl what’re you doing?!” Holly couldn’t believe she was actually following Axyl to the one familiar place, where she had screwed up before.

“I know,” Axyl said, “I’m just wanting to kick this Zjok guy’s ass! Come on, bro! Let’s finish what we started, buddy-boy!”

Zjok snarled, looking at the teenager. “So naïve! You have no idea who I am, do you?!”

“A real pain in the crotch!”

“Axyl, let’s just go!” Holly shouted, frantically. “Let’s just destroy the damn engines and be done with it!”

Axyl didn’t listen to her, he descended down the staircase to the cockpit, blasting Zjok’s minions who shot at him. Axyl was actually smart enough to spare the ones who were actually controlling the ship’s stability. Once he was finished with the other hostiles, he fired more lasers at Zjok. Again, none of the lasers were able to penetrate Zjok’s shield. Holly rolled her eyes, sighing deeply, and followed Axyl. She helped take down any other hostile who did their best to protect Zjok. Holly then made the bold decision to charge at Zjok, as Axyl fired his lasers at him. Zjok was too fast for her, as he grabbed her face and slammed her to the ground. “PATHETIC BRUTE!”

“Holly, no!” Axyl shouted, as Zjok lifted Holly by her long, luscious, blonde hair, and threw her at the cockpit’s massive window. The window slightly shattered and Holly’s body had slammed back onto the ground. Zjok unfolded an Adoa rifle and began to shoot an immense amount of firepower

Chapter 26


at Holly, all while she was trying to get up. Holly screamed in pain and attempted to gouge Zjok’s eyes out with her vines. Zjok caught the vines, pulling Holly towards him and slamming her on the metallic ground of the Elephant ship. Holly was unconscious immediately, once she had hit the ground. Her body was taking a longer time to heal up, a lot longer than usual.

Zjok was just about to stomp her face in, with is heavy-armored boot, until the sudden force of Axyl knocked him on the ground. They wrestled around the cockpit, punching each other like politicians. As Axyl remembered the time he was in Varsity wrestling in sophomore year, long before he got into baseball, he remembered of a fantastic wrestling move he had learned from Coach Sleeve. Before Coach Sleeve had hated Axyl for screwing up his final chance at the district baseball game, he had taught Axyl of a fantastic wrestling move, which resulted in a deadly chokehold. Axyl was doing great with the wrestling, but he didn’t remember the exact move. This actually resulted Zjok in punching Axyl in the face hard enough to knock him off. Axyl fell backward and immediately attempted to get back up and fight.

Zjok kicked him back to the ground with his heavy boot, which also had a razor sharp spike sticking out from the front. The heavy kicks also resulted the spike to dig deeply into Axyl’s stomach. The kicking got fiercer until Axyl did not have the power to get back up. The Serum was taking forever to heal his body, giving Zjok enough time to pull out his Steamy Vampire B-105.

“Oh, Axyl!” Zjok shouted, laughing maniacally. “It’s been fun!” Without giving Axyl the chance to get up on his feet, let alone his body to heal, Zjok pointed his weapon at him, and shot the massive needle into the center of his chest. He could feel his bones breaking, as the needle intruded his body. Axyl gasped for air, as he could feel the Serum fight to recover his body from such horrific pain. The needle was sucking the Serum into the massive vile. All while that was happening, the needle was also sucking out all of Axyl’s own blood, evaporating it into the air. Axyl was getting weaker and weaker, as his powers were ultimately stolen by Zjok. He couldn’t get the needle out of his chest, nor could he fire lasers, fly, or even move.


Zjok’s Providence


Zjok couldn’t wait any longer for his Serum to be obtained. He quickly tore the needle and vile from Axyl’s chest, seeing that all of the Serum had been extracted. Zjok continuously laughed his ass off, as he quickly injected the maximum dosage of the Misara Serum. Holly remained unconscious, as Axyl’s vision was beginning to blur. His skin was completely white and he was soon going to bleed out. Zjok could feel the Serum flowing through his veins and he laughed viciously. “Yes! OH YES! THANK YOU, DROKENSMUR! You have given me the best gift of all!! I WILL NOW FULFILL YOUR DYING WISH, YOUR DESTINY, AND MY DESTINY!”

Axyl didn’t want to hear this before he died. Not one bit. “Y-you freaking psychopath.”

Zjok chuckled. “Oh, you should see me when I’m around milk.” The Serum continued to flow into Zjok’s insides, until the vile was completely empty. Zjok tossed the vile aside, feeling his muscles grow in size, including his whole body. Axyl was close to losing consciousness, once Zjok had obtained all of the Serum. Zjok laughed and laughed, as he approached the massive, yet shattered, window of the Elephant. He viewed Kingzing City, watching his minions descend into battle. “YES! DROKENSMUR YOU HAVE NOT LET ME DOWN! YOU DO SHOW CONSEQUENCES UPON THOSE WHO USE YOUR BLOOD, WRONGFULLY! SEE, BLUE LAZER?! YOU ARE BEING PUNISHED BY THE MIGHTY DROKENSMUR! I AM THE TRUE RULER OF THE SERUM! WATCH ME, AS MY ARMY WILL CONQUER YOUR PLANET, KILLING EVERYONE AND EVERYTHING! OF THE PAIN AND SUFFERING I HAVE ENDURED, I CAN FINALLY HAVE MY UPRISING! MY REVENGE HAS FINALLY COME TO CEASE FOR THE BEGINNING OF A NEW CHAPTER!”

For the first time in his life, Axyl felt like an absolute failure, even when he slipped out of consciousness. He was going to die soon. Then, Holly was awakened by Zjok’s constant laughter. Zjok hadn’t noticed her awakening, so she had a slight chance of taking him down. Seeing that Zjok was completely vulnerable, Holly weakly crawled to Axyl’s unconscious body, for she was more concerned of him more than anything. “A-Axyl? Honey, please don’t do this to me, dammit!”

Chapter 26


Zjok turned and faced her. He continued to laugh at her. “YOU ARE AN UNGRATEFUL BITCH! YOU’RE TOO LATE! I POSSESS THE SERUM, NOW!” Holly ignored him, sobbing over Axyl’s face. Zjok’s body was growing rapidly in size, including all of his muscles and teeth. His voice was growing deeper and much scarier. “HAHAHA! FOOL! YOU LET YOUR EMOTIONS GET TO YOU! HOW PATHETIC! DON’T EVER LET THEM GET TO YOU! THEY WILL DECIEVE YOU, HAUNT YOU, AND EVEN DESTROY YOU! MY PROVIDENCE HAS FINALLY BECOME A REALITY! I WILL FOREVER REIGN MY TERROR OVER THE GALAXY, WITH MY ARMY OF ADOA! FOR EVERYONE WHO DESERVES IT, WILL DIE! THEY WILL ALL DIE, INCLUDING YOU, BLONDIE! I WILL NOT DIE! I WILL NOT DIE! HAHAHAH, I WILL NOT--.”













At that precise moment, when all things seemed lost and hopeless, the evil Asid exploded! Exploded! Exploded into nothing but neon-pink blood, innards, and filthy shards of skin. Blood splattered all over the area, all over Holly, and all over Axyl. The first thought that could ever approach Holly’s mind was a simple emotion of pure confusion. “Okay, what the hell?” Shards of Zjok’s armor pierced into the main controls of the Elephant, causing the entire ship to avert directly, diagonally-downward to the left. The ship was


Zjok’s Providence


going to crash into Greedy Beach, right in front of the Stupendous National Forest. Not only that, the Elephant’s lightning cannons had ceased fire.

Ignoring the fact that an evil tyrant had just exploded into bits of flesh, Holly hoisted an unconscious Axyl over her shoulder began limping towards the cockpit’s massive window. She formed her other arm into the razor sharp, wooden branch and broke off the rest of the window. The Elephant was descending towards the Earth’s surface, faster. “Hold tight, idiot, I’m getting you out of here.” After trudging through Zjok’s blood and guts, Holly jumped as high as she could, out of the Elephant’s interior. Another thought came to Holly’s mind, the moment she had jumped: Wow. That maniac just did that. All by himself.

The waterfront


Agents Moosey, Jon, Clarke, and a Mr. Flower fought valiantly on the edges of Pier 63, fighting off all of the remaining Adoa. Rig did a pretty good job at taking care of any Adoa Bats or Mohawks that tried to penetrate the waterfront, from the west side. Rig’s powerful lightning pierced through Bats, like a knife slicing through a delicate wedding cake. Rig laughed like a little kid, as he killed off many of his enemies. As for Sergeant Murphy and her marines, they were having trouble holding off infantry that physically attempted to climb up Pier 87. Ever since the battle had started, two more battle ships went down into the Pacific Ocean. Sergeant Murphy, her tanks, and her marines held their ground, however. The tanks were the ones keeping the Adoa busy, but that wasn’t going to be for long.

“Call me crazy,” AJ started, firing a few rounds into a Mazer, “but all of that purple lightning stopped! It just stopped!”

“I hope you’re not crazy,” Murphy said, “because then I would be, too!”

“Is that good thing?!”

“Hell if I know! Just keep fighting for your life! That’s an order!”

That’s when Evil Nacho entered the scene and fought off the Adoa, with the marines, and killing them off with his nacho chips.


Chapter 26


“Keep your focus, Kriket,” Preox ordered, holding his rifle tight. He and 1st Class Envoy Kriket were still dealing with Zjok’s annoying companion, Vanish. As they heard the constant battling, Preox and Kriket kept quiet on the roof of the building they were standing on.

Kriket laughed. “Oh, Preox, you don’t need to remind me. Once he’s in my sights, he’s as good as dead.”















After a few more moments of silence, the two Asids heard the unnerving laugh of Vanish from the left. Preox and Kriket turned immediately, opening fire at nothing, as an Adoa grenade lay beside them.

“Damn, he’s fast!” Preox shouted, taking notice of the grenade. “Kriket, hit the deck, now!” As they dodged away from the grenade, a green flash of light shined on their eyes, as an implosion occurred. The implosion sent Preox across the air, slamming hard against the small brick wall surrounding the building. Preox could feel his left arm snap; the bone had shattered. He grunted in pain, as Kriket took notice of what happened. Kriket seemed to be alright, considering the fact that she was running towards Preox to help him out.

“Oh! Preox, honey, are you okay?!” All was fine, until Vanish appeared to the left of her, shooting her down with his Adoa rifle. Kriket’s armor was able to keep her stable for a couple seconds, so she could have the chance to

Zjok’s Providence


fire back. However, Vanish did not let her have that chance. He shot her a few more times, until she finally hit the ground on her back. Vanish stood over her, aiming the barrel of his rifle at Kriket’s face. She coughed up tremendous amounts of blood, as Vanish finished a few last words for her. “Pathetic. You allow your emotions get in the way of your combat responsibilities. Zjok would not like this, at all.”

Kriket coughed. She was dealing with so much pain, she couldn’t even move. “P-Preox, I love you…”

“Shut up!” Vanish ordered. “Just die, already.” Kriket was ready, she was ready to accept her fate, so she shut her eyes tight and heard nothing but gun shots. However, they weren’t Vanish’s gunshots and Kriket didn’t seem to “feel dead.” She could still hear the warfare from a distance and she could still feel the unbearable pain left from her wounds. She then heard a thud from right next to her, so she opened her eyes to see Preox limping towards her. Preox held his rifle in one hand, desperately attempting to position his broken arm comfortably. Vanish laid next to Kriket, deceased.

“The idiot forgot I was even here,” Preox said, kneeling next to Kriket. “Kriket, are you going to be--?”

“I don’t know,” Kriket said, blood oozing from her mouth. “Quickly, take off my armor and tend the wounds. My medical kit should be in my Vambit. Hurry, p-please.” Preox felt like he was going to panic, though he didn’t want to because Kriket’s life was at stake.

Kriket’s naked body had completely thrown Preox off-guard, once he had taken off her armor. “Kriket, you don’t wear any under armor… under your armor?”
