Kriket laughed weakly. “No; it makes my body feel fresher when I’m in combat. But damn, I didn’t want you to see me naked like this.”

Preox spat nervously. “This is my first time seeing a naked female Asid.”

“Oh, well that just makes it even worse,” Kriket laughed, coughing more blood. “Hurry, use my medical tools to tend the bullet wounds. Oh, God. It hurts so damn much.”

“You have six bullet wounds,” Preox said, almost hyperventilating. “You got four in your shoulder, one in your chest, one in your thigh.”

Chapter 26



















“J-jeez, what kind of aim does that tool have?” Kriket questioned, referring to Vanish’s scattered aim. Preox started to sweat, as he rummaged through Kriket’s medical kit. He even used his broken arm, completely ignoring the pain. Kriket noticed of Preox’s nervousness. “Hey, big guy.”

“Y-yes?”

“I’m going to be just fine,” Kriket said sweetly, as if she wasn’t in any agony at all. She looked into Preox’s eyes, smiling weakly at him. “You got this, Preoxy-pooooAAAGGGH GOD THAT HURTS!! RRRGGHH!”

Preox had begun tending Kriket’s wounds, all while feeling the pain from his broken arm. He had realized that this whole medical process was not going to be a piece of cake. Preox also had to admit that he wasn’t as experienced with medical qualities as much as his combat capabilities. But he wasn’t going to tell Kriket that, of course, for that would raise more tension. Before they knew it, both Preox and Kriket were both screaming in agonizing pain, as Preox tended her wounds.

At one moment, while Preox was taking out the lava bullets and extracting the lava out of Kriket’s body, he had noticed Zjok’s Elephant descending onto the Earth’s surface. A sudden rush of happiness flowed through his cranium. “Son of a bitch. They did it.”

Zjok’s Providence


Moosey was the first to notice that the Adoa was beginning to retreat from battle. At first, Moosey thought it was all a part of an illusion he had gained from fighting for so long. Then, Moosey didn’t feel so confused when Jon, Clarke, and Mr. Flower started noticing this sort of event, also.

“Wait, what?” Jon said, keeping his pistol held tightly. “I’m confused. Is anyone else, here, confused?”

“I’m pretty confused,” a marine replied, putting a few rounds into a Mazer. “I think they’re retreating.”

Moosey watched the Adoa retreating, then noticed the Elephant was suddenly falling from the sky. “Guys, I think we won, or something?” The rest of Moosey’s group watched the Elephant, falling and falling. They couldn’t believe their eyes. Was this too good to true? “GUYS! WE WON! WE WON!”

After the breath-taking, awesome realization, the human forces did not allow the remaining Adoa to retreat. Air force jets and helicopters attacked and destroyed the rest of the Adoa ships. Marines, Navy, Agents, moose, nacho monster, and flower, took out the rest of the minions, who all desperately tried to escape by swimming away in the ocean.


Kyle and Velouria heard of their sweet victory, once they heard an obnoxious thud. The two of them were being driven in a bus to Marsing City, for safety. The ground slightly shook from the obnoxiously loud thud, making the driver pull to the side of the road. They both left the bus, curious enough to see what was going on. They could watch the damn Adoa ships fleeing the city, from a substantial distance. Kyle and Velouria, and every other militant surrounding them, were all confused as to what made the loud thud that shook the earth.

Kyle completely ignored that factor, as they all watched the Adoa flee. The Adoa failed miserably at retreating, as the rest of the air force took them all down. Kyle opened his mouth wide, before asking, “Did we just win?”

Velouria held his hand tightly. “I-I think we just did. Kyle, we need to go back to Kingzing.”

Kyle nodded in agreement, and they immediately started running in the opposite direction of whence they came. The marines, who were evacuating

Chapter 26


the two, along with other remaining citizens, yelled at Kyle and Velouria to get back to the bus, for they were both the military’s responsibility. The two of them ignored the marines and continued to run as fast as they could. They were both cheering happily for the victory they had all accomplished. They both even ran into Jared Smithy, who was walking with a few marines. “Kyle, Velouria?! Marsing City is that way!”

“We won!” Kyle shouted, as they both continued to sprint as fast as they could.

“I just heard word that this is so,” a marine said, holding his walkie-talkie. “Sergeant Murphy just told me they diminished the last wave of Adoa, including the destruction of that big Rhino thing.”

Jared immediately thought of his son. “That’s Axyl! That’s mah boy! Oh, wow! It feels likes the sixties, again!! WOO!!” Jared began running after Velouria and Kyle. “Hey guys, wait for me!! I wanna run with you, too!”

“That’s not creepy at all!” Kyle shouted back. Despite the fact that Jared, Kyle, and Velouria were all definitely out of shape their sprinting hurt so good!


Preox had finished removing the last lava bullet, from Kriket’s naked body. She moaned in pain, she could not scream any longer. Tears had rolled down her eyes, and as did Preox’s. He didn’t cry from pain, he cried from seeing Kriket in pain. “There’s the last one. Here, let me just patch this up.” Preox had finally finished tending to Kriket’s fresh wounds, and Kriket immediately asked, “Preox, hold me close?” The patched wounds covered up most of Kriket’s nude-self, but that didn’t stop Preox from suffering nervousness. He had never touched a female naked body, let alone see it. He pulled her up with one arm and they both sat on the building’s roof, together. The time was about five in the morning and the sun had begun to rise over the horizon. It was the first time that the light of day had illuminated the critically damaged city of Kingzing.

Despite the fact that the view was somewhat unnerving, it was also quite beautiful. Preox then began thinking about casualties including Admiral Bxir, Envoy Zitkir, and Commander Derno. He had to make sure they were all okay. “Kriket, we have to go.”

Zjok’s Providence


Kriket moaned. “Preox, please, just enjoy this moment with me? For two minutes?”

Preox stuttered. “B-but--.”

“Please? Can we just have two minutes of no worries? Plus, your arm needs to be worked on.”

Preox took a deep breath, exhaling for a good thirty seconds, making Kriket giggle. “Alright, fine. Let’s enjoy the sun rise. I think it’s about time I had a break, anyway.”

Kriket kissed Preox’s cheek and he started blushing a dark shade of green. “Thank you, Preox. It means a lot.”

Of all the things Preox had put up with (That being Rig, Moosey, stupid gangsters, Zjok, the Adoa, the Area 72 Agents), Preox was grateful that he had Kriket. If it weren’t for Kriket, he would have ended up like Zjok, a long time ago. He held her tight, but not too tight, as they both enjoyed the beautiful sunshine reign over the city.
















Chapter 27: “We Did It?”
















Greedy Beach was the final resting place of the infamous third Elephant, the Elephant of which was destroyed to end all conflict with the Adoa’s invasion upon Earth. The sun shined upon the ocean’s calm atmosphere, including the significant amount of debris left from annihilated Adoa ships. Some deceased bodies of the Adoa were scattered around the beach, as the third Elephant rested on its side. Once the Elephant had impacted, nothing but absolute silence roamed all over the beach. There was nothing but crashing waves, cool sand, large amounts of debris, and the dead bodies of Earth’s deceased predecessors.

Holly was surprised that the Elephant itself didn’t explode on impact, rather than just hitting the ground in a casual manner. Of course, the ship was heavily damaged and appeared to be inoperable, but Holly found it somewhat

Chapter 27


appalling to realize that the ship could sustain so much damage from falling out of the sky. Holly considered herself to be extremely lucky because if the Elephant were to actually explode, she wouldn’t be sitting on the beach completely soaked with water, holding Axyl close to her.

Axyl was still unconscious, though was going to die any minute and there was particularly nothing Holly could do about it. She continued to stare at his unconscious, expressionless pale face. She held his hand, trying to read any thoughts that may have been roaming through his unconscious mind. From Axyl’s dying mind, Holly kept hearing her name. She wanted to cry, although she wouldn’t allow herself to. “Axyl, you dumb idiot, don’t you dare leave me. Don’t leave me when I’m just starting to like you and your stupid, stupid smile. You rescued me, once! And the minute I rescue you, you’re on the brink of death. Would kissing you help?” Holly pressed her lips gently against Axyl’s, which were cold and wet. The kiss obviously didn’t work and Holly hated herself for believing that it actually would. “I wish I wasn’t someone to believe in fairy tales. If you’re still alive, Axyl —and you better be—I promise to not punch you as often as I should.”

Axyl didn’t move and Holly could feel his heart rate decrease and decrease. A tear started running down Holly’s cheek. “Dammit, you’re the first boy to make me cry.” Holly held Axyl as close as she could, as beautiful flowers started to sprout from areas along her arms and in her hair. For some reason, and that reason being the fact that Holly’s superpowers were behind it, Axyl’s body started to gradually warm up. Before Holly knew it, Axyl was coughing super hard in Holly’s ear. She gasped and pushed Axyl into the sand. “EW! You coughed right in my ear! Oh, damn, sorry!” Holly pulled Axyl back up in her arms, as his eyelids slowly opened.

“O-oh, why hello, fair princess of the ocean,” Axyl said weakly, grinning like an idiot. It was the grin that Holly had always adored, even when she hated it more than anything else. Holly slapped him hard. “Ow! If you’re gonna cuddle with me, at least me nice, because I almost died and stuff.”

Holly smiled, kissing Axyl hard. “I don’t know what I did to ‘revive you,’ but it worked!”


“We Did It?”


Axyl thought for a moment. “Well, when I had my cool powers, I first discovered my lasers by accidentally blasting my windshield to shreds. At least your discoveries have been more helpful.”

Holly laughed. “I guess I can heal other people too, other than myself.”

“I think you got better powers than I did,” Axyl said, out of jealousy. He sighed deeply, realizing that he had no more superpowers for the first time. The struggle was so real. He got up from the sand, standing on his two feet. He was completely healed, within seconds, thanks to Holly’s healing ability.

“Are you alright?” Holly asked, getting close to him. For once in her life, she was actually grateful to see Axyl alive and well.

Axyl nodded, with a slightly confused look on his face. “Yeah, I’m just confused.”

“Hmm, why’s that?”
















Axyl was fully aware of his surroundings, before he had asked any further questions. “How did all of this happen? Did I seriously miss out on this big ship crashing?? All I remember is running at that Zjok freak!”

Holly didn’t know how else to explain what had happened, because she was not responsible for destroying Zjok, or taking down yet another Elephant mother ship. She took Axyl’s hand and held it, as she gazed at the sunrise.

Chapter 27


“Well, if this weren’t for you, being the dummy you are, all of this would not have happened. You see, after I had woken up from slight unconsciousness, after that Zjok guy kicked my ass into oblivion, it seemed like he took all of your powers and injected it into his own body. Instead of fighting him, I went over to try and help you, and I knew we were about to be killed right then and there.”

“And that didn’t happen?”

Holly shook her head. “Nope. Instead of being crushed by that annoying alien, he blew up.”

Axyl reacted, blinking a few times. “I’m sorry, what? ‘Blew up?’ Like as in--?”

“Yep! Blew up into nothing but flesh and blood!”

“And you didn’t do a thing? Didn’t even touch him with your vine-y thingies?”

Holly shook her head. “Nope. I didn’t even take down that big ship, either. Once he injected your powers into his veins, everything just went downhill.” The two of them had started walking along the beach, together, away from the Elephant and the other remnants of the Adoa. “I do like long walks on the beach, but I never expected it to be like this.”

Axyl laughed, noticing each other’s clothing. They were torn, scratched, and burnt. They’ve been through one hell of a ride. “Hehehe, I think I’m gonna need some hardcore counseling, after all of this.”

“Don’t worry about it,” Holly said with a smile. “I’ve been through some crazy stuff. If you need anything, just know that I’m here.”

Axyl blushed, as he straightened his messed up baseball cap. He had been wanting to hear Holly say something as sweet as that for a long time. As they walked along the beach, they slowly made their way back to Kingzing City. Despite the fact that the city was up in smoke, calm emptiness was all it presented to those who had survived the vicious onslaught of Zjok and his army of Adoa. Everything was fine.


Rejoice was acknowledged, once Axyl and Holly walked across the Dansko bridge. Greeted by their friends, Axyl and Holly finally felt at peace. Holly had never hugged Kyle so hard in her life. In fact, Kyle felt she was going

“We Did It?”


to squeeze the life out of him. Hugs were given out to everyone, and even given to Preox, who didn’t sound too excited about the reunion. Kriket was working on his broken arm, once Preox had heard the news of Admiral Bxir’s, Envoy Zitkir’s, and Derno’s demises. Moosey didn’t take Derno’s death too lightly, either; same with Agents Jon, Clarke, and the other A72A Agents. However, those who have felt despair over the ones who had been lost, they kept their heads held high in a victorious manner.

Axyl, Holly, and all of the others, rested in a massive military tent, sitting along a plastic table. The setting was as familiar as the setting they were all familiar with when they held a meeting in the Dookoran restaurant. As Kriket worked on his broken arm, Preox decided to do all of the talking, once again. “Well, that plan worked out a lot better than I had hoped, except the fact that about a quarter of the city has been heavily damaged, flooded, and covered in cheese.” Evil Nacho snickered evilly and Preox shot him a look. “Despite the fact that the city is going to smell like cheese for a long time, I would like to congratulate all of you. I would like to congratulate all of the troops who had taken participation in this tremendous battle between good and evil. We saved thousands of civilians, we destroyed three Elephant ships, and we defeated one tyrannical rule of pure heresy. Alas, I do believe that Zjok actually defeated himself.”

Everyone’s heads perked up, confused from what Preox had said. He continued, taking notice of everyone’s attention span. “After being told that Zjok had ultimately exploded into pieces, after injecting an amount of the Misara Serum, he didn’t realize that he performed unrighteous acts against the Drokensmur. For those of you who don’t know what a Drokensmur is: Drokensmur are a rare (almost extinct) species that can obtain unnatural powers beyond imagination. When they are about to die, they grant their special abilities to those who seem worthy of obtaining. The last Drokensmur to ever exist, or so we think, visited Zjok on the brink of its death. Zjok was always a disturbed Asid, but the Drokensmur saw what Zjok was capable of. The Drokensmur’s dying wish was to grant Zjok his powers to use it for the greatness and protection of his kind. According to this ‘Dying Wish,’ if Zjok were to do the complete opposite, let alone misinterpret what the Drokensmur had intended, Zjok himself would receive dire consequences.”

Chapter 27


“Ever since Zjok had the Drokensmur’s powers, which were bestowed in the last drops of its blood, Zjok intended to use the blood only for evil and destroying those who have hurt him. In an ironic sense, Zjok planned to hurt everyone, even the ones who loved him dearly. After being ridiculed by only some immature acquaintances, Zjok assumed every Asid was against him and wanted to humiliate him further. He went mad and succeeded for such a long time, up until now. Sad thing is, Zjok never got to realize of his faults; he never realized that he had broken the Drokensmur’s oath. Those are some dire consequences, indeed.”

“Who made you the therapist?” Axyl spat, as he sat down after grabbing a bottle of Lazorade (The military was providing many refreshments, once the ultimate battle had ended.) Preox growled and rose from his seat.

“Axyl, don’t be a smartass,” Jared said immediately.













“You are required to study psychology when you’re in the Asid Military, you dense piece of plastic. Anyway, Zjok ultimately received the consequences that the Drokensmur had promised. This explains why he exploded after injecting the Misara Serum into his blood, Holly. The Drokensmur’s bio signature could telepathically read Zjok’s deepest intentions. Once the signature read ‘evil,’ the blood expanded immediately, thus blowing Zjok into bits. It’s really cool actually, the way the Drokensmur lives, that is. Anyway, more consequences followed, once his Elephant began to mysteriously lose control and crash into the ocean coast.

“We Did It?”


Maybe some falling debris of some sort diminished the main controls.”

“Wouldn’t that make the ship self-destruct?” Kriket asked. She was wrapping Preox’s arm up, when he answered her.

“Not if you destroy all of the controls, babe” Preox replied. He took a sip of some water, looking around at everyone who was in the tent. There was Moosey, Jon, Clarke, Mr. Flower, Axyl, Holly, Kyle, Jared, Kriket, Rig, Evil Nacho, AJ, and Sergeant Murphy. He took a deep sigh of distress and proceeded his speech. “Anyway, I would like for all of us to remember the following who have fallen in combat. This includes all the soldiers and civilians, whose lives were lost in battle. May their memory be forever in our hearts (And stomach for Rig.) Some casualties I would like to mention: 3rd Class Envoy Drox, 2nd Class Envoy Zitkir, Agent Nathan12, Commander Derno, Axyl ’s friend Cale Omnous, Admiral Bxir, and of course Zjok. The real tragedy behind Zjok’s death was not that the tyrannical bastard did indeed deserve to die, but rather that he never realized what the hell he was dealing with. He became what he hated the most. And I think a lot of us can learn from that. Now I’m really starting to sound like a therapist.”

So many moral values were rushed into everyone’s minds, like a crazy flock of sheep. Mr. Flower got up in the table, grabbing everyone’s attention. “So now what? We’re just gonna sit here and mourn?! I mean, no disrespect, but I think we deserve a party!”


And that was that! That was the cue for Preox’s little meeting to come to a close. Indeed, everyone did party; especially when civilians were brought into Marsing City. The party was unlike any other, having taken place about twelve hours after Preox’s little meeting. The party was emotional, it was a blast, and probably one of the most memorable moments of the heroes’ lives. As well as mourning the losses of their loved ones, the party was more than necessary and extremely therapeutic. The party was held in Ion Park, which was where Axyl participated in his district baseball game. There was a barbecue, there were games, and there was cake. Rig ate all of the cake, of course.

During the barbeque, as Jared made more stake, and as Kyle and Velouria ridiculously danced with one another, Mr. Flower couldn’t help

Chapter 27


but feel excruciatingly lonely. Although he had Agent Moosey17 and many others to accompany, Mr. Flower needed someone to love.

“Are you alright?” Moosey asked, offering Mr. Flower some delicious pie. Mr. Flower denied the offer, as he watched happy couples (such as Axyl and Holly, Kyle and Velouria, and especially Preox and Kriket), and he exhaled a deep sigh. Holly, whom of which was playing Frisbee with Axyl, Kyle, and Velouria, noticed Mr. Flower sitting on the bench next to the playground. She told her friends, and newly acclaimed boyfriend, to give her a couple minutes to talk with Mr. Flower. As she casually jogged towards Mr. Flower and Moosey, the two of them couldn’t help but capture a few glimpses of her bouncing breasts from every step she took.

“That’s making me feel pretty lonely, too,” Moosey said.

“Shut up!” Mr. Flower whispered as loudly as he could, shushing Moosey. Holly had been wearing new clothes and her hair was completely washed up. She looked like a new person; it was as if the raging battle against the Adoa had never happened.

“Flower,” Holly started, “I hope you’re not mad at me for forgetting.”

Mr. Flower looked up at her, his big black eyes glistening in the sunlight of the gorgeous afternoon. “Forget what?”

Holly knelt down, setting the palm of her hand in the grass. She lifted her hand out of the grass, revealing a beautiful pink rose with a posture similar to that Mr. Flower’s. The anxious daisy immediately got off the bench to meet this new rose. The gorgeous little thing looked at Mr. Flower, smiling brightly. Before Mr. Flower could say anything, he climbed up to Holly’s ear and whispered, “D-do you think you can make more…?”

Holly gave him a death glare. “Just say ‘hi’ to her, before I squash you.”

Mr. Flower laughed, thanked Holly, and descended from her arm to meet the pink rose formally.

“Hello, there.”

“Hi,” the rose replied, getting closer to Mr. Flower. “I’m a pink rose. You can call me Rosa Thorn.”

“Hooray, third wheel is always fun,” Moosey said sarcastically. He casually munched on his pie, pretending like nothing bothered him.

“Why don’t you come play Frisbee with us?” Holly laughed.

“We Did It?”
















Moosey smiled, tossing his pie away. “YAY! I’M FINALLY ACCEPTED!” Holly laughed as Moosey ran on his four legs. Axyl tossed the Frisbee into the air and Moosey caught it with his mouth, like an energetic dog.

“Hey! Nice catch, buddy-boy!”

“BUDDY-BOY?! I’M A BUDDY-BOY, NOW! YAY!”

The party was going swimmingly and it saved everyone from the grueling despair of what the Adoa had given them. The invasion, the people who fought valiantly, and the report of many lives being saved, roamed all over the media. Within twelve hours, the heroes of saving the city (let alone the world!) were all known for who they were and their upmost bravery. Amongst the celebration, the happiness, new hope, and the constant uprising of delicious pie, the heroes were now ready for anything. Anything that may threaten many lives, once more. On another note, ever since the victory, Evil Nacho had disappeared, once again, without leaving a single splotch of cheese. No one had a clear reason as to why he left, but his legendary aide was sincerely noted. His true story and motivations still remained a mystery.

“Kyle, what is this?” Preox asked, which an intriguing question by Kyle’s standards. He and Velouria have been getting hotdogs, prepared by Jared Smithy (who was in charge of all the barbeque food) when Preox walked up to the two with a beach ball. Kriket was standing beside him and she looked about as confused as he was.


Chapter 27


“What’s what?” Kyle replied, taking a bite out of his delicious hotdog.

“This thing!” Preox shouted, showing the beach ball close to Kyle’s face.

“You’re not serious are you?”

“Why is it so light?” Kriket asked.

Velouria giggled. “Kyle, honey, remember they are not from this planet! Preox, Kriket, this is a beach ball. You can hit it, kick it, and play with it!”

“Play?” Preox said.

Kyle rolled his eyes. “Okay, you’ve never heard of the term, play?!”

Preox chortled. “Of course I have, you ape! It’s just I’ve never done it before.” Kriket laughed and hit the beach ball out of Preox’s hands. “HEY! I was concentrating on that!”

Kriket kicked the ball across the grassy field, laughing. “Wow! Balls are neat!”

Preox face-palmed his forehead. “Oh, jeez. Well, thank you for informing us, Kyle. We’re going to go play with this ball, now.”

Kyle saluted to Preox, as he and his amazing girlfriend enjoyed their hotdogs. Velouria faced Kyle, who seemed to be quiet, and with concern she asked if something was bothering him. “Nothing is wrong, Vel. I just couldn’t believe we went through all of that doo-hickey. I’m also thankful my parents weren’t here to witness it. They’re on a cruise, lucky them. Question is: Are you gonna be okay? I mean, Cale Omnous was your ex and all…”

Velouria nodded, taking a bite out of her wiener. “Yeah, I’ll be fine, and I can relate with what you’re feeling. Ha, that’s funny, speaking of parents, I think I see mine.” Velouria took another, hesitated glance, smiling brightly. “Those is my parents! Look, in the baseball field!”

Kyle gulped, his nervousness was coming back to him. “Y-your parents?! I mean, that’s good, but is your dad--?”

Velouria took his hand, making him drop his hotdog. “My dad will shoot you if you piss him off, but I’m sure he’ll like you!”

Kyle laughed frantically and out of fear. “Sounds wonderful, sweetie!”


After the most memorable celebration party of many lives, Marsing City increased in population, once the city of Kingzing went under extreme

“We Did It?”


martial law. The entire month consisted of hunting down and being rid of any remnants of the Adoa. Preox, Kriket, and Rig commanded this movement and by the time of which one whole month had surpassed, it was time for Kingzing City High School’s graduation ceremony for Class of 2005. What’s more was that Axyl was actually able to pass all of his classes, for the first time in his life. The graduation ceremony took place inside Marsing State University, which was where Kyle was pursuing his acting career. The MSU stadium was massive, yet small for massive amount of attendees. Once the entire stadium was full, and when the time was right, students of KHS started walking down a long blue carpet.

Axyl, Holly, Velouria, and Kyle were duly noted for their heroic acts during the Adoa invasion. They were so duly noted that they were given permission to sit next to the members of the school council. Holly seemed to be the only person who was absolutely ecstatic about sitting with the old geezers. Before the four teenagers, there sat an astounding audience, along with other graduating students. Axyl smiled brightly, realizing that he was going to actually graduate! Before the four friends knew it, the ceremony had begun.

“Wow,” Kyle whispered, as he straightened his graduation cap, “we did it, huh? Even when we just fought off a bunch of alien invaders?”

“Pretty sick, if you ask me,” Axyl said, leaning back in his chair.

Holly rolled her eyes at him, then frowned. “Damn, I hope my speech isn’t too long.”

“Same here,” Velouria said. “How’s yours, Kyle?”

“Eh, so and so,” Kyle replied, taking out a piece of paper from his gown. He began reading over his graduation speech and stuffed the paper back in his gown. “There! All memorized!”

Axyl was confused, and scared. “Wait, why’d you guys write a speech?”

“We were asked to,” Holly whispered sharply. She was getting frustrated from her tassel continuously getting caught in her hair. “The school district asked, from the four of us, to write a speech for graduation!”

“And why was I not informed?”


Chapter 27


“You were there, with us, when we all agreed to do it,” Kyle said, trying his best not to laugh his ass off.

“I was?”

“I guess you were slightly hung over from the party, the night before,” Velouria said, shrugging. “We’ve been having a lot of parties!”

Axyl gulped, looking around the astounding audience. “Well, of course I would be hung over! Ugh, what should I do? I’ve looked like a douchebag enough, as is.”

“We’re all used to it,” Holly replied, with a smile. Despite the fact that she and Axyl were together, that still didn’t stop her from giving him so much crap. Axyl glared at her.

“Just go with it, man,” Kyle advised. “Do what I do, like in drama class, improvise! Oh, and always say ‘yes!’”

“Why do I have to say ‘yes?!’”

“That’s the rule, son!”

Holly nudged Kyle to shut up. “I wouldn’t worry about it, Axyl. We don’t give our speeches for about another hour.”

“So, I’m fine?”

“For now,” Holly replied, and she laughed.



Chapter 28: Class of 2005










“Velouria Knight Lancelot, will you please stand at the podium?” the student body had spoken into the mic, calling Velouria to give her speech. Kyle pat her on the back gently, as she took a deep breath and rose from her seat. She had a small stack of note cards, which contained the material of what she wanted to say to the enormous audience. She shook hands with the student body, members of the school district, even the janitor, and stood behind the podium. She was facing thousands of people and while showing very little signs of stage fright, Velouria began talking. Kyle and Holly listened attentively while Axyl was spacing out, due to the amount of anxiety, solely from the fact that he had no idea what he would speak about. He was pretty sure everyone knew who he really was, as Blue Lazer, also.

Chapter 28


It was all overwhelming for him, because he played a huge role in fighting against the ruthless Adoa. Since Axyl was highly expected to give a respectable speech, the pressure was almost too unnerving. There were also young children in the audience, wearing Blue Lazer ninja masks, red capes, holding Blue Lazer dolls, and possessing other means of merchandise.


“Hello everyone, hello people of Oregon,” Velouria started, with a bright little smile. She lowered the mic slightly, due to her shorter height. She looked so cute in her blue graduation gown. “My name is Velouria Lancelot and as far as some know, I usually go by ‘Vel’ or ‘Sir Lancelot.’ Today, class of 2005, we are here to celebrate an accomplishment, an accomplishment we’ve been waiting for since we started kindergarten. There are so many wonderful, familiar faces I see in the audience; faces I’ve been seeing since I was the age of five. It feels so heartwarming to see all of these familiar faces sitting in front of me, just waiting to finally toss their cap in the air and shout, “WE DID IT!”

The audience applauded and Velouria continued her speech. “As far as many of you may know: there was an attack over a month ago and Kingzing City ended up in a heap of danger, along with many of its inhabitants. I, myself, along with my three best friends, and many other brave souls partook in fighting back, against a force which threatened the human race’s way of life. Fortunately, we succeeded! Unfortunately, we’ve lost plenty. I pray for those who were lost on that day and for those who are still in mourn, including me and my friends. I’ve learned a lot this year, especially after the invasion of Kingzing City. I’ve learned that no matter how hopeless a situation can be, all you’ve got to do is keep your loved ones close to you. Enjoy every second with them. Keep those people close.” Velouria took a slight glance at Kyle, and smiled at him gently. “I would like to thank my parents, my family, my teachers, and my peers for keeping me up on my toes in whatever direction I was headed, whether it was bad or good. I would also like to thank all of the brave souls who fought valiantly ing last month. You guys will always be true heroes to us all. Thank you, everyone, for this incredible opportunity to speak to all of you, I love you all, and GO KINGZING RATTLESNAKES! SSSS!”

Class of 2005


The entire audience clapped, roaring with cheers, with the students hissing like a bunch of rattlesnakes. Even a few students had maracas to portray a rattlesnake’s tail. Velouria immediately received her high school diploma, once she had stepped down to sit next to her friends. It was now Kyle’s turn to give his speech. He stood before the audience, holding no notecards, placing his hands on either side of the podium and gave everyone a huge smile. “HI! Hello, everyone! Allow me to introduce myself! I’m Kyle Manning and I am more than happy to be speaking in front of all you lovely people, tonight. I can’t believe it myself, we’re actually graduating! Look at us, all grown up, determined to create the future we’ve always dreamed of. We’ve all known each other, seen each other, for over ten years. It breaks my heart that I’m not going to see much of you guys, anymore, especially the ones who were responsible for calling me names. Names such as ‘Pencil,’ ‘Skinny Boy,’ or just ‘Shit-Face.’ Oh, yeah, I’ll miss those people sooo entirely. I digress! Much has changed for me, since these past three months. I’ve faced new challenges, I’ve killed aliens from outer space, and I’ve made new friends. Friends I’ve never thought I would even have the pleasure to give a proper greeting. Of all that’s happened, I too have learned a valuable lesson: Never back down. Great, now I have that Tom Petty song stuck in my head!”

The entire audience laughed at Kyle’s ridiculously corny remark. He laughed softly into the mic, smiling his biggest smile yet. “When I first started high school, I had a hard time expressing who I really was. I’ve found it difficult to say the right things around others and I always worried what they would think of me if I did anything. No one should ever worry about the way he or she is! Thanks to my most recent experiences, such as fighting for my life, as well as for others, I’ve learned that standing up for yourself for something that you could change is all worth taking any risk. Even if it seems to be a preposterous notion. And if something gets in the way, just knock it down! Plus, be sure to never lose, or forget, who you really are and what you’re standing up for. As individuals, we are all powerful and there is no ‘weakest link.’ Be proud of who you are and don’t feel obligated to impress one another. Speak for yourself, respect yourself, just be yourself!”

Everyone roared with laughter and cheers. Kyle wiped a tear from the

Chapter 28


corner of his eye. He laughed softly into the mic, before finishing his speech. Holly smiled up at Kyle, as she took Axyl’s hand and held it tight. He didn’t expect that to happen and his cheeks began to flush pure red. Velouria was almost crying her eyes out. She was clearly devoted to Skinny Boy.

“Please remember what I said tonight, Class of 2005,” Kyle began, “and be proud of who you are. Don’t let anyone else tell you, otherwise! However, I’ve also learned that forgiveness is the best weapon! But, without further ado, I would love to thank my parents and family for all of their support; I want to thank my friends, and Paul Archibeque! As a most lucky student to have you as a teacher, I salute to you sir! Peace, I’m out of here, and congratulations Kingzing City High School! You’ve taught some pretty amazing students!” Kyle stepped down from the podium, taking his diploma from the school district.












Axyl started laughing about Kyle’s final words. For some reason he found them funny and he could help but say in his head, Ha! Gayyy!

Holly was still holding Axyl’s hand when he thought of that. She turned and looked at him (taking notice that she can still read his thoughts) smiling sweetly as she squeezed Axyl’s hand as hard as she possibly could. Axyl could feel the power of the Serum crushing his hand and it hurt like hell. “Ow, ow! OW! OKAY! I’m sorry!”

Holly smiled, letting go of his hand. “Good boy.”

Kyle had sat back down at his seat, giving a kiss on Velouria’s cheek, and it was time for Axyl to stand on the podium. Axyl’s heart rate began to

Class of 2005


increase, especially when the student body announced his full name and requested him to stand. “Will Axyla Matthew Smithy please come to the podium?”

Kyle spat laughter, as the audience clapped for Axyl. “Oh my God! I didn’t know that was your full name! Axyla?! BAH!”

Axyl stuck his tongue at him, as he proceeded to the podium, and his hands were shaking and eventually beginning to sweat. Once he had seen the entire audience, directly in front of him, Axyl was really wishing he had written a speech. Some people in the audience were chanting “Blue Lazer, Blue Lazer, and Blue Lazer” over and over. For another minute of constant chanting and no words from Axyl, the ridiculously nervous young man finally spoke. Before he did, he had remembered of Kyle’s advice about improvisation. Time to put that to the test.

“Uh, yes! Oh, yes! Yes, yes, yes!” Axyl stopped, wearing a ridiculous smile on his face. “YES! Yes, we are… here!”

The audience roared with cheers and thunderous clapping. Axyl reacted, raising an eyebrow, realizing how easy it was to contain the audience. “U-uh, hmm, well hi!”

“Hi,” said the entire audience.

Axyl wanted to wipe the sweat off his forehead with his brown graduation outfit. He looked down at his feet and took a deep breath. Axyl immediately began thinking about what all has happened over the course of three month, then rose his head back up. “Hi, everyone, my name is Axyl. Most people just call me Axyl, most people call me Blue Lazer--.”

“YEAH BLUE LAZER!!” the audience roared, scaring the hell out of the school district members. “SAY SOMETHING AWESOME; SOMETHING THAT WILL SEND CHILLS DOWN OUR SPINES!”

“Okay, okay!” Axyl shouted nervously. The audience calmed down at last. “Hah, yep! I’m Blue Lazer. So much for keeping that a secret, right? Anyway, most of you people might also know that I’m one of the most ‘popular’ teens in Kingzing City High School’s history―” Holly rolled her eyes, crossing her arms, though was completely thrown off guard when “―and the most sadistic jerk in the history of the universe.


Chapter 28


Before Blue Lazer, I was picking on innocent kids who were smarter than me, who were better than me, and were actually much cooler than me. I think about this now and I regret every single taunt, every punch, and every harassment; everything that I have done to most people, which was completely unnecessary. After becoming Blue Lazer, I was too naïve to believe that life as a superhero would be fun and adventurous, just like in the comic books. I realized that life is not all about fun and games, like the moment when I first got shot in the chest, the moment I lost one of my best friends, and especially the moment when I was getting the tar beaten out of me by a hundred-foot tall monster from outer space.”

The entire audience was immediately confused, once Axyl mentioned him fighting the Neeka. He sighed. “You know that big, dead, purple-ish monster the military found near the Dansko Bridge?”

“Yes,” the audience replied.

Axyl nodded. “Yeah, that was me, I killed that thing. No big deal, or anything! Anyway, this is completely irrelevant to what I have to say here. If it weren’t for being Blue Lazer, after getting know people who have actually despised me in the past, after saving many lives from terrifying fates, I would never had noticed how much of pompous turd I was. My dad, Jared Smithy, also helped me realize that. My dad has done nothing but stand by and made sure I learned the basics about life and what will be thrown at you, once you enter the real world. Being a wealthy father, who had enough money to pay for my car, my phone bills, and my education, he made me get a job. At first, I whined like a little kid, but then I started getting paid. After a few months of working there, I’ve realized that doing hard labor and helping others actually felt good. Once Blue Lazer came into view, I realized, ‘Hey, I’m helping others, right now, regardless if I’m working or not,’ and it felt really good. Then I thought, ‘Why live a life, where everyone hates you and despises your well-being because you’re such an ass to them?’ Having my eyes completely open now, I’m really thankful that I turned out this way, the way that I am now. What’s more is that I gained new friends, friends who also respect me, and I can’t be more thankful than that. I truly mean that.” Axyl could feel himself tearing up a little, but fought it back by giving a normal smile, rather than just a goofy grin, towards the audience.

Class of 2005


“Whether I have super powers or not, I’m happy where I am, no matter what. Along with my friends, I would also like to thank my dad for pushing me up to where I need to be. I want to thank my teachers, who all put up with my constant annoyance, and everyone else especially. You are all awesome, thank you. I would also like to give my condolences, again, to Cale Omnous’ family. Cale was a good friend and he will be missed, dearly. Oh, and another thing, I would also like to thank someone who means a lot to me (You know who you are.) I know, it sounds very corny, coming out of my big mouth, but this special person has had my stupid, tiny heart, ever since I first looked into her eyes instead of her chest. If anyone should be super, it should be her. Always. She’s also the most beautiful thing I’ve laid undeserving eyes on. She’s smart, wonderful, charming, a bit crazy (but she has her reasons), she’s independent, and she smells amazing. And finally, this goes out to the rest of you buddy-boys and buddy-girls, those who are graduating that is: Don’t be a cocky, little monkey. It will never get you far, nor will it get you away from trouble. Keep on the sexy, 2005!”

Axyl stepped down and when he first touched his diploma, he almost hyperventilated before he could get back to his seat. The audience continued to cheer, as Holly and the others stared at him. They were so impressed with Axyl’s speech, they almost couldn’t believe it.

“Now that’s what I call improv,” Kyle said, laughing, giving Axyl a majorly awesome high-five.

Axyl smiled, laughing along with Kyle. Holly’s thoughts have gone blank. She couldn’t get what Axyl had said out of her head. It wasn’t her fault, although she’d always wanted the man of her dreams to say something as sweet, and weird, like that towards her. Once the student body called “Holly Astrid Ransfield,” Holly calmly rose from her chair and proceeded to the podium, without saying a word. The audience’s cheers, chants, and claps had finally ceased, once she faced everyone. From Axyl’s ridiculously sweet speech, Holly was almost unable to give hers. She took a deep breath and spoke. “Living in a world of hate, utter stupidity, crime, and anything else negative that I can think of, I was almost too convinced that the world was literally too crappy for me to live on. Wrist cutting, self-hatred, constant


Chapter 28


screaming only made it worse and there was literally nothing I could do about it. At first glance, I figured a permanent departure would change nothing, until I found myself as to what I’m really made for. We, including myself, are much stronger than that one terrible day, week, or maybe even year. We are stronger than what tries to hold us down and expects us to suffer for something not worth suffering for. We are stronger than the ones who deliberately abandoned us, we are stronger than the ones who’ve tried to hurt us, and WE are stronger than anyone else who dares to bring the darkness with them. We will make mistakes, we will question our wrongs, we will lose balance every once in a while, but removing yourself from the rest of world will only make things worse. Removing yourself will only remove the chances of anything ever improving. Your existence is not worthless; there is no such thing as an unwanted soul.”













There were some small whoops and cheers coming from the audience, though the rest gave Holly the silence she deserved, for this particular moment. Axyl and other two were getting chills up their spines. They have never heard anything like this coming out of Holly, the prettiest girl in school. Holly started to tear up. As soft, miniature droplets of eye fluids started to roll down her cheeks, she continued. “I have no parents to thank tonight, but I know plenty people of which who I can look to and be happy with. Class of 2005, you are strong. We’re headed down a path that’s going to challenge us, but nothing is going to alter what we are going to accomplish.

Class of 2005


My name is Holly Ransfield, I am honored to be up here on this stage, and I am more than honored to be a part of an amazing class. Good luck to you all, and congratulations.”

Everyone in the entire stadium of MSU cheered as loud as they possibly could, all looking down at Holly. She smiled, once she received her diploma, with a couple tears rolling down her cheeks. Axyl, Velouria, and Kyle got up from their seats and pulled her in for a group hug.

“You’re the badass of badasses!” Kyle shouted happily, amongst the constant cheering.

“You’re a role model for us all!” Velouria shouted.

Axyl was really hesitant to say anything, however. “Uh, you’re very pretty!”

Holly laughed, thanking Axyl by kissing him on the cheek.

The graduation ceremony was nothing but smooth sailing for the next two hours. It was more like “two hours of constant anxiety” for Axyl, especially. He was so excited to toss his graduation cap into the air and not have to worry about school, ever again. College seemed to be the last on his mind. The moment when everyone had thrown their hats into the air, Axyl had never realized that his cap struck another student in the face, for he didn’t even bother going after it. He picked up someone else’s and wore that, instead.


Immediately after the ceremony, the graduation gradually turned into an autograph intervention. Kids and adults were going nuts for a picture with Axyl and Holly. People scrambled for Kyle and Velouria to at least say “Hi” to them (Kyle recalled that he had never said “Hi” so many times in his life.).

Axyl noticed his good friend, Hayson Prent, walking by and hugging his parents. Hayson noticed Axyl and the two of them proceeded to approach one another and shake hands. “How’s it hangin,’ Axyla?” Hayson laughed once he said Axyl’s real name. “Damn, dude, that’s a funny name”

“Sometimes I wonder if it’s even real at all,” Axyl replied. The two of them laughed. “But you can blame my drunkard of a mother for naming me that.”

“It’s just so white!” Hayson laughed and so did Axyl.

Chapter 28


“So, what are you doing in the future, Prent?” Axyl asked.

“Serving my country, that’s what I’m doin,’ dawg,” Hayson replied with a smirk, lifting his chin up. “Wuda ‘bout you? Still be Blue Lazer?”














Axyl shrugged. “I don’t think so. I kind of lost my awesome powers.”

Hayson reacted in a confused manner. “How?!”

Sighing, “It’s a long story.”

“Oh no, you miss your powers?” Holly asked, taking Axyl by the hand, who had snuck up behind him. “I can change that.”

Axyl’s eyes widened, as Hayson remained in a state of confusion. Axyl had completely forgotten about how exactly Holly obtained her special abilities and she still had the Misara Serum in her system. Having deep, physical actions with Holly was the key in getting his powers back, and Holly was opening the gates. “Gee, you think so?” Axyl’s flirtatious tone of voice confused Hayson even more. For a school jock who had been with countless girls, young and old, it seemed surprising that Hayson was not catching onto what Axyl and Holly were hinting at.

“Graduation party,” Holly replied with a wink, then was abruptly brought to the attention of a little girl. The little girl had been tugging on Holly’s gown, impatiently saying “Holly” over and over. “Oh, hey there!”



Class of 2005


The little girl appeared to be an innocent, sweet ten year-old, who had been losing her baby teeth. She was absolutely adorable. “I heard you can make flowers.”

Holly knelt down to the little girl. “Why, yes I can. What’s your name?”

“Rylee. Sometimes I like to pretend I’m a dog.”

Holly laughed. “Do you like dogs and flowers?”

Rylee nodded happily. “Ruff, ruff!”

“What flower would you like?” Holly asked sweetly, adoring Rylee’s amazing dog impression.

“Petunias!”

Holly smiled opened her mouth slightly. A fresh, purple petunia flower floated gently from her lips, as Rylee’s eyes widened. Holly plucked the flower from her tongue and gave it to Rylee, who barked happily. “Yeah?”

“Ruff!” Rylee bared and took the flower. “Thank you! I have to go find my parents, now.”

Rylee left Holly, barking at the top of her little lungs. Holly stood up and faced Axyl and Hayson, before she was requested by more children who wanted a flower from her. “Oh jeez, Axyl, I’m going to be a little busy.”

“And so will I, tonight,” Axyl responded, winking at her.

Hayson had finally caught on. “Oh, snap! Dynamite!”

Holly only gave the two a slight chuckle. “So, Axyl, I have a gig, tonight at the Cray-Z Babün Café. Kyle and Velouria are coming! Want to tag along?”

“Um, is that a question?” Axyl questioned. “Hell yeah! Can Hayson?”

“I’ll understand if you still hate me,” Hayson replied, laughing a bit.

Holly spat. “Sure! I’m over it. It’s a public event, so go right on ahead. I gave my only free tickets to Kyle, Velouria, and nooowww… Axyl and Hayson!” Holly rummaged through the pockets of her pants, under her gown and handed Axyl and Hayson her last, free concert tickets.

“YES! All access, baby! And what I mean by ‘all,’ I mean ‘ALL!’”

“Settle down spaz,” Holly said with a smile. “Concert starts at ten.”

“See ya,” Axyl said with a smile. Axyl and Hayson left Holly, proceeding to venture throughout the stadium. Axyl was often stopped by Blue Lazer fans, asking for autographs and pictures.

Chapter 28


Jared Smithy had found his son signing a few shirts for a group of local school dancers, and gave him a huge hug. “Oh, son! OH! My boy! You’re officially smart enough for society! Actually, I lied, you still got a lot to learn, buddy-boy.”

“Looking forward to it.”

Jared smiled at Axyl, shaking his hand. “Son, you make me a very proud father. A very proud one, indeed. Now, if your mother was here―”

“She would be passed out drunk?!” Axyl shouted, laughing hysterically. Jared began laughing and so did Hayson.

“Aiiieee, snap!” shouted Hayson giving Axyl a high-five.

Suddenly, they all heard a woman shrieking as if she was getting bludgeoned to death. Many people turned their attention to the direction of the sudden screaming, only to see Preox, Kriket, and Rig walking on the fake grass of the MSU football stadium. The woman, followed by many other fanatics, were shrieking by the sight of the three aliens. Girls swooned over Preox and Rig, taking their alien and heroic stature to be the most attractive features they’ve ever seen.

Kriket held onto Preox’s arm, giving the women death glares, allowing them to crawl all over Rig instead. Rig was having a blast. “WOW! I want to stay on this planet forever! Boobs! Boobs everywhere!”

“Hello, courageous idiot,” Preox said, giving Axyl a faint smile.

“Preox, what’re you doing here?”

Preox quickly shoved a fan girl off his arm, as Kriket threatened to start throwing punches. “I’ve come to tell you some better news. And to congratulate you in your final chapter of basic education, of course.”

Axyl shook his hand, which Preox found definitely odd and unfamiliar. “Thanks, bud. That means a lot, it actually really does. Anyway, you want to stick around with Holly, Kyle, Vel, and I? Holly’s performing tonight. What about you, dad?

“I’m goin,’” Hayson added.

“I’ll go,” Jared shrugged, “I don’t start up work again, until Monday. Plus, I’ve been staying inside the rental house for too long. It’s about time I get partyin’.

“We’ll pass,” Preox said, Kriket agreeing, “I also speak for Rig, since

Class of 2005














he practically doesn’t know how to.”

“Aw, come on, man! We need more variety!” Axyl begged.

“I hope you don’t mean that in a racial manner.”

“Eh, kinda.”

“I guess no offense is taken, then. Anyway, as far as you know, Kriket, Rig, and I have been restoring your city, and I am relieved to say that everything is back in order. No more Adoa, no more foreign technology by your human standards (I double checked on that. I will not allow curious humans using the technology for any use of weaponry. Trust me, Rig and I got a ‘wonderful’ impression of your race, when we first ended up here. I made sure everything from the Adoa was rid of.) So, you guys should be good for primary reconstruction for the next couple years. Oh, and the city is no longer named Kingzing.”

“Really?” Axyl was surprised. He was kind of hoping that the state government had renamed the city to “Axyl City.”

“It’s rather corny,” Preox replied, “you’ll have to find that out for yourself. In the meantime, while your city is under reconstruction, Kriket, Rig, and I will be leaving your planet on our own.”

Axyl blinked. “What?””

“I know. However, when the city was under martial law, we discovered that Zjok’s Elephant was still operable. We’ve been working on its functions and we should be on our way home, within the end of this Earth year.”

Chapter 28


“Well, dude! We gotta at least chill, before you leave!”

“No time,” Kriket informed, “we need to fix the Elephant as fast as possible, so we can tell everyone other Asid what had happened.”

“The rest of the Adoa will not be happy about this, one bit,” Preox said. “Between the Asids and the Adoa, we’re supposed to be under a Peace Treaty. We need to settle things out and, hopefully, turns out smoothly. Axyl, this may be the last time we see you, because we’ll not going to be coming back.”

“We goes to our planet now?” Rig said, sniffling. “I-I… love you, Axyl.”

Axyl laughed and he couldn’t believe Preox, Kriket, and Rig were actually leaving. It felt like he should have spent more time with them; especially since they were a group of intriguing aliens from outer space. “Jeez, I wish you could have told me and the others of this, earlier.”

“We’re going to tell the others, also,” Kriket said with the smile, “so it’s not all over, just yet.”

“YES! PREOX, BUY ME A MILKSHAKE!” Rig shouted, scaring the crap out of a few people. “I WANT IT TO BE THE BIGGEST MILKSHAKE, IN THE HISTORY OF SHAKES! OH MY GAWL, LET’S PUT PRETZELS IN IT! MMMEEERRRRRAAAAAGGGGHHHH!!! CORN STARCH!!! LOTS OF CORN STARCH!” Rig had evaporated into his thick, cloud-like form and started shooting lighting into the air in excitement. The lightning looked beautiful in the night sky and everyone surely had lots of fun watching the amazing lightning show.

Preox focused his attention on Axyl, completely ignoring Rig’s little episode. “Axyl, it’s been a wonderful pleasure working with you. I know we didn’t get to know each other as much as I had hoped, even though you do seem to be a great guy –aside from the fact that you’re annoying, as hell― and I wish you luck in the long run. I also wish you luck with Holly! She’s a feisty one.”

Axyl laughed, admitting to what Preox had said about his girlfriend. Preox stood at least two feet over his height’ Preox looked down at him, smiling faintly and he gave a soft chuckle. “Couldn’t have said it any better than that, Preox-My-Man! Come here.”

Class of 2005


Axyl walked up to Preox, his arms spread out. Preox took a few steps back, confused. “What’re you doing?”

“It’s a bro hug, man,” Axyl responded, hugging the seven-foot tall alien. “You’re my bro.” Preox just stood there, not wrapping his arms around Axyl. Kriket started laughing, amongst the completely awkward event.

“I appreciate the compliment,” Preox said, “but this couldn’t be any more awkward than it needs to be.”

Axyl let go of him. “Yeah, you’re right. It’s your height.”

“It’s your height, you ass!”

The two of them laughed, along with everyone else. Rig was attempting to laugh harder than everyone else, because he liked to be loud. He always did.


Saying goodbye to Preox, Kriket, Rig was more difficult than Axyl had thought. Despite the fact that he had only known the three for only a short period of time, he was really going to miss his amazing partners of combat. The same, emotional status occurred for Holly, Kyle, Velouria, and even the others who had met the three most astounding soldiers.

Preox was thankful for human resources, by the time they left, because the Elephant required lots of orange juice (for fuel) and the humans had plenty of it! Rig was also thankful for not just for the fuel, but that the orange juice was mighty delicious (“This tastes better than that Misara Serum crap!! HEHEHE!”). Kriket was thankful for being a part of Preox’s life, and she didn’t care so much for the orange juice. Kriket decided to stick by Preox’s side forever; taking care of him, making him smile, and making sure he wouldn’t beat Rig for his idiot personality. Once the Elephant took off in 2006, the two Asids and Aziquet were gone for good, only to leave their astounding moments on planet Earth as a nostalgic, wonderful gift for everyone to remember and tell through story.









Chapter 29: New Adventures Await











Not all the fun was over, once the KHS class of 2005 graduated with great excitement, rejoice, and bitter-sweet emotion! On another note, there was a concert to attend to! The Nasty Pen had finally gotten back together, fully ready for some ultimate rock, all after that has happened in the past month. Unfortunately, The Nasty Pen was unable to perform in the Funky Munkey Café, which was currently nothing but a pile of rubble. However, the Cray-Z Babün was just as promising.

Axyl and the others arrived at the café at the same time as The Nasty Pen did, giving them enough time to get ready before the big show. Axyl strolled along with Hayson Prent, Kyle Manning, Velouria Lancelot, his father, and they were all completely excited and ready for another fun-filled adventure.

“I think she and the band are already in there,” Axyl said, reaching for the front door. Before entering the seemingly empty building, a middle-aged man had approached the group riding a skateboard. He stopped, looked directly at Axyl, and mooed at him. “Couch Jim? What’re you doing here?!”

Chapter 29



“Nasty Pen, duh!” Couch Jim replied, taking off his skateboarding helmet and knee pads. He stuffed his safety gear in his backpack and followed the others inside, as followed by a re-acquaintance of Bobcat, who had just arrived as well.

“You and Axl know each other?” Kyle asked, concerned. “And did you just moo at him?”

“Moo!” Couch Jim replied, giving a soft laugh. The Cray-Z Babün was completely empty, excluding the employees. There were posters, antiques, retro technologies, movie DVDs, and dimmed colorful lights throughout the entire café. Also similar to that of the Funky Munkey Café, the Cray-Z Babün really lived up to its predecessor’s potential. They all went beyond the beverage area and gift shop, through a doorway which was replaced with red curtains.

“This place is dope!” Hayson hollered, excitingly, as he gazed at several band posters hung along the wall. “Why haven’t I discovered this kind of place, before?”

“Cale and I used to go to Funky Munkey all the time, during school,” Axyl replied, as they went through the thin red curtains.

“I was high the entire time I was at school,” Hayson replied, “I don’t even remember being a part of it. Damn, I’m going to miss Cale. He was an idiot, but he sure knew how to smoke it up.”

The concert venue larger than the Funky Munkey’s, which was really impressive for Marsing (Being a much smaller city and far less popular than Kingzing City.) Couch Jim and the ridiculously tall stature of Bobcat had found a couch and decided to sit and wait for the concert to start.

“It’s funny,” Bobcat stated, looking at his surroundings, “I was taken hostage by a group of aliens in an interior as similar as this.”

“You were taken hostage?” Couch Jim gasped in surprise.

Bobcat laughed, as if he wasn’t bothered by the traumatic experience at all. “Yeah! The real action happened when this guy came through the window, riding a moose wearing a fine tuxedo. I tried so hard not to laugh; especially when there an alien gun pointed directly to my head.” Bobcat laughed harder as he pointed at Kyle and thanked him for saving his life.

New Adventures Await


Kyle shrugged, as Velouria laughed along with Bobcat and Couch Jim. “Well, it was either death or riding a talking moose! What can I say?”

“OH!” Bobcat exclaimed, laughing his ass off. “The moose talked, too! He sounded like he was inhaling helium on a regular basis! It was so priceless!”

After a long moment of constant laughter, Jared couldn’t help but question, “Have we always had places, like this?” Jared asked, who took appreciation in the one-of-a-kind interior of the café. He was quite impressed with the place and his love for coffee had increased.

“In Kingzing we did,” Axyl replied. “I wonder if they have banana-caramel cappuccinos, here.”

Jared was slightly disgusted. “Ew, what?”

“It’s a lot better than it sounds.”

Holly slowly poked her head out of the doorway, leading to the break room, and summoned Axyl without causing so much commotion. “Psst! Ugly, get over here.”

Axyl immediately responded to Holly’s request and went into the back room. It was small, much like a house, and toasty. There was a massive couch towards the end of the room, surrounded with more posters on the wall; some Chinese lanterns hung on the ceiling, several vinyl records scattered across the floor, and The Nasty Pen’s band equipment was being hauled inside the room from the other door that led to the backside of the café.

Cody Gadomski (the lead guitar) had brought his equipment in, and was also helping Zamie Green bring in her drums. After helping her, Cody walked up to Axyl and gave him a big, gentle hug. “Mmm, I’ve been needing a hug. Come here, Holly, I need one from you, too.”

Holly smiled, giving Cody a gentle hug. “Anyway, Axyl, I just wanted to say thank you,” Holly said, facing Axyl.

“For?” Axyl took off his jacket and tossed it on the couch.

“What you said about me at graduation speech, Dumbo.”

Axyl decided to play his smart-ass card. “Oh, I wasn’t talking about you.” Holly laughed and slightly punched him, which was strong enough to slightly hurt.

“Okay, I know you have super powers but take that fist lightly, okay?”

Chapter 29

The two of them looked at each other, immediately shouting “That’s what she said!” at the same time. They laughed atrociously.

“Axyl.”

“Yes?”

“I also want to thank you for showing me that not all guys are complete sausage heads.”

Axyl blushed slightly, as Holly kissed him on the cheek and took his baseball so she can wear it herself. “Holly, what’re you doing? That’s mine.”

“I’m gonna wear it during the concert!”

“Ha! Oh yeah? I mean, why’re you acting so nice, all of the sudden? I feel like you’re gonna hurt me or call me names, sooner or later.”

“Oh, I’m gonna hurt you, alright,” Holly replied, with a wink. “Okay, Bozo, go away! We’re going to start sound-check in five.”

Axyl obeyed his woman and proceeded to leave the back room. Axyl was immediately welcomed by a massive crowd of people, who had shown up for the concert. The Nasty Pen was completely sold out within minutes.














“So,” Hayson said to his buddy, “you hittin’ it up with a super-powered rock star who used to hate chu?” The jock raised his eyebrows, as he suspected promiscuous activity from Axyl and Holly.

Axyl nodded, with a slight chuckle. “I think she still hates me, slightly, but everything else is for sure.”

New Adventures Await


“I used to hate him, too!” Kyle shouted, who was standing with Velouria, from the very front of the stage. Everyone was having a great time and many of The Nasty Pen’s fans were more excited than ever (Not only was Holly Ransfield an exceptional rock star, but she was also an outrageous super heroin. In conclusion, this show was going to be what most teenagers would call “epic!”) After a few sound checks, the band was ready to rock and roll.

“Hello, Marsing City!” Holly shouted into the mic, as their audience went absolutely crazy. She was wearing Axyl ’s hat, which really did not match the rest of her outfit, but she didn’t care. “The band would like to thank you for making it tonight, as we not only pleasure your ear holes, but to pay a tribute to a dear friend of ours. He was a part of this band and we lost him last month. Greggory Stanley, this new song is for you.”

The band began to jam out and Axyl was able to enjoy it more thoroughly, rather than feel nervous about his surroundings like he did the last time he saw Holly perform. He felt like he was with a family now and it was perfect. As for Jared, being a father who didn’t go out and socialize very often, he seemed to fit in well. He really enjoyed Holly’s singing voice, along with Charles Thompson’s supporting vocals and frequent shouting. The rock music was loud, persistent with passion, and awesome. Even a few hardcore Nasty Pen fans fainted when Holly’s beauty shined in the stage lights. Her eyes had turned into sunlight, as flowers slowly grew along her guitar. Everyone found it a bit emotional to see that there was no electric piano on stage, which would have been used by the undercover identity of Agent Nathan12.


“So now what?” Kyle asked. He, Velouria, Holly, Axyl, and Jared were all in the back room, together. The concert had ended about an hour ago and the small group ended up listening to random records. After a record had finished spinning, Holly replied, “I’m really not sure, actually. I mean, we just graduated, so I guess we could have a vacation or something.”

Axyl’s ears perked up. “Camping?! Just the four of us?”

“Oh, is Dad too amazing for you to bring along?” Jared sarcastically remarked with a slight chuckle.

Chapter 29


“You graduated a hundred years ago, Dad.”

“Don’t worry, Mr. Smithy, I’ll look after your son,” Holly said, patting Axyl on the back.

Jared snorted. “Be sure you have a leash.”

“I’ll get him a muzzle, too.”

Everyone laughed, except for Axyl, who obnoxiously took his hat from her. “This is mine!”

Holly pulled him close, tightening her arms around him and little flowers grew along them. “Aw, don’t be such a butthole.”

“Well you are what you eat, Holly,” Kyle said. Holly snorted, followed by a crazy roar of laughter. Jared and Velouria caught on, their laughter lasting for minutes.

Axyl laughed, also. “That was a really good one. Nice, Kyle.”

“Ha, thanks!”

Jared laughed at his son, “Well, I best be on my way home, I’m beat. Hey Holly, nice show tonight. That performance you made me realize how much of a gem you are; especially for Axyl who remains a small shard of coal.”

“Hey!”

“Thanks, Mr. Smithy that means a lot. I put a lot of work into what I do.”

“Thank nothing of it. Oh, and you can call me Jared. Calling me ‘Mr. Smithy’ just makes me feel old.”

“Well you are” Axyl said softly.

“Hey, watch it, bud. Don’t be such a li’l’ monkey. I’ll see you at the rental home.”

“See ya, Dad.”

“Good to meet you all,” Jared said with a smile. “I wished we all could have met on softer terms, rather than the middle of a crazy alien war-conflict. It’s been a crazy month for all of us, but like Holly said, we’re all strong. I’ll be seeing you around.” Everyone waved goodbye to Axyl’s dad, as he left the backroom, and shut the door quietly. The rest of The Nasty Pen have all gone home, taking their band equipment with them. It was now just Axyl, Holly, Kyle, and Velouria, all sitting in an empty coffee shop.

New Adventures Await


“I wouldn’t mind camping,” Velouria said, “I haven’t been for a long time.”

“I was gonna say the Stupendous National Forest,” Axyl pointed out, once Holly sat on the couch and allowed her legs to rest on his lap. He really liked that.

“Yeah but it’s kinda half-destroyed, right now,” Kyle said.

“Exactly.”















The Dinosaur Jr record had stopped playing its tracks and Kyle took the record off the player. “Nice collection they got back here,” Kyle said, standing up with Velouria, taking her hand. “I think Vel and I are about done, for tonight.”

Holly and Axyl laughed. “Riiiggghtt! Sure you are!”

Velouria began to blush, as did Kyle. They were just too cute, together. “Y-yeah, well…ye-yeah whatever! You two behave! You guys available tomorrow?”

“I got work,” Axyl said with a shrug, “Cheese and Crackers transferred me to the other one, here in Marsing. Kinda sucks, but whatever!”

“I got rehearsal,” Holly said. “We’re working on a new album.”

“Oh? What’s it called?” Everyone was really interested in Holly’s music, so who was not to be interested in a new album by The Nasty Pen?

Chapter 29


“I named it based on what we’ve all went through these past few months. You know, the drama, how all four of us came together, the ill warfare, the aliens, the super powers, everything. It’s gonna be called Infinite Valor. It’s what I’ve thought of so far, anyway.”

“I like it,” Axyl nodded in approval. Holly snatched his hat back and put it on her head.

“Thanks, dummy, you’re so nice.”

“I’ll listen to it, fo’ sho’!” Kyle said happily. “You got some exquisite talent, Ransfield! Use it to your advantage.”

“Thanks, BFF,” Holly said with a smile, getting up from the couch and giving him a big hug.

“Yeah, I need to get a job, too,” Kyle smiled.

“Same here,” Velouria said. “Well, let’s get going, sweetie.”

“’I just can’t wait to get into your pants,’” Axyl laughed, imitating Velouria’s voice, as the two of them walked out of the café. Holly snorted, shutting the back room door behind them. Holly took off her massive stage boots, and put on a new record, before laying back down on the couch with Axyl.

“Who are these guys?” Axyl asked, as new music brought the room back to life from the silence. He nodded his head repeatedly, taking interest in the sound.

“Sonic Youth,” Holly answered. “The song is called ‘Sugar Kane.’ I need to introduce you to more bands.”

“I like this song. What other bands are on your mind?” Holly sat up and kissed Axyl on the lips. Her soft lips were sugary, tasteful, and addicting. Axyl didn’t expect Holly to even hold his hand on this night, but he realized that he should actually expect a little more.

“Well,” Holly said, kissing Axyl’s lips, “if you’re looking for music, other than local, I guess you could check out A Place to Bury Strangers. If you’re in a tasteful mood for great rock and metal, there’s Pixies, Alice in Chains, and Beat Happening.”

Axyl continued to kiss her. “I will definitely look into those bands. And I will listen to them as much as you do, because you’re pretty cool and stuff. Oh yes.”

New Adventures Await


“The bands are amazing,” Holly said, taking off her shirt. She took it off faster than Axyl could say “buddy-boy.”

The Sonic Youth record continued to the next song on the album, which was more uplifting than the last. “Wow, what’s this song?”

“’Youth against Fascism,” Holly said quickly, for all she wanted to do was just touch and kiss the person she used to hate.

“I like this song t―”

“Shut up, or you’re not getting your super powers back.”

Watermelon Seed Paradise








Kyle’s neighborhood, Watermelon Seed Paradise, was on the border between the Stupendous National Forest and Kingzing City. A neighborhood of which was particularly a part of the Neeka’s messy destruction, one month before. The neighborhood itself was partly, critically damaged from the Neeka’s crazy rampage, but not enough for the entire neighborhood to be under strict security. No one was allowed to enter Kingzing City, until the city itself was in decent condition, but that didn’t stop Kyle and Velouria from wanting to gaze at the skyline of the city, from Kyle’s rooftop. However, Kyle was the only one expecting to be star gazing with Velouria tonight, but Velouria had something else in mind.

“Kyle, let’s make love tonight,” was all she said; just five words to make Kyle almost swerve into someone else’s home. He slammed on the brakes of his 1993 Buick Century, nearly hyperventilating.

Chapter 29


He ended pulling to the side of the road, breathing heavily. Velouria giggled, completely out of fear from the fact that Kyle almost crashed. “I’m sorry, Velly-poo, what was that? The radio was too loud.”

“The radio isn’t on, sweetie,” Velouria replied, with a smile.

“Oh, yeah, it’s still broken. I need to fix that.”

“Kyle, it’s okay if you don’t want―”

“NO! Uh, erp, I just—I’m sorry, what?”

Velouria took off her seatbelt and leaned close to Kyle, kissing his cheek. “Kyle, I really, really think you’re great. I know it’s only been three months since we first started, but I really do want you. I need you, Kyle.”

Kyle gulped. “S-so, I’d be allowed to see your cleavage?”

Velouria laughed. “Of course, silly! And more, much more.”

Kyle inhaled and exhaled as carefully as he could; he could not believe this was actually happening to him. “My parents are home.”

“Mine aren’t.”

“Your house is damaged, Vel!”

“It was just a hole in the roof! It’s fixed! The house is empty, Kyle. But, are you ready? I really care about you, sweetie. If you still wanna wait, I understand.”

“No, I’m ready,” Kyle said, looking at her in the eyes. “You’re probably the only girl who finds me interesting (Other than Holly, but she’s my friend, and my mother), and you’re the only girl who laughs at the dumbest jokes I ever say. I mean, I know I kind of ‘stole’ you from Cale, but―”

“I (you) needed to be stolen,” they both said together, before kissing immensely, like a couple of animals. They stopped kissing and Kyle proceeded to drive to Velouria’s house.

“I like this night, Velouria. I like it a lot.”


Three Years and Five Months later - Nov. 2008


Over the past years, since the vicious war conflict between the forces of planet Earth and Zjok’s branch of the Adoa, Moosey became the new Head Commander of the A72A. He had exceeded Derno’s status.

New Adventures Await


In their memory, Moosey’s first order of business was to build a memorial statue of Agent Nathan12 and Commander Derno, right before someone were to actually enter the (now TWO) A72A vicinities. On another note, Moosey was able to build the second A72A base near Longview, Washington. Commander Moosey also hired Mr. Flower as an Agent, who was more than interested in doing so. As of now, Mr. Flower has become formally known as Agent Flower14. Mr. Flower now has a wife, Mrs. Rosa Thorn-Flower (who is a red rose) and three baby daisies. Ever since the conflict, Moosey and Mr. Flower had become best of friends, similar to the friendship Moosey had with Nathan.

Preox, at first glance, was infuriated that Moosey wanted to continue the A72A’s legacy, since the agency captured and held him and Rig as prisoners, months prior. Moosey promised to never go after the Asids, or Aziquets, ever again. Preox, who didn’t give a damn about the rest of Moosey’s career, was okay with his newly sworn oath and allowed Moosey to carry on with his business. Ever since that, the two of them have been on good terms, even when the aliens finally left Earth in 2006.

















Chapter 29


Longview, WA – A72A Base #2: Floor 12

Moosey’s horns had certainly grown, over the past few years. His uniform was perfectly decorated with special badges and emblems. Badges for bravery, persistence, and even keeping a positive and keen attitude! The seven-foot tall moose now sat behind a crescent-shaped desk, which was where he focused on his career the most. There was a giant, framed illustration of him, Commander Derno, Agent Nathan12, and many of his other friends on his back wall. Friends such as Axyl, Preox, Rig, Holly, etc. One object was for certain to piss off Preox, which was taken place in Moosey’s big, nature decorative office: Below the framed illustration was an Adoa Mazer’s rifle. The gun was taken care of, clean, and much larger than the average-sized human rifle. It was a rifle Moosey had stolen, while he was in combat. Moosey had also kept two cartridges of ammo in the bottom right drawer of his desk, in case of a severe emergency. Preox knew none of this, but Moosey knew he would be in trouble if he did.

During a calm, quiet day, Moosey was busy concentrating on special paperwork, and was rudely interrupted by Commander Jon, who was formally known as Agent Jon43. He opened Moosey’s office door, not shutting it, and slammed a stack of files on Moosey’s desk. Completely broken out of his full attention on the paperwork he was working on, Moosey squealed and jolted from his seat. “AH! Don’t do that!”

“I’m sorry, Head Commander, I just really needed to bring you these.”

“What did I say about shutting the door behind you?”

“To not to, right?” Jon replied. He headed for the door and shut it.

“It doesn’t matter. What is it, Commander? I was just finishing the Case of the Yeti.”

“Wow, it’s been three years since you looked into that,” Jon said, stunned. “Did you find him? What’s he like?”

Moosey sighed, feeling disgruntled. “He was just a snowman in someone’s backyard. We haven’t had a real breakthrough since 2005!”

“Wait until you hear this,” Jon said, leaning over Moosey’s desk. “Okay, three groups of A72A Agents, of our own of course, each went on an expedition to investigate the city of Atlantis.”


New Adventures Await


Moosey was immediately interested and leaned closer to the paper work Jon had set on his desk. “Go on, Commander. I’m just gonna look at these.”

“Okay, so the first group was sent in 2006, after gathering all of the information they needed. They ended up in Presung City, Florida. After two more days, the A72A hasn’t heard from the group since. No communications, nothing! The other groups were sent for a search and rescue, plus the continuation of the expedition. In February of this year, a Navy found three crashed yachts on the shores of the Bahamas. Here’s the kicker: By the time the Navy found the yachts, there were no traces of the agents. Not anywhere! The Navy now has the destructed yachts in Washington, D.C., but whenever someone took a picture of the destroyed yachts, he or she would die within the next day.”

Moosey found a few disturbing pictures in the files and almost vomited. “Looks like someone doesn’t want us knowing what is going on. Are these the agents who went missing?”

“Again, there are no current traces of the agents. There are about thirty of them who are missing. Those are photos of those, who tried to develop pictures of the yachts. Whenever a photo was developed, the film would come up as a picture of spattered blood.”

“Oh, good Lord.”

Jon laughed nervously. “Yeah! Morbid, right?! The yachts are being kept underground, under maximum security, in Washington D.C. and not anyone has taken a look at them since. Oh, and get this, the Navy carrier that discovered the yachts, immediately disappeared without a trace, between Florida, the Bahamas, and―”

“San Juan, Puerto Rico,” Moosey finished. “Jon, it’s the…”

“…Bermuda Triangle,” they both said. Chills ran down their spines.

“What do the forensics say about these victims?!”

“Nothing like they’ve ever seen before,” Jon answered. “There have been some, including forensic scientists, who have stared down at these deceased victims and have either become very sick, scared out their minds, or just end up screaming continuously, even when they no longer could; just their eyes and mouths wide open out of fear.”

Chapter 29


Moosey gulped. “We gotta do something about this. Jon, these are the most disturbing images I’ve ever seen. This is a brilliant case and this does not look like your average crime scene!”

“Uh, duh!”
