Moosey threw the yeti documents off his desk and replaced it all with the documents about the Three Yachts. “Get me Agent Flower14, we’re investigating this situation.”

“It’s his day off,” Jon said. “He’s with Rosie, making pollen. At least that’s what he’s told me, anyway.”

Moosey sighed. “Well, get him to my office, once he’s back on Floor 12. We’re going to learn more about these yachts.”

“First, let me go to the bathroom! All this anxiety really makes me need to pee.”

“Yes, yes, hurry back!” Moosey began looking through all of the paper work, and was willing to bring back more than just papers. He spoke to himself, as his heart continued to race with excitement. “Oh jeez. Agent Flower14, you remember our conversation about gross socks and our silly discussion about ‘a Stinky Sock Adventure?’ This may as well be it, except without socks. Oh, man, do I need a candy bar!”



Chapter 30: A Chilling Christmas

















Welcome to Infinite City, population of almost a million! Just sitting on the beautiful waterfront in the state of Oregon, Infinite City never fails to be a part of an awe-inspiring community! Other than the city’s free-spirited people, gorgeous climate, and amazing architecture, newer and familiar residents will soon be apart from what used to be Kingzing!

Infinite City was named, due to the inspiration of heroism partaken against a force that threatened the entire world. However, Axyl Smithy, who was now at the age of twenty-one, didn’t think it was a very good name. “Jeez, why Infinite City? Kingzing was so much better.”

“It was the mayor’s decision,” Holly replied. The two of them were taking an elevator up to Jared Smithy’s apartment. Axyl was holding a small stack of Christmas presents and Holly was holding a plate of apple pie. The two of them have been together for over three years, they were both living in a house of their own, and things couldn’t be any better for them. Holly was still in the roaring position of the leader in the The Nasty Pen, which had increasingly grown in popularity, almost to the point where the band

Chapter 30

was actually recognized from all over the world. Axyl spent his career managing Cheese and Crackers Supermarket and coaching for Infinite High School. His career status was the best he ever had. He was happy and so was Holly.

“I just wish they could have kept it as ‘Kingzing,’” Axyl said.

“Well, I guess life can’t be all that great,” Holly said sarcastically, rolling her eyes. “I hope your dad likes the picture. I’m actually surprised he’s never gotten a copy of Velouria’s illustration, yet.”

“I know! We all have a copy! By the way, do you have any idea when Kyle and Velouria are coming? I still can’t believe he knocked her up!”

Holly shrugged. “Kyle told me that he was staying at MSU for another hour. Apparently he’s being discussed about starring in a movie.”

“No shit?!”

“Yeah shit!”

The elevator stopped at the twenty-third floor, followed by the sound of a dingling bell, and the doors slowly opened. They both made their way to through the hallways, which Axyl could barely even recognize. “Jeez, they really worked on renovating this place, I can barely recognize it. I can’t believe it’s been three years since I was last here living with my dad and all.”

“Well, now you’re a man,” Holly said, with a smile. She knocked on Jared’s door and he had opened it immediately, as if he was waiting for the two of them. The fifty-six year old wore a Santa beard and hat, while also wearing his classic apparel of a button-up flannel and baggy jeans.

“Hey! Merry Christmas, you crazy kids! You can set the presents under the tree, Axyl. Hey Holly, how are you doing?”

The two of them hugged after Holly had set the apple pie on Jared’s kitchen table and after she had taken off her black coat, hanging it on Jared’s coat hanger. “I’m great! Just, you know, touring a lot.”

“She just got back from Nova Scotia,” Axyl said, walking into the kitchen and hanging up his coat, then proceeded to hug his father.

“That’s neat! What about you, buddy-boy?” Jared asked his son, with a smile. “You’re packing up more meat!”

“Well, I gotta be prepared, don’t I?” Axyl replied, flexing his biceps.


A Chilling Christmas


Axyl and Holly proceeded to take a look around Jared’s massive apartment. The interior looked just as familiar as it did before, only with a few less things to show; things of which were Axyl’s, which were now residing in his and Holly’s home. “Jeez, Dad.You’ve really done a number on this place. I remember it always being so messy.”

“And that was all because of you, bucko!”

“I’m sure! I bet you just finished cleaning up the place before we evern got here! Oh hey, by the way, open this present!” Axyl went for a big, rectangular-shaped presend and handed it to Jared. Jared held it, surprised by the present’s heavy weight.

“What the hell is it?”

“You won’t find out until you open it, Pops,” Holly replied, laughing. Jared unwrapped the gift and softly chuckled. It was a framed illustration of him and many other familiar faces; some faces of which he had never seen in over three years. He smiled and looked up at the two of them.













“Merry Christmas, Dad.”

Jared nodded. “Who drew this? This is amazing!”

“I did,” came Velouria’s voice, as she and Kyle made their way through the door, which Jared had forgotten to close. He did, once the couple walked in. The two of them wore their winter clothes and had been carrying presents for others. “I’m surprised you haven’t gotten your copy, up until now of course. Why didn’t you wait for him to open it, before Kyle and I came?!”

Chapter 30


Axyl shrugged, laughing a bit, and went in to hug her and Kyle. Something about Velouria’s appearance was much different than most would expect. Her belly had been sticking out in a sense of enduring pregnancy. Axyl pointed at her belly and solemnly asked, “How’s the uh…?”

“Seven months,” Velouria said, rubbing her tummy, as Kyle put their Christmas presents under Jared’s tall evergreen tree. “Yep, she’s kicking like crazy, nowadays.”

“She’s a crazy bugger!” Kyle shouted, happily.

Holly sat down on Jared’s couch, drinking the cup of coffee she had made from Jared’s coffee maker. “That’s so sweet. We’re so happy for you two. Any ideas for a name, yet?”

“We’re not sure,” Kyle replied, after walking into the kitchen and grabbing a Juicy-Sun pouch. Jared really didn’t mind them making themselves at home; especially since it was Christmas Day. “We were thinking of some names, here and there.”

“How about ‘Ass-Turd,’ like Holly’s middle name?” Axyl suggested.

“It’s Astrid!” Holly said, giving Axyl her famous death glare.

“Nah,” Kyle replied, laughing slightly, “maybe something like Audrey, or―”

“Chrysanthemum?” Jared suggested.

“W-why Chrysanthemum?” Velouria’s eyebrows raised in concern.

“It’s cute,” Jared shrugged. “You know, like the kids’ book?” Everyone looked at him strangely. “Okay, jeez, sorry for trying to help! I’m gonna go get the eggnog. Axyl, see if you can find a Christmas program on TV.”

“I was gonna watch football, Dad,” Axyl said, holding the television remote in his hand. Everyone groaned in disappointment.

“You don’t need football every damn day,” Holly said. “Come on, search through the channels and see if you can find a Christmas program.”

Axyl rose his hands in the air, surrendering to her complete sass. “Okay! Sorry! Excuse me for wanting to express my harmonious happiness and holiday cheer!” Kyle and Velouria laughed, once the two of them sat on Jared’s massive couch with Holly, as Axyl stood in front of the massive television, browsing through an immense amount of cable channels.


A Chilling Christmas















Axyl took a few glances at the city, just outside the sliding glass door, leading towards Jared’s balcony. The view, as usual, was marvelous and Trans Island was seen in a distance. Although the city was granted with constant overcast and gloomy climate, the view could not be obstructed in any way. It was perfect, and this Christmas morning couldn’t get any better.

Kyle eyed on his favorite view, and that was glancing at Velouria’s tummy. He smiled, resting his hand on Velouria’s pregnant belly, feeling a few kicks from the mysterious creature on the other side. “My, my, what a lovely fetus you got in there, Miss Lancelot.”

Velouria giggled, resting her hand on his. “It’s your lovely fetus, too.”

Holly stared at them. “Could you at least say baby?”

“Fetus and baby are the same,” Kyle said, snobbishly.

“I know, but it just sounds weird.”

“Well, if you were pregnant you would understand,” Kyle said.

“Kyle! You’re not pregnant!”

“I’m speaking for Velouria and the baby!”

Velouria continued to giggle, as usual. “Holly, have you thought of having a baby? I mean, Kyle and I sure didn’t before my pregnancy started. I’m just wondering.”

Holly shrugged. “I’m not sure. I’ve thought about it plenty of times.”

Axyl laughed nervously, after receiving a glass of eggnog from Jared.

Chapter 30


“I sure hope you’re not tricking me into something silly, babe.”

“Oh, nothing to worry about, dearie,” Holly replied, giving Velouria a wink. “Not sure, Vel; maybe someday. I still got Nasty Pen to focus on, right now. What’s this about you starring in a movie, Kyle?”

Kyle smiled brightly. “Well, it’s a long story: I met a few people, they took a liking for my acting and I’m going to be a co-star for a romantic comedy.”

“Sweet, brutha!” Axyl shouted, skimming through channels.

“I’ll say, I’m pretty excited!” Kyle giggled, as did Velouria.

Jared took a few steps toward the sliding glass door, gasping. “Wow, it’s snowing. It never snows, here!” The gorgeous sight of gentle snow falling down on the city immediately caught everyone’s attention.

“I don’t think I’ve ever seen snow before,” Axyl said, his mouth gaping. He was actually talking in all seriousness, which appalled Holly.

“The—what?! You’ve never seen snow? Pssh! You’re a big, fat liar.”

Axyl snarled at her, setting the television remote aside. “The closest I’ve seen snow is dandruff!”

“How about we all stop arguing,” Kyle started, “and just be thankful that it’s Christmas and that Santa has the generosity to not give you guys any coal, this year?!” He got up from Jared’s couch and approached the two glass doors of the balcony. “Now, how about we all enjoy a marvelous view of complete splendor?!” Kyle opened the glass windows and (no one could really believe it at first) a great pile of snow slammed onto the porch, scaring the life out of Kyle. The mysterious clutter of snow slowly formed into an evil snowman, with a substantial gaping mouth and branches for arms. He smiled devilishly, as a snow cap and scarf formed upon his ice-cold body. As friendly as it appeared, the snowman’s intent was to kill.

“Nyah haha! It’s time for a bit of a chill!” the evil snowman shouted. Everyone else was screaming in utter horror.

“The hell is that thing?!” Kyle shouted in horror, falling back on the floor, scrambling to get up. The snowman grunted, with sheer evil, pulling out a massive icicle from his gut.



A Chilling Christmas


“Kyle, watch out!” Velouria shouted, getting up from the couch. The snowman attempted to impale Kyle with the icicle, but Kyle rolled to his side on the floor, just barely avoiding instant death.
















“You watch out! You’re the one with the baby!”

“Oooo! I do love it when things get poppin!’” the snowman laughed evilly and started to go after Velouria. The pregnant lady screamed in fear, and Axyl had tackled the snowman before it could get any closer.

“Hey, skippy! Nice for you to drop in!” the snowman laughed, before Axyl beat the snowman’s head into nothing but a pile of slush.

“Ugh, not my living room carpet,” Jared moaned.

“Nevermind that!” Holly said, her forearm turning into a massively deadly tree branch. Another evil snowman had descended onto the porch, laughing manically, as three more climbed their way up Jared’s apartment. Holly sliced up the snowmen before they could wield their icicles. “What the hell is this?!”

“I don’t know! Get rid of them!” Jared shouted angrily. “If you’re gonna have a snow fight, take it outside!” Axyl ran for the kitchen to get his backpac, as more snowmen were making their way up to the apartment.

“Sorry, getting my costume on!” Axyl shouted in the kitchen.


Chapter 30


“Jeez, you packed that thing?!” Holly shouted back, fighting off the snowmen with her branch-sword thing.

“Of course I did!” Axyl shouted back. “Being a superhero is everything!”

Holly rolled her eyes. “Kyle, get Velouria to safety. Jared, if you’re going to just stand there, go drink your eggnog somewhere else! Axyl, you better hurry your ass up; there’s more of these things!”

Axyl started making grunting noises from the kitchen, indicating annoyance towards Holly’s constant nagging. A snowman laughed hysterically as it shot icicle pellets at Holly, from the palm of its wooden hand. “It’s time that I give you one hell of an ice time!”

“Axyl?! Hurry up! These snowmen are really pissing me off; especially with their horrible puns!”

“You got this Holly!” Kyle shouted, taking Velouria into Jared’s bedroom upstairs.

“Errf! These gloves are too tight!” Axyl shouted angrily, but immediately transferred to a happier mood. “I guess I am packing some meat!”

“Or some fat!” a snowman shouted back, smacking Holly with his icicle stake.

“What was that, bitch?!” Blue Lazer had ran out of the kitchen, in a newer outfit, and threw a massive fireball at the snowman that had just insulted him. The snowman exploded into slush. Blue Lazer was wearing his classic mask and cape, including a pair of elastic red gloves. He also wore red hockey pads to go with the occasion of looking bigger and mighty (This was just Blue Lazer’s way of completely showing off his “image.”)

“’Bout time!” Holly said, fighting off the snowman who had been obstructing her with the icicle. She wrapped her thorny vines around the snowman’s neck and ripped his head off, clean. Blue Lazer, having obtaining yet another unique ability, formed another blue fire ball and blasted away the last snowman. The monster exploded into nothing but steam. The entire apartment was a mess of snow, slush, and cold water. Jared’s moans of distress came from the bathroom.

A Chilling Christmas


“I really don’t wanna clean that mess, out there!”

“It’s just water, Dad, you’ll be fine!” Blue Lazer hollered right back, as he and Holly took notice of screaming civilians coming from the outside. They both made it to the balcony, looking down at the streets of Infinite City. Snow had been rapidly falling to the ground, causing more evil snowmen to rise from the ground, thus terrorizing the citizens.

“I don’t think the snow is actually coming from the overcast,” Holly announced.

“Duhhh,” Blue Lazer exclaimed.

“You dummy, you’ve never seen snow!”

“That doesn’t mean I don’t know where it comes from! Jeez! Come on, hop on my back, we’re going down there to have ourselves a snowy time.”

Holly hopped onto Blue Lazer’s back, laughing. “Are you seriously trying out that pun ordeal, right now?”

“It sounded funnier in my head!” Blue Lazer jumped down from the balcony and he landed with a sonic boom, sending snowmen flying through the air and diminishing on impact. Holly hopped off his back, using her solar flares to melt down the snowmen.

“Hey!” a bigger snowman yelled, firing ice pellets at the two heroes. “Freeze!”

“Enough with horrible puns, buddy-boy!” Blue Lazer shouted, blasting the snowman with his elbow laser. After finishing off a substantial amount of snowmen, a few earthquakes had occurred and were immdiately taken notice of. The ferocious, super-powered couple gazed around at their surroudnings, as the small earthquakes continued. The earthquakes seemed to be unnatural and less aggressive than actual earthquakes. It was as though there was something massive headed their way.

“Oh, jeez, what now? We don’t have snow here in Oregon, and we sure as hell don’t have earthquakes!” Holly sighed. A massive, thirty-foot robotic snowman wandered from around the corner, shooting tremendous amounts of snow into the air for the other snowmen to spawn from the ground. A psychotic, crazy man operated this giant and could be seen from atop of the robot itself. The man laughed like crazy, as his army of snowman rose from the ground like relentless zombies.

Chapter 30


“I am my own way, Blue Lazer and Flower Brat! The city is mine for the taking! I am the direction you point, I am the arrow you see, and I am the source! I am THAT WAY!”

That Way rose his hands in the air, with one of them being replaced by a mechanical extension in the form of a red arrow. That Way laughed viciously, firing a small missile from the tip of his mechanical arrow. Blue Lazer and Holly took cover, as the missile impacted the ground. The missile exploded into a tremendous amount of snow, forming a giant snowman with an icicle- weapon in the shape of an ax.

“LOOKS LIKE YOU AX’ED FOR IT!” the giant snowman roared confidently.

Before the giant snowman could swing his giant ax, a geyser of hot nacho cheese erupted, from the sewer under the monster itself. The cheese was hot enough for the giant to scream in pain and melt into the concrete. Evil Nacho crawled out of the sewer and stood before Blue Lazer and Holly. “Merry Christmas, insignificants!”













“Evil Nacho, we were never able to thank you for helping us with the Adoa,” Holly said, as more vines grew around her arms. Blue Lazer kept his focus on That Way and the small army of snowmen; Evil Nacho appeared to be much larger and more terrifying, than how he used to be. The nacho monster stood beside the two, ripping sharp nacho from his structured body.

A Chilling Christmas


He held them tight, ready to use them as weapons at any moment.

“My apologies, Miss Ransfield. I now realize my rudeness was unnecessary.”

“It’s all good, man,” Blue Lazer said, “let’s just get this over with. I want to be able to open my presents.”

“It’s not like you got anything special,” Holly said, as her eyes turned into complete sunlight.

“Hey, That Way!” Blue Lazer shouted. “How about you take your pansy-snow-hoes back to the North Pole, huh?!”

“Negative, Super Cretin! Surrender the city, before you all go through quite the blizzard!”

“Well!” Blue Lazer started. “Then I guess we’ll see who will be the cooler one in this situation!”

Holly laughed. “That was better, Axyl.”

“Thank you very much!” Blue Lazer shouted back in agreement, as Evil Nacho cackled and stared down the evil snowmen who had their icicle weapons ready for combat. After a spark of self-confidence and personal gain, That Way had ordered his “horrifying” fleet of snowmen to charge at the trio. The snowmen continued to make excruciatingly annoying puns as they charged at them.

Blue Lazer smiled at Holly, who smiled back, as Evil Nacho was the first to jump into the crowd of snowmen to fight them off. Blue Lazer formed two fireballs in each hand, watching Holly jump into the fight. Blue Lazer flew straight up into the air, enjoying the cool winter breeze rushing through his face. He held onto the fireballs, smiling brightly at the overcast sky. He remembered everything, everything such as winning the girl of his dreams, making new friends, saving lives, and most of all: not being so much of a jerk-face, all the time. He had never felt so fresh in his life. He was happy to be home, he was happy to be with the people he loved, he was happy it was Christmas. He was happy to be back in action as his amazing alter ego, Blue Lazer. He took a deep dive towards the army of snowmen, shouting as loud as he could, “YO, THIS IS BLUE LAZER! BRING IT ON, BUDDY-BOYS!!!”


THE END

“There is a vitality, a life force, an energy, a quickening that is translated through you into action, and because there is only one of you in all of time, this expression is unique. And if you block it, it will never exist through any other medium and it will be lost. The world will not have it. It is not your business to determine how good it is nor how valuable nor how it compares with other expressions. It is your business to keep it yours clearly and directly, to keep the channel open. You do not even have to believe in yourself or your work. You have to keep yourself open and aware to the urges that motivate you. Keep the channel open. ... No artist is pleased. [There is] no satisfaction whatever at any time. There is only a queer divine dissatisfaction, a blessed unrest that keeps us marching and makes us more alive than the others.” –Martha Graham, 1991

1
